1043472774157.summary: Hey Mums and Dads. Let's connect ! Join us for a morning filled with delicious coffee, friendly mums and dads, and great conversations at Merci Marcel. We love to feature "ADHD Shimmers" . This coffee morning will taste special as we will have the pleasure to have Luke Tan and Candice Chaignat with us! They'll be mingling with us and will be answering questions you might have about mind training, breathwork, hypnotherapy and how it can turn ADHD into a key asset. Who are Luke and Candice? Luke and Candice Chaignat are the founders of Free Human Project , a transformative wellness initiative designed to help individuals optimize their lives and build stronger bonds. Together, they bring a powerful combination of expertise in mind training, breathwork, lifestyle optimization, and inner child integration. Luke, a #1 Amazon bestselling author, trauma-informed Breath Architect, and Lifestyle Optimization Coach, specializes in nervous system regulation. His journey overcoming depression, chronic asthma, and ADHD fuels his commitment to guiding high performers toward enhanced cognitive performance and optimal health through lifestyle changes and targeted breathing techniques. A master of mind and heart, Candice empowers individuals to forge deeper, more fulfilling relationships. As a clinical hypnotherapist, inner child integration specialist, and NLP practitioner, she guides clients to unlock their innate potential, heal past wounds, and cultivate lasting connections. Drawing from personal experiences of transformation, including motherhood, grief, and relocation, Candice offers transformative tools for healing, growth, and thriving relationships. About Meru (ex-LemonADHD): Meru is a vibrant community of parents with ADHD children. Our mission is to provide a roadmap for parents of neurodivergent children and teens, to be their support system, to remind them of how far theyve come and how well they are doing by making them feel heard, understood, and inspired. We exist to nurture community and share vetted resources to mums and dads who know they dont have to embark on the journey of neurodivergent parenting alone. Join our community ! #adhd #neurodiversity #breathwork #merucommunity
1043472774157.description: Join us for a mind blowing coffee morning and learn how breathwork, hypnotherapy and mind training can transform ADHD into a powerhouse.
1043472774157.title: Meru Coffee Morning #ADHD #parenting

1014254381157.summary: Copenhagen Fintech is organising a Fintech Delegation to Singapore from 5-8 November, 2024 with corporates, fintech scale ups and startups to attend Singapore Fintech Festival and to meet various financial institutions and banks. The trip would be facilitated by Copenhagen Fintech. Why Singapore? Singapore is the leading financial centre in the Asia-Pacific region and is an attractive hotbed for businesses looking to base their Asia HQ, and build partnerships with international stakeholders all of whom have a slice of the cake in this tropical island. Since 2017, Copenhagen Fintech has been working with financial regulators, the central back and the financial tech ecosystem in Singapore and Japan. We have brought over 100+ individuals and more than 40 companies including Reality+, Performativ, Risika, Matter, etc - resulting in investments from venture capital funds in Danish-founded companies, and several local partnerships. In addition, several Danish Fintech companies have a significant presence in Singapore, including Simcorp and Chainalysis. SFF, otherwise known as Singapore Fintech Festival, attracts 60,000+ attendees each year. Read more here about the festival and the crowd it attracts, as well as what you can learn from the sessions and various industry events. You should sign up if: You are a corporate who wants to explore the vibrant innovation ecosystem of South East Asia. A unique opportunity to develop your competencies and network, and learn about corporate innovation and new trends. You are a Nordic Fintech interested in attending Singapore Fintech Festival and/or engaging with partners/network on the ground. You are a Nordic Fintech based in Singapore and/or have an office in Singapore and would like to be invited to the side events we are hosting What is covered in the trip: A 4-day program including attending Singapore Fintech Festival (5-8 November), 3 side events/networking sessions co-hosted by Copenhagen Fintech and partners and up to 3 additional social events throughout the week Marketing and branding promotion on social media channels for you and your Fintech for the trip 1:1 Pre-Program Matchmaking for Fintech Startups with Nicolette to curate your wishes/target market for the trip 1:1 Pre-Program Matchmaking for corporates with Laura and Marie-Louise to curate your wishes for the trip Pre-delegation call with the companies and post-delegation survey What is not included in the trip? Tickets to Singapore Fintech Festival (discounts or complimentary tickets are likely available - please contact Copenhagen Fintech) Flight tickets to/from Singapore Accommodation (recommended 6 nights) If you are interested to be a part of the delegation, please register latest by Friday, October 4th 2024. Your attendance is not confirmed and would require email confirmation from the Copenhagen Fintech team. If there is not enough sign-up for the delegation, we reserve the right to cancel. NB: We dont know at this stage if we will have a joint nordic booth, if so, we will contact you with more information.
1014254381157.description: Copenhagen Fintech is organising a Fintech Delegation to Singapore from 5-8 November, 2024 with corporates, fintech scale ups and startups
1014254381157.title: Singapore Delegation 2024

948162769367.summary: Reboot Your Mind with LinkedIn Local - Singapore: Journey to Wellness Welcome to our first-ever LinkedIn Local - Singapore signature one-day event! Join us for a transformative mindful wellness journey, let's Reboot Your Mind on a Journey to Wellness of: Self-Discovery Growth Connection Our expert speakers and facilitators will guide you through engaging discussions, interactive sessions and mindful practices Michelle Mah, Rebalance Singapore Yen-Lu Chow, Over-the-Rainbow by WholeTree Foundation Ms Suchi, Laughter Therapy Alex Loh, Aviary & Co. Nick Sim, WhizHeartz Brian Liu, Bros Before Woes EMCEE: Glenn Van Zutphen , SPH MoneyFM On this journey to wellness, you will be empowered to: Cultivate resilience and mental clarity Develop coping strategies for a balanced life Connect with like-minded individuals and build a supportive community Take The First Step Towards A Renewed You! Event Partner: Over-The-Rainbow - WholeTree Foundation In celebration of Over-The-Rainbow's (OTR) 12th Anniversary, OTR is the Official Event Partner of Reboot Your Mind - Journey to Wellness with LinkedIn Local - Singapore . Special Thanks to Our Sponsors for enabling the event to support OTR! In support of Over-The-Rainbow, a donation will be made from the event's proceeds! VOLUNTARY Donations will support OTR in her mission to prioritise mental wellness and community well-being. Over-The-Rainbow (OTR) is the mental wellness initiative of WholeTree Foundation , the not-for-profit family foundation of Yen-Lu & Yee Ling Chow founded in loving memory of their dear son and only child who ended his own life at the age of 26 after suffering for many years from manic depression. OTR is a one-stop hub for youth mental wellness. OTR's mission is to transform mental wellness for the 21st century. You can also make a contribution [250% tax deduction via Giving.SG ] at: https://www.giving.sg/donate/campaign/wellbeing-champion--leading-the-movement . Donations via Eventbrite/Peatix event pages are not eligible for tax deduction. Thank you for your generous support! FAQ Where is the exact location? CRANE Claymore Connect is located at 442 Orchard Road, next to Delfi Orchard , and near two MRT stations: Orchard (TE14/NS22) and Orchard Boulevard (TE13). Is this a conference? While this is not a conference event, this is a one-day LinkedIn Local - Singapore signature event where we are privileged to have the esteemed speakers and panellists partake in mindful wellness conversations. As the first mindful wellness event of LinkedIn Local - Singapore, we are glad to have practitioners and professionals to lead us on a journey to holistic wellness! What do I get out of the ticket or event? Get to immerse in this one-day holistic wellness journey, where youll explore introspection and mindfulness through engaging activities. Its designed to help you reflect, recharge, and find joy. Get to know other professionals via the LinkedIn network and establish connections in person! Each ticket also entitled to catered refreshments during the event. Supported and Encouraged by LinkedIn, LinkedIn Local is a registered trademark of LinkedIn Corporation and is used under license. However, LinkedIn Local events are NOT sponsored or operated by LinkedIn Linkedin Local - Singapore events are live, in-person experiences, that bring together LinkedIn members in Singapore. Organised by LinkedIn Local - Singapore co-hosts Kia-Khing (JQ - Jiaquan) Low (Lu) and Adrian Tong, this event is to strengthen existing LinkedIn connections and to build new ones!
948162769367.description: Come join us for a rejuvenating Saturday afternoon experience at Reboot Your Mind with LinkedIn Local - Singapore: A Journey to Wellness!

1036669324857.summary: Join us for an empowering and reflective community Thrive: Women Empowerment Circle. Our very first meetup is called Reconnection & Reflection. This intimate gathering will foster connection, self-reflection, and forward planning in a supportive and nurturing environment. We are all living in a busy era, and day in and day out, we are focusing on doing rather than being. Because of that, at times, we lose sight of great things & connections that we have achieved or failed to give enough time to acknowledge setbacks or even give ourselves enough rest that we deserve. With our very first meeting - Reconnection & Reflection , we will hold a space for one another, allowing us to jot down and reflect on how life has been for us in 2024 and what energy and experiences we want to have in 2025. Reflection & Reconnection Meetup Date & Time : 26 Oct 2024, 11AM - 12.30 PM Location: @strangerconvos -195 Pearl's Hill Terrace. Nearest MRT: Chinatown Fee: $18/ pax What to expect in the session - Expand your social network & get to know other like minded women Establish healthy habits through meditation which help you to stay centered & grounded for the days ahead Gain understanding & appreciations on your wins & setbacks and understand what it takes to embrace your life with gratitude Discover methods & techniques in Visualisation Learn ways to prioritise your life and give space for what truly matters We look forward to seeing you there and creating a space of connection, reflection, and growth together! About Thrive - Women Empowerment Circle Thrive - Women Empowerment Circle is created as a social space for women to meet and connect regularly (both offline and online), with themes focusing on Self-Love, Self-Development, Wellness, Connection, and much more. If youre interested in being part of Thrive, join our Facebook group to stay updated on upcoming events - https://www.facebook.com/share/g/P58WUxFNZhAkM749/ Thrive is created by Tiffany Nguyen, an Image Consultant & Holistic Personal Coach. 1012538539027.summary: Event Title: Launch of the Community Safety Framework Join us for the official launch of the Community Safety Framework, where key leaders and experts come together to discuss and promote a vision of safety across industries and communities. This event is designed to inspire and engage CEOs, WSH officers, government agencies, educators, and anyone committed to fostering a safer and healthier environment for all. Date & Time: Monday, 21 Oct 2024 from 1.30 to 5.30pm Location: Raffles Town Club Ballroom Objective: The launch aims to introduce the Community Safety Framework, offering fresh insights into enhancing workplace and community safety standards, with a focus on collaboration between public and private sectors. Target Audience: We expect 150 participants from diverse sectors, including industry leaders, educational institutions, government agencies, statutory boards, and town councils. This event is particularly relevant for CEs, CEOs, Workplace Safety and Health Officers (WSHOs), and professionals interested in advancing community safety and health initiatives. Keynote Speaker: - Mr. Abu Bakar Mohd Nor, Chairman of the Workplace Safety and Health Council, will share his vision for a safer community for all. Programme Highlights: - Community Safety - A Vision for All by Mr. Abu Bakar Mohd Nor - Community Safety Framework - NSCS2.0 by Mr. R K Jaggi, Asst Secretary-General, NSCS - WSH Culture in the Logistics Industry by Mr. Dave Ng, Group CEO Bok Seng Ltd & Former WSH Council Member - Q&A Be part of this important conversation and contribute to building a safer community for everyone. 1040321578847.summary: Are you ready to unlock your potential and elevate your public speaking and leadership skills? Join us at Braddell Heights II Toastmasters , where we meet every second and fourth Saturday afternoon from 2:45 PM to 5:30 PM! Why Attend? Whether youre looking to overcome stage fright, improve your communication abilities, or sharpen your leadership skills, our Toastmasters meetings provide the perfect environment for growth. Our sessions are structured yet friendly, offering a mix of prepared speeches, impromptu speaking (Table Topics), and constructive evaluations that help you become a more confident and effective communicator. What to Expect: Warm Welcome: From the moment you walk in, youll be greeted by a supportive and encouraging community. Engaging Activities: Participate in or observe our Table Topics and speech evaluations, which are designed to help you think on your feet and offer constructive feedback. Learn and Grow: Gain practical experience in public speaking and leadership, with guidance from seasoned Toastmasters. Networking Opportunities: Meet like-minded individuals from diverse backgrounds, all eager to grow and learn together. Meeting Schedule: When: Every 2nd & 4th Saturday of the month Time: 2:45 PM - 5:30 PM Where: 245 Serangoon Ave 2, Singapore 550245, EVENT ROOM Why Visit as a Guest? Guests are always welcome at our meetings! Theres no pressure to participate on your first visitjust come and observe. Experience firsthand how Toastmasters can help you achieve your personal and professional goals. Plus, its a great way to meet new people and expand your network! How to Attend: Its easyjust sign up here on Eventbrite to reserve your spot. We look forward to seeing you at our next meeting! About Toastmasters: Toastmasters International is a world leader in communication and leadership development. Our members improve their speaking and leadership skills by attending our structured, friendly, and fun meetings. Join Us: Dont miss this opportunity to grow, learn, and connect with others in a positive and supportive environment. We cant wait to meet you!

1041862277117.summary: About Queer Business Collective (QBC) The Queer Business Collective (QBC) is a collective that empowers lesbian, non-binary, and queer women business owners & professionals in Singapore. We do this by organizing opportunities through business networking, education, and mentorship. Our goal is to create an inclusive space for queer entrepreneurs and professionals to thrive and succeed. Join us at the **Abriza Rooftop Bar** for an evening of empowerment and networking with queer women business owners & professionals. By providing a dedicated safe space for queer women and non-binary entrepreneurs to connect with various communities , we are fostering an inclusive environment where all parties can share experiences, exchange ideas, and form meaningful business relationships. This event isn't just about networkingit's about empowerment. It allows attendees to connect with like-minded professionals, share stories of resilience, and explore avenues for collaboration. These connections will help strengthen the sense of community and provide resources and support that can be instrumental in personal and professional growth. By introducing the Queer Business Collective (QBC), we aim to cultivate a long-term network of support and advocacy that can continue to benefit attendees well beyond this event. If you're a queer women/non-binary entrepreneur and would like to join the QBC, please ask one of the organizers at the event. See you there!
1041862277117.description: Join us for a gathering of badass queer women making waves in the business world! Build connections, share insights and uplift each other.
1041862277117.title: Empowering Connections for Queer Women Founders & Professionals

Imagine: Sharing inspiration with hundreds of others committed to a life free from alcohol. Hearing powerful speakers share their stories of strength and resilience. Building meaningful connections with a supportive community that understands your struggles. The RoundUP is a celebration of triumph . It's a chance to recharge your spirit and discover new tools to navigate your path in Recovery and Spirituality. This is NOT just another meeting. This is a day of fellowship, fun, and growth. Here's what awaits you:- International and Local Speakers :- Learn many paths to spirituality Diverse speaker panels: Gain insights from experienced members of the program. The $10 ticket + Booking fee ( $11.58) includes a buffet lunch, light snacks throughout the day, and coffee and beverages. Don't miss this opportunity to: Rekindle the fire of your recovery. Gain fresh perspectives and tools for lasting sobriety. Be a part of a community that uplifts and inspires. T ickets are selling fast! Secure your spot at the Annual Singapore AA Roundup and invest in your continued success. 967556767337.summary: Harnessing Zero Trust Framework and Generative AI to Further Bolster Defences At the heart of Singapore's highly developed digital environment lies robust and proactive cybersecurity. Underpinned by the government's commitment to enhancing digital resilience through initiatives like the Cybersecurity Act and the establishment of the Cyber Security Agency (CSA), the nation continues to adopt forward-looking approaches to combat evolving cyber threats and safeguard its critical infrastructure. Singapore maintains its vigilance and adaptability by continuously investing in cutting-edge technologies and fostering collaborations to ensure its digital landscape remains secure and resilient against future cyber challenges . In addition, this approach equips both businesses and individuals with the necessary tools and knowledge to navigate the digital age safely. Despite this progressive momentum, cyber incidents remain a significant challenge in Singapore. As a leading innovation hub, Singapore is particularly vulnerable to cybersecurity risks, with the Singapore Cybersecurity Agency (CSA) reporting a marked increase in cybercrimes such as phishing, ransomware, and scams in recent years. More importantly, as cyber threats grow more sophisticated, organisations in Singapore must consistently update their security strategies and invest in advanced technologies to stay ahead of potential risks. A key cybersecurity solution for strengthening security postures in Singapore is integrating the Zero Trust framework. This approach is especially crucial given Singapore's status as a global financial hub and its heavy reliance on digital infrastructure for both public and private sector operations. Operating on the principle of "never trust, always verify," Zero Trust ensures that every access request is authenticated, authorised, and continuously validated. However, a significant challenge of Zero Trust is enforcing strict access control without causing excessive friction from frequent verifications. Additionally, existing solutions burden IT teams with the need to analyse extensive log data, requiring large teams and substantial budgets to detect rare attacks. This is where artificial intelligence (AI) becomes invaluable. AI addresses this by introducing behaviour-based user risk scoring, streamlining the process. By analysing real-time data, AI identifies anomalies in user behaviour, providing administrators with tailored security recommendations. Ultimately, the effective integration of Zero Trust and AI helps organisations in Singapore enhance their security postures while minimising operational burdens. This advanced approach ensures robust protection of sensitive data and infrastructure , supporting Singapore's ongoing efforts to foster a secure and innovative digital landscape. AI-Powered Zero Trust Framework Artificial intelligence (AI) has the power to extend the effectiveness of the Zero Trust framework in improving security postures. An AI-powered Zero Trust framework leverages AI to dynamically monitor and assess user behaviour, enhancing the detection and mitigation of security threats. This approach ensures continuous verification and adaptive security measures, significantly reducing the risk of unauthorised access and data breaches. Protecting against Next-Gen Threats with Defensive AI The rise of technologies has escalated the risk of AI-driven attacks. To counter this threat, organisations can utilise AI to bolster protection across various security domains , from application security to the Zero Trust framework. This strategy includes developing tailored security measures for each customer, such as API or email protection, and leveraging vast amounts of attack data to train models capable of identifying previously undiscovered application threats. The session will allow delegates to: STREAMLINE Zero Trust processes by integrating AI solutions ENHANCE the effectiveness of Zero Trust through the implementation of AI LEVERAGE AI-powered Zero Trust to reduce the risk of unauthorised access and data breaches EXPLORE the power of Defensive AI in safeguarding organisations from next-gen cyberattacks IMPLEMENT a comprehensive strategy for protecting sensitive data and establishing strong control over infrastructures ADDRESS challenges in navigating Zero Trust and AI for security Who should attend: Chief Information Security Officers Chief Information Officers Chief Technology Officers Chief Data Officers Directors and Heads of Risk and Compliance Directors and Heads of IT Security Directors and Heads of Security Operations Directors and Heads of Data Directors and Heads of Network Operations and Engineering Directors and Heads of IT Infrastructure Directors and Heads of Cloud Architecture Heads of Network Architecture Heads of Security Architecture Heads of Cloud Operations Heads of Information Technology Heads of IT Security
967556767337.title: Zero Trust & Gen AI Securing Singapore's Digital Frontier

1013251732207.summary: Unlock the Power of Data Singapore's financial landscape has shifted significantly in recent years as a result of technological advancements and changing customer expectations. Singapore's financial sector, known for its stability and innovation, faces both possibilities and challenges, particularly in terms of data management and real-time decision-making . Traditional batch data processing methods in Singapores financial institutions can hinder quick responses in todays fast-paced environment. Delays in accessing up-to-date information can make it difficult to react swiftly, meet client demands, and comply with regulations, potentially leading to poor investment decisions and compliance issues. Furthermore, financial institutions in Singapore face significant challenges integrating diverse data sources , including legacy systems, digital platforms, and third-party services. The varied data formats and sources complicate the creation of a unified data architecture necessary for accurate analytics and decision-making. Another critical issue is maintaining high data quality and accuracy . Inaccurate or incomplete data can lead to flawed analytics, poor decision-making, and operational inefficiencies. Ensuring data integrity across various sources and systems requires continuous monitoring and cleansing efforts, which can be resource-intensive and complex. In Singapores financial sector, integrating advanced analytics and AI is challenging due to compatibility issues with legacy systems . Institutions must invest significantly in new data platforms and expertise, facing high costs and resource constraints while trying to stay competitive and meet growing market demands. To overcome these challenges, how does Singapore's Financial Services Industry streamline data processing, unify diverse data sources, ensure data accuracy, and leverage advanced analytics and AI while managing costs and resources? Enhancing Data Quality and Accuracy with Cloud-Based Integration Cloud data integration and visualisation tackle data challenges by unifying sources into a single platform, eliminating batch delays, and ensuring real-time accuracy. They streamline legacy system integration, enhance data quality, and convert complex data into actionable insights, boosting decision-making and efficiency while cutting costs. According to Qlik, Singlife uses cloud data integration and visualisation for 360 real-time customer insights, improving claim processes and call centre operations. This approach enhances decision-making, reduces friction, and elevates the customer experience for over one million clients, resulting in a 35% reduction in data analysis costs and increased efficiency. Advanced Analytics on Budgeting and Forecasting Advanced analytics is revolutionising budgeting and forecasting in Singapore's financial sector. Traditional methods often fall short due to their reliance on outdated data and static models. By leveraging real-time data, machine learning, and predictive modelling, advanced analytics provides more accurate and flexible insights. Financial institutions can now uncover hidden trends, forecast market shifts, and model various financial scenarios with greater precision. This empowers them to make more informed decisions, optimise resource allocation, and better prepare for market changes. Ultimately, advanced analytics contributes to improved financial performance and stability. Maximi s e Data Value and Drive Innovation with AI Leveraging AI for data management and analysis presents transformative opportunities for the Financial Services Industry (FSI). By embracing AI, financial organisations can maximise data's potential, turning it into a powerful asset for operational efficiency and strategic decision-making. This approach not only enhances data value but also lays the foundation for sustained growth and innovation. In a rapidly evolving market, AI is essential for maintaining competitiveness. It enables institutions to manage risks more effectively, identify emerging trends, and tailor customer experiences. Implementing advanced AI techniques enhances data utilisation, provides deeper insights, and drives innovation, positioning organisations for long-term success. OpenGov Asia is pleased to extend an invitation to an exclusive OpenGov Breakfast Insight focused on how advanced data analytics, data quality, integration, and AI are transforming the financial landscape for Singapores financial sector. This session will explore how advanced analytics can optimise decision-making, the importance of high-quality, integrated data for delivering precise insights, and the transformative impact of AI in identifying new opportunities and managing risks. This event is by invitation only and will be an interactive session with decision-makers from the Singapore Financial sector. This session will allow delegates to: EXPLORE Singapores FSI sector can enhance resource allocation and efficiency through advanced data analytics, integration, and AI UNDERSTAND the crucial gaps between data collection, insightful analysis, and actionable outcomes to elevate service delivery within the financial sector DISCOVER leveraging data analytics and integration can help financial institutions in Singapore maximise their resources and improve decision-making ENSURE compliance with the latest data protection and privacy regulations by understanding the security components embedded in data analytics and integration strategies ESTABLISH strategic collaborations with AI-powered technologies to enable automated insights, real-time data transmission, and effective operational planning within the FSI sector Who Should Attend: Chief Information Officers Chief Data Officers Chief Transformation Officers Chief Technology Officers Chief Analytics Officers Chief Operations Officers Chief Compliance Officers Directors and Heads of Technology, Strategy and Policy Directors of IT Governance Directors and Heads of IT, System Directors and Heads of IT Transformation Heads of Analytics& Center of Excellence Heads of Data Platform Heads of IT Operations Heads of Infrastructure Heads of Data Governance Heads of Compliance
1013251732207.title: How Integration, Analytics, & AI Give Singapore's Financial Sector an Edge

954947783527.summary: Revolutionising Government Operations in the Age of AI AI is integral to Singapore's digital transformation, enhancing public service delivery through advanced data analytics and automation. Modern technologies such as Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) can revolutionise governance, not only transforming the capabilities of AI systems but also setting the stage for more advanced applications. However, a survey by Pure Storage revealed that 83% of organisations require substantial IT infrastructure upgrades to leverage AI fully, indicating that many are not yet AI-ready and need significant reconfiguration. In the public sector, agencies are grappling with outdated legacy systems that lack automation, while the demand for processing power and storage continues to rise. Moreover, the government faces significant challenges in information security, privacy, and data resiliency. Generative AI: The Next Frontier GenAI extends far beyond merely generating new content like text, images, audio, and video, encompassing advanced capabilities in data synthesis, pattern recognition, and creative problem-solving. Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs), Variational Autoencoders (VAEs), and transformer models like GPT (Generative Pre-trained Transformer) are some of the most prominent examples of GenAI. By integrating GenAI into government, Singapore can enhance its competitive edge in smart governance, predictive analytics for policy formulation, and personalised citizen services. Driving Innovation with RAG Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) is a significant innovation that bridges the gap between generative skills and external knowledge, resulting in more robust and context-aware language understanding and generation systems. A key technique of RAG is in natural language processing, it improves contextual awareness, ensures fluent content, eliminates bias, and manages vast knowledge libraries, making it essential for long-term content development. In Singapore's public sector, where efficiency and precision are critical, RAG allows agencies to streamline operations and provide more responsive services to the public. RAG improves decision-making by enabling rapid and precise data processing, resulting in better insights from massive datasets. Building Robust Data and AI Infrastructure The backbone of effective AI implementation is a robust data and AI infrastructure. According to Pure Storage, high investment costs and a shortage of in-house skills are cited by 73% of organisations as the primary barriers to deploying AI. Another significant challenge, faced by 43%, is the delay in acquiring necessary hardware, especially GPUs. Key components of infrastructure include high-speed connectivity, secure cloud services, and advanced data analytics capabilities. By ensuring that data is accessible and reliable, Singapores public sector can develop platforms that support large-scale data collection, storage, and processing and fully exploit the potential of RAG and GenAI. Ensuring Cyber Resilience in the Age of GenAI As Singapore advances its AI capabilities, ensuring robust cyber resilience becomes imperative. Government AI initiatives are increasingly vulnerable to cyber threats, ranging from data breaches to sophisticated cyberattacks. AI initiatives aim to enhance cyber resilience by implementing proactive strategies to mitigate risks and protect sensitive data. AI-driven cybersecurity solutions, analyse vast data, detect anomalies, and respond swiftly to potential breaches, thereby enhancing security posture and fostering confidence in data privacy and integrity among citizens. Outlook: Integrating RAG and Cyber Resilience Looking ahead, the integration of RAG and cyber resilience will continue to shape Singapore's public sector landscape. RAG not only saves costs by optimising infrastructure utilisation but also enhances the utility and effectiveness of AI applications through improved access to diverse, relevant data sources. By fostering a collaborative ecosystem of AI experts, and cybersecurity specialists, Singapore can navigate the complexities of digital transformation while safeguarding its national interests and citizen trust. The Importance of Infrastructure for RAG, GenAI, and Cyber Resilience A strong infrastructure ensures that AI systems have the necessary computational resources and data to function optimally. This infrastructure not only supports the operational needs of RAG and GenAI but also fosters an environment where AI technologies can flourish and contribute to the public good. It also provides the security measures needed to safeguard against cyber-attacks, thereby maintaining the trust and confidence of the public in the digital government. OpenGov Asia extends a special invitation to an exclusive OpenGov Events , which will demonstrate how Retrieval-Augmented Generation and GenAI enhance decision-making processes and operational efficiencies across government agencies. It will highlight strategies for bolstering cyber resilience within governmental AI frameworks, which are essential for safeguarding sensitive data amidst evolving cyber threats. Participants will: DISCOVER cutting-edge strategies for enhancing AI excellence and building cyber resilience ENHANCE understanding of how RAG improves accuracy and speed in governmental operations EXPLORE innovative solutions to bolster cyber resilience and safeguard sensitive governmental AI initiatives from evolving threats PREPARE strategies to ensure readiness for future AI advancements and cybersecurity challenges in government FOSTER collaborations with experts in AI and cybersecurity to tackle challenges specific to the public sector Who should attend: Chief Information Officers Chief Technology Officers Chief Data Officers Chief Transformation Officers Chief Information Security Officers Directors and Heads of Data Heads of Data Science Directors and Heads of IT Infrastructure Directors and Heads of Cloud Architecture
954947783527.title: Empowering Impact: Expanding RAG and GenAI in Singapore's Public Sector

1041724525097.summary: Empowering Public Services with Trusted Digital Foundations In today's digital era, cybersecurity is vital for government operations, particularly in Singapore's public sector, which sets a benchmark for the region. As citizen services increasingly rely on digital technologies to enhance citizen engagement, efficiency, and transparency, robust cybersecurity measures are now indispensable. The Cyber Security Agency's (CSA) Annual Report for 2023 revealed that Singapore experienced over 70,200 compromised systems, marking a 14% decrease from the 81,500 compromised systems reported in 2022. This decline reflects the increasing effectiveness of Singapore's cybersecurity policies and a growing awareness among public sector organisations. However, while this reduction is a positive development, it underscores the need for continued efforts to safeguard digital infrastructures. One of the CSA's key initiatives, the Singapore Cybersecurity Strategy 2021, aims to strengthen defences by enhancing capabilities, building alliances, and securing critical information infrastructure. While the CSA has advanced cybersecurity through national frameworks and threat detection platforms, challenges remain in maintaining resilience against evolving threats. A key challenge is the growing sophistication of cyber-attacks, with criminals using AI, machine learning, and advanced tools to infiltrate systems more effectively. Traditional measures like firewalls and antivirus are no longer enough; Singapore's public sector must adopt dynamic, integrated solutions that can detect and respond to breaches in real-time. Another challenge is the fragmented digital infrastructure within the public sector, where different agencies operate on disparate systems, creating vulnerabilities in cybersecurity defences. Without a unified approach to cyber assurance, ensuring comprehensive protection across all digital touchpoints is difficult. Cybercriminals exploit these gaps, targeting weak links to infiltrate larger networks and potentially disrupt public services. To address this issue, which proactive and integrated cybersecurity solutions should Singapore's public sector prioritise to effectively battle modern cyber threats? Unified Cybersecurity Framework A single cybersecurity framework is critical to improving Singapore's public sector security posture. Standardising cybersecurity policy ensures that processes are consistent across all government agencies. This central governance architecture improves effort alignment, fosters collaboration, and reduces vulnerabilities due to separate systems. Secured Networking Secured networking is essential for protecting data integrity, confidentiality, and availability, especially in the face of evolving cyber threats. Key components include next-generation firewalls like FortiGate NGFW, data encryption solutions, and access control tools like passwords and biometrics, which ensure thatonly authorised users can access sensitive information. Additionally, intrusion detection and prevention systems (IDPS) monitor traffic for suspicious activity, helping to prevent attacks in real-time. Network segmentation creates isolated network segments, minimising the spread of threats and enforcing stricter access controls to sensitive areas. These measures collectively enhance an organisation's network security. Migration to Cloud Migration to the cloud requires strong security and management, and there are key solutions available to facilitate this transition. Centralised management enables organisations to efficiently oversee security policies across both public and private clouds, ensuring consistent enforcement.Robust VPN capabilities provide secure site-to-site connectivity, safeguarding data during transfers between cloud environments. These solutions are highly scalable, automatically adjusting security as cloud usage grows, ensuring seamless protection. Additionally, support for compliance with stringent regulatory requirements includes encryption, access control, and audit logging to meet data sovereignty and protection laws. Integration of AI and Automation The use of AI and automation in cybersecurity provides a potent approach to battle the growing sophistication of cyber-attacks. AI systems can analyse large volumes of data to uncover trends and abnormalities, allowing for proactive threat identification and response. Organisations can improve their ability to respond to attacks in real-time by automating routine security processes such as monitoring, incident response, and vulnerability management while decreasing the workload on security staff. This collaboration not only improves the overall security posture but also allows organisations to respond more quickly to developing cyber dangers, ensuring strong protection against prospective breaches and assaults. OpenGov Asia extends a personal invitation to an exclusive OpenGov Breakfast Insight focusing on the critical importance of cybersecurity in Singapore's public sector. As digital technologies increasingly support public services to enhance citizen involvement, efficiency, and transparency, addressing the growing sophistication of cyber threats has become essential. This session will allow delegates to: EXPLOR E the current cybersecurity landscape within Singapore's public sector, gaining insights into the latest trends and emerging threats. IDENTIFY the key challenges and vulnerabilities facing government agencies,including the growing sophistication of cyber-attacks and the issues arising from fragmented digital infrastructures. RECOGNISE the essential role of a unified cybersecurity framework, securing networking, andcloud migration in bolstering the security posture of Singapores public sector. LEVERAGE AI and automation to strengthen cybersecurity resilience and improve threat response capabilities. Who should attend: Chief Information Officers Chief Information Security Officers Chief Technology Officers Chief Innovation Officers Chief Transformation Officers Chief Data Officers Chief Operating Officers Chief Project Officers Directors and Heads of Digital Services Directors and Heads of Technology Capabilities and Innovation Directors and Heads of Network Engineering Directors and Heads of Data Directors and Heads of Applications Directors and Heads of Cloud Architecture Directors and Heads of IT Security Heads of Technology Research & Development Heads of IT Security Heads of Operations Heads of Procurement
1041724525097.title: Securing Singapore: Advanced Cyber Solutions for the Future of PS

957025929317.summary: TRANSFORMING POSSIBILITIES INTO REALITIES AI now stands as a pivotal game-changing technology that impacts us all. Recent breakthroughs in AI have sparked renewed interest in its potential, risks, and implications for humanity. While AI has primarily been about pattern recognition, future advancements will bring systems with human-level cognitive abilities, fundamentally reshaping our way of life with profound implications for societies everywhere PM Lawrence Wong Artificial intelligence (AI) is no longer a future concept, but rather a present-day reality that is transforming industries and society throughout the globe. Singapore, with its forward-thinking policies and strategic initiatives, is leading the way in this shift. AI is crucial for Singapores ambitions, enhancing efficiency, innovation and competitiveness. Singapore's push for innovation relies on its capacity to leverage data. AI's ability to analyse vast datasets yields valuable insights, driving the development of new products and services. This data-driven approach not only creates new business opportunities but also improves customer experiences. Agility and vision are essential for staying competitive in a globalised economy. AI gives Singaporean businesses the predictive power to improve supply chains, streamline decision-making procedures, and predict market trends with unique precision. By taking a proactive stance, organisations can stay ahead of the curve and quickly adjust to changing market conditions. AI's importance extends beyond economic gains to advancing sustainable development goals. It optimises energy utilisation and lowers waste by deploying resource-efficient apps, resulting in much lower environmental footprints. Smart grids and AI-driven logistics are great examples of how simplified processes may increase energy efficiency and reduce carbon emissions. This emphasises AI's critical role in creating a more sustainable future for the entire world. Singapore's commitment to AI is demonstrated by strong government support and forward-thinking policies. The new National AI Strategy and Model AI Governance Framework provide a comprehensive framework for ethical AI development. This enabling ecosystem promotes responsible innovation and ensures that AI deployment is consistent with ethical standards and societal well-being. As attendees gather at the AI Summit, Singapore's AI journey unfolds, demonstrating the country's steadfast commitment to leveraging technology for societal advancement. Singapore lays the groundwork for a future where AI acts as an accelerator for equitable growth and global leadership by enhancing efficiency, fostering innovation, boosting competitiveness, promoting sustainability, and empowering its workforce. The Singapore Gen AI Revolution Summit 2024 brings together industry leaders, innovators, and visionaries from the enterprise, finance, and public sectors to explore the newest AI developments and applications.
957025929317.description: 19 November 2024 8.00 am - 4.00 pm Singapore Standard Time
957025929317.title: Singapore Gen AI Revolution Summit 2024

526881987207.summary: WebCongress APAC Region 2025 @WebCongress is a leading Technology & Digital Innovation Conferences, with over 44 editions held in 17 countries so far. Decision makers, government, businesses & technology giants meet at our events to learn and network. Every year we inspire thousands of professionals to leverage todays digital opportunities and build a better future. 2025 is here and we are going on a world tour! With events, talks and training programs in the U.S, Australia, Spain, Colombia, France, Ecuador and Middle East. CONFERENCES + WORKSHOPS + VIP NETWORKING PARTY It's an inspiring event, with keynote conferences, experts panels and practical workshops, come learn and network with our amazing international speakers. @WebCongress is designed to help you be on top of the digital game, meet thought leaders, find business partners and skilled talent, and most importantly connect with our roster of partners & sponsors here to help you solve all your digital challenges in 2025. And of course we love to entertain you with shows and networking sessions too! 911082571497.summary: 2024 2nd Power Electronics and Power System Conference (PEPSC 2024) Nov. 6 to 9, 2024| Nanyang Technological University, Singapore https://www.pepsc.org/ 2024 2nd Power Electronics and Power System Conference (PEPSC 2024) is co-organized by University of Electronic Science and Technology of China and Hong Kong Society of Mechanical Engineers(HKSME), technical Sponsored by IEEE PES Singapore chapter, supported by Nanyang Technological University, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Hangzhou Dianzi University, media supported by Electric Machines and Control, Proceedings of the CSEE, CSEE Journal of Power and Energy Systems(CSEE JPES), Automation of Electric Power Systems, New Type Power Systems, Power System Protection and Control, Protection and Control of Modern Power Systems, Power system Technology, High Voltage Engineering, Power Generation Technology,High Voltage, Electric Power Information and Communication Technology, Electrical Power Engineering Technology, CPSS Transactions on Power Electronics and Applications(CPSS TPEA), Journal of Power Supply,Nanfang Nengyuan Jianshe and Neimenggu Dianli Jianshe, which will be held at Nanyang Technological University in Singapore from Nov. 6 to 9, 2024. The theme of PEPSC 2024 is "Digital, Intelligent Power Conversion and New Power System". This conference is aimed at providing a platform for all researchers and engineers to share ideas, highly developed skills and successful practices to others. The conference will last for 3 days with the reception to be held on the first day to meet and mingle with conference chairs, session chairs and other participants. We would like to invite you to join us in this important event and share your recent advance development and research finding in Power Electronics and Power System to all attendees. Besides, it is also a good opportunity for you and your family to enjoy the culture and view in Singapore. We are looking forward to seeing you in PEPSC 2024. Publication and Indexing (1)All the accepted and presented papers will be submitted for inclusion into IEEE XploreISBN: 979-8-3503-9019-3 subject to meeting IEEE Xplores scope and quality requirements. The publisher will submit articles to Engineering Village, Scopus, Web of Science and other databases for review and indexing after publication. (2)Selected papers(accepted and presented) with great extension will be recommended to publish in Special Issue of electronics (ISSN 2079-9292): "Advances in Power System Dynamics, Stability, Control and Dispatch with Large-Scale Renewable Energy Penetrated" after conference. Topics 1. Power Electronics Topology and Control 2. Wind and solar storage power electronics 3. Power electronics for power transmission and distribution 4. Transportation electrification power electronics 5. Data center power electronics 6. Power electronic devices 7. Control, modeling, simulation 8. System stability and reliability 9. Renewable energy conversion technology and new energy storage 10. New power system 11. Smart grid and energy Submission Electronic Submission System: https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/PEPSC2024 E-mail: info@pepsc.org Notice 1) Manuscripts must be written in English; 2) The manuscript should be written in accordance with the standard of template; 3) The topics of paper should be relevant to conference topics; 4) Plagiarism and Duplicate submission are prohibited; 5) Innovation and scientific value is a must. Call for participants 1,Presenter: If you are interested in giving presentation on conference, without publishing your paper in the proceeding, you need to submit the abstract and title of your presentation to us: info@pepsc.org 2,Listener: If you are interested in attending the conference to participant this gathering on the field above you are welcome to join us and share your ideas! 3,Reviewer: Experts in the area of power electronics and power systems are welcome to join the conference as reviewer. Contact Ms. Amber Cao Phone:s+852-30506862 Cell Phone: 18200296850 E-mail: info@pepsc.org / ambercao@smehk.org Website: https://www.pepsc.org/
911082571497.description: 2024 2nd Power Electronics and Power System Conference will be held at Nanyang Technological University in Singapore from Nov. 6 to 9, 2024.
911082571497.title: 2024 2nd Power Electronics and Power System Conference

883832114647.summary: Understanding Green Financing, Risk, Profit, and Purpose - TGS-2024043800 In today's rapidly evolving global landscape, the imperative for sustainable investments has never been more pronounced. As investors and financial institutions increasingly recognize the critical importance of integrating environmental considerations into their decision-making frameworks, this course emerges as a timely and indispensable resource. Designed to furnish participants with a comprehensive toolkit, it navigates the intricate terrain of green financing, empowering individuals to comprehend the associated risks and challenges while embracing the broader ethos of sustainable finance. Throughout the duration of this course, participants will embark on a journey towards a profound understanding of the concepts and principles underpinning green financing and its intricate relationship with sustainability. Delving into the multifaceted facets of green investment and the overarching objectives of sustainable finance, each module serves as a stepping stone towards enhanced comprehension and proficiency. By exploring foundational concepts in green financing and dissecting the four cardinal elements of sustainable finance - finance, governance, social, and environmental - participants will acquire invaluable insights and expertise. Guided by a meticulously curated curriculum, participants will traverse through modules delineating critical topics such as the Introduction to Green Financing, Relationships between Green Investment & Sustainability, Sustainable Finance Asset Class & Investment Strategy, and Sustainable Investment Trends & Challenges. With each module, individuals will hone the requisite knowledge and skills imperative for navigating the dynamic landscape of sustainable finance. Empowered with the ability to identify, assess, and capitalize on opportunities in green financing, participants will develop a nuanced understanding of associated risks and challenges, thereby emerging as discerning and adept practitioners in the realm of sustainable finance. By journey's end, participants will emerge equipped with the acumen to make well-informed investment decisions, catalyze positive environmental and social outcomes, and spearhead transformative change within the financial sector towards a more sustainable future. Moreover, participants will gain invaluable insights into the diverse array of stakeholders comprising the sustainable finance ecosystem, thereby fostering enhanced collaboration and synergy towards shared objectives. Yes, this course is IBF-funded! The IBF Standards Training Scheme (IBF-STS) provides funding for training and assessment programmes accredited under the Skills Framework for Financial Services. For our training programmes that are accredited under the IBF Standards, eligible Singaporeans & PRs can apply for funding support under the IBF Standards Training Scheme (IBF-STS), subject to all eligibility criteria being met. Note: All participants (Self-Sponsored and Company-Sponsored) must be physically based in Singapore For company-sponsored participants, the company must meet the following two requirements to qualify for funding support of up to 70% from IBF (excluding GST). 1. Company-Sponsored participants have to be Singaporeans or Singapore Permanent Residents (PRs) that are physically based in Singapore. 2. Eligible companies refer to Financial Institutions that are regulated by the Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) (either licensed/exempted from licensing) and Fintech companies that are registered with the Singapore Fintech Association.
883832114647.description: Explore the evolving world of sustainable finance, learn to integrate environmental considerations into decision-making, and drive positive.
883832114647.venue_name: Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre, an IHG Hotel
883832114647.title: [05 & 06 Nov 2024] Understanding Green Financing, Risk, Profit & Purpose

943994863047.summary: The AI Health World Summit, organised biennially by SingHealth, serves as a pivotal gathering for global leaders across healthcare, academia, government, legal, and industry sectors. This esteemed event converges experts to explore and deliberate on the latest advancements and applications of artificial intelligence in healthcare. Scheduled for 2025, the summit will focus on crucial topics including last-mile adoptions of AI technologies, clinical applications in healthcare, data governance frameworks, AI and data privacy safeguards, advancements in vision and language models tailored for health contexts, explainable and responsible AI practices, and the promotion of AI education and literacy. In 2023, the summit welcomed over 500 delegates from more than 20 countries, representing a diverse spectrum including clinicians, technical experts, academics, regulators, startups, technology firms, venture capitalists, and AI enthusiasts. The expert panel featured distinguished figures such as the Editor-in-Chiefs from prominent publications like Nature Medicine and Lancet Digital Health, global and regional Technical and Marketing Directors from leading technology companies such as Google and ASUS, and senior governmental leaders from Singapore's Ministry of Health, National Research Foundation, and A*STAR. Stay tuned for updates and announcements as we prepare to gather once again for AI Health World Summit 2025, fostering collaboration and innovation at the forefront of AI-driven healthcare solutions. Date: 19 21 March 2025 (3 days) Time: 8am 6pm Venue: 19 - 20 March 2025 (2 days) Flower Field Hall, Gardens by the Bay Address: 18 Marina Gardens Dr, Singapore 018953 21 March 2025 (1 day) Ngee Ann Kongsi Auditorium at The Academia, Singapore Address: 20 College Rd, Singapore 169856 Ticket Price: - [Early Bird Promotion] 580 SGD (U.P. $900), inclusive of entry to Flower Dome on 20 Mar 2025. Visit www.healthsummit.ai for more details. For any enquiries, please email askai@singhealth.com.sg
943994863047.description: Join us at AI Health World Summit 2025 and hear from our experts and thought leaders.
943994863047.title: AI Health World Summit 2025

594566683957.summary: Vision: To become the most popular metaverse ecological social platform Mission: To connect the industrial chain - build a platform for knowledge sharing and resource docking, and provide information resources and solutions for the development of enterprises Values: openness, cooperation, win-win Preface to the summit: Metaverse is sought after by capital and has become a popular technology concept all over the world, attracting countless attention in the technology industry and the capital market. Statistics show that in the first five months of 2022, more than 120 billion U.S. dollars of investment has been used to build metaverse technology and infrastructure. And this figure is more than double the $57 billion invested in the whole of 2021. McKinsey released a metaverse report in June: Value Creation in the Metaverse (creating value in the metaverse), McKinsey said in the report that by 2030, the value of the virtual world may grow to 5 trillion US dollars , while conducting a survey of more than 400 senior leaders, 95% of business leaders believe that Metaverse will have a positive impact on their industry in the next 5-10 years. Meta is called meta in the computer field, and verse is the abbreviation of universe. Metaverse means to explore the next stage of the Internet. It is a continuous virtual space that can be shared, supported by AR, VR, 3D and other technologies. Also known as the third generation Internet technology. Metaverse is a new type of Internet application and social form that integrates multiple new technologies. It provides immersive experience based on extended reality technology, and digital twin technology generates a mirror image of the real world, and builds an economic system through blockchain technology. , closely integrate the virtual world with the real world in terms of economic system, social system, and identity system, and allow each user to produce and edit content. It was first mentioned in the novel "Snow Crash" published by American sci-fi writer Neal Stevenson in 1992. In 2021, the concept of metaverse will spread rapidly. Become the leader, and the concept of metaverse has begun to gradually become popular. If there is anything in the next five to ten years that can disrupt the global entertainment industry like Tesla disrupted the global auto industry, many people believe that it may be the Metaverse. The 2023 Yuan Expo & Yuan Universe Ecological Conference is held under such a background. This conference involves and covers Metaverse, Web3.0, NFT, Blockchain, Payment, AR/VR smart devices and other industries. It will attract more than 5,000 professional audiences and more than 80 well-known companies to participate. At the same time, this conference will communicate with many industries. Media cooperation and publicity have produced great brand exposure effects in Southeast Asia, East Asia, the Middle East, and Europe and the United States. Last year's 2022.11.24-26, Meta Expo Singapore was grandly held at the Marina Bay Sands Hotel in Singapore. It successfully attracted more than 3,000 people to participate. The audience, speakers and sponsors shared the development status and future trends of the overseas Metaverse industry. The development of Metaverse in Southeast Asia has a broad market prospect. Singapore MetaExpo 2023 will also give you an in-depth analysis of the development and future of the Metaverse industry in Southeast Asia. Summit Features: World-renowned Metaverse companies participated in the exhibition This summit will attract world-renowned Metaverse companies and Internet companies to participate in the exhibition, design encryption technology, digital technology, and financial industries to gather in Shanghai, bringing the most advanced Metaverse technology research and development exchanges and product applications to the participants, let us know To the most cutting-edge metaverse technology and commercial application development context. Authoritative guests and scholars share speeches This summit will invite the person in charge of the technology development field of the world-renowned Internet company Metaverse and the authoritative Metaverse researcher as the sharing guests of this summit, leading everyone to understand the whole process from the birth to development of the Metaverse to future application scenarios Experience, theory combined with technological development help us understand more clearly how the Metaverse and the third-generation Internet technology will change our future life. Immersive Interactive Experience Exhibitors at this summit brought immersive on-site experience equipment based on the development of AR/VR technology to the audience, allowing the audience to combine theory with reality, and experience the basic application scenarios brought to us by the development of Metaverse technology. Let everyone get a more intuitive personal experience. High-end network exchanges and upstream and downstream resources of the metaverse industry chain The Dimensional Universe (Singapore) Summit sets the corresponding participation threshold. The main audience of the audience is the management of technology companies, and the level of vice president and above, which is biased towards high-end customer communication and communication. At the same time, this summit integrates the upstream and downstream of the Metaverse industry chain resources, and provide visitors with necessary technical support and resource docking services. Agenda of the summit (for reference only): The Origin and Development of the Metaverse How the Age of the Metaverse Changed Our Lives NFT Technology and Metaverse Application of Decentralization Mechanism Metaverse must meet five characteristics The core of the metaverse is to solve the problems of the existing Internet The Big Opportunities and Big Challenges of the Metaverse Metaverse and Next Generation Social Metaverse Accelerates the Process of Digital Life Fully explore the commercial value of the Metaverse Metaverse in the 5G Era - The Comprehensive Evolution of Third-Generation Internet Technology Decrypt the underlying core technology composition of the Metaverse AI+Metaverse Digging deep into metaverse and blockchain digital economy topic discussion Is the metaverse a spiritual home or an abyss of human depravity? Artificial intelligence satisfies the material world, and metaverse satisfies the human spiritual world? The development stage of the metaverse, which stage of the development of the metaverse are we in, are we on the cusp? Contact: WeChat: 18621737740 WhatsApp/Telegram: +86 18621737740 Email: twinkle@ifinexpo.com Skype: twinkle01131206@163.com Website: https://ifinexpo.com
594566683957.description: Connect the industrial chain. Build a platform for knowledge sharing and resource docking; provide information resources and solutions.
594566683957.event_address: L4, Peony Main Ballroom Marina Bay Sands Expo& Convention Centre. 10 Bayfront Avenue, Singapore, 018956
594566683957.title: Singapore MetaExpo 2025

1024460357507.summary: Transforming Talent & Workforce Strategy with AI and Automation Join Us for an Exclusive Dinner Event in Singapore! Date: Tuesday 26 November 2024 Time: 5:00pm - 9:00pm Venue: LeVeL33 - Singapore We are thrilled to invite you to an exclusive event in partnership with Eightfold AI and Allegis Global Solutions . This event is designed for Heads of Talent Acquisition, Human Resources, Workforce Management, and Workforce Strategy to explore the transformative power, and ROI / Operational Efficiencies of AI and automation in talent strategy. Key Topics and Takeaways 1. AI in Talent Acquisition Discover how AI can revolutionise the way you attract and hire top talent. Learn about the latest AI-driven tools and technologies that can enhance your recruitment process. 2. Skills Development and Management Understand the importance of continuous skills development in today's dynamic workforce. Explore strategies to identify and nurture the skills your organisation needs to stay competitive. 3. Automation ROI Gain insights into the return on investment (ROI) of implementing automation in your talent development, skills and HR processes. Hear success stories and case studies from industry leaders who have successfully leveraged automation. 4. Operational Efficiency Learn how to streamline your Talent Operations to achieve greater efficiency and productivity. Discover best practices for optimising your workforce management processes. 5. Workforce Strategy Explore innovative strategies to build a resilient and agile workforces. Understand how to align your workforce strategy with your organisation's long-term goals. Event Highlights Expert Speakers : Hear from industry experts and thought leaders, as well as Leaders from Eightfold AI and Allegis Global Solutions on how they, and their clients are adopting technology, and how they track ROI. Interactive Sessions : Engage in interactive discussions and Q&A sessions to gain deeper insights. Networking Opportunities : Connect with peers and industry professionals over a 3-course dinner, drinks and canaps. Why Attend? Stay Ahead of the Curve : Equip yourself with the knowledge and tools to lead your organisation into the future of work. Actionable Insights : Walk away with practical strategies and actionable insights to implement in your organisation, and teams. Expand Your Network : Build valuable connections with other leaders in the field of talent acquisition and workforce management. Register Now! Don't miss this opportunity to transform your workforce strategy with the power of AI and automation. Seats are limited , be sure to secure your spot today. Event Disclaimer: Our curated events are designed to foster meaningful exchanges, and we cater meticulously to each participant. Should your plans change so that you are no longer able to attend, we kindly ask for timely notice to accommodate others who could benefit from this event. Our events are invitation only for Talent and HR professionals. Those who do not fit this profile will have their registration cancelled.
1024460357507.description: This intimate dinner event is designed for Heads of TA, HR, Workforce Management, and Workforce Strategy.
1024460357507.title: Transforming Talent & Workforce Strategy with AI and Automation

1037681351857.summary: Join us at the 3rd Clinical Trials Festival Festival Asia on 12 - 13 March 2025 at Marina Bay Sands, Singapore, where industry leaders come together to address the evolving challenges of clinical trials. CTFA 2025 is proudly celebrating its successful third year as the region's leading event for clinical trials and research leaders. Building upon the resounding success of our inaugural conference, we are thrilled to bring together industry experts once again to explore cutting-edge insights and advancements in the field. Join us as we delve into crucial topics shaping clinical trials, from protocol design to decentralized trials and effective trial management. This event offers valuable insights, networking opportunities, and collaboration to improve drug discovery and translation, ultimately benefiting patient outcomes. Asia's potential in clinical research takes center stage, with countries like Singapore, South Korea, and Australia becoming attractive hubs for international drugmakers. The conference provides a pivotal platform for discussing partnerships, regulations, patient engagement, and digital strategies, while exploring advancements in medical imaging. Our goal is to foster collaborations, share best practices, and explore innovative solutions to enhance trial efficiency and impact in the region.
1037681351857.description: The Asia Pacific Regions Only Dedicated Clinical Trials Conference for Biologics
1037681351857.venue_name: Sands Expo & Convention Centre, Marina Bay Sands Singapore
1037681351857.title: 3rd Clinical Trials Festival Asia 2025 (APAC, NON-SG Biopharma/Academic)

807551848317.summary: Illicit trade and counterfeiting pose significant and escalating threats to society. Governments face substantial losses in tax revenues due to smuggling, counterfeiting, and tax evasion. Legitimate businesses are adversely affected, and consumers are exposed to substandard and unregulated products. The ASIA Security Conference & Exhibition serves as a critical platform, uniting brand owners, regulators, law enforcement agencies, government policy-makers, and security solution providers to address challenges in anti-counterfeiting, online brand protection, cross-border product security, product smuggling, and diversion. This comprehensive event aims to explore and discuss the profound impacts of illicit trade on governments, brands, and society. After a successful 2023 Edition at Singapore, the ASIA Security Conference & Exhibition | Anti-Counterfeiting, Trademark & Brand Protection will convene again in Singapore focusing on the theme 'The Power of Collaboration and Unity in the Fight Against Illicit Trade and Counterfeiting.' The conference will attract an international audience of over 300 leading specialists engaging in discussions about the latest trends, developments, threats, and solutions pertaining to illicit trade and counterfeiting across various industries. This event provides a unique opportunity to delve into winning strategies, successful case studies, and cutting-edge technologies, with a particular emphasis on the Asia-Pacific (APAC) region. The agenda includes interactive panel discussions, case studies, presentations, vibrant networking sessions, and an exhibition.
807551848317.description: 'The power of Collaboration and Unity in the fight against Illicit Trade and Counterfeiting'
807551848317.venue_name: Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre, an IHG Hotel
807551848317.title: ASIA Security Conference & Exhibition | Anti-Counterfeit & Brand Protection

984183207467.summary: Early 2025, Market development Mission to Singapore & Malaysia In-Sec-M, the Canadian Cybersecurity Cluster , in collaboration with Global Affairs Canada & Trade Commissioner service offices in Singapore and Malaysia is organizing a market development mission in the cybersecurity sector to Singapore & Malaysia. This mission is the logical follow-up to an exploratory mission led by In-Sec-M to Singapore, Malaysia and Indonesia in October 2023. While this mission enabled us to confirm the high export potential of this market, and to meet with the main local players, both public and private. From a cybersecurity perspective, Singaporean and Malaysian authorities are eager for cutting-edge technology that can secure their governmental, commercial, and financial infrastructures, especially in an environment where competition and ambitions of the neighboring major power make the issue even more urgent and crucial. Singapore's cybersecurity market is worth $3.7 billion in 2024, and is expected to grow to $6.4 billion by 2029, representing a compound annual growth rate of over 16%, compared with almost 11% in Canada. In Kuala Lumpur, the vibrant Malaysian capital, mission participants will have the opportunity to meet with representatives of leading public and private organizations active in cybersecurity. A visit to the brand-new cybersecurity center of excellence launched last year by Canadian firm Blackberry is also on the agenda. Numerous private meetings will be organized, including various networking cocktail, in partnership with local players and the Canadian diplomatic representation on site. In-Sec-M will also take the opportunity to present Canadian cybersecurity services and solutions to local buyers. On the agenda: Networking activities with key representatives from the Singaporean and Malaysian cybersecurity ecosystems, and more broadly, from the Asia-Pacific region. conferences, round tables, workshops and technological demonstrations; a trade show and its B2B matchmaking platform; numerous networking opportunities; meetings and group visits. Registration and information As the number of places is limited, they will be allocated on a first come, first-served basis. Registration deadline: December 30th, 2024, at 5:00 PM To register for the mission or for more information, contact: Fella Bouredji, Director of communications and Head of Member relations Fella.bouredji@insecm.ca
984183207467.description: In-Sec-M, the Canadian cybersecurity cluster, organises a trade mission at the occasion of GovWare 2024.
984183207467.title: Market development Mission to Singapore & Malaysia

1040353735027.summary: The Antibody Drug Conjugate (ADC) industry is poised for a transformative leap, with a surge of deals, innovations, and collaborations spotlighting Asia as the hub for next-generation ADC development. Asia is leading the way in advancing beyond traditional biosimilars, delving into novel payloads, conjugation technologies, and linkers. This heightened interest in ADCs is driven by the rising global incidence of cancer, which increases the demand for advanced therapeutic options. Breakthroughs in antibody technology are significantly boosting ADC efficacy and specificity, opening new possibilities for targeted treatments. This progress is bolstered by escalating investments and a growing number of FDA approvals, highlighting the field's potential and gaining regulatory confidence. Despite these exciting developments, the ADC sector faces critical challenges that demand innovative solutions and strategic planning. High development costs, intricate manufacturing processes, and potential toxicities are notable hurdles that require thoughtful strategies to overcome. ADC Asia Congress 2025 will provide a crucial platform that will bring together pioneers and key opinion leaders across mega-pharma and biotechnology focusing on Singapore, China, Japan, South Korea, Australia and the rest of Asia Pacific to discuss the latest technological innovations, clinical development, strategic collaborations, and common hurdles in the development of ADCs in the region. Event Highlights: Hear from 40+ leading industry experts and visionaries in the ADC field from Singapore, China, Japan, South Korea, and Australia on the latest advancements and future directions of Antibody Drug Conjugates. Engage with 300+ attendees to explore forward-looking perspectives on ADC research and development and discover how strategic collaborations can drive innovation. Delve into Asia-Pacific-specific challenges and opportunities in ADC development. Discover real-world applications and success stories from top researchers and companies in the Asia-Pacific region. Explore breakthrough technologies and methodologies shaping the future of ADC development, including novel conjugation techniques and advanced drug delivery systems. ADC 2025 is co-located with the 12th Annual Biologics Manufacturing Asia 2025, 9th Annual Biologistics World Asia 2025, 3rd Clinical Trial Festival Asia 2025, Biologics Digitilisation & A.I. World, and Asia-Pacific Bioprocessing Excellence Awards Gala Dinner 2025.
1040353735027.description: Asias Leading ADC R&D & Manufacturing Conference Uniting Asia Leaders in Antibody- Drug Conjugates market
1040353735027.title: ADC Congress Asia 2025: (Non SG- Intl Biopharma)
