1003341309867.summary: Addressing Finance Transformation Requirements for Singapore Organisations Financial leaders increasingly face the challenge of leading their organisations through a landscape of unexpected obstacles in today's constantly changing economic environment. The Chief Financial Officer's (CFO) function has grown far beyond traditional financial management to include a strategic mission to promote innovation, improve operational efficiency, and assure long-term sustainability. The future of finance highlights the vital need for the transformation of basic financial activities. As Singapore's position as a global financial hub grows stronger, the challenges for its public sector and businesses have never been higher. Inadequate financial management methods are widely seen as significant hurdles to operational and strategic efficiency in many industries, forcing a transition to more flexible, data-driven approaches. Singaporean organisations face significant hurdles due to outdated systems and procedures that are unable to satisfy current business requirements. These difficulties make it difficult to manage high transaction volumes and adjust to complex trading patterns, as they lead to delays in trading and clearing procedures. These inefficiencies highlight the critical necessity for a thorough revision of all financial management procedures. Outdated financial management systems in Singapore's public sector and corporations affect the entire landscape rather than simply individual organisations. These outdated systems result in fragmented financial data, making it difficult to plan strategically or make informed judgements. Errors, delays, and increased risks become the norm when effective integration and automation are not implemented. As regulatory expectations increase, these organisations must modernise their financial systems and adopt more agile, data-driven processes. Overcoming the critical challenges of outdated financial management systems among Singapores public sector and enterprises requires the urgent adoption of cloud-based Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) and Enterprise Performance Management (EPM) solutions . How Can Cloud-based ERP and EPM Solutions Turn Around Poor Financial Performance? Planning and Forecasting: By automating manual procedures and integrating data from throughout the organisation, cloud-based EPM solutions improve planning and forecasting. With real-time insights and standardised inputs, firms may increase forecasting accuracy by switching from intricate spreadsheets to a single platform. This change lowers errors, boosts consistency, and helps teams make data-driven decisions more quickly, leading to more accurate financial projections. Empowering Financial Planning: These technologies transform financial planning by combining historical data, budgets, and projections into unified models. This integration enables exact trend analysis and risk assessment while minimising errors and inefficiencies through automated data aggregation. Real-time data keeps financial insights current, allowing for faster and more strategic decision-making. Furthermore, automating difficult calculations and consolidations improves data processing efficiency, allowing finance teams to focus on strategic projects and increasing agility in a changing business environment. Maximising Efficiency and Effectiveness with Automation : Automating financial procedures dramatically improves efficiency and effectiveness. Employees can devote more time to strategic activities that drive corporate success by removing regular duties like data collection and consolidation. The automation of forecasting models and reporting simplifies operations, allowing for better decision-making and planning. Continuous updates and predictive analytics from cloud solutions provide flexible forecasting and rapid adaptation, benefiting all stakeholders by increasing overall efficiency and speeding up planning procedures. The session will allow delegates to: EMBRACE the future by understanding how cloud-based ERP and EPM solutions are transforming financial operations across Singapore's public and enterprise sectors EXPLORE how these advanced solutions streamline forecasting, enhance accuracy, and enable real-time decision-making, all of which are crucial for maintaining Singapore's competitive edge UNDERSTAND how integrated data management and automation are revolutionising financial planning, allowing teams to shift focus from manual tasks to strategic growth initiatives DISCOVER effective strategies for overcoming outdated systems and manual inefficiencies, thereby enhancing efficiency and agility in financial operations Who should attend Chief Financial Officers Directors of Financial Planning and Analysis Heads of Finance Planning Heads of Finance Transformation Heads of Budgeting Heads of Financial Controller Heads of Treasurer
1003341309867.venue_name: voco Orchard Singapore, an IHG Hotel
1003341309867.title: Empowering Financial Leadership to Drive Transformations Through Innovation

1038715896207.summary: The Digitalisation and Al presence in the Global Biopharma Industry is valued at approximately USD 1784.1 Million in 2022 and is expected to exhibit a robust growth rate exceeding 5.7% 2023 to 2030. It is expected to reach $2.47 Billion by 2027. Meanwhile, the APAC market is catching up rapidly with digitalisation as many corporates are adopting technology in their research, manufacturing and supply chain initiatives. Governments including the nations of Singapore, China, Australia, South Korea, Japan, India, Taiwan to mention a few, offer strategic incentives for biomanufacturing, promoting investment, technology adoption infrastructure development and supportive regulations to bolster the region's biopharmaceutical manufacturing capabilities. The event this year hence features a focused track on Biologics Digitalisation & AI on the first day, 12th of March. This congregation would be a platform to meet the leaders from the Biologics World of APAC, who have pioneered in adopting AI & Digitalisation in the R&D, Manufacturing/Bioprocessing, Quality, Compliance and Supply Chain aspects to improve the efficiency of processes, productivity and to reduce cost while bringing best in quality.
1038715896207.description: Meet key leaders from the APAC biologics world, who have pioneered in adopting AI & Digitalisation in R&D, Manufacturing, and Bioprocessing.
1038715896207.venue_name: Sands Expo & Convention Centre, Marina Bay Sands Singapore

1010257386037.summary: Celebrating 12 years, Biologics Manufacturing Asia 2025 is Asias bioprocessing-focused, knowledge-sharing conference that provides regional biopharmaceutical industry stakeholders a carefully tailored networking platform for leveraging opportunities for strategic collaboration, and exposure to the latest manufacturing technologies and know-how. We have an agenda built around success stories from Asias biopharmas as well as the technical expertise from International Biopharmas and BIG Pharmas, presentations on the latest manufacturing technologies such as single-use and end-to-end continuous processing for biologics, todays challenges and opportunities in biomanufacturing, advances in upstream process development, cost-optimization strategies in downstream processing, analytical characterization strategies, facility design, and scale-up strategy, fill & finish innovation to streamline the operations amongst other crucial themes. The BMA 2025 is co-located with 9th Annual Biologistics World Asia 2025, 3rd Clinical Trial Festival Asia 2025 and Asia-Pacific Bioprocessing Excellence Awards Gala Dinner 2025.
1010257386037.description: Don't miss out on Biologics Manufacturing Asia 2025!
1010257386037.title: Biologics Manufacturing Asia 2025: (International Biopharma/Big Pharma)

1038714140957.summary: The Digitalisation and Al presence in the Global Biopharma Industry is valued at approximately USD 1784.1 Million in 2022 and is expected to exhibit a robust growth rate exceeding 5.7% 2023 to 2030. It is expected to reach $2.47 Billion by 2027. Meanwhile, the APAC market is catching up rapidly with digitalisation as many corporates are adopting technology in their research, manufacturing and supply chain initiatives. Governments including the nations of Singapore, China, Australia, South Korea, Japan, India, Taiwan to mention a few, offer strategic incentives for biomanufacturing, promoting investment, technology adoption infrastructure development and supportive regulations to bolster the region's biopharmaceutical manufacturing capabilities. The event this year hence features a focused track on Biologics Digitalisation & AI on the first day, 12th of March. This congregation would be a platform to meet the leaders from the Biologics World of APAC, who have pioneered in adopting AI & Digitalisation in the R&D, Manufacturing/Bioprocessing, Quality, Compliance and Supply Chain aspects to improve the efficiency of processes, productivity and to reduce cost while bringing best in quality.
1038714140957.description: Meet key leaders from the APAC biologics world, who have pioneered in adopting AI & Digitalisation in R&D, Manufacturing, and Bioprocessing.
1038714140957.venue_name: Sands Expo & Convention Centre, Marina Bay Sands Singapore
1038714140957.title: Biologics Digitalization & AI World 2025 (Solution Provider)(SG)

864416572237.summary: CDICS 2024 warmly welcome authors to submit your research papers to CDICS 2024 and share your latest research results with other researchers from all over the world. The registered and presented papers will be included in the CDICS 2024 Conference Proceeding (online publishing) subject to meeting publishers scope and quality requirements. The proceedings will be submitted to Engineering Village, Scopus, and other databases for reviewing and indexing. The author should submit the draft version of paper for review before the due submission deadline. Please submit the manuscript via: https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/CDICS2024 Topics of interest for submission include, but are not limited to: Track I: Data Science and Applications Foundations of Data Science Programming Techniques Analytics and Metrics Representation Formats Cloud Computing Techniques Mobile and Pervasive Computing Data Structures Data Management Data Quality Data Modeling and Engineering Protection, Integrity and Privacy Visualization Databases Big Data Data Mining Parallel and Distributed Data Mining Data Streams Mining Graph Mining Spatial Data Mining Multimedia Data Mining Statistical and Scientific Databases Temporal, Spatial, and High Dimensional Databases Deductive Databases Track II: Information Science and Technology Information Management Information Engineering Information security Information Retrieval Information Theory Information Systems and Technology Information & Knowledge information processing Intelligent information processing technology Information-centric networking Image and Signal Processing Distributed Information Systems Information and Communication Technology Communications and Networking Bioinformatics and Computational Biology Applications of Blockchain Technology Web Technology and Management IT Education and Society Accounting and Financial Information Systems Business Strategy and Information Technology IT Software Development and Methodology Knowledge Management Track III: Computing Science Activity-based computing Ambient computing Artificial and Computational Intelligence Big data-oriented computing Cloud Computing Cognitive computing Data intensive computing Dependable computing Distributed Computing Parallel computing Embedded computing Edge computing Fog-computing High-performance computing Human-centered computing Intelligent computation Macro- and micro-computing Mobile computing Sensor-based computing Quantum Computing Network Computing Real -time Computing If you have any question or need any assistance regarding the conference, please feel free to contact us. 1001676791247.summary: I am pleased to invite you and your team to the Spatial Biology Congress taking place on November 21-22, 2024 at NTU@One-North , Singapo re . This year's event is co-hosted by the Genome Institute of Singapore (GIS) and Global Engage. The congress will feature a diverse range of topics including spatial omics technologies, imaging technologies, AI and data science, disease mechanisms, diagnostics, drug discovery, and emerging trends. In addition to the scientific program, the event will offer numerous opportunities for collaboration and networking. For CONFERENCE BROCHURE click kere Key Highlights: 20+ speakers from academia and industry experts Case studies from across variety of contexts Interactive panel discussions session Early career researchers and poster exhibition to promote scientific development Networking opportunities Meet the Scientific Committee: Shyam Prabhakar , Associate Director and Senior Group Leader, Genome Institute of Singapore (GIS), A*STAR Grace Yeo Hui Ting , GIS and BII Fellow, Genome Institute of Singapore (GIS) and Bioinformatics Institute (BII), A*STAR Ashraful Haque , Laboratory Head and Team Leader, The Peter Doherty Institute for Infection & Immunity, University of Melbourne Jonathan Loh Yuin-Han , Deputy Executive Director, and Research Director, Institute of Molecular and Cell Biology (IMCB), A*STAR Kylie James , Laboratory Head, Garvan Institute of Medical Research, University of New South Wales Attending a Spatial Biology Scientific Conference provides numerous benefits: Cutting-Edge Research : Stay updated on advancements in spatial multi-omics and emerging technologies. Networking : Connect with experts, researchers, and industry professionals for collaborations and partnerships. Application Insights : Learn about spatial biology's role in clinical research and interdisciplinary fields. Hands-On Learning : Engage in workshops and case studies to boost your skills. 1040288921167.summary: What You'll Do In Maharashtrian tradition, families gather for lunch on the 13th day after a loved ones passing. This meal serves as a tribute and a reminder that life, like laddoo, a sweet dish always served on such occasions, is a beautiful balance between sweet and sour. Vishakha, honouring her father-in-law who passed away earlier this year, will be preparing a menu reflecting his tradition. Guests can expect comforting dishes like rice kheer, tangy kokum, and her father-in-laws favourite fried vadai a heartfelt nod to his memory. About Whats For My Dinner In moments of remembrance, food becomes a heartfelt tribute to our departed loved ones. This year, join us as we witness the preparation of these special meals and learn about the connection between food and the departed from communities from different cultures, nationalities and background. Multiculturalism is important in Singapore as it serves as the bedrock of the nation's societal fabric. It fosters mutual respect and harmony among diverse ethnic communities with different cultural practices, languages and religions. This shared understanding bridges social divides, cultivating an environment where every individual feels valued and included. It shapes Singapore's unique identity on the global stage, fortifying its reputation as a cosmopolitan hub. Food serves as a conduit for understanding and appreciating our neighbours culture and traditions. From Singaporean food to ASEAN cuisine to far beyond, there are dishes sure to suit everyones tastebuds. Through interacting with members from different communities, Whats For My Dinner aims to inculcate a greater awareness of the diverse communities residing in Singapore. It spotlights Singapore, through many of its culinary adaptions, as a melting pot of cultures and encourages deeper appreciation of our multicultural identity. Be inspired by the flavours and friendships and let us makan (dine)! About The Host Vishakha was born in Baroda, Gujarat but raised in Nagpur, Maharashtra. She studied Hotel Management and worked in Mumbai and Pune. Back in India, she was a culinary teacher and chef. When she met her partner, a captain of a merchant navy, she travelled the world. In 2019, they moved to Singapore. However, no matter where she goes, food still reminds Vishakha of her hometown. She continues to cook with her roots in mind but based on the availability of ingredients, substituting recipes with fresh ingredients that she can source from the markets here. Who should come? Everyone is welcome to participate! Participants under 13 must be accompained and supervised by a parent/guardian at all times. Programme Details Approximate Duration: 2 hours (Please arrive 15 minutes before the tour for registration) Language: English Meeting Point: Meet at the Security Post of Melville Park Condominium (16 Simei Street 1, Singapore 529942). Ending Point: The event will start and end at the same point. The events will proceed rain or shine. What to bring? Participants should be dressed respectfully in smart casual (i.e. collared shirt, long pants and covered shoes). Sleeveless attire, shorts/miniskirts or sandals are strictly not allowed. Participants will be denied entry if they dress inappropriately. Participants should bring along an umbrella and a bottle of water. Please ensure that you bring along any personal medication. Asthmatic individuals are reminded to bring their inhaler. Other important information Dishes may contain peanuts, tree nuts, dairy, and gluten. The food is vegetarian but not halal-certified. Parking is available in the condominium. The venue is wheelchair accessible. Photography is allowed at event premises. Disclaimer All ticket sales are final. There will be no refund if you wish to cancel your tickets. Each ticket admits only one participant. By agreeing to participate in the tour, every participant will be responsible for any injury, loss of damage due to careIessness of other actions on his/her part or that of children under his/her charge. Videos and photographs may also be taken during the event. By registering for this event, you give My Community full rights to use the photos for marketing and publicity. For updates: Follow us at @mycommunitysg on Instagram and @myqueenstown on Facebook. Visit mycommunity.org.sg to learn about our initiatives. Visit mycommunityfestival.sg for all our latest updates.
1040288921167.description: Join Vishakha for a heartfelt Maharashtrian tribute, honouring family memories with a traditional meal that celebrates love and stories!
1040288921167.venue_name: Meet at the Security Post of Melville Park Condominium (16 Simei Street 1, Singapore 529942)
1040288921167.title: My Maharashtrian Dinner with Vishakha Shahane

1041896750227.summary: About Each Program Are you looking to obtain Canada Permanent Residency? Are you an entrepreneur with an innovative business idea OR a highly skilled investor? By investing just $195,000 CAD, you can get permanent residency in Canada for your WHOLE family (that's you, your spouse and any children under the age of 22!). About the Canada Start-Up Visa Program: Offers a direct pathway to Permanent Residency for qualifying applicants. Total cost of CAD $195,000 (approximately AED 526,000) inclusive of investment and fees. Business founders are matched with other highly skilled applicants. Permanent Residency (PR) irrespective of success or failure of the business. Benefits extended to investors family (spouse and all children under the age of 22). Eligibility to apply for Canadian citizenship and passport after 3 out of 5 years have been spent in Canada. ______________________________________________________________________________________________________ About the Portugal Golden Visa Program: You can qualify for residency by investing EUR 280,000 in real estate property (one of the lowest investment thresholds in Europe). You dont have to move to Portugal to keep your residence permit. Staying in the country 7 days in the first year and then 14 days every subsequent 2 years will suffice. You can live, work and study as well as access healthcare and free education in Portugal. You can travel freely within the Schengen Area (which includes most European Union countries). Favorable corporate and income tax regimes. You are eligible to apply for Portuguese citizenship and/or EU passport after 5 years. Once you become a Portuguese citizen, you get visa-free access to 188 countries. * Additional times and dates are available on request ____________________________________________________________________________________________________ The Caribbean has many investment immigration programs in countries such as Dominica, Antigua & Barbuda, St. Lucia, St. Kitts, and many more. These programs are hugely popular with investors around the world due to their affordable nature, and short timelines to residency. About Caribbean Programs: Typically processed in 3-4 months (from the time of application submission) Associated costs with the Caribbean programs are usually between $200,000 to $300,000 More affordable option for investors looking for secondary citizenship ____________________________________________________________________________________________________ About Step Global: Step Global is a leading investment immigration advisory firm in the UAE and MENA region headquartered in Dubai. We specialize in permanent residency and citizenship by investment programs. Our clients include individuals and their families looking to acquire alternate or second citizenship, or to migrate to another country through investment. Our award-winning team of immigration lawyers advise clients on which citizenship by investment program would be best suited for them based on their immigration needs and risk profiles. Contact: info@stepglobalgroup.com | +971 4 770 7825 | www.stepglobalgroup.com

1041896750227.title: 1 to 1 Consultation with Step Global on Canada, Portugal and Caribbean Visa

1004677997937.summary: Bx - Business Networking Reimagined is a fun, social, dynamic and productive networking event, designed to help your business grow through referrals and business opportunities. Come along as a guest or as a member, you can attend ANY and as MANY as you like! We are the FASTEST GROWING business networking community across the globe, both face-to-face AND online. We help you GET RESULTS in your networking. There are no minimum requirements or performance measures. Everyone just wants to help! Meetings are relaxed and friendly, there's structure to maximise networking...but not all the rules! 80% of the meeting is spent getting to know other business owners. Our breakfast events include an la carte breakfast and barista-made coffee, and our lunch and dinner events, include an xceptional la carte meal, available from our special Bx menu for each event. We have a relaxed, enjoyable atmosphere for you to get to know, and build strong working relationships with other professionals, in order for you to grow your revenue. We believe that the best way to produce loyal, repeat business is through word-of-mouth. After all, it's WHO you know, not WHAT you know! At the end of the day, we understand MONEY TALKS and at Bx, we have a return on investment money-back guarantee from your membership and investment into Bx. We really are NETWORKING REIMAGINED! HERE'S HOW OUR LUNCH EVENT'S RUN: 9.00am - 9.25am - Open Networking 9.25am - 10.05am - 40 Second Business Introductions 10.05am - 10.25am - Feature xCite Presentation by Member 10.25am - 10.55am - Three x 10-minute 1-2-1 Meetings If you would like to find out more about Bx and our events, check out our website: https://bxnetworking.com/locations/ Come along to a Bx event near you and grow your business, meet great people, and take part in NETWORKING REIMAGINED!

998521684237.summary: The Urban Living MEA 2024, takes place at Rove Downtown, Dubai Now in its fourth year, hospitality and real estate leaders convene at the region's only b2b conference and exhibition on hotels, serviced apartments, branded residences, coliving, student housing, holiday homes and short-term rentals. NEW FOR 2024: case studies unique workshops focus coliving trends, and their impact on hospitality exploring what are the real estate business models of the future? deep dive into assisted living. 'socialising the box' workshop. technology sessions: the value of 'trust'; the smart apartment; channel management and distribution; property management. battle of the dealmakers and more WHAT'S NOW? WHAT'S NEXT? Urban Living MEA is evolving to reflect the rapid pace of change in one of the worlds most vibrant and fascinating hospitality markets. The Middle East and Africa regions continue to actively broaden their tourism and hospitality accommodation offerings to address an increasingly diverse and more sophisticated traveller requirement.The agenda reflects the very latest market dynamics such as technology, operations management, space-as-a-service (SAAS), as well as the ever-present topics that form the bedrock of the industry: finance and investment, design, legal, branding, digital, sales and marketing, distribution and more. DUBAI REAL ESTATE UPDATE* Pent-up demand from travellers and increased spending by residents led the post-pandemic recovery of the real estate sector in Dubai. Inflation remains a concern for consumers and is expected to impact sentiment resulting in price discovery and rent increases leading into 2023. Occupancy for Dubai averaged 72% at the end of 2022, compared to the same period in 2021, while the average ADR over this period has increased by 22% year-on-year to AED 674. This is higher than the majority of the regional and international markets. Average sales prices for residential property in Dubai increased by approximately 10% between Q3 2021 and Q3 2022. Average rents also increased by approximately 21% over the same period. * Deloitte Dubai market review 2023 Forecasts predict that the real estate sector will reach AED300 billion by the end of 2023. In 2022, sales volumes in the emirate registered AED261 billion, showing a 75 percent increase from AED149 billion in 2021. The MEA region already has a fast-growing hospitality development pipeline with a wide range of projects from local and international developers and operators. The area is rapidly becoming a global hot spot for hospitality real estate with activity levels ramping up considerably - we look forward to seeing you there!
998521684237.description: Located at Rove Downtown, Dubai: The 4th annual B2B event unites hospitality & real estate leaders in hotels, residences, coliving & more.

923438297807.summary: Welcome to the 3rd International Conference on Primary Care and Public Healthcare! Date: May 08-09, 2025 Location: Dubai, UAE Join us for a dynamic event focused on the latest advancements in primary care and public healthcare. This conference will bring together experts from around the world to discuss key issues, share insights, and network with peers. Don't miss this opportunity to learn from top professionals in the field and gain valuable knowledge to enhance your practice. Register now to secure your spot! Conference Objectives: The primary aim of the conference is to provide a comprehensive platform for the exchange of ideas, research findings, and clinical practices. Participants will have the opportunity to discuss the latest advancements in primary care and public healthcare, explore innovative solutions to current challenges, and network with peers from diverse backgrounds. Key Topics: The conference will cover a wide range of topics, including but not limited to: Primary Care Innovations: Exploring new models of care, patient-centered approaches, and the integration of technology in primary care. Public Health Strategies: Addressing global health issues, prevention strategies, and public health policies. Chronic Disease Management: Best practices in managing chronic diseases, improving patient outcomes, and reducing healthcare costs. Health Equity and Access: Ensuring equitable access to healthcare services and addressing disparities in health outcomes. Telemedicine and Digital Health: The role of telemedicine in improving healthcare delivery and the impact of digital health tools. Mental Health and Well-being: Promoting mental health, addressing the stigma, and integrating mental health services into primary care. Healthcare Policy and Reform: Discussing policy changes, healthcare reforms, and their impact on primary care and public health systems Call for Papers: The conference committee invites researchers and practitioners to submit abstracts for oral and poster presentations. This is an excellent opportunity for individuals to showcase their research, receive feedback from peers, and contribute to the body of knowledge in primary care and public health. Selected papers will be published in the conference proceedings, and outstanding contributions will be recognized with awards. Registration and Accommodation: Early registration is encouraged to secure a spot at this highly anticipated event. Detailed information on registration fees, accommodation options is available on the conference website. Conclusion: The 3rd International Conference on Primary Care and Public Healthcare promises to be a landmark event in the field of healthcare. It offers a unique platform for knowledge exchange, professional development, and collaboration. We look forward to welcoming you to Dubai in May 2025 for an enriching and impactful experience.

915120208177.summary: Started in 2006, Molecular Frontiers operates as a non-profit organization, hosted by the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences. Its Scientific Advisory Board, a group of eminent scientists including many Nobel Prize laureates, represent expertise from a wide range of molecular science disciplines. For the first time, a Molecular Frontiers Symposium will take place in Hong Kong. Lead organizers are Bengt Nordn, Pernilla Wittung Stafshede, Zhongli Luo, Chen Ping and Shuguang Zhang. All sessions will be conducted in English. This event is free of charge. A complimentary lunch will be provided to students who register for the morning sessions. Date and Time: 15 Nov 2024 (FRI) | A.M. Session 08:30 - 13:30 | P.M. Session 13:30 - 18:15 16 Nov 2024 (SAT) | A.M. Session 08:30 - 13:30 | P.M. Session 13:30 - 18:15 17 Nov 2024 (SUN) | A.M. Session 08:30 - 13:50 | P.M. Session 13:50 - 16:15 Venue: Shaw Auditorium, Hong Kong University of Science and Technology For more information and agenda updates, please visit: https://molecularfrontiers.org/symposia/hong-kong-2024 For enquiries regarding student registration for high schools/secondary schools, please email: hkinnovationnode@mit.edu
915120208177.description: Join the 3-day Molecular Frontiers Symposium in Hong Kong; meet Nobel Prize laureates and explore the frontiers of new knowledge in science!

917454490077.summary: Our meetups are designed to provide a rich learning experience, valuable networking opportunities, and a platform for collaborative innovation. What will we discuss: Foundations of Cryptocurrency: Understand the basics of cryptocurrencies and blockchain technology. Learn about the history and evolution of digital currencies. Gain insights into how cryptocurrencies work, including mining, transactions, and security. Investment Strategies: Explore various investment strategies in the cryptocurrency market. Learn how to evaluate and select promising cryptocurrencies and blockchain projects. Discover techniques for managing risk and building a diversified crypto portfolio. Blockchain Technology: Delve into the technical aspects of blockchain technology. Learn about smart contracts, decentralized applications (dApps), and how they are transforming industries. Understand the role of consensus mechanisms like Proof of Work (PoW) and Proof of Stake (PoS). Regulation and Compliance: Stay updated on the latest regulations affecting the cryptocurrency industry. Learn about the legal and compliance aspects of trading and using cryptocurrencies. Understand the importance of KYC (Know Your Customer) and AML (Anti-Money Laundering) regulations. Future Trends and Innovations: Explore emerging trends in the cryptocurrency and blockchain space. Gain insights into new technologies, such as DeFi (Decentralized Finance), NFTs (Non-Fungible Tokens), and more. Understand the potential impact of these innovations on various sectors and the global economy. What You Will Gain: Networking Opportunities: Connect with like-minded individuals passionate about cryptocurrencies and blockchain. Build relationships with industry experts, entrepreneurs, and investors. Participate in discussions, share ideas, and collaborate on exciting projects. Practical Skills: Develop practical skills for trading, investing, and using cryptocurrencies. Gain hands-on experience with wallets, exchanges, and blockchain platforms. Learn how to secure your digital assets and protect yourself from common threats. Community Support: Become part of a supportive and knowledgeable community. Access resources, mentorship, and guidance from experienced members. Engage in ongoing learning through workshops, seminars, and panel discussions. Opportunities for Growth: Discover career opportunities in the fast-growing blockchain and cryptocurrency industry. Stay ahead of the curve by staying informed about the latest developments and innovations. Gain a competitive edge by understanding the future direction of finance and technology. Join us at Crypto Connect to unlock the full potential of cryptocurrencies and blockchain technology. Whether you're a seasoned investor, a tech enthusiast, or a curious beginner, our meetups offer something for everyone. Let's connect, learn, and build the future of finance together!
917454490077.description: Welcome to Crypto Connect: "Where Blockchain Meets Community" At Crypto Connect, we are dedicated to fostering a vibrant community
917454490077.title: Getting started in Bitcoin, Crypto and all things Blockchain

1000628425557.summary: Join the London Haynes Boone team for an evening of champagne, craft beers, and freshly made momos in the heart of Shoreditch at our quarterly event. This exclusive gathering is designed for Founders to meet, share ideas, and network in a relaxed, informal setting. We are thrilled to welcome NordicNinja as our Resident VC for the evening a role that we rotate between VC Managers at each event to introduce founders to key investors in the London market, their investment strategies, and what they can offer start-ups and Founders. NordicNinja is the largest Japanese-backed VC and growth investor in Europe, tackling the worlds carbon footprint with a focus on climate tech, deep tech, and digital society. The fund is made up of a team of founders and operators focusing on problem areas the world must solve - from transportation to healthcare to a wide array of digital infrastructure to decrease the vast carbon footprint. NordicNinja serves founders with ambitious missions, and its portfolio includes a number of companies which have achieved unicorn status. We are also delighted to partner with our sponsors for the event: Amplifi Solutions , Briffa , CSC and Six Berries . We hope to see you there! The London Haynes Boone Team RSVP as soon as possible tickets are limited and all registrations are subject to review and approval. Your hosts for the evening are Karma Samdup and Andrew Pannell For more information contact Caroline Hammond at +44 20 8734 2854 or Caroline.Hammond@haynesboone.com ------------------------------------------------------------------ About our Resident VC: NordicNinja NordicNinja is the largest Japanese-backed VC in Europe, tackling the worlds carbon footprint with a focus on climate tech, deeptech, and digital society. Formed of a team of founders and operators focusing on problem areas the world has to solve - from transportation to healthcare to a wide array of digital infrastructure to decrease the vast carbon footprint. NordicNinja serves founders with ambitious mission, and its portfolio includes a number of companies which have achieved unicorn status. About our partners and sponsors: Amplifi Solutions : At Amplifi , our purpose is to accelerate innovation for growth businesses in the UK and Ireland. We bring enterprise level experience and process to SME businesses, helping them to reach their goals faster and enabling investment to go further. We're driven by the belief that harnessing the potential of HMRC entrepreneurial tax schemes, namely R&D reliefs, not only fuels business growth but propels the entire landscape of innovation forward. We're not just navigating tax regulations; we're on a mission to empower your journey, transforming challenges into opportunities for your business. Join us in redefining success through the lens of innovation. Amplifi have a highly experienced team which includes qualified accountants, tax advisors and technical experts with backgrounds in manufacturing, engineering , software and life sciences. Our aim is to optimise claims for companies, whilst ensuring that all claims are accurately prepared and defendable under any HMRC or Revenue Commissioners scrutiny. Briffa : Established in 1995, Briffa has developed into one of the UKs leading specialists in intellectual property law. Whether youre involved in a dispute or you need help with a non-contentious matter (such as registering a trade mark), our team will quickly and diligently undertake the necessary work to protect, commercialise and enforce your intellectual property assets. From copyright to confidential information, and trade marks to trade secrets, Briffa is here to help. Plus, with offices in London (UK) and Cork (Ireland), and an established global network of agents, the firm is ready and able to assist with all aspects of IP law in the UK, Europe and beyond. SixBerries: SixBerries partners with non-technical startup founders and SMEs to transform great ideas into successful businesses by providing them with strategy, leadership and people. Sixberries business launchpad takes ideas and products/services which can be spun out into individual businesses, and its non-traditional model helps entrepreneurs from concept, ideation, validation, design, build, launch and growth. They also have a co-investment model to help early stage start-ups get going. CSC: CSC is the trusted partner of choice for more than 90% of the Fortune 500, more than 90% of the 100 Best Global Brands (Interbrand), and more than 70% of the PEI 300. We are the worlds leading provider of global business administration and compliance solutions, specialized administration services to alternative asset managers across a range of fund strategies, transactions involving capital markets participants in both public and private markets, domain name system management and digital brand and fraud protection, and corporate tax software solutions. Founded in 1899 and headquartered in Wilmington, Delaware, USA, CSC prides itself on being privately held and professionally managed for more than 125 years. CSC has office locations and capabilities in more than 140 jurisdictions across Europe, the Americas, Asia Pacific, and the Middle East. We are a global company capable of doing business wherever our clients areand we accomplish that by employing experts in every business we serve. We are the business behind business. Learn more at cscglobal.com. About us (the organiser) Haynes and Boone, LLP is an international corporate law firm with a cross-disciplinary team of nearly 700 lawyers providing a full spectrum of legal services to clients across the nation and around the world.
1000628425557.description: RSVP as soon as possible tickets are limited and all registrations are subject to review and approval.
1000628425557.title: Founder Drinks

848149557157.summary: Calling all retailers! Calling all retail entrepreneurs! Running any retail business can be tough. But here at Quickfire, we know firsthand how important the fast moving mid-sized UK retail sector relies on community to foster growth. Thats why we think networking should be fun! So, we strive to create unique experiences and the extra 'wow factor' for our guests. Our Retailer Dinners at the prestigious Ivy Club are by far our most popular events, and with good reason! We love bringing people together to discuss the highs and lows of life in ecommerce, as well as some cheeky personal questions thrown in! So, do you: Own, run or work for a mid-sized UK retailer (5m+ turnover)? Find it hard to keep pace with or grow your ecommerce business? Want to learn more about digital, ecommerce and tech from your peers? Then register to enjoy a fabulous three course dinner and plenty of drinks, hosted as a roundtable discussion by Quickfire Co-Founder and CEO Nathan Lomax. Join us for the perfect opportunity to expand your network and build meaningful connections. We hope to see you there! Meet our Speaker: Yasamine Beheshti , Head of eCommerce at Batra Group Yasamine is an experienced e-commerce professional with 7 years of expertise in driving innovation and delivering impactful results for online stores. A 2017 graduate of the University of Sussex with a degree in business marketing and management, Yasamine has consistently applied her academic foundation to excel in the fast-paced e-commerce industry. Her passion for continuous improvement and commitment to excellence make her a valuable asset to any business. Meet our Sponsors Klaviyo powers smarter digital relationships. With Klaviyo, marketing automation is driven by data from across your tech stack for a complete view of every customer. With your marketing channels communicating in one automation platform, you can increase conversions and revenue, while delighting customers with the targeted content they want. Omnicommerce helps businesses instantly use insight to improve focus and drive enhanced efficiency. 948421041867.summary: Design is Strategy Come join us for a thought-provoking panel discussion on how design can thrive in complex environments at the EY Seren Collab Space ! We will host the amazing Hanna Kops (Head of Experience at TfL Digital) who will introduce the topic " Design is strategy" and will highlight her experience in complex environments, touching on creative leadership and culture. This event is a blend of learning and development, insightful discussions, and meaningful connections with designers from diverse backgrounds. Connect with like-minded individuals, hear from industry experts, and get inspired to make positive changes in your career. Who should attend Service designers, UX professionals, Design Thinkers, System Thinkers and anyone interested in the field of service design Mid-career individuals looking to expand their leadership skills and network Experienced practitioners seeking a fun and engaging way to connect with the community _________________________________________________________________________ About the panel We are excited to host a discussion and learn from the experience of these design experts: Hanna Kops Head of Experience at TFL Over the last few years, Hanna co-built TfL Digital, the team behind the TfL Go app and other future digital experiences. TfL Go includes an innovative new approach to digital maps, was shortlisted for a D&AD Award and won multiple industry awards, including BIMA, The Drum and Design Week. She is also a Visiting Lecturer at the Royal College of Art (RCA). Before joining Transport for London, Hanna led design teams, innovation projects and culture change for a wide range of organisations in the UK and USA. She also co-founded a design studio. Clive Grinyer Consultant, Clivegrinyer Limited, former Head of Service Design Programme at Royal College of Art and Director of Service Design at Barclays Clive is a seasoned UX Strategic Advisor and executive trainer with deep experience in service design. He is the Advisory Board of the Design Museum Future Observatory, and has trained a wide variety of clients such as the Bank of England, Honda, Panasonic, and Southern Housing. He's also the lead for Project Love , funded by the US based Fetzer Institute, a year long project identifying how design can create artefacts and rituals to foster love in our relationships, communities and across society. Prior to this, he was the Head of Programme for the Service Design Masters for the Royal College of Art in London where he established a series of Challenge Labs in Social Impact, Liveable Planet, Financial Futures, Healthcare and Service Futures. He also led the service design team for Barclays Retail Customer Segments team. znur zkurt - Director of Design and Research at Genomics England Suzanne de Witte - Service Designer at Ford Motor Company _________________________________________________________________________ Where does the ticket fee go? The ticket fees reserve your spot, and the profits will be divided equally between the National Saturday Club ( website here ) and SDN-UK. The National Saturday Club runs design and creativity courses for 1316-year-olds across the country at their local university, college or cultural institution, for free, to develop their skills, nurture their talents, and encourage their creativity. Event Location: EY Seren Collab Space - Standup area (First Floor East) 1 More London Place, London, SE1 2AF

1043454710127.summary: Event: How to Start Up Funding Date: Wednesday, November 6th 2024 Time: 12.00 - 14:00 GMT Venue: Digital Dock, 205 High Street, Brentford TW8 8AH Starting and growing a business is a rewarding challenge. There is so much to learn. This webinar is designed to show you how to get started quickly without wasting time, resources and money. This series is specifically aimed at female entrepreneurs. Join us for this live workshop and learn how to prepare your business to be funding ready is a fundamental step in your business growth. In this session we tell you exactly what you need to do to get ready for the big leagues. In this session we will help you: Understand the funding landscape Understand the types of funding available Discover the best financing alternatives tailored to your business growth needs. Get a breakdown of each of the major funding options. Learn how to get your numbers together without breaking a sweat. Develop a sales forecast for the upcoming 12, 24, and 36 months. Gain proficiency in understanding your numbers like an investor will. Led by Helen Roberts of CPG, who has over 20 years of experience each in helping new businesses develop set up and grow quickly across all industries. Who is it for? This is for any person based in Hounslow Borough who wants to start and grow a successful business quickly and with minimal fuss. It is also for any business less than 1-year-old that needs to tweak their current model to maximise results. This is Session 5 of a 6-part series for Hounslow Council's Female Entrepreneurs Programme. Join us for a series of six 120-minute webinars with experts in business who will give you the skills, tools and confidence you need to start and grow your business. The Sessions: Session1: How to create a viable business Session2: Developing your branding, sales and marketing strategy Session 3: Setting up a flow of consistent sales Session 4: How to get your first clients Session 5: Getting start-up funding Session 6: Habits of entrepreneurial success As part of this programme, you can also access: Digital Skills Programme 121 mentoring assistance helping you with strategy, marketing, sales and business growth Access to an extensive library of webinars and workshops specifically designed for small businesses Access to templates and tools to implement into their business. Peer-to-peer mentoring This programme is part of Hounslow Council's Business First Programme. This event is part of Hounslow Council's, Business First which is running from October 2023 to December 2024. It is run by Hounslow Council, CPG, Smarter Society and West London Chambers of Commerce, all collaborating to support local businesses and fuel the local economy. Find out more about the programme at https://www.mygrowthpod.com/hounslow/

964488841087.summary: Hi there, fellow social media creators, influencers, brands and all people interested in London. Welcome to our meetup! We at Social Rising organize regular events for you to connect, learn and grow, not only here but all over the world! We invite you to meet and engage in conversations with like-minded people both locally and in our worldwide community! First things first!: The best way to stay informed about our events is to join our newsletter at socialrising.com/join . If you're a creator with a significant audience , you will benefit the most from this newsletter at socialrising.com/join . You will be invited to public and exclusive events, and we will reach out to you with partner and job opportunities. If you want to help us creating our events: We're looking for 1-2 volunteers per event! Let us know if you're intersted through this form: https://socialrising.com/volunteer - we'll then reach out if we need you. What do participants & speakers think? "Matteo's meetups are incredible. Every time I come, I meet people who genuinely change my life. He somehow manages to get everyone involved, and the overall vibe is so nice. Can't wait for the next one!" - Dom (tech_wizzdom) "Matteo, thanks for the event yesterday. Its much better than other social media events that I have attended. Good work! So thanks!" Joe (via a Google Review) "What a fantastic group of people! If you are looking to connect with top-shelf digital communicators, Social Rising's meetups are perfect for that."- Oliver Aust - Founder, Investor, Bestselling Author, Podcast Host. "Matteo put on a killer event. Normally events are full of trivial, uncomfortable conversations, but I love Social Rising events, cool people and discussion points, and great locations", Digital Nomad Lifestyle. Our story In 2019 we started organizing meetups for creators & influencer in Berlin, and we became big fans of the people we brought together and the topics that were discussed. So we expanded to London early 2020, and as the pandemic started, we became a home for creators worldwide. Now, in 2023, we do our events in multiple cities and countries and are expanding to more and more countries. Wherever we are, influencers & creators connect, learn, and grow. Sometimes creators join us and share insights in lightning talks, and each time we all go home with new, interesting connections! Virtual events We have regular virtual meetups. Join your local meetup group ( https://socialrising.com/meetup-groups ) or follow our Eventbrite organizer dedicated to virtual events ( https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/o/social-rising-virtual-34048034485 ). Current Social Rising events: Paris #3 on October 2nd, 2024 Virtual #42 on October 7th, 2024 Vienna #5 on October 29th, 2024 London #14 on November 4th, 2024 Stockholm #1 on November 7th, 2024 Lisbon #4 on November 14th, 2024 New York #3 on November 18th, 2024 San Francisco #2 on November 20th, 2024 Bangkok on March 20th, 2025 What is this meetup for? Get to know new people in the social media space Share experiences with like-minded people Listen to inspiring lightning talks Brainstorm and share ideas with fellow creators Motivating each other Finding opportunities to work together Discuss how to approach and reach chosen target groups Sometimes we have a product/brand presenting how they can support you ... and of course: have a good time and grab a drink together! Your host Matteo Savio, CEO of Social Rising & Digital Ideas , hosts the event. As a digital marketer, he is consulting in B2B marketing & sales, and started Social Rising in 2019 as became fascinated by the topics and amazing people that showed up. He's enthusiastic ever since! Connect with him beforehand on LinkedIn ! What next? Do you have experiences in growing and/or monetizing on Social Media? We'd love you to apply for a lightning talk: socialrising.com/lightning-talk . Are you interested in helping us creating our events? Help out as a volunteer: socialrising.com/volunteer . Follow us on Instagram and check out event images from past events: instagram.com/socialrisingevents . Especially as a brand or product you might be interested in following us on LinkedIn: linkedin.com/company/socialrisingevents . Does your product bring value to creators? Apply for a product presentation: socialrising.com/product-presentation . Join the meetup group closest to you here: https://socialrising.com/meetup-groups . See you at the event! Your Social Rising Team

940225609107.summary: Have you always wanted to join a book club but dont have time to read the books? Or do you need inspiration for your reading list? Or are you dying to talk about your latest read with fellow book folk? Come on down to the Anti-Book Club! At the Anti-Book Club, there is no designated book of the month. Instead, everyone is invited to bring a book they recently finished - regardless of whether they liked, loved, or loathed it - and tell the rest of us what this book does (or doesnt do) for you. We are open to all kinds of books - audio, electronic, old school. In fact, it doesnt even have to be a book, as long as it is book-adjacent. And you dont have to bring the physical thing, just be willing to share something about it. The event will be facilitated by John Evans, long-time friend of SPACE4 and the cooperative movement, and Nida Sajid, resident librarian at creative collective Studio61, who will guide us through an evening of fun discussions. We will kick-off with an introduction by John and Nida, delving into their motivations for setting up the Anti-Book Club and what they hope to realise through it. We will then split up into smaller groups to chat about the books people have brought with them. Following this, we will reconvene as a room to share our insights and identify common themes across our audience-chosen book nook. There will be a selection of drinks and snacks available on the night as well as the option to purchase a home-cooked dinner, served up by Studio61s culinary team. The organisers John Evans is a software developer and imagineer residing in cyberspace. He is the project lead of spacetu.be, a group communication tool. Nida Sajid is a bibliophile living in London. She teaches all things culture and design at the University of Arts London and has previously worked for Libreria, a curated bookstore in Spitalfields designed for maximising serendipity. Studio61 is a co-operative made of people who are friends, neighbours and colleagues into all sorts of things - art, music, design, climate action, community energy, urban greening, technology, community organisingand more. https://studio61.substack.com/ https://www.instagram.com/thebookno0k/ SPACE4 SPACE4 is part of Outlandish, a co-op that builds websites and digital tools for social good. We are interested in tech for good, progressive economics, and social change. We provide co-working, meeting, and events space, primarily to social enterprises and digital activists. We also organise and host a range of events, workshops, and meetups around these topics. Dont hesitate to get in touch or visit us. Venue access information: https://space4.tech/visit-us Sign up to our newsletter: http://eepurl.com/dKiIsU Visit our website: https://space4.tech
940225609107.description: An alternative book club in collaboration with Studio61
940225609107.title: The Anti-Book Club | Last Thursday Sep to Nov

1044873232967.summary: Club Meeting (Mon 28 Oct 2024): Counter-Proliferation at the UN At our next meeting, we are pleased to have our fellow Club member Joshua Tjeransen as a guest speaker. Joshua is a specialist in counter-proliferation finance, supporting the coordination of day-to-day activities for the Counter-Proliferation Financing Project at the United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime (UNODC). His responsibilities include strategic planning, thematic research, capacity building, and awareness-building initiatives. Before joining UNODC, Joshua worked as a Research Assistant at the Centre for Science and Security Studies (CSSS) at Kings College London, where he conducted research on weapons of mass destruction (WMD) proliferation, sanctions evasion networks, and proliferation financing. He holds a masters degree in Countering Organised Crime and Terrorism from University College London and a bachelors degree in Criminology and Criminal Justice from the University of South Wales. He is currently pursuing a PhD at Kings College London, focusing on the intersection of financial crime and financial innovation, particularly Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDCs). We request all virtual attendees to switch on their cameras. F or those attending in person, please purchase your tickets by 18:30 on the day. We confirm food selection at the venue and order delivery ahead of the meeting start. 1029805605287.summary: Community Places and Spaces in East Barnet Please join us at St James Church, Tuesday 22nd October, 6pm - 8pm, for an open discussion about Community Spaces in East Barnet. This research included an audit of the community spaces, both formal and informal, through the lens of residents. We would like to gain your feedback on these findings and hold a discussion about how we can work to build on them. 908396447227.summary: Rise London are excited to bring our free monthly mentoring programme to this year's FTT Fintech Festival at the Brewery. Rise FinTech mentoring, gives FinTech startups the opportunity to meet 1:1 with our guest mentors. Our mentors include individuals from around the FinTech community and have expertise in marketing, legal, business development and other fields to accelerate your startup's growth. Were really excited to give you the opportunity to engage 1:1 with some of the top thought-leaders in the FinTech eco-system. We are also delighted to offer FREE entry to the festival to those participating in our mentoring programme (limited to 1 ticket per company). If you are accepted to attend, you will receive an e-mail with time confirmation, each time slot is 20 minutes each. This event will be in-person during the FinTech Talents Festival at the Brewery in London. Please ensure, before applying , you or a representative of your company is able to make it in-person on the day. FTT Fintech Festival Mentors Esme Wilson - has worked as a growth investor at Apis Partners for a year, specialising in fintech and particularly payments. Prior to joining Apis, Esme was responsible for M&A origination and execution at Apis portfolio company Teya (formerly SaltPay). Prior to this she worked in Private Equity at 3i and began her career in investment banking at Deutsche Bank. Esme graduated with first-class honours from the University of Oxford with a degree in Economics and Management. Ricardo Chaves - After kick starting in investment banking and the Ministry of Finance as a financial advisor, Ricardo developed his general management toolkit during his journey of more than 8 years at McKinsey, where he focused in Marketing and Sales in Telcos and Banking. His drive is transformation: he launched a successful start up rental company that turned top 3 in 5 years and lead a major turn around of the incumbent payment processor into digital and AI First. The last 2 years at McKinsey were spent co-leading a hub for Machine Learning and Advanced Analytics and since 2022 leads a center of excellence for AI at BPI (Caixa Bank branch in Portugal) focused on an AI first transformation of the bank, across all core areas (sales, digital, risk, operations, Customer Care, etc). Sadeque Ahmed - Visionary Product Leader, building a segment defining Digital Onboarding & KYC solution capable of supporting Individual, SME and Corporate client types across geography; using cloud native, API first and composable architecture. Expertise includes driving strategy, transformation and managing large global teams. 10+ years of global Onboarding & KYC domain experience across retail and wholesale banking. Non-executive Director (NED) and advisor for Miraj Studios - a childrens EdTech App - which provides content for Muslim parents interested in culturally enriched content for kids 4-9 years old. Wasim Mushtaq - career in financial services has focused on leading operational teams and delivering strategic change across banking sectors. Partnering with global banks to execute large-scale transformation, and advising innovative startups to launch new products and services. He currently is the Managing Director of 1CG (1Consulting Group). Wasim's specialisations: Digital Transformation : Leading several global banking system implementations in ACBS, Avaloq, Loan IQ, Mambu, FNZ. Financial Services : Specialist in improving businesses across all segments and industries for effective digital banking. Operations : Global head responsibilities in FCA, PRA and EBA regulated entities, SMF24 third party risk management. Product & Proposition : Replacing inefficient client propositions with new product development leveraging ecosystems. Outsourcing : Delivering strategic initiatives, reengineering digital banking transaction cycles across key client journeys. Client Segmentation : Prioritising target client cohorts for businesses, aligned to corporate strategy and sustainability. Lending : Developing, launching structured products. Credit sanctioning, full e2e lifecycle servicing, ex department head. Wealth Management : Specialist in structuring and improving businesses for effective Private Bank client experience.

1040727342497.summary: Date: November 8th, 2024 Time: 3 :00 PM - 5:00 PM, followed by networking drinks & refreshments Location: IDEALondon, 69 Wilson St, London EC2A 2BB We all know that protecting IP and entering into well-negotiated contracts is vital to the success of an early-stage business. But where do you start? How do you contract for maximum growth and innovation? **If you want the low down on everything involved with protecting your valuable IP in all of the contracts you might need to protect it in- this is the session for you ** Agenda: In this highly practical 60-minute session, we will work through the following: Why is protecting your IP so important? Confidentiality is a key issue, should you disclose confidential information and if you do, how do you ensure that your NDAs actually protect it? Your start-up is only growing from here on out. There are going to be other people, employees and contractors and consultants, helping in the development of the business and perhaps the development of the IP. How can you be sure that no one else ends up with a claim to your IP? What are the key issues and pitfalls in your out-sourcing agreements and consultancy agreements to make sure you retain ownership and control of your IP and new IP that is developed? If youre a university spin-out, then youre unlikely to have ownership of all the IP you need to develop and grow your company. What kind of licence agreement should you expect from the university? What should you be looking for in the grant funding agreements that created the IP in the first place? Collaborations are great, but how do you negotiate the key rights you need when new IP is created? Investor Due Diligence: How can you be sure that youve got the IP rights you need to give investors confidence in your start-up? How to avoid the chaos. If you use any Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning in your company, what are the legal issues and pitfalls to be aware of? Who is this for? This session is for anyone wanting to understand the legal arrangements around intellectual property in contracts and to help their company grow. Speaker Biography Dr Lisa Page is a partner in the intellectual property team who specialises in the life sciences and technology sectors. With a client base ranging from universities, pharmaceutical companies and software companies to digital and biotech start-ups and spin-outs, she advises on all stages of the innovation pathway. She has particular experience in the development stage of new products, covering collaboration, out-licensing and in-licensing arrangements including software licensing, SaaS and software development agreements, including AI. Lisa has a PhD in molecular microbiology and direct practical experience of working in the pharmaceutical industry before re-training as a solicitor. Her scientific background provides a specialist insight into the issues faced by her clients and enables her to speak their language when advising on development programmes and the exploitation of life science technologies. She has held a number of in-house legal roles, including at the Energy Technologies Institute and Coventry University, and is a director of the West Midlands Health Technology Cluster Organisation. ---- About UCL CDI's First Fridays Community Networking evenings Our First Fridays series is designed to empower the UCL CDI community by bringing together experts in academia, industry, and funding bodies to discuss essential topics surrounding funding and business readiness. It's an opportunity for you to gain valuable insights, connect with peers, and tap into the expert know-how that can fuel your entrepreneurial journey. Don't miss this opportunity to kickstart your Autumn'24 First Fridays series with us and set the stage for the November 8th event. Register now to secure your spot for an evening of knowledge-sharing, networking, and collaboration.
1040727342497.description: A focused introduction to protecting your IP in your contracts, which will be particularly helpful for early-stage life science companies.
1040727342497.title: CDI Workshops: IP & Contracts for Start-ups: Creating Value not Chaos

1001904813267.summary: SheSays Brighton for Dreamy Place 24, Brighton's digital festival Friday 25 October 2024 6.00pm to 8.30pm - in person Projects, Nile House, Nile Street BN1 1HW Are you a woman working in digital, tech, or creative industries? Come and join us for an evening with our fantastic speakers, talking about their extraordinary journeys in work and life. We are celebrating Dreamy Place 24, Brighton's digital festival ! Come and be inspired, make connections, and learn something new. Speakers to be announced very soon. We're delighted to hear from Alice Reeves! Throughout her career, Alice has worked for fast-paced startups and established global businesses across almost every sector. Shes worked client side, agency side, and freelance before co-founding and growing a successful brand and marketing agency, The Joyful, for five years. Alice was diagnosed with ADHD in 2021 and it completely changed the way she worked and related to herself and others. Now, as Co-Founder & Director of Joyfully Different, Alice supports neurodivergent folks to start and grow their businesses through our supportive online community, online & in-person events, programs and workshops for neurodivergent leaders and founders. Alice is fiercely passionate about diversity, inclusion, and raising awareness of mental health and neurodiversity. She is an ambassador for Beat, the UK's eating disorder charity, Founder and Host of Women In Business Worthing, Non-Exec Director for SIC, and the author of the Truth & Tails children's book series which celebrates diversity, builds understanding of each other's differences and promotes social inclusion. HURRAH! We've got Grace Baird ! As a Creative Producer with 10+ years of experience in the Arts, TV, and Immersive industries, Grace specialises in crafting audience-centred projects across various mediums. From site-specific installations to interactive films and social-VR experiences, she has delivered innovative projects in collaboration with renowned cultural organisations, broadcasters, production companies and game studios, providing audiences with fresh and captivating ways to engage with art and entertainment content. Passionate about experimental storytelling, Grace captivates audiences using cutting-edge technologies like mixed reality, spatial computing, VR, and immersive installations. With extensive experience leading teams as a Project Manager, Producer, and Executive Producer across real-world, virtual, and augmented-reality projects, she oversees the entire development pipeline from design to distribution. Grace is passionate about authentic, memorable experiences that prioritise audience enjoyment and meaningful engagement. Hosted by Rifa Thorpe-Tracey , a highly accomplished coach and founder of Refigure Ltd, with a focus on teaching women to create their big vision. With over 25 years of consulting experience, Rifa has won numerous awards and accolades for her work, as well as contributing to publications such as The Times and CNN. Rifa is also the driving force behind SheSays Brighton, Spring Forward Festival, (and Women of Colour Brighton), which attract hundreds of people from the digital and creative industries each year. Rifa empowers women not just to uplift themselves but to thrive and create change in the world. Her teachings focus on helping clients gain clarity and generate abundance. We can't wait to see you there, any questions drop us an email rifa@rifa.co.uk This event is mainly for women and anyone who identifies as a woman. Trans women are women. Non-binary, gender-queer people are very welcome at all our events. Would you like to sponsor this event? Get in touch SheSays Brighton is a Refigure event

1036637289037.summary: Are you passionate about shaping the future of Education through Technology? Whether you are a start-up founder, educator, developer or simply curious about the intersection of Education and technology, the event is for you! Date: 28thof November 2024 Time: 6.00pm - 8.00pm (Registration from 5.30pm) Location: Wellington Chapel,the Wellington by Blue Orchid Hotels, 71 Vincent Square London SW1P 2PA Title: Flipping the switch: How Generative AI makes digital and remote learning two-way conversational and why there is no looking back. Learn about the fundamental difference Generative AI brings to digital and remote learning and why it marks a paradigm shift in EdTech. Reflect on the data opportunity this new way of learning unlocks Imagine what it takes to make this technologyuniversally accessible Bios of speakers: Dr. Pauldy Otermans is a female tech leader in the UK. She is a neuroscientist and psychologist by academic background and a female leader of AI technology. She was awarded as the inspirational womxn in the Tech Industry by Hustle Awards, was named one of the 22 most influential women in the UK of 2022 by Start-Up Magazine UK, andhas also been awarded by the UK Prime Minister in the UK in 2021, and globally for her work. Pauldy helped build the first digital human teachers powered by AI in 2021 called OIAI. The language model developed for OIAI is now also used to power Teddy AI which provides a conversational AI study buddy for all children aged 3-7 years where parents can be part of their child's learning journey by prompting Teddy AI and get reports back. She is the winner of the Women in Tech Excellence award 2023. She is also active in the research community of AI in Education and is Topic Editor for Frontiers in AI: The Role of Conversational AI in Higher Education. Dev Aditya is an expert in AI from London, UK. He led the team that built the first Digital Human AI teacher (OIAI) with the mission to upskill 750 million learners globally by 2030. Currently, his AI teachers teach in 8 countries from teaching for universities and corporates to direct marginalised learners. Dev Aditya has also developed a specialist teaching and learning LLM OIMISA-7B. Dev Aditya was awarded by the UK Prime Minister for his work and has been a Young Global Innovator and Under 30 Social Entrepreneur (Mint). For research work in AI, he was recognised by Innovate UK and secured $250,000 in funding from them. He has conducted AI and HCI research with The Alan Turing Institute and Brunel University London, regularly publishes in this space, and his work is currently operatingin 15 countries. Lets Connect, Collaborate and Innovate together! ** By applying for this event, you consent to being photographed and recorded, and to receiving communications via the provided email. If you have any concerns, please contact us before the event.

976238404347.summary: Pop down to your local People Planet Pint meetup to find more about what's going on locally with sustainability and how you can get involved. No pitches, powerpoints or panels. Just People, Planet, Pint/s. Your local meetup is a great place to start your journey or continue learning, and meet diverse people to chat about life and how we can sustain it. Every job is a climate job, so come along and learn about how you can take action, as well as what is going on locally. We welcome everyone, regardless of their experience or background. People Planet Pint is a space where everyone can feel comfortable learning about sustainability and sharing their ideas. Afterall, creating a sustainable future requires connected communities. And what better way to bring everyone together than over a drink? Prefer a Pastry to a Pint? Head along to People Planet Pastry ! Equally relaxed and welcoming, they run during the day and offer an informal way to learn about what is going on locally in sustainability. Your Volunteer Hosts Georgia Strivens, Marketing Specialist Georgia is a global marketing expert with a specialism in sustainability, events and digital innovation. She has worked for start-ups all the way through to major blue-chip organisations, including Salesforce, Oracle, RELX, Vonage and Delinian. Georgia has an entrepreneurial mindset with a passion for crafting ideas and strategies to inspire individuals and businesses to embrace sustainability. She believes that these endeavours cannot be achieved alone and it is unrealistic to expect ourselves to possess all the answers or attain perfection. Instead, she advocates for transparency, openness, and the courage to have candid conversations in a supportive environment where ideas can be shared, whilst having fun at the same time. You can connect with Georgia on LinkedIn. Alex Greig, Founder, Fuggles Beer Caf Alex founded Fuggles Beer Caf in Tunbridge Wells in 2013, driven by a vision to create a venue showcasing the finest British and European beers, as well as exceptional wines and spirits, in an atmosphere blending elements of a pub, Belgian-style cafe, and bar. Since its inception, Alex has expanded with two additional establishments. His dedication to quality, community, and environmental responsibility has earned Fuggles Beer Cafe recognition in the Observer's 'Best Places to Drink' guide and won the CAMRA's Pub Of The Year competition. Alex has implemented a dedicated sustainability policy, driving various initiatives to minimise Fuggles' environmental footprint. From sourcing products from like-minded suppliers to implementing energy-efficient practices and waste reduction strategies, Alex is committed to creating eco-conscious hospitality and further integrating sustainability into every aspect of the business. Additionally, he leads a Sustainability Food and Beverage group in Tunbridge Wells as part of the local Amplifi programme, to help other businesses learn how to do the same.
976238404347.description: Pop down to your local People Planet Pint meetup to find more about what's going on locally with sustainability and how you can get involved
976238404347.event_address: 28 Grosvenor Road, Royal Tunbridge Wells, TN1 2AP
976238404347.title: Tunbridge Wells - Small99's People, Planet, Pint: Sustainability Meetup

1014340819697.summary: Please note: Registering your interest does not guarantee a ticket. This process allows us to carefully select attendees to ensure the content is highly relevant and valuable to you. It's our way of making sure your time is well spent. As an eCommerce brand focused on growth, navigating the future eCommerce landscape can be challenging. With the rapid rise of AI and other emerging technologies, the lines between performance and innovation are increasingly blurred. How can brands adapt their media strategies to not only survive but thrive? Join us for an insightful and interactive roundtable breakfast where well dive into the critical balance between risk and reward in the pursuit of growth. Well explore questions like: Are brands' potential defined by their aversion to risk? In an industry where the safest bet is often to stick with what works, how can companies embrace innovation without jeopardising performance? Innovation in eCommerce: How can businesses stay ahead of the curve with cutting-edge strategies that drive both immediate performance and long-term growth? Learning vs. Earnings - can you have both? We'll discuss whether its possible to maintain strong performance metrics while also investing in learning and experimentation that could unlock future growth. Through open dialogue with industry peers, well uncover actionable insights to help you navigate the complexities of growth, investment, adaptation, and operational scalability. Whether youre grappling with how to allocate budgets, integrate AI into your strategies or scale operations efficiently, this roundtable promises to be a powerhouse of practical takeaways. Event Details: Date: 21st October Time: 9:00-11:00 am Location: Club Room, SoHo House 40 Greek St, London, W1D 4EB Who Should Attend: T his event is designed for senior leaders within eCommerce brands, D2C brand leaders, digital marketers, and anyone involved in driving growth and innovation within their organisation. Why Attend? Curated Conversations: Engage in meaningful discussions tailored to your challenges. Expert Insights: Hear from thought leaders and industry experts who are redefining the future of eCommerce. Valuable Networking: Connect with like-minded professionals facing similar challenges and opportunities. Secure your place at the table and be part of a conversation that could reshape your approach to eCommerce success.
1014340819697.description: Register your interest for a no-prep, open discussion over a hearty breakfast to share what it takes to unlock a brand's true potential.
1014340819697.title: Breakfast Roundtable: Testing Times in eCommerce: Performance vs Innovation

A one-person company, which is why most things are a mess 7. Just there; the business might grow in 10-15 years ** Positive Image: ** 1. They would never guess it was a home business 2. They like to be associated with you 3. They see you as the leader in the market 4. They feel secure trading with you because there are standards in the company 5. They see you booming as time goes by 6. They are actually fans 7. They get more than just a product or service from you ** Greatest Needs of Businesses Today: ** 1. Getting and keeping clients 2. Having a good company image 3. Having a strong social media presence 4. Understanding why customers dont buy and do buy 5. Using communication to get sales 6. Positioning in the market ** Top Questions Life Guides Ask Their Students: ** 1. How many mentors do you have? 2. How many books do you read? 3. Have you made a life plan past the age of 60? 4. How many skills did you learn last year that will complement your sales? 5. How many of your friends are where you would like to be? 6. Do you believe you can be successful in all areas of life? ---
