1040621686477.summary: Choose from a selection of dates and times to suit you. Once you've registered, we'll pass on your details (name and email address) to Nicola, who might contact you with some questions regarding your meeting. Please advise Nicola if you are happy with an in-person session or you'd prefer to have the meeting online. Some of the areas that Nicola can discuss with you; Cloud Accounting, Pros and Cons and tips (QuickBooks and Xero) Pros and Cons of different company structures Registering as a sole trader with HMRC Director Responsibilities when setting up a Ltd company Registering for VAT, Payroll, CIS and Corporation Tax Using HMRCs online services (Government Gateway) Basics of Financial Reporting (P&L, Balance Sheet and Cashflow) These sessions are open to everyone, therefore if you think that you or someone you know would benefit from having this discussion then please book one of the available sessions now. This is offered free of charge, without obligation and in complete confidence. Expert biography About Nicola Starting a new business is an exciting time but can also be daunting. Nicola is passionate about helping businesses with their accounting and has spent the last six years supporting small and medium-size businesses to grow by providing all things accounting. Whether that's getting registered with HMRC, choosing whether to be a sole trader or Limited Company, putting manual bookkeeping onto digital software platforms, giving guidance on dividends, payroll and VAT, Nicola's all-round experience in industry and practice, over 25 years means she can help with all of these areas. Nicola works for Longwood Business Support, specialists in Accounting, HR and Recruitment - www.lwbs.co.uk Note The adviser is an independent professional and is not an agent or employee of the Council, nor the Library. They will be regulated by their own professional body and they will be able to provide you with details of that organisation. We will not be aware of any advice that is given to you by the adviser when you consult them in the 121 session and we do not verify or approve their advice. We therefore take no responsibility and make no representations regarding the relevance, accuracy, timeliness, completeness or otherwise of any such advice or information. Any views expressed by the adviser are their own views and not those of the Council. ------------------- This in-person 1-to -1 session will take place at the BIPC on the 2nd floor POD at Crawley Library. Following the session, the expert will send you a feedback form which we would be grateful if you could complete to allow us to monitor the success of our offered expert 121s. ------------------- Important All our expert one-to-one meetings on offer are free, but places are limited as our business expert partners are giving their valuable time to the BIPC and to you for free while fitting these sessions into their busy schedule. Therefore, if you need to cancel the session, to give a chance for others to still book it, please give at least two working days notice when possible via: email to enquiriesteam@westsussex.gov.uk, or cancelling your booking on Eventbrite, or email/call to the business expert. Please note down the experts' contact details when they get in touch with you prior to the session. ------------------- Increase your chances of business success Business & IP Centre Sussex supports people to start, grow and protect their businesses in Sussex. Come and access our free market research and intellectual property databases and take part in our regular programme of workshops, webinars and networking events. What if I don't live / have my business in Sussex? Find your local BIPC here to find out how they can help you: https://www.bl.uk/business-and-ip-centre/national-network ------------------- FAQs What is your cancellation policy? The majority of our events are free, but places are often limited - especially for in-person events, therefore please make sure you cancel your place, if you are unable to attend . You can cancel through your Eventbrite booking or emailing enquiriesteam@westsussex.gov.uk . Can I attend if I'm not a member of the library? Absolutely! Any Sussex based business/ person with a business idea is welcome. Though we always recommend joining the library as it's free and will make accessing our databases, books and publications much easier. How can I find out about any news & upcoming events? So glad you asked - we have a newsletter ! You can also follow us on Twitter , LinkedIn , Facebook and Instagram for the latest goings-on.

1042835447897.summary: We are excited that Worthing & Adur Chamber, Freedom Works & Barclays Eagle Labs are back with the second Worthing & Adur Digital Forum! This event is all about how to 'play' Google! Leveraging Google Workspace, Gemini AI and Quality Management Systems The importance of operational efficiency and security in driving business growth. Google Workspace's capabilities for streamlining communication, collaboration, document editing, and file management. How Google Workspace scales with business growth, supporting remote and hybrid work environments. Introduction to Gemini AI and its integration with Google Workspace, enhancing productivity and decision-making. The value of implementing ISO Management Systems for operational efficiency, compliance and winning tenders. 6 Wh ats of Organic Traffic What is it What value does it provide What do you need to see it What do you need to measure What do you need to get more of it What to avoid The structure of the event is as follows: Welcome & Introductions - with Freedom Works, Barclays Eagle Labs + Worthing & Adur Chamber. Robert Lee REAS Group, WorkspaceForBusiness.Com, AI-Experts.Work, and Guyana-Business.Com Leveraging Google Workspace, Gemini AI and Quality Management Systems Stephen Jones, Fresh Egg 6 Whats of Organic Traffic Panel Discussion + Q&A Networking, Drinks & Close The session will start with the three speakers and then a Q&A session finishing with networking, drinks & snacks. Panellists: Robert Lee - Founder, Investor & Owner of REAS Group, WorkspaceForBusiness.Com, AI-Experts.Work, and Guyana-Business.Com Roberts entrepreneurial leadership, coupled with his deep understanding of the business landscape and commitment to people first, sustainable tech and process driven practices, has made him a respected figure in the business community. His dedication to driving positive change and promoting economic development both in the UK and abroad has earned him recognition and awards in innovation and diversity and inclusion. Hes a hugely successful entrepreneur that founded REAS Group, WorkspaceForBusiness.Com, AI-Experts.work, and Guyana-Business.Com. REAS Group provides expertise in digital business transformation, video, social, web, apps and AI Data Management, helping businesses adopt new technologies effortlessly, to drive sustainable business growth - powered by AI. Guyana-Business.Com is a platform that provides valuable resources, news, market insights, and business directories, empowering users to make informed decisions and foster economic growth in Guyana - the fastest growing economy in the world and the UKs largest trading partner in the Caribbean. Stephen Jones, Fresh Egg Stephen started his career as a bookseller in a busy branch of Waterstones, supervising the order section and advising on a branch-wide strategy for customer ordering. He followed books into a library career, first at a legal library in the City and then the Research Library at the Royal National Institute of Blind People (RNIB). During this period, he helped convert the library catalogue into an online, user-accessible, digital format and integrate with the collection held by the National Library for the Blind, resulting in the largest accessible catalogue of research material on blindness in Europe. Moving into publishing, Stephen then became web marketing manager at Elsevier Health Sciences, managing the B2C and B2B websites for EMEA and the email marketing activity conducted from the UK and Amsterdam. He co-managed the revision and build of the main customer-facing website, helped spearhead the development of health sciences E-books, and gained a reputation for rather irreverent presentations at sales meetings and company digital summits. Looking to expand his digital experience, he then moved into affiliate marketing and subsequently wholesale email marketing, managing a monthly inventory of around 40 million addresses, before joining Fresh Eggs SEO department in 2010. Promoted to SEO Director in 2024, he has worked across various clients in the financial, charity, retail, employment and education sectors, including those with a multinational site presence. As a technical specialist, he works extensively onsite audits and assessments, migrations and ongoing organic SEO strategies. Who are your hosts? Freedom Works - Providing flexible, affordable yet homely hot desk, meeting room and private office space facilities across the South East. Alongside this, Freedom Works also run numerous business support provisions for local businesses, such as the recent Grow Digital programme - find out more here -> https://www.freedomworks.space/ Barclays Eagle Labs - On a mission to support the UK's entrepreneurial community, Barclays Eagle Labs provide support to individuals and businesses of all shapes and sizes, ranging from mentoring for start-up founders through to investment connections for established scaling businesses - find out more here -> https://labs.uk.barclays/ Worthing & Adur Chamber of Commerce - Focussed on collaboration, building resilience and championing their members, the Chamber provide a vast range of high-quality business support and opportunities to their members ranging from events and training through to business support and funding options - find out more here -> https://worthingandadurchamber.co.uk/

896261059957.summary: Housing Associations and Local Authorities are facing severe challenges. With increasingly restricted budgets and services being strained to support more people, these sectors are forced to do more with fewer resources. This challenge is combined with high debt interest rates, mandatory improvement of home standards, strict energy efficiency objectives, and green targets. To alleviate pressure, a drive for operational efficiency and improved productivity is central to success and technology offers the opportunity to deliver services more cost-effectively, but with so many touch points, are there more efficient ways to connect to our communities? One way of doing this is the single front door. It provides a single point of contact between citizens and services. It triages individuals to ensure they receive the right service(s) at their point of need whether adult social care; tech-enabled care; debt advice, or digital inclusion. In this roundtable we will be joined by speakers including Matt Adam, Founder of We Are Group , a champion of connecting communities to ask how we can create more integrated services and discuss whether the single front door approach improves outcomes. This roundtable is for those in senior roles in the public sector and involved in shaping the future of community support services in local government and housing. Places are limited so please register here.
896261059957.description: Housing Associations and Local Authorities are facing severe challenges.
896261059957.title: Connecting local communities: Do we need a single front door?

820173229207.summary: Pop down to your local People Planet Pint meetup to find more about what's going on locally with sustainability and how you can get involved. No pitches, powerpoints or panels. Just People, Planet, Pint/s. Your local meetup is a great place to start your journey or continue learning, and meet diverse people to chat about life and how we can sustain it. Every job is a climate job, so come along and learn about how you can take action, as well as what is going on locally. We welcome everyone, regardless of their experience or background. People Planet Pint is a space where everyone can feel comfortable learning about sustainability and sharing their ideas. Afterall, creating a sustainable future requires connected communities. And what better way to bring everyone together than over a drink? Prefer a Pastry to a Pint? Head along to People Planet Pastry ! Equally relaxed and welcoming, they run during the day and offer an informal way to learn about what is going on locally in sustainability. Your Volunteer Hosts Alexis Eyre is a sustainable marketing consultant with experience in both marketing and sustainability helping companies ensure that their marketing functions become a force for good both from a strategic but also operational perspective. The main aim is to help companies ultimately contribute towards their wider business sustainability objectives. -- Meredith is the founder of BambooWorx , a sustainable marketing and growth consultancy for fintech, crypto and digital-first businesses that want to build or scale on the principles of people, planet, and profit. Shes a marketing leader and 'doer' who draws on her vast experience to bridge the world of crypto and digital assets, traditional finance, fintech and ESG principles as new technologies transform economies, ecosystems, and societies. Her motto is live and lead with purpose. Meredith has held global marketing leadership positions across the globe in Australia, Singapore, Hong Kong, and the UK for category leader brands like Citibank, FTSE Rusell, Elliptic, Contis, and SS&C Technologies. She is a Fellow of the Chartered Institute of Marketing, a Cambridge Institute Sustainability Leadership (CISL) Business Sustainability Management (BSM) alumni, and holds a Bachelor of Commerce (Marketing and Hospitality Management) from UNSW, Australia. -- Elaine Roberts is the change maker behind Klara Futura , a consultancy helping leaders and organisations navigate change to create resilience. Over the last 20 years, Elaine has held senior leadership roles in global purpose-led companies. Her experience spans launching the first mobile data services to the decarbonisation of shipping and renewable energy. From FTSE to SME to Private Equity and NGOs, she has expertise in driving strategic business transformation in B2B sectors, leading on customer, commercial, innovation, brand and marketing change. Committed to responsible business (#leadgoodchange), her work in resilience and growth for long-term sustainability, focuses on self, strategy and systems. Elaine is a Trustee of Stop the Traffik, a charity working to eliminate human trafficking and has previous Board experience in youth and disability charities. She is a mentor for Be the Business, an assessor for the Cambridge Institute of Sustainable Leadership and a Fellow of the Institution of Engineering and Technology.

1029166373327.summary: BUFF Creative Director, Tamika Martin presents this year's industry programme which returns to London as part of the 19th British Urban Film Festival. The focus of attention (and discussion) is on a growing sector of creatives for whom having multiple titles as a profession is now becoming the norm. Joining Tamika on the panel to discuss the working life of a multi-hyphenate are actress, writer and TV personality Verona Rose; music video, film and TV director Mo Ali and writer, producer and director Jesse Quinones. Verona is a writer-performer who starred in and was in the writers room for the latest series of Top Boy on Netflix. Verona may be best known for co-creating and starring in BBC Threesomes series Fully Blown based on two wannabe rappers, which was nominated for a Broadcast Digital Award. Verona is also the host of ITV2 dating show Secret Crush . Verona has been selected as BBC Studios' new Factual Entertainment creator in residence. Other TV appearances include Horrible Histories for the BBC, Sneakerhead for Dave, Dating No Filter for Sky, 8 out of 10 Cats and Celebrity Come Dine With Me for Channel 4, Pants on Fire for E4 and Sorry I Didnt Know for ITV. Mo started out as an award winning music video director working with some of the most innovative artists in the UK's urban music scene. His feature debut, the post-apocalyptic action-thriller Shank , was released theatrically in 2010; His second feature Montana premiered at BUFF in 2014 and was a searing look at life in the underbelly of London. In 2021, Mo was booked to direct 2 episodes of the Sky TV drama series Cobra starring the likes of Robert Carlyle, Marsha Thomason, Jane Horrocks and Emmanuel Imani (BUFF award-winning actor). In 2023, Mo was booked to direct 2 episodes of the Apple TV drama series Hijack starring Idris Elba, Neil Maskell and Max Beesley. His other list of credits includes UK drama Breathe and documentary Somaliland . Mo has also served as a BUFF patron. Jesse is a writer/director and producer. Originally from Miami, Florida he currently splits his time between London and LA. His most recent feature spec script PENTESTER has been selected to the 2023 Blacklist. He is also developing HEIST OF BENIN, a feature spec set up with Apple TV, with David Oyelowo attached to star. Other projects in development include FAIRFIELD, a YA adaptation with Igeneration, and POSTER BOY, a TV series set up with Buffalo Dragon. In 2024 he will be lead directing on season 15 of Waterloo Road . Jesse's most recent credits include directing Love Is A Stranger, episode 4 of season 8's Inside No 9 , which received a 5 Star Review in The Times. He was also lead director on BBC Ones flagship return to Waterloo Road (2022), seasons 11 and 12, for which he was nominated for the Victor Adebodun Award for Best Debut Director at the Edinburgh TV Festival. Jesse's first feature film, Calloused Hands , starred Andre Royo (HBO's The Wire ) and Daisy Haggard. Produced through his own company Woolfcub Productions, it premiered at BUFF in 2013 in London's Leicester Square, screening in over 20 festivals around the world, and garnering numerous awards including best feature and director at BUFF 2015. Jesse's second feature film Cagefighter starred Gina Gershon and Chuck Liddell, and was released in select theaters in 2020, followed with a global online release on Crackle. Jesse has also served as a BUFF patron and co-produced BUFF's first feature film No Shade in 2018. (Refreshments will be provided on the night).
1029166373327.description: The main attraction in this year's BUFF industry programme is being hosted at The Film & Television Charity's London headquarters in Soho.
1029166373327.title: MEET THE MULTI-HYPHENATES (BUFF 2024 INDUSTRY PROGRAMME)

1012634315497.summary: The Ashford Marketing Meetup is an informal, friendly place for the marketers of Kent to meet, learn, and share knowledge with one another. Come in 'listen' not 'sell' mode We'll be back at the lovely Coachworks for this one :) We just want to get together, say hello, have a chat, and have a nice time. Think of this as a community event, where the focus is very much on you meeting other people in a chilled out friendly space. Well chat over food and drink, listen to an inspirational speaker or two, chat some more, and go home buzzing with new contacts and new ideas. Lets have a lovely night in the company of some amazin people. -------------------- Speaker: Andy Barden, Co-Founder & Chief Attention Seeker at Think Unconventionall Ltd Topic: The Importance of an Identifier in Your Marketing Our goal with social media content creation is to become memorable among the people we want to attract, but this is rarely done by simply demonstrating a knowledge of the solution you provide. In a world filled with fierce competition for the eyes of your target buyer, you need to find something relatable and interesting that people remember you for, away from your product or service. You need an identifier. -------------------- The format of the night: 6.00 PM - Doors open - drinks, networking, and smiles 6.30 PM - Introduction and talks begin 7.15 PM - Talks finish, networking, listening, saying hello, and positively lovely people - a nice chilled out time 8:00 PM - End of the night - you leave with new contacts and fresh ideas -------------------- Supported by The Good Stuff. Were putting the good back in to marketing, working with people to make a difference. Using the right ingredients from the very start. After all, you get out what you put in https://www.thegoodstuffgroup.co.uk Supported by Mersudin Forbes, providing transformative change at pace to a portfolio of SEO clients and Digital Agencies. If you want to grow your business from search engine traffic (aka Google), get in touch here! www.linkedin.com/in/mersudinforbes Supported by Your Video Team. Boost your business in 2023 with expert video services from Your Video Team - reach new audiences and achieve your goals with high-quality video content! Check them out at https://www.yourvideoteam.co.uk/ Supported by Coachworks, a unique community where we encourage you to eat, drink, work, dance and do! A mixed use indoor and outdoor event space, a food and drink destination and a multi-use work space for start ups. Check out https://www.coach-works.co.uk/ -------------------- And finally... This is a donation ticketed event. The ticket price is yours to choose, from 3 to 30 (The average community members choose to pay 8.79 ) We of course understand that these are tough times, so if you are experiencing financial hardship and cannot afford the minimum donation amount, please reach out to el@themarketingmeetup.com and well find a ticket for you (provided capacity hasn't already been reached!) Please let your marketing friends and colleagues know about this group too, we hope to build it into a great resource for the community over the coming months and years. Attendance will be taken at this event. If you sign up but dont show up, this has a knock on effect on event arrangements. If it happens 3 times, youre outta here! This is simply a measure to allow appropriate respect to the organisers, speakers, sponsors, and your fellow community members -------------------- See you there!
1012634315497.description: The Ashford Marketing Meetup is an informal friendly place to meet, learn, and share knowledge with one another. Come in 'listen' mode :)
1012634315497.title: The Marketing Meetup IRL: Ashford

996324863487.summary: This month we'll be hearing from Claire Douglas , Head of Marketing at RM Technology, and PR & Comms Consultant Emma Duke , about how to use your people and your content to establish authority in your industry. Claire's based in Wallingford and loves being outdoors, either on the sidelines of a pitch cheering on her football-mad son or on long walks trying to wear out her dog. Emma's based in Cowley, enjoys a wild swim (no matter the weather), and when she was nine years old she once played badminton with Jason Donovan live on Radio 1. Thought leadership is a massively overused phrase in marketing, and often people don't even really know what they mean by it, or what they want to get out of it. But when it's done right it's not just some wishy-washy bit of jargon - it's a serious tool for growing your brand and its bottom line. So we'll kick off by looking at exactly what a thought-leadership campaign is and why it can be valuable, learning how to set clear goals and get buy-in (and investment) from across the organisation. Then we'll focus on how your company can actually be a thought leader in your space - what good campaigns might look like, who to involve, and how to get (and keep) people's attention. And finally we'll think about how you can track and demonstrate ROI, learn from the work for next time, and put the results to good use for the wider business. Between them Claire and Emma have run a ton of thought-leadership campaigns - for all kinds of brands from one-man-bands to places like OUP and Hodder Education - so the talk will be stuffed full of real-life examples and practical advice. ----------------------------------- How our gatherings usually go 6pm: Doors open for (free) drinks, marketing chit-chat, and - let's face it - probably at least some small talk about the weather 6.15-7.15pm: A brilliant marketing talk from a knowledgeable and interesting human, plus some Q&A and informal group discussion 7.15-7.30pm: Its GUS time (thats Genuinely Useful Shit) 7.30-8pm: More (still free) drinks and fun chat, hopefully about more interesting stuff than the weather by this point Here youll find everyone from marketing managers and comms execs to freelancers, solo business owners, and students exploring the industry. If youre interested in marketing, youre welcome around the campfire.
996324863487.description: How to use your people and content to establish authority in your industry, for results you can measure - with Claire Douglas & Emma Duke
996324863487.title: Show me the money: making thought leadership pay

964956329357.summary: This month we'll be hearing from Anna Munday , Head of Events at The Ashmolean Museum . Anna lives in Enstone with her partner, young daughter, and two cheeky cats who love to bring her daily gifts (read: dead mice and birds) and in her spare time she enjoys getting creative with a bit of bag-making or furniture painting. Most companies think more about how their marketing team can help with an event (e.g. promotion) rather than how an event can help their marketing team. But given that events can grow awareness, increase loyalty, and lead to sales, they're actually a brilliant marketing tool. So in this session we'll be learning how to effectively bring them into your marketing mix - and make the most of them. We'll start by looking at the different kinds of events businesses could think about hosting - whether online or IRL - and the pros/cons of various options. And we'll explore how we can look at events through a marketing lens, considering key questions and activities it's good to think about before, during, and after. Then we'll focus on how we can define and measure success, as well as learn from our efforts so we can do even better next time around. And all accompanied by plenty of real-life examples of great (and not-so-great) events and how they've contributed meaningfully to brand growth. ----------------------------------- How our gatherings usually go 6pm: Doors open for (free) drinks, marketing chit-chat, and - let's face it - probably at least some small talk about the weather 6.15-7.15pm: A brilliant marketing talk from a knowledgeable and interesting human, plus some Q&A and informal group discussion 7.15-7.30pm: Its GUS time (thats Genuinely Useful Shit) 7.30-8pm: More (still free) drinks and fun chat, hopefully about more interesting stuff than the weather by this point Here youll find everyone from marketing managers and comms execs to freelancers, solo business owners, and students exploring the industry. If youre interested in marketing, youre welcome around the campfire.
964956329357.description: Grow awareness, sales, and loyalty by adding events into your marketing mix - with Anna Munday, Head of Events at The Ashmolean Museum
964956329357.title: Turn attendees to advocates: how to boost your brand with brilliant events

737828794787.summary: Child-Friendly Business Networking Netwalk Event in Southampton What to expect The Freelance Mum netwalks are child-friendly business networking events, designed for you and your business, to make connections with likeminded women, grow your business, with fresh air and fresh thinking! Where is it? We meet at Itchen Valley Country Park where you will be greeted by your Freelance Mum Fairies, aka walk leaders. Keep an eye out for them, carrying the Freelance Mum tote bags and coffee cups. They'll lead your netwalk around the beautiful park. Who can attend? This is a business networking event for women in business and children are always welcome. You are welcome to bring your toddler/children and the walk will always be at the pace of the slowest toddler! You will have a chance to connect with other mums in business, grow your network and support your business. More than just a netwalk Before our netwalk we have an 'icebreaker' session to get to know each other and after our netwalk we have a chance to grab a coffee and hear from other women in business in '5 minutes with' or sometimes a session with a guest speaker. If you can't make it in the end Don't worry, we get that sometimes the best laid plans fall through so if you no longer need yours or your childs ticket, please remember to cancel the place, so another member is able to use it. Thank you. We cant wait to see you! Information for non-members Come and try us for FREE for 30 days! This includes the netwalk and our weekly digital coffee mornings! As with all Freelance Mum events, they take place whatever the weather - unless there is a severe weather warning. In the event of rain, activities may be adjusted. What else? These netwalks are supported by weekly online Coffee Mornings , for connections and conversations in between netwalks. There are additional netwalks in hubs across the country, which are part of the Freelance Mum membership.
737828794787.description: Freelance Mum Netwalk - childfriendly netwalk for mums in business
737828794787.title: Freelance Mum Netwalk Southampton: Business Networking

NB: An organisation can only hold one grant at a time, so these drop-in sessions are not applicable if you already have a grant from round 1 this year. The Councillors Grant Fund provides each of Warwickshire County Councils 57 councillors with an allocated fund of 8,000 each to support small-scale projects within their division with the following aims: Improve community assets and their sustainability Improve access to services Improve financial capability Reduce loneliness and isolation Improve physical and/or mental health and wellbeing Promote equalities and inclusivity Improve the local area to support the ambition of becoming a Net Zero county by 2050. 1027276781507.summary: Trowbridge retailers are invited to a meeting from 2pm-3pm on 5th November at The Civic to discuss local retail crime figures, trends and actions to increase town centre safety as part of the Trowbridge #SaferStreets campaign. The joint Chamber of Commerce and Trowbridge Police event will be an opportunity for businesses to exchange information with the police and fellow businesses and to discuss issues affecting local retailers with a view to reducing retail crime. Shopwatch schemes play a crucial role in enhancing the safety and security of retail environments. These schemes bring together local businesses, law enforcement and community safety teams to tackle crime and anti-social behaviour in shopping areas. Effective communication is at the heart of Shopwatch schemes, enabling quick responses to incidents and the sharing of vital information. Digital two-way radios such as Storenet, which is in operation in Trowbridge stores, have become an indispensable tool for these initiatives, offering numerous benefits that enhance the effectiveness of Shopwatch schemes. Shopwatch is a community based initiative where businesses in a specific area collaborate to prevent crime. The scheme often involves regular meetings between local shop owners, security personnel, and the police to discuss issues, share information and coordinate responses to criminal activity. Participants often use two-way radios to communicate in real-time, enabling them to respond quickly to incidents and deter potential offenders. Sergeant Charly Chilton of the Trowbridge Community Policing team said: "This meeting will give retailers an opportunity to discuss the issues they are currently experiencing and for the local Neighbourhood Policing team to talk about the work they are currently doing to tackle shoplifting and other associated offences". Chair of Trowbridge Chamber, Kez Garner, said: "We are pleased to organise this meeting with Trowbridge Police and local businesses to address the issue of retail crime. All businesses are encouraged to report any ASB, shoplifting and other offences and to sign up to our town centre Storenet radio system. Installing CCTV is also recommended to add to the increasing CCTV coverage of the town centre." Please book your FREE TICKET ASAP . Coffee will be available from 1345.
1027276781507.description: Trowbridge retailers are invited to discuss local retail crime figures, trends and actions.
1027276781507.title: Trowbridge Shop Watch - Police Meeting

This is your chance to connect with like-minded creatives, get expert advice, and fuel your passion! This is part of The Creative Village, an exciting project by Creative Crawley that aims to empower creative professionals and volunteers in Crawley. This event is open to people who are interested in making stuff happen, volunteers, and creative professionals. Guest speakers to be announced soon Producing Essentials: Learn about event planning from top speakers in outdoor arts, theatre, and events. Idea Development: Refine and develop your event concepts in an interactive session. Networking Lunch: Connect with fellow creatives over a delicious lunch. Schedule: 10:00 am - 10:30 am: Registration and Welcome Coffee 10:30 am - 11:30 am: Opening Session: "What is Producing?" (includes Q&A) 11:30 am - 12:15 pm: Developing an Idea Session 12:15 pm - 1:00 pm: Networking Lunch 1:00 pm - 1:45 pm: Funding Advice Session 1:45 pm - 2:30 pm: Panel Discussion: Building a Team & Making Your Idea Happen 2:30 pm - 2:55 pm: Speed Date with Your Colleagues: Roundtable Chats 2:55 pm - 3:00 pm: Closing Remarks Don't miss out on this chance to be part of something amazing. Get ready to make stuff happen! Travel bursaries are available - please contact producergathering@marlboroughproductions.org.uk Live Transcription of the event will be available after the event on our website as a resource to access. Producer Gathering in partnership with Creative Crawleys Creative Village INTRODUCING OUR GUEST SPEAKERS.... Saziso Phiri is a UK-based curator, producer, artist mentor, and strategist with a focus on contemporary visual arts. She is dedicated to broadening arts engagement beyond traditional spaces, and in 2015, founded The Anti Gallery, a pop-up arts platform which hosted approximately 30 events in unconventional art locations during its 6-year run. Saziso was a core team member at Nuart Festival (Stavanger, Norway and Aberdeen Scotland) one of the world's leading international visual art street art festivals, and most recently, she served as Associate Artistic Director at New Art Exchange, the largest gallery in the UKs dedicated to contemporary visual arts from the Global Ethnic Majority. Her work includes collaborations with organisations such as UK New Artists, Nottingham Contemporary, Fifth Word Theatre, Format International Photography Festival, Maison Foo, Sadlers Wells and Migration Matters Festival. Kevin Wratten (he/him) is the Director of Split Second - a production company working with artists and companies blurring the lines between circus, dance, theatre and variety to create gripping experiences. Split Second produces and tours work nationally and internationally and supports the development of artists and producers through training and mentoring opportunities. Split Second is currently producing work with Olivier Award winning artist Kit Green and Hip Hop Circus company Simple Cypher. Kevin is the Producer of FESTIVAL.ORG s Global Streets programme, touring international outdoor work to a network of 12 England partners; working with local people to deliver free, international productions which lift peoples spirits and bring communities together. As an Independent Producer, Kevin has worked in festival contexts including Shubbak Festival (2021) and Greenwich+Docklands International Festival (2019-2020) and with independent companies including award-winning internationally renowned acrobatic circus company Barely Methodical Troupe. Prior to working independently, Kevin worked in leading venues Sadlers Wells, Jacksons Lane and the Roundhouse where he led a programme of social circus and artist development opportunities including ongoing training, professional masterclasses and producing new work with emerging artists. www.splitsecond.org.uk Melina Barnett is a Senior Producer and Audience Engagement Lead at Actors Touring Company, recognized for her work on RICE Tour 2022, Family Tree Tour 2023, Tambo & Bones 2023 at Stratford East, The Architect 2023, and Bodies of Water 2024. She produced My Period The Cockblock by Ruth Oyediran at Goose Theatre 2022, Vaults Festival 2023, and Brixton House Housemates Festival 2024. A nominee for both Producer of the Year and Innovation Award at the Stage Awards, Melina uses data-driven strategies to bridge gaps in the theatre industry, amplifying diverse stories, especially Black narratives. Her approach, shaped by her time as Head Usher at the Young Vic, is also influenced by her work as an artist at Theatre By The Lake, where she integrates nature and wellness into creative idea generation Amy Nicholls is a self-producing Circus Artist, and Arts Fundraiser; fundraising for organisations like The Revel Puck Circus, and Levantes Dance Theatre. She's the Co-Director of Lavrak Circus and Make Space Circus, and a Board Member for Handstand Arts, who run Circus City; the UKs largest programme of Contemporary Circus. She's currently wrapping up 'Where Do I Sit?'; an international collaboration with Tamba Africa Social Circus, which looked at the disability landscapes in Zimbabwe and the UK.

1038875995067.summary: Join us for an evening of fun at this months hack::soho taking place 31 October, 6pm - 9pm GMT, set up to be a loose networking environment where cyber security professionals can chat, get some complimentary food & drink, and discuss rising global trends. This month's hack::soho will feature a talk, 'Lost in Translation: Challenges of Internationalisation,' from Colin Cassidy, IOActive Principal Security Consultant. The abstract of the talk is below! hack::soho is a monthly event hosted at our London, UK office for the cybersecurity and hacking community to discuss all things security over food and refreshments. We welcome you to invite others in your circle to extend our collective network. We hope you can join us, IOActive team ABSTRACT Come and see Thrilling Terrors from Turkey, Magnificent Mongolian Monsters AND more dogs that YOU can possibly count. This talk is an archaeological treasure hunt and collection of issues found whilst delving into obscure parts of internationalisation and Unicode. We will explore interesting characters, numbers, and language rules that take internationalisation attack move beyond traditional homoglyph attacks used as part of social engineering attacks. A number of interesting and unusual input validation attacks, filtering bypass techniques that are available when we think beyond ASCII. We will also cover a interesting supply chain attack, and method of hiding malicious source code within innocent looking code, and how this code can be deployed globally in a manner making it very difficult to identify. The learned audience may use this new-found knowledge to identify new and interesting attack vectors, finding themselves thinking "I remember that presentation where that bloke went on about the Mongolian vowel separators, I think I might be able to use that here!"
1038875995067.description: Join us for an evening of fun at this months hack::soho featuring a talk from Colin Cassidy, IOActive Principal Security Consultant
1038875995067.title: hack::soho | Halloween Special: Spooky Edition | Colin Cassidy

756214226107.summary: The 2024 Close Protection and Security Conference has been confirmed and booked for Friday 8th Nov between 10am and 10pm. The event has been booked around the remembrance weekend which takes place that weekend. This allows people to attend the conference on the Friday and attend any remembrance events later that weekend. Regardless of your position with the industry, networking and learning with colleagues is arguably the most successful way to continue progressing through your career. What is the Close Protection Security Conference? See the conference promotional video here: Promotional video The conference is an annual networking and security event which takes place in the heart of the London Executive Protection industry. It is an opportunity for Security and Close Protection Professionals to meet, network and socialise in a secure and professional environment. The Close Protection World forum is an on-line forum that rose to infamy over a decade ago when it was launched on the web. Heralding from the CP World website social meet ups over a decade ago, the meetings soon became viral and over time formalised into the current format of the annual CPW conference. The conference now hosts a full day of : Presentations Guest speakers Exhibitors Workshops Networking Charity raffle Sponsored drinks reception The sponsored drinks reception which is held at the end of the event is a great opportunity to meet others and build on any new contacts in an informal and friendly environment. Historically we have had close to 400 delegates attending our events but anticipate this year will be busier. Who should attend? We warmly welcome all backgrounds and nationalities to our London event. This event is for the entire spectrum of the security sector: From security consultants, family TL's and newly trained CPO's, to Hostile operators working in Afghan, family chauffeurs and Surveillance professionals. Experienced CPO. If you have a few more years under your belt (And a few more notches) then come along and listen into some of our workshops, network with others and expand your network. Chance your arm at the charity raffle (All donations welcome) and meet countless Operational companies and recruiters in attendance. Considering a new career. Civilian, Police, UK Armed Forces, blue light services or any other walk of life who have an interest in entering or are considering entering the security industry are welcome. This is a perfect opportunity to network with security professionals who are currently on the circuit, or like you, maybe trying to enter the circuit. Our industry naturally attracts a large proportion of Ex Military and Police and should you fall into this category and are considering entering the 'Circuit' then come along. See the industry first hand, speak with others, meet training providers and try your hand at the charity raffle and maybe win some top prizes. Can't decide on a training provider. Come to the event and speak with your training provider or ask about your preferred supplier. There is no better way to assess the company you are considering investing in than to meet them face to face. Historically we have attracted training providers from driving, CP, First Aid and surveillance exhibitors. Why should I attend? Networking and building contacts is without doubt the best way for security professionals to organically grow into and throughout our industry. This is an opportunity to network, learn, socialise and meet like minded individuals within the security sector. Meet Exhibitors Meet other CPO's Network Attend workshops Listen to guest speakers Meet operational companies and build 'In-roads' with them Meet recruiters and 'Get on their books' Enter the renowned charity raffle and win big prizes Some frequently asked questions: How much does the event cost? 50 tickets will be sold as the 'Early bird' tickets price of 20 + Booking fee. Once these tickets are sold the ticket price will be 27 + Booking fee Will I require identification to gain access into the event? Yes - Proof of purchase and 1 form of identification will be required. How can I contact the organizer with any questions? For questions, please contact John Morrison at: +44 7515 526 209 or admin@closeprotectionworld.com Are there sponsorship opportunities? Yes, please contact John Morrison at: +44 7515 526 209 or admin@closeprotectionworld.com Is there an opportunity to sponsor the drinks and lunch reception? Yes, please contact John Morrison at: +44 7515 526 209 or admin@closeprotectionworld.com Can my company exhibit at the conference? Should you be interested in any last minute cancelled locations please contact John Morrison at: +44 7515 526 209 or admin@closeprotectionworld.com What's the refund policy? There will be a full refund for delegates up to 7 days prior to the event. Close Protection World can not be held accountable if you can no longer attend the event. Can tickets be purchased on the door? Tickets are available on the day of the event - Please note entry can not be guaranteed due to the venue capacity of a maximum of 450 people. Are free tickets available to serving Blue light services and UK Armed forces? Yes - Contact the event organiser for further information.
756214226107.title: 2024 Close Protection and Security Conference

1037022009747.summary: PRODUCER LINK UP 2024 BOXPARK CROYDON! 18:00pm - 22:30pm Producer Beat Battle + Beat Showcase / Open Mic Please bring your instrumentals on your Phone or Laptop. 200 CASH PRIZE UP FOR GRABS This year we have a slight twist; every month you have the opportunity to play your beats and the final winner will take home 200! Producer Beat Battle: To take part all you need to do is arrive early at each event and put your name in a raffle. 16 producers will be picked out of a hat to compete. You will need a beat for each round (4 rounds, plus a bonus knock-out round for the belt with the finalist from the previous month) Beat Showcase / Open Mic If you would like to play your beats, please put your name on our list on arrival. We will have a lot of beats to share with everyone! (1st come, 1st serve basis) Artists will have the opportunity to sing or rap to producers beats after the Beat Battle. Please Note: This will not part of the Cash Prize Entry [No Under 18's Please] [ NO ID, NO ENTRY] This event will be filmed by Link Up TV. Our event involves networking and promotes exposure for Producers / Beat Makers. This is a space where you can share your vibrations and create beats together. Bring yourself, some beats (on Mobile Phone or Laptop) and some positive vibes. Please sign up for admission; Tickets will starting at 7.50 with 1st release tickets. Tickets on the door: 10 Security on the Door (For more info on venue https://www.boxpark.co.uk/) In association with Link Up TV. Don't forget to follow @producerlinkup on all socials! For further enquiries: @ProducerLinkUp @CarnsHill @Shomokeh @LinkUpTV @BoxPark Join our Discord Community: https://discord.gg/UuBPVJwY

1037022009747.title: PRODUCER LINK UP [BOXPARK CROYDON] 29/10/2024

1040431597917.summary: The London FinTechs Network is a New Business Network dedicated to professionals working within Londons world-leading FinTech & Related sectors . Join us at the Famous Bonds of Mayfair for our October 2024 Networking Breakfast and join us in sampling their wonderful Food, Drinks and the opportunity to chat about the FinTech sector, learn more about the many related topics and make new friends and seek out fresh business leads . 944960802197.summary: At this Single Muslim Professional Speed Dating event you can expect to meet around 18-20 people in 4-5 minutes dates with an interval half way through for refreshments. Single Muslim Professionals Speed Dating kicks off at 8:00pm prompt and any guests arriving late may not be able to take part so please ensure you arrive 15minutes before the scheduled start time to allow for registration. When all the guests have arrived the host will explain how the evening will unfold and you will be provided with a scorecard, name badge and pen. When the event begins women will be seated and men will rotate between tables every 5minutes. At the end of each date guests mark on their scorecard whether they would like to see that person again. This location attracts a fun, crowd of single Muslim professionals from across United Kingdom not just those working in the square mile. Join us and youll be amazed how sociable People can be and be left wondering why you never tried speed dating sooner. Meeting new single Muslims in this way is hugely fun, highly energising and a brilliant way to start dating. Everyones single and up for meeting people so the success rate is very high. Book early, we'll sell out. There will be a 4 minute break half way through to allow for refreshments. The event will finish around 9:30pm but guests are welcome to stay and mingle if they wish. Before you leave the host will collect all the scorecards in and collate the matches and the following day you will receive an e-mail with the results. Due to the popularity of this event, we advise you to book your ticket in advance and at your earliest to avoid disappointment. To ensure gender ratio, bookings are non-refundable. Note: we are not responsible for people's schedules - no show or late comers! Important information This event takes place in the private upstairs bar. Please head upstairs on arrival where the host will check you in. - Event starts 8.00pm - Event Finishes 9.30pm Its essential that you arrive before 8:00pm in order to take part. We might not be able to allow entry if you are late. Price: 23 PLEASE NOTE: Advance booking is essential and no tickets will be available to purchase on the door. Online booking is simple and very secure. Our payments are handled by Stripe, one of the world's largest payment processors using the highest grade security currently available. Nearest station -Bond Street on Elizabeth Line
944960802197.description: Speed dating events allow you to meet 14-18 single muslims in your age range for 4 minute dates. This allows you to get to know each other.
944960802197.title: Single Muslim Professionals Speed Dating (Ages 28-44)

929114665977.summary: We continue to make waves! rev is a place for Pre-seed to Series-B founders to explore their options to grow their businesses. Starting with warp , aiming to provide acceleration options to earlier -stage founders. Then followed by rev, to gain insights from leading and emerging investors. What is warp? Were hosting warp from 2:30 pm to 3:30 pm , where we invite accelerators/incubators to showcase their programmes to an audience of early-stage founders that are looking for different support and funding options. Each speaker has 10 minutes to showcase their proposition. Attendees from warp can also participate in the rev afterwards. NB. If you are an accelerator/incubator and would like to present, please register here , select a relevant category, and we'll co-ordinate with you. What is rev? rev is our reverse-pitching series where leading and emerging investors showcase their propositions to an audience of Seed to Series A founders, both in person and on live stream, nationally and internationally. Were hosting rev from 4:0 0 pm to 7:30 pm at Canary Wharfs Level 39, London's iconic melting pot of innovators, investors, industry experts and ambitious entrepreneurs driving change across the sectors that dictate our experiences in daily life and bring a major financial and social impact - FinTech, Cyber Security, Data & AI, GreenTech, Life Sciences and more. Arrive earlier at 2.00 pm if youd like to participate in warp too. Theres no extra charge. Why rev? Pitching to VCs takes a chunk of time and loads of energy, and every rejection takes a little chip out of the soul; as an entrepreneur, you better be pitching to the right investors! As a startup founder, you have hundreds of other things to do, so weve structured rev to deliver fast, efficient insights to make the best use of two hours of your time. What happens at rev? rev is more than finding alignment with a VC's investment thesis, it's about finding where chemistry and personality resonate. We're here to help you discover the right investors efficiently. Each VC has five minutes to pitch, followed by your questions. Afterwards, immerse yourself in networking and leave a lasting impression - better still, make yourself unforgettable for the investors! NB. If you are an investor and would like a speaking spot at rev, please register at this link and well coordinate with you. More about the Organizer: About Pitchflix Pitchflix is your investor network powered by pitch videos. Investors can discover investment opportunities across the startup ecosystem from the UK and internationally, and founders can look for their future investors on the platform. Video provides a much richer experience and more efficient review process for investors compared to a pitch deck alone. Make yourself discoverable for VCs by registering on www.pitchflix.tv and uploading your own pitch video. Let us know if you have any questions. We're more than happy to help! The Pitchflix team is looking forward to welcoming you soon!
929114665977.description: Reverse-pitching showcase: leading and emerging VCs and accelerators showcase their propositions to investment-ready founders
929114665977.title: rev November: Investors and Accelerators Pitch to YOU!

1012856720717.summary: Join us for the annual HAC Sports Briefing Evening at 7.15pm on Tuesday 22 October 2024 at Armoury House, City Road, London, EC1Y 2BQ. This exclusive event is your chance to find out more about the Company and the HAC Regiment and to learn about the history of the HAC Sports Clubs. New members who have joined the sports clubs are particularly encouraged to attend. The format will be similar to last year and the outline programme is: 7.15-7.30pm: Arrive/Check in at Armoury House (Medal Room). 7.15-7.50pm : Drinks reception (Long Room); finger food will be available. 7.50-8.40pm : Welcome from the Chairman of the Sports Committee and briefings on the Company and the Regiment, concluding with a short history of the HAC Sports Clubs. 8.40-8.45pm : Closing remarks from Chairman of the Sports Committee. o/c: Drinks continue in the Sutling Room (cash bar, closes at 11.00pm). 9.00pm: Witness the Dismissal Parade and firing of the Picquet Gun (optional). Dress for the evening is jacket, trousers (no denim, no trainers) and collared shirt, ties optional (and equivalent for ladies). HAC Sports Club ties and bow ties will be available to purchase. Attendance is free but registration is mandatory for security/catering purposes so please register your place here. Don't miss out on this exciting opportunity to network and find out more about the HAC. We look forward to welcoming you to Armoury House.
1012856720717.description: Join us for an evening of HAC Sports Briefing where we'll discuss all things sports-related in a casual setting!
1012856720717.title: HAC Sports Briefing Evening

1026692634307.summary: You're Invited to an Empowering Women's Network and Event! Jona Hysa, MSc and Dr Coco Novak, MBA are the founders of the Moving Women Forward" Network. Are you feeling stuck in your life and dont know how to move forward? Do you have a side hobby youre passionate about and dream of turning it into a successful business? Or maybe you need expert guidance on how to market your new venture across social media platforms? You may have even written a book but cant figure out how to navigate the self-publishing process and use the plethora of digital tools out there. If any of this resonates with you, then this networking event is designed for YOU. What youll gain from joining the network: Monthly masterclasses, 1-2-1 coaching and expert workshops - which will be introduced at the launch. Topics will include: Three pillars of personal happiness : Feeling stuck? Learn how to pinpoint what is holding you back and how to find solutions. There's no such thing as failure: Becoming braver to begin the projects you dream about Single, and too tired to mingle? Raising children on your own is difficult - you are not alone. Career Growth : Learn how to break out of your comfort zone and advance your career. Business Tips : Turn your hobby into a profitable venture with the latest Digital Marketing funnels and opportunities. Social Media Guidance : Get practical and tailored advice to boost your online presence. Writing Success : We'll help you to finish your book and self-publish. As women, we often find ourselves held back by fear, upbringing, responsibilities of childcare or just life - which can make us feel stuck. But its time to break free and take charge of your journey. Join us for an inspiring and uplifting event where Jona and Coco will launch their new network for women Moving Women Forward . Through their network, Coco and Jona will share insights, tips, and strategies to help you move forward and live a more fulfilled and productive life. Women can achieve so much more when we work together. Spaces are limited, so dont miss this chance to invest in yourself! RSVP now and take the first step towards a brighter, more fulfilled future! Please note - attendance at the launch does not make you a member of the 'Moving Women Forward' network. Jona Hysa, MSc Social Media Strategist and Female Empowerment Speaker. Jona helps you boost your social media presence with three easy-to-implement steps - Strategy | Consistency | Structure. Jona is also the founder and host of monthly networking events for founders and entrepreneurs across South-West London. She believes in women's empowerment through collaboration and partnerships. More on Jona www.time4pa.com & linkedin.com/in/time4pa Dr. Coco Novak, MBA Ex-scientist, award winning entrepreneur, author of the book ' Single, and too tired to mingle ', podcaster of 'The Coco Novak Show ', public speaker and tennis coach. Coco is an expert in pivoting careers she has reinvented herself over the years and is thriving. She believes you should have a fulfilling life too. She does not believe there is such a thing as failure. Especially as women we are sometimes less able to move forward and find it difficult to figure out what is best for themselves. Lets go together! More on: coconovak.com & https://www.youtube.com/@CoCoNovak Agenda 7pm : Welcome drinks and tasting of exclusive Olive oil from the Mediterranean - Welcome from Coco and Jona 7.30-8.30pm : Speed Networking 8.30 : Introduction and Invitation to the Moving Women Forward network. 8.45pm : Chat to Jona and Coco about the network. 9.00pm: Closing remarks and see you at our first Masterclass in December!
1026692634307.description: Are you feeling stuck in your business growth and dont know how to move forward? Then this networking event is designed for YOU!
1026692634307.title: The Moving Women Forward Network - Event Launch

1030973508517.summary: Emma Parla, Financial Adivsor, will be hosting Octobers event. Emmas Bio: Fully qualified financial advisor, having worked in Financial Services 25 years I have a passion for supporting people in their financial journey, whatever stage that may be. I have clients who are just starting out, to those approaching the prospect of later life care and everything in between including small business owners. I love what I do and genuinely can make a difference to peoples lives just by taking away some financial worry or supporting them in setting financial foundations to achieve financial freedom. Subject matter: You and Your Business When you are a business owner, your focus is on ensuring is continues to be valued by your customers, maintains its competitive advantage, and seizing every opportunity you can. So where do this leave your personal situation and financial affairs? Planning your own personal financial security is also crucial and if you have support in that plan, this frees you up to concentrate on your all-important business. Have you thought about Financial independence? I will give you some hints and tips and aim to encourage you to also think about your own personal financial wellbeing.
1030973508517.description: Royal Arsenal Business Network is made up of local businesses from the Royal Arsenal and wider Woolwich business community.
1030973508517.title: Royal Arsenal Business Network

753927737157.summary: Calling all retailers! Calling all retail entrepreneurs! Running any retail business can be tough. But here at Quickfire, we know firsthand how important the fast moving mid-sized UK retail sector relies on community to foster growth. Thats why we think networking should be fun! So, we strive to create unique experiences and the extra 'wow factor' for our guests. Our Retailer Dinners at the prestigious Ivy Club are by far our most popular events, and with good reason! We love bringing people together to discuss the highs and lows of life in ecommerce, as well as some cheeky personal questions thrown in! So, do you: Own, run or work for a mid-sized UK retailer (5m+ turnover)? Find it hard to keep pace with or grow your ecommerce business? Want to learn more about digital, ecommerce and tech from your peers? Then register to enjoy a fabulous three course dinner and plenty of drinks, hosted as a roundtable discussion by Quickfire Co-Founder and CEO Nathan Lomax. Join us for the perfect opportunity to expand your network and build meaningful connections. We hope to see you there! Meet our Sponsors 360 OM is a performance marketing agency that accelerates growth for leading e-commerce brands. Founded by Tariq Mohammed, the agencys team of seasoned paid media experts use cutting-edge technology to manage complex, large-scale campaigns for some of the UKs most successful online retailers, including Bella & Duke, Sekonda, Bathshack, and Workwear Express.Recognised at the UK Digital Excellence Awards 2024, 360 OM took home the trophies for Paid Social Media Campaign of the Year and Best Use of TikTok for their groundbreaking 360 OM & Uni Compare Clearing 2023 TikTok Campaign.
753927737157.description: An exclusive networking opportunity for retailers to connect over a roundtable dinner hosted by Nathan Lomax.
753927737157.title: Retailer Dinner

Here are just some of the professions we are looking to refer business to: Solicitors Caterers Life coaches HR specialists PR agencies Beauticians Cyber Security Plumbers Copywriters Telemarketers Domestic and commercial cleaners Gardeners Tilers Architects Dentists Social media experts Restaurant owners Plumbers Property surveyors IT Managed Services and many, many more! Why are we looking for these professions? Because we share the same customer base as you but not in competition. In fact, there will be opportunities for synergies. 744417321247.summary: Capture the Flag Sharpen your skills, win prizes, and showcase your teams security skills in one of the biggest ethical hacking events of the year. Join us for a unique cybersecurity experience at the SCSC Capture the Flag (CTF) competition. Step into the shoes of a skilled ethical hacker and put your cybersecurity skills to the test in this exciting and educational event. The Royal Holloway, University of Londons victory in last year's CTF competition was a remarkable achievement, setting a high standard for all participants. Their dedication, innovation, and teamwork were evident throughout the event, and their success has certainly inspired many. Whether you're a cybersecurity professional or just starting your journey in the field, CTF competitions are a fantastic opportunity to sharpen your skills and showcase your talent. Work individually or team up with like-minded enthusiasts as you dive into a series of challenging scenarios, designed to simulate real-world hacking situations. Explore the Exciting World of Cyber Security The CTF event provides a safe and controlled environment to explore the world of cyber security. Interact with fellow participants, exchange knowledge, and learn from industry experts who will be present to offer guidance and support. By participating in the CTF competition, you'll gain invaluable hands-on experience, enhance your technical proficiency, and boost your credentials in the cyber security field. Additionally, the event offers a unique networking opportunity, allowing you to connect with professionals and potential employers in the industry. Secure your spot today and embark on a fun journey into the world of ethical hacking. A Hybrid Experience to test your skills Join us SCSCs second capture the flag competition on 16th October from 6pm at Login Lounge, Camberley. The CTF events also serve as a vibrant networking platform, enabling you to connect with fellow cyber security professionals. This opens up avenues for career opportunities and collaborative projects, enhancing your professional journey. The competition will run from 7pm BST on Wednesday 16 th October to midnight on Sunday 20 th October . We have several challenges for you to try, there will be hints available for most challenges, so youll be able to learn something. Prizes Grand Prize: The winning team will take home a prize. Gather your team, fine-tune your strategies, and register now for the Capture the Flag Championship. Beating last years winners, Royal Holloway, University of London, will require not only matching their level of excellence but also surpassing it in every possible way. The Rules Well provide more instructions once youve signed up, but an important thing to note is to get approval from your manager and relevant security team. While nothing in the CTF is malicious, some content may still cause security alerts if handled inappropriately. One member of your team must be based in Surrey, UK. How to enter Ready to put your ethical hacking skills to the test? Complete the Eventbrite registration and we will be in touch with you with a formal invite.
744417321247.description: Elevate your cyber security skills, build valuable connections, and have some competitive fun all in one place.
744417321247.title: Red Team: Capture The Flag Competition

903204949317.summary: Build your international business network at Global Britain Trade Expo 2025 . Now in its eight year, GBTE continues to promote the UK as a global trade and business destination and welcomes delegates from 36 countries. The event is designed for those businesses looking grow internationally, be it setting up overseas, sourcing new suppliers or exporting to new markets. Over 800 business leaders, 75 exhibitors and 33 speakers are set to attend, coming together to do business and exchange best practise. GBTE 2025 collaborates with 32 International Embassies and their respective Chambers of Commerce ensuring high level international networking throughout the day. Sessions will offer delegates the strategic knowledge, practical skills and high profile connections to help grow internationally. Key Participants include: Institute of Directors, Federation of Small Businesses, London Chamber of Commerce, Foreign Press Association, The Ambassador Partnership, Made in Britain, Eastern Powerhouse, London School of Economics, techUK, Emirates Trade and Investment, American European Business Association (AEBA) & 11K Consulting 2025 Programme soon to be announced 2024 Programme: Badge Collection - 8.45am Welcome to Global Britain Trade Expo 2024 - Matthew Stadlen, Master of Ceremonies Welcome to Global Britain Trade Expo 2024 - Sir Vince Cable, Former Secretary of State for Business and Trade Made in Britain: British manufacturing as a driving force for the UK's growth and global competitiveness - John Pearce, CEO, Made in Britain Lincolnshire Chamber of Commerce Presents Creating cultural alignment during an M&A - David Liddle, Chief Executive, The TCM Group Cyber Security Strategy When Going Global - Yuri Poluneev, Former Executive Director of the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD), deputy Head of the Supervisory Board of the National Bank of Ukraine, former Ukrainian MP How to enter the China market - Jack Wu, Managing Partner, Acadia Advisory Group Your Next Million: How marketing your business internationally could unlock success - Farhad Divecha, Managing Director, AccuraCast How to Generate More Business at International Trade Shows - Lee Ali, Manging Director, Expo Stars Interactive Ltd How to avoid financial risk when transacting internationally - James Broadley, Co-Founder, Estuary FX East of England Global opportunities - Steven Lynch MBE, Executive Director, Eastern Powerhouse Space - The Next Horizon - Julie Holt-Jones, Founder, Space4Sight Common Tax Traps for SMEs expanding into US markets and How to Avoid Them - Sarah Eddie, CEO, S.E. Tax Professionals Ltd Achieving global business success: how did these women industry leaders did it? - Sally Maier-Yip, Managing Director and Founder, 11K Consulting. Susan Fang, CEO & Co-founder, OxBridge Holdings Inc. Naomi Heaton, CEO & Founder, The Other House. Suki Fuller, Advisor | Analytical Storyteller, Miribure From Ideas to A with Martin Warner - Founder & Curator, Entrepreneur Seminar Getting Results From Generative AI - Dave Birss, Author, Speaker & Trainer Protecting your brand for export - Rachel Jones, Head Dragon [CEO/Founder], SnapDragon Monitoring Ltd Glocalisation: Think Local, Act Global for Brand Success - Farzana Baduel, CEO, Curzon PR How to future-proof your business - the role of sustainability for innovation and internationalisation - Dr. Max Jungmann, CEO, Momentum Novum Seizing Global Growth: Strategies for SMEs in an Evolving Trade Landscape - Prof Trevor Williams and Mr JP Agrawal, FXGuard Limited To view timings visit: https://www.globalbritaintradeexpo.com/programme Benefits of attending: Access to Main Conference and Masterclass Stage (all sessions) Lunch, refreshments throughout the day and drinks reception High level networking sessions Attend workshops and access exhibitor zone Contact Phone: +44 (0) 20 3693 1944 Email: lauren@iconicmediasolutions.co.uk Website: www.globalbritaintradeexpo.com FAQs Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event? No, once registered your badge will be available for collection on the badge collection desks at the entrance of the venue. Are there ID or minimum age requirements to enter the event? Yes, all delegates require valid photo ID and must be 18 years or older. Acceptable forms of photo ID are: either passport or driving licence, or a company pass with your photograph, a company logo and company name as an alternative. How can I contact the organiser with any questions? Should you have any questions please contact us on +44 (0) 20 3693 1944 or email lauren@iconicmediasolutions.co.uk Is it ok if the name on my ticket or registration doesn't match the person who attends? No, in order for you to gain access to the event the name given for your ticket/registration must match the person who is attending. You are, however, able to transfer your pass into someone else's name, see below. Can I update my registration information? If you would like to change any details for your badge please email lauren@iconicmediasolutions.co.uk with this request. Is my registration fee or ticket transferrable? Yes, your pass can be transferred into someone else's name as long as this is done more than 2 weeks in advance of the event. To do so please email lauren@iconicmediasolutions.co.uk with this request. For more information, please visit: https://www.globalbritaintradeexpo.com
903204949317.description: Global Britain Trade Expo 2025 occurs as an annual conference and exhibition, hosted at Londons QEII Centre on 29th May 2025.
903204949317.title: Global Britain Trade Expo 2025

1036851860827.summary: All artists involved in this art shop are our Jelly workshop leaders, studio artists, members of our Associate Artists and our Young Creative's Network. Follow Jelly on our social media accounts - @thejellyreading where will be announcing participating artists. Entry is free - you do not need a ticket to attend . Register your interest and get event notifications by signing up via the 'Register' button. Find us in our space on the 1st Floor in Broad St Mall. We are the last unit nearest the public toilets. Inclusivity, safety, respect, confidentiality and consent are fundamental principles at Jelly workshops and events. Our workshops and events are subsidised and in most cases we are able to offer our workshops for a nominal fee. If you are able we have an option to donate. All donations help us to continue our work to make space for art for everyone every day. By attending this event you are agreeing to act in accordance with our workshop behaviour policy which can be viewed here: https://www.jelly.org.uk/policies Frequently asked questions: We are a small team working behind the scenes answering your questions. If you email us via eventbrite or via our website we will answer as soon as we can. Where are you based? Our studios are located within Broad St Mall. You can find us on the first floor. We are the last unit before the toilets and exit to the carpark. If you get lost please ask any Broad St Mall security guard and they will direct you. How can I find out more about Jelly? Sign up to our newsletter - www.jelly.org.uk/newsletter Can I pay for items by card? We recommend that you bring cash. Payment is made directly with the artists and not all artists will have card readers.
1036851860827.description: Join us at Jelly for our Christmas Art Shop. Meet and buy work directly from local artist and designer makers.
1036851860827.event_address: Jelly, 1st floor, 115-116 Broad Street Mall, Reading, RG1 7QE
1036851860827.title: Jelly Christmas Art Shop

999313713217.summary: Jelly's group for young artists, creatives and producers aged 18 to 25. The group is facilitated by young artist Cheri Clayton and new people are always welcome to join. Come along to meet and collaborate with other young creatives in Reading. This session and next we will be working on planning a young creatives table at Jelly's Christmas Art shop, which is happening at the studios December 15th. Help make collaborative artworks and badges to sell at the shop or bring along your own art projects to work on. Please fill in this form to tell us about you, let us know any access need you have and be added to the mail list for the group so we can keep you up to date on meetings and opportunities Some of the suggestions from the group as to what they would like to do through this network include: Workshops Collaborative projects Talks from industry proffessionals Skill sharing Opportunity to meet other young creatives We know joining a new group can sometimes feel a little overwheling. Email laura @jelly.org.uk if: you have any questions you feel a bit shy about coming -we can arrange for you to come and see the space or have a chat before you would like to discuss access needs We're looking forward to meeting you! Our workshops and events are subsidised and in most cases we are able to offer our workshops for a nominal fee. If you are able we have an option to donate. All donations help us to continue our work to make space for art for everyone every day. By attending this workshop you are agreeing to act in accordance with our workshop behaviour policy which can be viewed here: https://www.jelly.org.uk/policies Find us in our next space on the 1st Floor in Broad St Mall. We are the last unit nearest the public toilets. Inclusivity, safety, respect, confidentiality and consent are fundamental principles at Jelly workshops and events. Frequently asked questions: We are a small team working behind the scenes answering your questions. If you email us via eventbrite or via our website we will answer as soon as we can. Where are you based? Our studios are located within Broad St Mall. You can find us on the first floor. We are the last unit before the toilets and exit to the carpark. If you get lost please ask any Broad St Mall security guard and they will direct you. Sometimes our workshops take place in the community. Be sure to check the address on your ticket. When we are out and about in Reading town centre in Forbury Gardens or at festivals we will not know our exact location within the festival site until the day. If I cannot make my paid workshop, can I transfer my ticket to another event or get a refund? We are able to offer a refund or transfer your ticket to a future event if you contact us a minimum of 7 days before the event starts. After this time we cannot offer any refunds or transfers. 48 hours before the event you can contact us to enquire about a waiting list and we will endeavour to transfer your ticket. As a charity we rely on donations and ticket sales to pay our artists and models. We always keep ticket costs to a minimum and when possible offer a limited number of tickets as a pay what you can and a donation option if you are able to pay more. Our free community workshops and festival workshops are often made possible due to funding by the organisers. These workshops are popular and run at capacity. If you have selected a free ticket and are no longer able to attend please return your ticket so it is able to go to people on our waiting list. At busy times there may be a short wait at the workshop table and make sure you allow plenty of time to join us. H ow can I find out more about Jelly? Sign up to our newsletter - www.jelly.org.uk/newsletter Can I arrive early? To allow ample time for our workshop host to prepare the space and set everything up, we kindly request that you arrive no earlier than 5 minutes before the scheduled start time. This allows us to create a welcoming atmosphere and ensure everything is ready for your arrival. If you're curious about the space or would like to introduce your children to the workshop environment beforehand, we're more than happy to accommodate your request. Contact us and we can provide you with photos of the space or arrange a visit prior to the workshop. We want to make sure you and your family feel comfortable and excited about the experience!
999313713217.description: A group for young artists, creatives and producers aged 18 to 25.
999313713217.event_address: Jelly, 1st floor, 115-116 Broad Street Mall, Reading, RG1 7QE
999313713217.title: Young Creatives

1042632741597.summary: Experiment with gel plate printing using non-traditional printmaking techniques. You'll be using oil-based printmaking inks (not paint!) and exploring the creative possibilities of making multi-layered monotypes. You'll be taken step-by-step through simple techniques and be able to practice them with different colours creating wonderful and surprising visual effects. Once you are confident, you'll be shown how to mix the techniques to experiment with mixed-media prints using transparent layers with textures and stencils to produce unusual and beautiful effects. Wear messy clothes or bring overalls / apron. The workshop is suitable for those with little or no experience as well as advanced. All materials are included. There will be a 30 minute lunch break within the session - feel free to bring packed lunch to the studios. The workshop is taught by Linda Newcombe, who is an artist who has been printmaking for over 35 years and includes it in her practice to play with ideas and colours. She is particularly keen on using printmaking to explore layers and experiment with different effects. This workshop is for adults. Please note that this workshop needs a minimum number of bookings to go ahead. By attending this workshop you are agreeing to act in accordance with our workshop behaviour policy which can be viewed here: www.jelly.org.uk/life-drawing-code-of-conduct-policies Find us in our next space on the 1st Floor in Broad St Mall.
