870585724337.summary: =================================== First London Toastmasters Meeting https://firstlondontoastmasters.co.uk/ To join us in-person, please register for the meeting here . Welcome to 1st London Toastmasters! Do you want to banish your fears about public speaking in a supportive, fun and professional environment? If so you've come to the right place. 1st London Toastmastersis one of the most accomplished and encouraging speaking clubs in London. It is part of the worldwide family of Toastmasters International clubs. Who are we? People like you! Every single one of us is actively improving our public speaking and leadership skills. Our membership is made up of an intriguing variety of nationalities and currently includes City-based professionals, small business owners, students, senior managers and many more besides. When?We meet every Monday, except Bank Holidays, at 6.15pm for a prompt 6.30pm start. The meeting finishes around 8.45pm with a 10 minute break in the middle. The deadline to sign up for a meeting is 13.00 the day before (Sunday). Where?We meet at the University of Law, 2 Bunhill Row, London EC1Y 8HQ. Nearest underground: Moorgate We meet every Monday ( except Bank Holidays! ) By following the public speaking and leadership curriculum ("Pathway") laid out in the Toastmasters International Programme and simultaneous Competent Leadership Programme you will: - Improve your speaking skills, both for prepared speeches and shorter, impromptu talks. - Learn how to observe, evaluate and listen to your peers more effectively. - Boost your leadership skills. - Formulate and express your thoughts in a way that will resonate with all your listeners. And you might just make a few friends for life along the way! We, at 1st London Toastmasters would love to meet you, so why not come along as a guest to observe or perhaps participate in one of our Monday meetings. We promise you a fun, relaxed and inspiring evening. Please book in for the next available Monday evening. IMPORTANT: Please sign up if you plan to come along so that we can add you to the guests list otherwise security at the venue will turn you away.
870585724337.description: A warm and welcoming public speaking club in the very heart of London with over 10 years of experience developing speakers and leaders.
870585724337.title: 1st London Toastmasters Meeting

1014309496007.summary: Join Us for an Afternoon Workshop on Cyber Resilience! This in-person event will take place on 2 3rd October, at Allia Future Business Centre, London Road, Peterborough, PE2 8AN . 2:00 PM - 4:00 PM Talks and Practical Advice: Learn from experts from Cyber and Innovation at the Eastern Cyber Resilience Centre, as they shares insights on the current threat landscape of cyber-attacks against UK businesses. Discover the latest tactics used by cybercriminals, gain practical strategies to build your businesss defences, and explore real-life case studies highlighting the importance of cyber resilience. Gain actionable advice, explore free tools and services, and start fortifying your business against cyber threats today. 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM Networking and Q&A: Connect with fellow business owners, industry experts, and cyber resilience professionals. Engage in a Q&A session to address your specific concerns, share your experiences, and discover new opportunities within the community. Escape Room blurb: The Cyber Escape Room is a fun, interactive cyber security exercise designed to highlight good online security behaviours. Teams are assigned to work within the police cybercrime unit and must work together through a variety of problem-solving tasks to prove an organised crime gang is behind an attack on the Detective Chief Inspector. Participants have 30 minutes to complete all the tasks or risk the collapse of the whole investigation. The escape room exercise covers a range of important cyber security topics such as phishing and data leakage, as well as providing techniques to combat common cyber-attacks like creating strong passwords. Who Should Attend? Whether youre a small business owner, manager, or just interested in learning how to protect your organisation from cyber threats, this workshop is for you. Equip yourself with the tools and knowledge to stay ahead of cybercriminals. Drop in and outfeel free to bring your team members along. Drinks and snacks will be provided.
1014309496007.description: Join our Cyber Resilience Workshop to learn how to protect your business from cybercrime with expert talks, practical advice, and networking
1014309496007.title: Peterborough Community Day: Cyber security

Its not just about placing someone into a role and ticking the placement off the list. Its about finding the right person for you and your team. We understand the profound effect that having the right team in place can have on a business. As an independent recruitment consultancy, we offer the flexibility you need to help you achieve your growth goals. Whether youre looking for support with the full recruitment process or want to partner with us on strategic elements from our Niche Flex service, we can help at every stage of your recruitment journey.

967784889657.summary: Were welcoming mindful employers from across Swindon and the local area to join us for crucial discussions surrounding mental health and employee wellbeing in the workplace. Helping you to foster an understanding, supportive and productive workplace for you and your employees. During our Swindon Mindful Employer Network series, which is in partnership with Swindon & Gloucestershire Mind and Swindon Borough Council, well discuss different challenges and issues that employers might be faced with. Our November event falls on World Kindness Day and is during Anti-bullying week, so our focus is on how you can take care and show support in the workplace and be a kind and positive employer. We will also be discussing Movember and the ways employers can better support men's mental health. You will also have the chance to ask our speakers questions and share your views on our event series. Our Speakers Emily Hutchinson, Occupational Psychologist from The Sound Doctor: Emily will be discussing the effects that the stress cycle can have on an individuals mental health and how we can break it, including dedicated strategies that men can adopt. Combining the topics of D&I, anti-bullying and her own expertise and lived experience Dr Ccile Jenkins, Executive, Leadership & Life Coach at In Professional Development (InPD) will be presenting around Creating Safe Spaces: From Theory to Practice Who can attend? Whether you run a small business with a tight knit group of employees or are in a managerial role for a larger organisation, youll be able to leave the event with newfound guidance from our expert speakers to help your team thrive and flourish. Sign up to our fully funded event today! About Swindon & Gloucestershire Mind Swindon & Gloucestershire Mind offers mental health support through counselling, therapy, and community programs. They provide information, and workshops, fostering well-being and aiding recovery. Their services focus on promoting mental wellness and aiding individuals in their journey toward improved mental health and resilience. About Swindon Borough Council Swindon Borough Council is the local authority of the Borough of Swindon in Wiltshire. Swindon Borough council serves a population of over 230,000 and employs over 2,000 members of staff. The council is responsible for a wide range of services that serve the local population, these include adult & Childrens social care services, schools, housing and planning and waste collection. Swindon is a hub for businesses and organisations outside of London, and economic development is an important focus for the local authority. By 2030 Swindon aims to have all the positive characteristics of a British city with one of the UKs most successful economies; a low-carbon environment with compelling cultural, retail and leisure opportunities and excellent infrastructure.

1031945455637.summary: Looking to learn how to build an extra income stream or even leave the 9-5 one day? Come hang out with us each week as we dive into the world of forex, crypto, and smart investing. This is a super relaxed gathering where we learn together, share ideas, and support each other on the journey to financial freedom. Heres what well be covering: Understanding Forex Markets : Well break down how forex trading works and how, with the right education, you can turn it into a solid income stream. No Get-Rich-Quick Hype : Were all about learning how to build real wealth, the right way. No gimmicks, no shortcutsjust solid strategies. The Future of Cryptocurrency : We'll chat about where crypto and blockchain are headed, and why it's such an exciting space to watch (and invest in). Using AI for Day Trading : Well show you how we use AI tools to make smarter, faster decisions in the market. Meet, Connect & Build Together : Its not just about the learningthis is a chance to network with people who have the same goals. Lets build a community and grow together! There is a 5 entry fee just to make sure people show up, but you can redeem it for a drink at the bar so really, its just a way to reserve your spot! The session itself is free this is all about giving you the tools to start your own financial journey. Whether youre new to this or already on your way, everyones welcome! Hope to see you there!

1015118465657.summary: AIM is introducing a series of free events scheduled across England to help prepare potential trustees to join our members and provide networking opportunities for those considering a trustee role in the independent museum sector. Sessions will also offer museums specific guidance on strengthening their trustee recruitment process. AIM has a sector leading reputation for providing advice and guidance on good governance and can draw on a roster of members for real world case studies on trustee recruitment and succession challenges. AIM consultants can also provide expertise on a range of topics on running a successful heritage organisation. Who is this for? Join the AIM team and more at this pilot event, ideal for potential trustees currently working within the sector looking to better understand the role of the Trustee and the skills and the commitment required for success. The session is also ideal for those outside of the sector, looking to understand the key governance issues and realities of Board work in museums. A successful Trustee in a heritage organisation can come from any background, from any career stage and at any age so whatever your motivation and wherever you are in your journey to joining a Board, join us to find out more!

1022526292667.summary: Welcome to The Business Misfit Network London launch party! Join us at Clockwise Wood Green for an evening filled with networking, value, and fun. Connect with like-minded individuals who are shaking up the business world. Whether you're a startup founder, freelancer, or corporate rebel, this event is for you. Get ready to swap stories, exchange ideas, play and maybe even find your next business partner. Don't miss out on this opportunity to expand your network and be inspired. Can't wait to see you there! Unlocking connection, creativity and collaboration for working professionals through PLAY! The Business Misfit Network is a community that does it differently - where we operate from the values of trust, respect, integrity, and FUN! Where PLAY is the centre of all of our events so that you leave feeling inspired, restored, and ready to unlock your full potential and purpose! Where we want you to do business in alignment with your own unique brand of magic! Showing up unapologetically, away from stuffy rooms and 60-second pitches, and into fun social events that allow you to do business differently... so that you and your brand can become magnetic! We are the misfits of networking we connect as REAL people, building REAL relationships and supporting each other in our own nationwide misfit business family. Each meeting is centred on activities that bring pleasure and joy to your working week, allowing human connection through fun and rejuvenation! Find out more about the group, the founder and the memebership HERE . Event overview: 4pm: Arrival and open newtorking 4.30pm: Intoduction and welcome from founder, Emma Eirene 4.45pm: Misfit play - networking games / social to connect, have fun and build real relationships and connections that lead to business opportunitues 5.30pm: Play round-off, everyone connect and open netwroking 6pm: Event close - If you want to continue socialising, you are welcome to transfer to the hotel bar or hold 1:1 meetings in the pods

904768014487.summary: Zoco Networking- how it works Zoco stands for Zoom + Coffee! And is headed up by Nick Blanchard. Nick says: I run informal online AND in-person groups. I wouldn't call it networking exactly, though we are a supportive network, but without the formalities, strict structures, rules and constant selling! We officially launched in August 2020 after a few months of free meetings to support people during lockdown. Whilst the Founder Nick is based in Hampton, South West London, we now have visitors from all over the world visiting us each week, many able to do business completely online so not tied to geographic limitations! We always encourage our members to set up 1-1 calls with each other outside of the official meetings. Building relationships is critical not only for business success but also for our mental health. Now we are also starting to run new in-person local groups, so welcome to the Cobham in-person part of Zoco! Who joins? One day we might do a group meditation session, another day an Accountant will give some useful advice at these ridiculous times, another day a Nutritionist will give some basic tips.it's real variety! Generally, it is small business owners working independently, as well as a few network marketeers, freelancers, and health & wellness consultants (who we need more than ever now right?!) There is a real mix of ages, backgrounds, professions and stages of business. Here's a recent screenshot from one of our group Zoom calls:
904768014487.description: Group Honcho Leonie Wright looks forward to welcoming you to the Cobham Zoco Networking meeting! #thezocoway #zoconetworking
904768014487.title: Zoco Cobham In-Person Meeting

1040562599747.summary: Join us for an exclusive Property Networking Event designed for entrepreneurs, investors, and professionals in the property sector. This event offers a unique opportunity to connect with key players across the industry, explore investment opportunities, and gain valuable insights into the latest trends shaping Londons property market. Event Highlights: 1-Minute Presentations: Property entrepreneurs and professionals will have the chance to deliver concise 1-minute presentations to highlight their projects, services, or investment opportunities. Industry Experts : Legal professionals, financial advisors, and sustainability consultants involved in property transactions or advising on property development projects. Why Attend: Showcase Your Projects: Deliver a 1-minute presentation highlighting your property developments, services, or investment opportunities to an engaged audience. Expand Your Network: Meet potential partners, clients, and collaborators in the London property market, from investors to developers and industry professionals. Discover Opportunities: Stay informed on the latest trends and investment opportunities in the property sector through direct conversations with peers and experts. Explore Collaborations: Find new partners and explore collaborative ventures that can help grow your business or investment portfolio. Dont miss this opportunity to be part of Londons thriving property community. Join us and build connections that can drive your real estate ventures forward. AGENDA OF THIS NETWORKING EVENT IN LONDON 7:00 pm - 7:30 pm: Meet and greet. 1034839301207.summary: Are you a Founder or CEO or BD pitching for investment or sales? Are you looking to learn from, and share experiences, with your peers and experienced industry professionals? Would you like to participate in an informative, engaging and fun thought-leadership discussion about your pitch under Chatham House Rules? Are you available on the afternoon of 23 Oct and can you get to the Mills Fabrica, 36-40 York Way, Kings Cross, London N19AB, it is next to Kings Cross Station? If your answer is yes to these questions, then this #AgileLeaders Investor and Sales Pitch Workshop is for you. The session is run by Prof Tony Sedgwick who has had an esteemed career in Big Pharma where he use to be Global Head of Clinical Research for 10+ years at Roche AG. Tony has also been CEO of 4 biotechs and Chairman of 10 biotechs plus he started a VC fund for Pierre Fabre, so he knows a thing or two. Tony has also recently been inspired by an acting and comedy course where he can see parallels with pitching for investment, instead they pitch for a particular play, film, TV Show or other opportunity. To be discussed: Pitching with Confidence: The importance of performance: This is the first of a series of #AgileLeaders events where we focus on helping entrepreneurs, founders, and CEOs be investor-ready and BD to be sales ready. We will be thinking more like professionals coming into the performance space. We will be thinking of a space like a theatre space or an audition in which we want to impress the investors from the first time they see us. This session will be perfect for those that think mainly of the content and not primarily of the performance they are giving. Tony, and Graham, will be using all their experience as a scientist, CEO, Chairman, VC, Acting, BD and Comedy to help you deliver your best performance and gain the investor or client's attention so that you are memorable and get that investment you need to take your business to the next level. In today's world, it is all about differentiation and performance, and not only what's in the pitch deck, although that is also important. 80% of a sale or investor pitch is about Performance and Personality, only 20% is about the content of your pitch. The science or idea will not sell itself. Instead, you need to sell yourself. This session suits individuals or teams looking to raise money for health innovation or differentiate themselves in a highly diversified life science sector. How do you benefit from attending? As a "Leader" in a life sciences innovation company you will benefit from this "Agile" workshop by sharing common challenges and building deeper connections and trust with your peers. In turn, the aim is to build your confidence when working in areas typically outside your comfort zone, by learning and having discussions with this / your "Agile" peer network. You can speak to people in a similar position about issues you may not have the opportunity to talk about elsewhere. You can discuss your challenges by learning from other people's experiences to help you find a solution or spark an idea. Why let leaders of emerging companies reinvent the wheel to be successful when we can learn from the experiences of others who have faced similar challenges before? Chatham House Rules apply - "what goes on in the workshop, stays in the workshop - so to speak!" Our mission is to help you build your innovation-enabled healthcare business so it is "fit for purpose," truly innovative and attractive to the global markets. Helping you build solid trustworthy networks with your peer group, and help spread your creative R&D business network nationally and internationally. Our motivation and focus are on helping you build long-term trustworthy business relationships and support you on your journey through our supportive business community. This workshop is facilitated by Prof Tony Sedgwick, the self-professed www.ThoughtDisruptor.com. Tony has an esteemed career in academia and in business, he is a trained pathologist. His accolades include once being the Global Head of Clinical Trials at Roche AG, being a VC and being one of the UK's first Biotech CEOs. Tony has now been CEO of four life science companies, Chairman of over 10 Companies, and many positions within the academic community. He is also an active psychologist helping him develop his "Agile" community group development passion and is a Jiu-Jitsu Grand Master VI. Last year Tony published the book "The Mighty Advisor" which became a number 1 best seller in the Amazon STEM Business Management category. He most recently has been on a full-time acting course, and his next goal is to get on Coronation Street or Eastenders! We will start this Agile Leaders Workshop on Wednesday, 23 October, with a 1.30 pm arrival (with a prompt 2.00 pm start). This is at the Mills Fabrica Office Space in the Kings Cross where it offers companies big and small lab space in the heart of the now named Knowledge Quarter. This is the prime real estate along the side of Kings Cross Station on York Way near all the exciting new life science and tech innovation organisations like MSD's new research facility, Google's new European Headquarters, the Crick Institute, University College Hospital, the Wellcome Trust HQ and so much more. We are limiting this event to a maximum of 25 Life Science Innovation Leaders only. Our promise to you is our #AgileLeaders Forum will be like no other life sciences workshop and business network you have experienced. You will be walking out of the session inspired, educated and more connected. In summary: 1.30-2 pm - Arrive at Mills Fabrica, 36-40 York Way, London N1 9AB 2 pm - #AgileLeaders Investor Pitch Workshop starts - Part 1 3.30-4 pm - Snacks and Refreshments 4-5.30 pm - #AgileLeaders Investor Pitch Workshop - Part 2 FEE = 65.00 - ALL-INCLUSIVE - LIMITED TO 25 x Leaders of R&D Innovation companies. 6 pm - for those that want to we, will go for "unofficial" drinks at The Fellow on Kings Cross after the Agile Leaders. If you can't make the workshop, but want to meet-up, feel free to come along and join us for a few networking drinks.
1034839301207.description: A "think-tank" workshop for founders and CEOs to get pitch ready for investors with a focus on their performance when in front of investors
1034839301207.title: #AgileLeaders Investor & Sales Pitch Workshop - focus on performance!

941984901197.summary: Focused Business & Professional Face to Face Networking at Cutty Sark Our unique one-off events provide high-quality face to face networking sessions in distinctive locations across London. Providing opportunities to connect with professionals, business owners, and company leaders who want to upscale their business in the U.K. Attendees are from a diverse range of industries including law, real estate, banking, creatives, and business operations, plus many more. Our IWant2Network events are enjoyed by both our Networking90 members as well as our IWant2Network 5 month pass holders. We do only ever have up to 30 pass holders at any one time. What makes us unique is that we actively pass our members referrals between our groups and sessions meaning you get to expand your contacts. Who is it for: This premium London networking event is suited for business owners and professionals across all industries who wish to upscale their business throughout the UK and beyond. How to book your visitor place: We welcome visitors to experience our networking events up to twice before joining. As an additional benefit of membership, we allow them priority booking and open up visitor tickets 8 weeks prior to each event.
941984901197.description: Come and join us for a tour of the Cutty Sark in London with facilitated business networking
941984901197.title: Premium London Business Networking I IWant2Network @ Cutty Sark Greenwich

984000310417.summary: Hello and thank you for your interest in joining a SPIRAL.IN women's circle! I believe that having a space where we can be unapologetically ourselves is a necessity, especially in a world where we are often expected to play a certain role, that of the mother, the colleague, the partner, the friend... Joining a SPIRAL.IN circle is an opportunity for women to hush the noise of day-to-day life, let the masks slip off and spiral inwards to find the woman underneath it all. Authenticity is a big thing at SPIRAL.IN so know that you belong in circle exactly as you are ! What even is a women's circle? You might be a pro at sitting in circle but in case you're new to it: a women's circle is a group of women who come together to support each other by sharing their authentic truth and by being witnessed and accepted for who they really are. You might choose to share a lot, only a little bit or nothing at all. Circle is a collaborative process, I facilitate but by being authentic and real, each group of women cocreates their own unique experience. A women's circle will usually have a couple of simple guidelines, which I will go through with you at the start of our circle. The most important ones are that this space is confidential and that SPIRAL.IN circles are not therapy. I am a trained circle faciliator (through Sister Stories) but not a therapist. Practicalities To keep my circles small and relaxed, the maximum number of participants is 10. In order to offer as many women as possible the support of a SPIRAL.IN circle, you can choose between a reduced cost ticket and a standard ticket, with a limited number of tickets each. You also have the option to make a donation, which gives me the opportunity to offer a ticket to women who wouldn't be able to afford the full cost of joining. No questions asked, I trust you know what ticket option is most affordable in your current personal situation. There is absolutely nothing to prepare, just wear something comfortable and show up as you are on the day. Please arrive 10 to 15 minutes early so we can start on time (and have a tea first!) and avoid being late as once I have opened our cirlce, I won't be able to admit late-comers. Circles are held at our family home so for evening circles, please be aware that some bath and bedtime noises may be heard. If you are not comfortable with this, please book a weekend circle instead. Cirlce is a tender space so anyone who is intoxicated won't be admitted. This is a circle for women over 18 only. This also means that if you feel a strong connection with your womb space as a non-binary person or trans-woman, you are most welcome here. Unfortunately my current location is not wheelchair accessible. If you are feeling unwell or have symptoms of covid-19, please do not attend our circle so we can keep everyone safe. You'll receive an email from me about one week before our circle with all the information, iincluding full location (please check your spam) but if you would have any questions or worries before then, please don't hesitate to get in touch at hello@spiral-in.co.uk SPIRAL.IN is the place for you if you would like to join a women's circle where you can reconnect not only to yourself but to other like-minded women who carry and support you. I cant wait to hold that space for you! Much love, Charlotte
984000310417.description: An in-person SPIRAL.IN circle offers an opportunity to pause and reconnect to your authentic self.
984000310417.title: Women's Circle (in person) - South London

1041831505077.summary: Arrival from 1.30pm for refreshments and 'meet and greet'. Are you interested in studying hearing, balance or training to be an audiologist? Join us for our open day information event where you will be able to: Learn some fascinating facts about the hearing system Find out what the job of an audiologist involves Talk to lecturers and current students about studying audiology with us Look around our hearing research centre. The Information day will run from 1.30 pm-5 pm at the Ear Institute, 332 Gray's Inn Road. The day is open to: Year 12 and 13 students considering their university applications Undergraduate students interested in postgraduate study Postgraduate students interested in undertaking PhD research in our fields of expertise Members of the public who would like to know more about audiology and the science of hearing If you have any questions, please email ear.education@ucl.ac.uk . Accessibility requirements If you have any accessibility requirements, please contact us on ear.education@ucl.ac.uk . to discuss any access requirements.
1041831505077.description: Come and join us at the UCL Ear Institute Information Day on Saturday 30th of November, for an exciting in-person event.
1041831505077.title: UCL Ear Institute Information Day

1034757486497.summary: Join us for a night of networking and inspiration! If you are a health and wellbeing professional looking to connect with like-minded individuals and want to grow your business and network, this event is for you. Join us for our networking event Tuesday, 19th November 7:30 PM to 9:30 PM The Red Lion, Shepperton |Russell Road | Shepperton | TW17 9HX monthly The benefits of joining our monthly meetings Your chance to expand your network and engage with other wellbeing business owners Connect with those who understand the health and wellbeing industry Bring a friend with our compliments or split the cost between you. Now we are also starting to run new in-person local groups, so welcome to the WOKING in-person part of Zoco! Who joins? One day we might do a group meditation session, another day an Accountant will give some useful advice at these ridiculous times, another day a Nutritionist will give some basic tips.it's real variety! Generally, it is small business owners working independently, as well as a few network marketeers, freelancers, and health & wellness consultants (who we need more than ever now right?!) There is a real mix of ages, backgrounds, professions and stages of business. Here's a recent screenshot from one of our group Zoom calls:

966325795467.title: Zoco St John's (Woking) In-Person Meeting

1032551959707.summary: We're thrilled to share that our in-person community building workshops are back! There will be three women-only sessions before the end of the year (26th October, 16th November and 7th December), so save the dates! *** Are you seeking community but struggling to find your people? Looking to cultivate more authentic connections and have deeper conversations? Join us in an exploration of the art of community building and authentic connection. At Held, we believe the key to fulfilling our potential lies in our ability to create collaborative communities that nourish and inspire us. This is your space if any of these resonate with you: You're craving for community and struggling to find your people in an overly individualistic society. You're tired of superficial connections and are looking for a way to have deeper conversations about what really matters to you. You agree that being human can be a very weird/intense/extremely confusing experience sometimes, and nobody should go through it without support. You sometimes feel stuck and disconnected from yourself, others and life at large. You are tired of reading/listening to self-development content on your own without a community to share your insights with. You've benefited from therapy and are taking care of your mental health but feel you lack a supportive community to share your growth and insights with. You're k een to connect with other like-minded women. You're passionate about building collaborative supportive communities but don't know where to start. If this sounds like you, we can't wait to meet you! What to expect: This is a very interactive, playful, and reflective workshop where we will: Learn how to (really) listen to ourselves and make space in our minds to actively listen to the experience of others. We will do this through mindfulness, journaling, and reflection (bring your favourite notebook/journal and pen!). Practice peer-coaching and peer-counselling skills to create a safe container for everyone to discuss their insights with others. Play with connecting questions to support our reflections and conversations. These are questions specifically chosen to help us understand and share what truly matters to us and others. Have fun! The sessions will be facilitated by me (hi!). I am Fran Vicario, a mindfulness mentor, mental health coach and founder of Held in Community. If you have any questions or want to know more about this project please don't hesitate to get in touch with me on fran@heldincommunity.com. I'd love to hear from you! By booking onto this session you are confirming that you: are over 18 years of age and identify as a woman. understand that these sessions are designed to be a supportive environment, but they cannot replace therapy or medical care. accept to take full responsibility for your own wellbeing and mental health during the sessions. *** This community `building workshop is brought to you by Held in Community. At Held , we facilitate spaces to nurture deep human connection based on authenticity, collaboration, and deep respect for the complexity of everyones life experience. Lets face it being human is a pretty intense experience. The spectrum of our feelings and emotions is endless and yet, our current society does not seem to provide us with many tools or spaces to process the intensity of our life experience in a balanced and healthy way. Held aims to tackle our generalised sense of disconnection from each other and the world we live in, by responding to the needs of those who long for real connection and caring communities. We're extremely excited to share more events with you as we grow! Make sure to join our mailing list and follow us on social media if Held sounds like the space for you. We'll keep you updated with future events as soon as they come out! Instagram: @heldincommunity Facebook: Held in Community Much love, Fran x
1032551959707.description: Are you seeking community but struggling to find your people? Looking to cultivate more authentic connections and have deeper conversations?
1032551959707.venue_name: Kagyu Samye Dzong London Tibetan Buddhist Meditation Centre
1032551959707.title: Community Building for Women: a space to be human together

1022600384277.summary: New for our London community, join We Create Space for an informal meet-up to forge intergenerational support networks between Queer Women in London. These events have been incredibly well received over in Barcelona and this will be our second one here in London! This group is aimed at anyone who identifies as a Queer Woman, femme or who is imp acted by being perceived/socialised as a woman in society and would benefit from making new connections in the city - discussing topics, finding support, learning about other experiences, mentorship and acquiring potential tools for personal and professional growth. Male allies are welcome to listen in, learn & show their support. Were bringing intergenerational Queer Women together to network, build lasting and nurturing friendships, reflect on challenges, and inspire each other as we work towards creating safer and more inclusive spaces - for ALL women. 18:30: Hello & Welcome from We Create Space 18:45: Conversation starter with our guest speaker 19:15 - 19:45: Small group discussion 19:45 - 20:15: Sharing our findings in a whole group discussion shaped by our moderators 20:15: Social & Networking We want the audience to gain fresh perspectives, feel inspired and uplifted. Afterwards, there will be time to continue the conversation, get to know one another and nurture connections. Accessibility: Buckle Street Studios by Locke is wheelchair accessible. Please reach out to events@wecreatespace.co for any additional accessibility needs and we will do our best to accommodate them.
1022600384277.description: A friendly & informal meet-up to forge intergenerational support networks between Queer Women in London
1022600384277.venue_name: Buckle Street Studios by Locke, Aldgate
1022600384277.title: WCS > LDN | Queer Women In Business | Meet up | Nov 2024

1020581455607.summary: Join the vibrant community of health tech startups, entrepreneurs, and professionals at London HealthTech Connect. This premier networking event is dedicated to fostering connections and collaborations among those passionate about revolutionizing healthcare through technology. Whether you're a budding startup looking to make your mark, an entrepreneur with innovative ideas, or a seasoned professional seeking new opportunities, London HealthTech Connect offers the perfect platform to exchange insights, discover cutting-edge advancements, and build meaningful relationships. Who Should Attend? Health Tech Startups: If you're an emerging health tech company looking to make a mark, this event is the perfect opportunity to network with potential partners, investors, and clients. Share your innovative ideas and discover new pathways for growth. Entrepreneurs: Those with a vision for transforming healthcare through technology will find valuable connections and insights at London HealthTech Connect. Meet like-minded entrepreneurs, share your experiences, and collaborate on groundbreaking projects. Healthcare Professionals: Doctors, nurses, and other healthcare providers interested in integrating technology into their practices can benefit from the latest innovations and network with tech developers who understand the needs of the healthcare industry. Investors: Venture capitalists and angel investors looking for the next big thing in health tech will have the chance to meet promising startups and entrepreneurs. Discover investment opportunities and stay informed about cutting-edge developments. Tech Enthusiasts and Innovators: Anyone passionate about the intersection of technology and healthcare is welcome. Engage in thought-provoking conversations, learn from others in the field, and contribute your ideas to the health tech community. Policy Makers and Industry Leaders: Individuals involved in shaping healthcare policy and leading industry organizations can gain insights into emerging trends and connect with innovators driving the future of health technology. The event focuses on dynamic networking sessions and engaging speed presentations. These concise, impactful presentations allow participants to quickly share their innovations and ideas with the entire audience, fostering an environment of rapid learning and connection. Why Attend? Expand Your Network: Connect with like-minded individuals who share a passion for health technology. Build relationships with potential partners, collaborators, and mentors who can help you grow your business and advance your career. Speed Presentations: Engage in dynamic speed presentations where participants share innovative ideas and solutions. Gain quick insights into the latest trends and developments in health tech, and find inspiration for your own projects. Discover Opportunities: Meet potential investors, partners, and clients. Whether you're looking to fund your startup, collaborate on a project, or expand your professional network, this event provides a unique platform to discover new opportunities. Stay Ahead of the Curve: Keep up-to-date with the latest advancements and emerging trends in health technology. Learn from your peers and stay informed about the innovations that are shaping the future of healthcare. Be Part of a Community: Join a dynamic community of health tech innovators who are dedicated to making a difference in healthcare. Share your experiences, challenges, and successes with others who understand your journey. London HealthTech Connect is not just about networking; it's about being part of a dynamic community that is shaping the future of health technology. Dont miss this chance to be at the forefront of healthcare innovation. Come and join us for an event that promises to ignite ideas and foster growth in the health tech sector.
1020581455607.description: London HealthTech Connect: a night of networking with fellow Health Tech startups, entrepreneurs, and professionals in London
1020581455607.title: London HealthTech Connect: Networking for Health Innovatiors

1014471480507.summary: Ignite Business Programme - Ignite . Launch . Grow Start Up Bootcamp - 3 Day Accelerator Day 1: Monday, 14th October at 10.00 - 16.00 Day 2: Tuesday, 15th October at 10.00 - 16.00 Day 3: Wednesday 16th October at 10.00 - 16.00 Venue: Tooting Works, 89 Bickerstetch Road, London, SW17 9SH Everything you need to know to grow a successful business. Starting and growing a business is a rewarding challenge. There is so much to learn. This 3-day event is designed to show you how to get started quickly without wasting time, resources and money. Learn the real practical steps to growing your business without needing a business plan and without needing any business knowledge. Our simple 3-day Start Up Bootcamp will show you exactly what to do and when. This training is aimed at both new business owners and those who are yet to start. Learn everything you need to know to get started on the right foot. Over the 3 days we will cover: Day 1 - The Start Up Foundations My business idea viability My business model My niche and differentiators My competitors and industry research My targets and business goals My customer journey Questions and clarifications Day 2 - Learning to Sell Getting my pricing right Creating branding and content Developing my website My lead generation channels Closing the sale Developing repeat sales Questions and clarifications Day 3 - Finance, Funding & Operations My funding needs My business mapper model Funding options Creating my financial model and business plan My operations, processes, green strategies and staff Using innovation, technology and AI Questions and clarifications Leave knowing everything you will ever need to build a viable, sustainable business. This is about learning the steps that work in the real world. If you want to know what works and stop wasting your time with ineffective and complicated business plans then this is for you. It is the best business training you'll ever do. LIMITED SPACES AVAILABLE This is a completely free business support programme for businesses and residents of Wandsworth Borough. Wandsworth Council, CPG, FSB, and Wandsworth Chamber are collaborating to support the local business community to fuel the local economy. Find out how to get involved by signing up at: https://www.mygrowthpod.com/ignite/
1014471480507.description: Join us where we take you through the most important critical start up first steps so we can fast-track your new business!
1014471480507.title: Wandsworth Start Up Bootcamp - 3 Day Accelerator

1037918290547.summary: Join us to discuss how the new Labour government will impact property development! Are you curious about the potential changes that the new government could bring to the property development sector? Join us for an insightful discussion on the implications of the Labour government's policies on property development.Industry leading keynote speakers,Live Q & A, high performance networking, and Lunch. Please note that our team will contact you to confirm your place at the event. This event will contain a specific selection policy Date: Wed Nov 06 2024 Time: 11:00 AM -3:30 PM GMT Location: 99 Bishopsgate This event is a great opportunity to network with industry professionals and gain valuable insights into the future of property development under the new government. Don't miss out! About the host Jerome Roith is an experienced property developer, with a skill for identifying profitable land opportunities and navigating complex planning processes. Over the past decade, he has strategically acquired sites without planning consent in high-value GDV locations, delivering in excess of 200 residential units through permitted development and new build schemes. His vast experience at gaining planning permission on brownfield and greenfield sites has seen investors profit from this lucrative strategy. Beyond his professional pursuits, Jerome prioritises holistic well-being, and enjoys cooking for his family. He maintains an active lifestyle through running, Pilates, gym sessions and daily meditation. What is the PropDev Summit? Having attended many property events over his 25 year property career,Jerome has launched his own event, the PropDev Summit.The concept of the PropDev Summit is to bring together property professionals active in Land and Development that will benefit from being in a high performance environment. The quarterly events take place at interchangeable Central London venues with director level keynote speakers sharing up to date market insights and "real world" development case studies.Through Jerome's unparalleled connections, he is able to call upon well respected industry leaders from all aspects of Land and Development in the UK including Funding,Planning Consultancy,Legal,Accountancy,and many more. Attendees will benefit from access to industry leaders,property developers,and existing property investors. The Summit format includes live Q & A's,lunch, and networking. Keynote Speakers at PropDev Summit 2.0 PLANNING CONSULTANCY Andy Moger is a Director based in Tetlow King Planning 's Bristol office where he has worked since 2013. He is a Chartered Member of the RTPI and has spent more than 18 years in the planning and development sector with a broad range of experience gained across both private sector consultancy and at local authorities across the midlands and south west. He is a leading specialist in self-build and custom housebuilding, acting for a wide range of clients from landowners, strategic land promoters, developers and volume house-builders and is regularly called as an expert witness on the subject of self and custom build at appeal by the Planning Bars top rated Kings Counsels and Barristers. He is an experienced inquiry witness. Andy also has a great deal of detailed planning policy experience and is well versed in the development plan site promotion process. Since joining Tetlow King Planning he has been involved in a range of work including strategic site promotion, pre-apps, planning applications, public consultation events and a wide range of successful planning applications and appeals. FUNDING Adam Butler Is Head of Sales and Marketing at Avamore Capital having joined in early 2020. Initially joining as Relationship Manager for the South, was promoted in late 2021 to his current role of Head of Sales and in 2023 took on the responsibility of managing marketing. Adam started his career in property finance over 15 years ago spending 5 years as a mortgage broker across Surrey and Berkshire focussing mainly on the regulated market before joining a specialist BTL lender within their origination team. Since then, he has worked for multiple specialist lenders in all different sectors of property finance before joining Avamore Capital. He currently specialises in development and bridging finance working closely on different types of schemes ranging from smaller development to larger more complex transactions across England and Wales. To date Adam has helped over 100 clients with their developments in his time at Avamore Capital, ranging from first time developers to seasoned professionals. ACCOUNTANCY AND TAX ADVISORY Taylor Rogers is a director at Williamson & Croft . They a firm of accountants & tax advisors with 50 staff spread over 2 offices in Manchester & Liverpool.Williamson & Croft act for a large number of developers, investors, construction companies, architects & consultants with the vast majority of their client base operating in the property sector. Williamson & Croft help their client base remain compliant and stay on the right side of HMRC, reducing stress for the stakeholders in these organisations. Our second main role is to ensure our clients are operating as tax efficiently as possible. If a property company faces a tax barrier should that be VAT, CIS or SDLT it tends to be that W&C have provided a similar solution for another client. On the day, Taylor will be providing a summary of the recent budget from a property perspective. Along with an outlook on the next few months. SELF INVESTED PENSIONS Whitehall Group are a multi award winning provider of self-invested pension arrangements rated 5 stars by Defaqto and Moneyfacts. With over 50 years of experience, in pension scheme administration, they specialise in self invested personal pensions (SIPP and SSAS). Their expertise ensures the level of service and support you expect throughout your retirement savings journey. Richard Mattison was raised in the West Country before attending the University of Reading. He commenced his career in life insurance in 1988 before starting in the SSAS business in 1990. Since then he has specialised in the field of SSAS and SIPP and has managed, launched, operated and sold award-winning pension products for many years. He is an enthusiastic music lover with a special affection for Elvis Presley.
1037918290547.description: Find out how the new Labour government plans to transform property development! Industry leaders, keynote speakers, live Q&A, networking
1037918290547.title: How will the new Labour government impact property development?

885564195347.summary: Join us for our Annual General Meeting, an evening dedicated to celebration, information sharing, and empowerment. It's an opportunity to come together, connect with others, and have a meaningful impact on our future. You are invited to two sessions and the AGM itself! If you are a partner organisation and wish to have a stand please email the organisor. From 6pm there will be light refreshments. On the ticketing page you will be given the option to attend both sessions or just the second . Please only select one option. We hope to see you there! Who is it for? All D/deaf and Disabled people and our allies in Tower Hamlets and beyond. Where? Grocers Wing, Tower Hamlets Town Hall, Whitechapel Road, E1 1BJ We'd love to see as many of you as possible! Session 1: Around the World of Real Starts 4:30pm (Doors open 4pm) Experience a fully interactive World Caf where you can engage with various teams and campaigns at Real. Discover what we've been working on, our upcoming plans, and how you can get involved. Topics covered include: advocacy, advice, housing, social care, primary care, research, and volunteering. Session 2: Challenges and Solutions : Disabled People, Hate Crime, Community Safety and the Police: Starts 6:30 pm (Doors open 6 pm ) Join us for a high-profile, interactive discussion on community safety. Together, we will explore the challenges and realities faced by Disabled people in Tower Hamlets in personal safety, and in reporting crime. We will critically examine why so few disability hate crimes are reported and solved, and why Disabled people are more likely to experience some crimes. Together , we will discuss meaningful solutions. There will be plenty of opportunities for participation and questions. Chair: Jack Gilbert, CEO Real DPO, and independent community advisor to New Scotland Yard and across east London police. Panelists: Superintendent Alexander Ogilvie leads on hate crime, domestic abuse and other safeguarding matters across Tower Hamlets and Hackney Ann Corbett - Director, Community Safety Division, London Borough of Tower Hamlets 2024 Annual General Meeting and Board elections: Starts 5:40pm In between the two sessions, we have reserved 25 minutes for the AGM part of our event. Our 2024 Annual General Meeting will be a chance to: find out more about the work were doing Meet our trustees get information about how Real has spent its money in the last year meet with members of the Real team, other Real members and other local contacts For members of Real the AGM is also a chance to elect new trustees to our board. If you are a member and are interested in becoming a trustee, please let us know via the contact details below. P lease let us know you are coming by signing up here on Eventbrite or in the following ways: 020 7001 2170 07458 305 430 events@real.org.uk Access r equir e ments There is step free access into the Town Hall and the Grocers Wing. Please reach out if you have any access requirements. We look forward to welcoming you! Real's Vision A world without barriers where Disabled people are respected and empowered, and experience equity. Real's Mission We empower all Disabled people to lead their best lives. We promote intersectional equity and inclusion for all disabled people. We work together to ensure services meet all Disabled peoples needs and recognise our diverse lived experiences. We combat discrimination, prejudice and ignorance against individuals, and challenge systemic barriers.
885564195347.description: Join the AGM of Real, a Tower Hamlets organisation run by Disabled people, for Disabled people.
885564195347.event_address: 160 Whitechapel Road Grocers Wing, London, E1 1BJ
885564195347.venue_name: London Borough of Tower Hamlets, Town Hall
885564195347.title: Test Real's Annual General Meeting 2024 (full event)

1006250952687.summary: Responsible Business - What does it mean for the East of England property world? The relationship between business and the community is now integral to any successful business in 2024. No more so than in Cities like Cambridge where the gaps in wealth and life opportunities are extreme. This event will explore how the property sector can make a difference and examples of successful projects and companies. In response to the growing need to highlight and identify successful examples of Responsible Businesses in the East of England property, architectural, and construction sectors, Tees Law and Get Synergised have partnered with UKPF on this event which aims to bring like-minded people together. FORMAT Moderator + Intro from our Partners Matthew Battle, Managing Director, UK Property Forums Rachel Hales, Founder + Director, Get Synergised Welcome to North Cambridge - Scope and Ambition Max Bryan, Head of Science & Technology, Bidwells Speakers + Case Studies Rebecca Britton, Regional Director - Communications Communities and Partnerships, Urban + Civic Nicky Shepard, CEO, Abbey People Sarah Coates, Partner, Tees Law More to be announced. Why should you attend? Content will include presentations from successful examples where companies engaged with the community and what needs to be done to continue their work Speakers will include a local charity based in Cambridge, providing insights into the value and benefits of mutually beneficial partnerships and what charities are looking for Examples will be provided from the 'floor' of where companies from the property, architectural, and construction sectors have engaged in responsible business approaches Opportunity to network with key players from the property market who are active in Cambridge, as well as nonprofits to collaborate with, working across Cambridge and the wider East of England property Location 2, Cambridge Square, Cambridge, CB4 0AE https://novotelcambridgenorth.uk-hotel.info/ https://cambridgenorth.co.uk/residential-quarter Travel The Novotel Hotel adjoins Cambridge North Railway Station which has generous car parking and can be booked at a reasonable rate for a few hours using the phone App-Pay By Phone. And note that the hotel can also help with parking and payments at the Reception Desk. Alternatively, arrive by foot or by bicycle. Partner + Sponsor Links https://www.getsynergised.com/ https://www.teeslaw.com/ Please contact the event organiser if you want to learn more about Membership for UK Prop Social.
1006250952687.description: Responsible Business - What does it mean for the East of England property world?
1006250952687.title: UK Prop Social - Cambridge

936690766297.summary: This session is free for small business owners looking to build a carbon reduction plan for their business. This interactive workshop provides a fun and engaging way to learn about carbon emissions, get your carbon footprint, explore practical solutions, and create a personalised action plan for your business. If youre a Facilitator looking for a new way to engage clients and a toolkit to add to your existing offering, come along to see it in action and get official facilitator training! Is your business ready for 2025? From 2025, UK and EU regulations will come into force, meaning that most small businesses will need to have a carbon reduction plan in place. Take the first steps in creating a plan for your small business. Estimate your carbon footprint in less than 3 minutes. Create your own plan using the action cards. Leave with simple, practical actions that will make an impact. Meet local businesses on the same journey, and make a plan together. Small99s Action Box: Carbon Reduction Fundamentals Create your carbon reduction plan in a simple, fast and fun workshop for any small business that's feeling lost and overwhelmed with carbon reduction plans. This introductory workshop gives your small business everything you need to get started with a carbon reduction plan. You will leave this workshop with: An overview of the business opportunity of climate action An estimate of their business carbon footprint A set of reduction action cards to build a plan Certificate of reduction actions Access to accountability meetings You will leave this workshop with: Carbon Footprint Estimate - Participants receive an estimated footprint in less than 3 minutes A reduction plan - Build a carbon reduction plan using our pre-designed action cards CPD Certificate - Certify the start of your reduction journey with a CPD-accredited Small99 certificate. The Session Plan As a business, build your reduction plan in the first 2 hours! Using a set of interactive cards, youll discuss 30 different actions your business could take and build a visual representation of your journey to Net Zero. Facilitator Tickets If youd like to become a facilitator of the Small99 Action Box, come along to see the workshop in full flow! At the end of the workshop youll get the chance to speak to expert facilitators and hear from their real life experiences, and investigate the materials in more detail. Your Facilitators Alexandra Pearson MBE Alex lived and worked in China for 25 years where she set up several businesses and organisations including one of the "Top Ten Bookshops in the World" and China's largest literary festival, a theatre company, an outdoor management training company and a leadership training organisation. With a track record of creating successful small businesses with big impact, she now shares her knowledge and experience as a trainer, consultant and facilitator with clients in the UK and abroad. Director of The Yurt Academy, Alex is also a Senior Lecturer at the University of Sussex Business School, specialising in project and technology management and leadership. Accredited as a Carbon Literacy Trainer by the UN PRME Carbon Literacy Project, a Climate Fresk Facilitator and a Carbon Reduction Action Plan (CRAB) Facilitator, Alex leads sessions on climate awareness and action both at the University and in the community. Simon Batchelar Simon Batchelar is a marketing mentor and author of Reframing Marketing: A 3-Step Plan for Effective and Ethical Marketing. With 20 years' experience of running their own marketing agency, Simon has transformed over 400 small businesses. Simon spent 10 years as a TV and commercial sound editor, working on Oscar and Bafta winning programmes. Since becoming a Carbon Reduction Action Plan (CRAB) Facilitator, their vision is to combine this knowledge with their experience of working with small business leaders and teams to empower small businesses to lead the move to Net Zero.
936690766297.description: Create your carbon reduction plan in a simple, fast, fun workshop for any small business that's feeling lost & overwhelmed
936690766297.event_address: Ship Street, Brighton and Hove, BN1 1AF
936690766297.title: How to Tell Your Sustainability Story - Carbon Reduction Fundamentals

894606461007.summary: Build your business and grow your connections via our networking events exclusively for women in business in and around the Henley-on-Thames area **PLEASE NOTE** At WIBN we have a one person professional category rule ; please contact vicki.messenger@wibn.co.uk BEFORE BOOKING to check the availability of your professional category. Women in Business Network (WIBN) is the UK's leading professional women's networking organisation, focused on building our member's businesses through collaborative, supportive, and engaging networking, over a business brunch or lunch. Our events are hosted once a month and follow a structured format so you get the most from your time with us. For further information and booking queries about the Henley Group, and our other WIBN Groups within the Thames Valley and online, please CLICK HERE . Here is an idea of what happens during our meetings: Open Networking - to build relationships with like-minded businesswomen Monthly Minutes - your chance to share with the room more about you and your business and ask for introductions and support for the coming month Member Spotlight we get to know one member per month either through an interview or mastermind session Business Topic - a value-adding presentation from one of our members, or a business coaching exercise to help you move you and your business forwards Lets Talk Business everyones chance to pass referrals, request 1-2-1s, or share testimonials Our WIBN meetings are focused, supportive, and aimed at helping you build your network, and grow your business alongside an incredible group of motivated women, who in time can recommend your business with their contacts. Dietary requirements and food choices (if applicable) are requested ahead of the event. PLEASE NOTE: At WIBN we have a one person per professional category rule; please contact vicki.messenger@wibn.co.uk prior to booking to check the availability of your professional category. We are so looking forward to welcoming you at our upcoming meeting, and please do get in touch if you have any questions prior to booking! Many thanks, Vicki

1036777779247.summary: Are you looking to develop innovation within your business? Book a free 45 minute online session with Ryan Davies , Innovation & Growth Specialist from Innovate UK Business Growth , for an initial conversation. Choose from a selection of dates and times to suit you. Once you've registered, we'll pass on your details (name and email address) to Ryan, who might contact you with some questions prior to your session with him. Ryan can help you with: Sourcing Finance and Funding Developing business plans Identifying new market opportunities connecting to partnership opportunities across UK and Internationally Exploiting business innovation: Developing a commercial strategy and building a team to deliver it; protecting & harnessing your IP; improving innovation management & accessing the innovation ecosystem globally Expert biography Ryan is an Innovation & Growth Specialist for Innovate UK Business Growth . Ryan has spent the last decade supporting high growth, innovative SMEs across the South East of the UK to identify their barriers to growth and supports them through their growth Journey. Support has included accessing finance and funding, developing business plans and models, taking products to market, and developing partnerships across businesses, SMEs and public organisations. Innovate UK Business Growth is a funded support programme for innovative, high-growth SMEs. It provides businesses with a range of services to suit specific needs, helping them to grow and scale. Support is tailored to meet the requirements of the business and can include commercialising R&D, accessing funding and finance opportunities, and entering new markets both in the UK and internationally. The service is delivered through 1:1 sessions from an Innovation & Growth Specialist, experienced at understanding the challenges faced by business owners and how to overcome the barriers to growth. This is backed by a team of specialists with wide ranging expertise across most business sectors, providing access to specific knowledge when needed. Note The adviser is an independent professional and is not an agent or employee of the Council, nor the Library. They will be regulated by their own professional body and they will be able to provide you with details of that organisation.We will not be aware of any advice that is given to you by the adviser when you consult them in the 121 session and we do not verify or approve their advice. We therefore take no responsibility and make no representations regarding the relevance, accuracy, timeliness, completeness or otherwise of any such advice or information. Any views expressed by the adviser are their own views and not those of the Council. This in-person 121 session will take place at the BIPC on the 2nd floor at Crawley Library, Southgate Avenue, Crawley. If you would prefer your 121 to be online, please email BIPC@brighton-hove.gov.uk directly after booking to request a zoom link. Following the session, the expert will send you a feedback form which we would be grateful if you could complete to allow us to monitor the success of our offered expert 121s. - ------------------ Important All our expert one-to-one meetings on offer are free, but places are limited as our business expert partners are giving their valuable time to the BIPC and to you for free while fitting these sessions into their busy schedule. Therefore, if you need to cancel the session, to give a chance for others to still book it, please give at least two working days notice when possible via: email to bipc@brighton-hove.gov.uk, or cancelling your booking on Eventbrite, or email/call to the business expert. Please note down the experts' contact details when they get in touch with you prior to the session. - ------------------ Increase your chances of business success Business & IP Centre Sussex supports people to start, grow and protect their businesses in Sussex. Come and access our free market research and intellectual property databases and take part in our regular programme of workshops, webinars and networking events. W hat if I don't live / have my business in Sussex? Find your local BIPC here to find out how they can help you: https://www.bl.uk/business-and-ip-centre/national-network - ------------------ FAQs What is your cancellation policy? The majority of our events are free, but places are often limited - especially for in-person events, therefore please make sure you cancel your place, if you are unable to attend . You can cancel through your Eventbrite booking or emailing bipc@brighton-hove.co.uk . Can I attend if I'm not a member of the library? Absolutely! Any Sussex based business/ person with a business idea is welcome. Though we always recommend joining the library as it's free and will make accessing our databases, books and publications much easier. How can I find out about any news & upcoming events? So glad you asked - we have a newsletter ! You can also follow us on Twitter , LinkedIn , Facebook and Instagram for the latest goings-on.

While this event is centered around women in tech, we extend a warm invitation to everyone to join us. On the company side, we have CTOs who can write code blindfolded, VP of Engineering who have a black belt in project management, and talent acquisition leaders who have recruited more people than McDonald's has served hamburgers. And on the attendee side, we have techies who know how to turn caffeine into code and can make an app out of thin air. This event is not just about networking, it's about connecting with fellow mid-/senior tech pros in the industry, sharing a laugh or two, and maybe even finding your next career move. So come join us for a unique networking event where job seekers take the driver's seat! We will: listen to short and sweet pitches by CTOs and hiring teams and vote best pitch (who said that corporate evaluation can't be fun?), talk all things tech, network and run speed interviews, meet faces behind our fav tech brands, and see what our local tech has to offer this season. 1041970059497.summary: Are you looking to develop innovation within your business? Book a free 45 minute online session with Ryan Davies , Innovation & Growth Specialist from Innovate UK Business Growth , for an initial conversation. Choose from a selection of dates and times to suit you. Once you've registered, we'll pass on your details (name and email address) to Ryan, who might contact you with some questions prior to your session with him. Ryan can help you with: Sourcing Finance and Funding Developing business plans Identifying new market opportunities connecting to partnership opportunities across UK and Internationally Exploiting business innovation: Developing a commercial strategy and building a team to deliver it; protecting & harnessing your IP; improving innovation management & accessing the innovation ecosystem globally Expert biography Ryan is an Innovation & Growth Specialist for Innovate UK Business Growth . Ryan has spent the last decade supporting high growth, innovative SMEs across the South East of the UK to identify their barriers to growth and supports them through their growth Journey. Support has included accessing finance and funding, developing business plans and models, taking products to market, and developing partnerships across businesses, SMEs and public organisations. Innovate UK Business Growth is a funded support programme for innovative, high-growth SMEs. It provides businesses with a range of services to suit specific needs, helping them to grow and scale. Support is tailored to meet the requirements of the business and can include commercialising R&D, accessing funding and finance opportunities, and entering new markets both in the UK and internationally. The service is delivered through 1:1 sessions from an Innovation & Growth Specialist, experienced at understanding the challenges faced by business owners and how to overcome the barriers to growth. This is backed by a team of specialists with wide ranging expertise across most business sectors, providing access to specific knowledge when needed. Note The adviser is an independent professional and is not an agent or employee of the Council, nor the Library. They will be regulated by their own professional body and they will be able to provide you with details of that organisation.We will not be aware of any advice that is given to you by the adviser when you consult them in the 121 session and we do not verify or approve their advice. We therefore take no responsibility and make no representations regarding the relevance, accuracy, timeliness, completeness or otherwise of any such advice or information. 810117201357.summary: Pop down to your local People Planet Pint meetup to find more about what's going on locally with sustainability and how you can get involved. No pitches, powerpoints or panels. Just People, Planet, Pint/s. Your local meetup is a great place to start your journey or continue learning, and meet diverse people to chat about life and how we can sustain it. Every job is a climate job, so come along and learn about how you can take action, as well as what is going on locally. We welcome everyone, regardless of their experience or background. People Planet Pint is a space where everyone can feel comfortable learning about sustainability and sharing their ideas. Afterall, creating a sustainable future requires connected communities. And what better way to bring everyone together than over a drink? Prefer a Pastry to a Pint? Head along to People Planet Pastry ! Equally relaxed and welcoming, they run during the day and offer an informal way to learn about what is going on locally in sustainability. Your Volunteer Hosts Raechel Kelly worked in sustainable finance for 12 years, on ESG analysis and fossil fuel divestment. In 2020 she set up The Liminality , her small solo project working on climate communications and facilitation. In the same year she approached local charity Vision 21 to set up Planet Cheltenham , the town's first community climate solutions hub with the aim of empowering residents around joyful climate action. She now runs several projects including a Youth Climate Group, Little Planet Cheltenham baby group, and took part in the pilot Doughnut Economics Learning Journey as a host to some amazing local renegade economists. She is a NED at Good With Money, an RSA fellow, and you will always find her in the kitchen at parties (asking where the recycling bin is). Becki Sillence works for local climate charity Vision 21 as the communications manager for the CheltenhamZero project, a joint initiative between Vision21 and Cheltenham Borough Council supporting local organisations to move towards a Net Zero position. She has worked with a wide range of people and organisations in Cheltenham and has experience in the community, engagement and flood resilience sectors. Andrew Lansley is the Innovation Manager for Cheltenham Festivals, Senior Academic at the University of Gloucestershire and facilitator for the Cheltenham Culture Board. He works cross-sector with regional and national stakeholders to help progress the towns relationship with culture, technology, sustainability and accessibility. Andrew believes culture can play a key role in promoting sustainable economics around Cheltenham, Gloucestershire and the UK, and is involved in numerous related projects across the live events and cultural sectors.
810117201357.description: Pop down to your local People Planet Pint meetup to find more about what's going on locally with sustainability and how you can get involved
810117201357.event_address: 27 Lansdown Industrial Estate, Unit 33/34 Gloucester Road, Cheltenham, GL51 8PL
810117201357.title: Cheltenham - Small99's People, Planet, Pint: Sustainability Meetup

1039380102867.summary: Energy and Buzzing are two words that are frequently used by guests to describe our Property Connector Events. You can put people together in a room, but without energy sparking off each other, nothing happens. If you want to be at an event where sparks are flying, we need to invite the right people together at the right time and this is exactly what we constantly do at Property Connector Events. Do you want to relax, have a good time, and introduce your property related business and how it can support others as well as to build long lasting, meaningful relationships? Then, you are the right person at the right time to come to a Property Connector event. At this event you will find a wide variety of guests from every area of property related businesses. People find the right people with whom to do business and widen their network. The social side is just as important as the business side when you are building the right business connections. This is the format of the evening. What to Expect: 7:00 PM - 10:30 PM: Open Networking Enjoy an extended period of networking where you can engage with a diverse group of attendees from various property sectors. Use this time to explore potential collaborations, exchange ideas, and expand your network. What Type of People Attend This Event? Our Property Connector events attract a vibrant mix of professionals across the property sector. You can expect to meet: Builders & Contractors Architects & Designers Investors & Developers Real Estate Agents & Sourcers Interior Designers Landlords Surveyors Legal & Accountancy Firms Proptech Founders Property Managers Mortgage Brokers Facilities Managers Construction Suppliers Urban Planners Sustainability Consultants By bringing together such a diverse group, the event creates a fertile ground for collaboration, learning, and networking. Location . The event takes place at the elegant bar of the Hilton Park Lane within a large private area. For the comfort of everyone attending, the maximum number of allowed geusts is 70. We recommend early booking. Pre-Event Connection: A dedicated WhatsApp group will be set up for attendees to start getting to know each other and set expectations for the event. Ticket Policy: Tickets purchased in advance are priced lower than those bought on the day and are non-refundable, though they can be reassigned to someone else if needed.
1039380102867.description: Get Ready for the Next Property Connector Event!
1039380102867.title: Property Connector in Mayfair

Event Highlights: - Building Strong Networks within Construction : Learn how to optimise local networks to deepen relationships. - Consistency in Recognition: Discover how consistency leads to stronger recognition in the industry. - Strategic Decision Making: Understand the importance of location in decision-making processes. The company is developing an international portfolio, with two masterplan projects in Tbilisi, Georgia. The company is expanding further international projects; in Turkey, India, Croatia, the Caribbean, as-well-as developing business opportunities in Saudi Arabia and the UAE. In this session we will advise on how we optimise our local networks to deepen relations, how consistency leads to stronger recognition in industry and how location is key to decision making. With our experience and expertise, we will be able to advise our audience on best practice and a deeper undertaking of relationship building within our construction industry. Why Attend Our Events? - High-Level Networking: Rub shoulders with industry leaders, key decision-makers, and innovators who can offer you new insights and open doors to exciting opportunities. - Top-Tier Speakers on Relevant Topics: Gain valuable knowledge from distinguished speakers who address the most current and pressing issues in the industry, providing you with actionable insights and fresh perspectives. - Exceptional Venues: Our events are hosted in some of Londons most prestigious and inspiring locations, offering the perfect setting for both professional engagement and personal enjoyment. - Exquisite Cuisine and Fine Wines: Indulge in a carefully curated selection of high-quality dishes and fine wines, making every event not just informative but also a culinary experience to remember. - Genuine Connections: We pride ourselves on fostering a welcoming and authentic atmosphere, where you can form meaningful relationships that extend well beyond the event. Ultimately, the opportunity is in your handswhile we can bring the horse to water, its up to you to make the most of it! London is teeming with events, but why choose ours? Our Founder, The Hon Richard Evans, has spent over 30 years attending a wide array of industry events. With this wealth of experience, he recognised the need for something better and launched the Construction Hub to offer an unparalleled experienceone that combines top-notch quality with tangible value. Dont settle for the ordinary. Join us and discover why our events stand out in a crowded field. What our guests say? Its a really clever networking format where it was very relaxed and created natural conversations which isnt always the case at other networking events Molly Sciberras, Trail Group Whats the cost?
