1042913842377.summary: Join us for a COLOSSAL Kent Property Meet on Wednesday 23 rd October 24 at The Maidstone Mercure Hotel from 6pm onwards. You simply cannot miss this meet masses of content, lots of big personalities and the knowledge and experience is insane! We also have a lot to celebrate this month. We are back from our summer recess to network with the best and to get together with our property friends. We have a fabulous keynote speaker in the shape of Marion Money from the NRLA. We have our regular Ambassadors of Excellence on hand to give you a hand with your property journey. And we will be celebrating 10 years of KPM with cake and fizz of course! Marion Money will be talking about how the impending Renters Rights Bill will affect landlords. She has her finger on the pulse and will be able to answer any of your burning questions given that the 2nd reading was on Wed 9th October. Marion is a fountain of knowledge and represents the NRLA in the South East, as well as managing her own properties. She has been a landlord since 1974, and has a portfolio of both commercial and domestic properties. In her role as a NRLA Representative, Marion is able to use her extensive experience to share information on best practice and implementing legislation. Marion believes it's an important part of her role to keep landlords informed and to represent their interests to local councils and legislators - landlords are dealing with someone's home and the focus on this must not be lost. She is very active in arranging landlord events, forums and information evenings. Marion sits on the Kent Housing Board and is vice chair of the subgroup focusing on the Private Rented Sector. She sees her role as keeping the Boards focused on issues affecting private landlords. We will also have: The latest lending news from Peter Vandervennin of The Mortgage Consultancy Graham Kinnear Property Consultant will be on hand to answer any of your burning property questions Sheena Parker of SJP Wealth Management will try to untangle all things financial and talk about financial wellbeing in this current challenging climate Georgia Martin of The Insurance Desk is available to answer any insurance queries Darren Hughes and his team from Friend & Grant Solicitors will talk about the latest in legislation and how they can help you. Kent Property Meet has everything you need for your property journey The Power Team Informative Keynote Speakers to keep you up to date And most importantly you have each other for support, networking and working together Get your tickets here for a sell out event and to celebrate our 10 Year collaboration as Kent Property Meet . Cooperation Collaboration Education Connections See you on Wednesday evening! Your Net-Work is Your Net-Worth. Sponsors:- Thank you to our sponsors for keeping us an independent network meeting, please feel free to visit them on their websites and make sure you catch up with them in person during the event.

1041888294937.summary: A Journey of Connection, Ceremony, and Healing reclaiming the powerful feminine energy living your deepest truth and highest purpose. Through connection, ceremony, mediation and breathwork. Gather close in this sacred circle, a space held with love, intention, and reverence for the Divine Feminine in all of us. Here, we connect not only to each other but to the infinite wisdom and power within, the eternal wellspring of creativity, intuition, and love. This circle is a place for deep healing, sacred sisterhood, and honouring the cycles of life. As we come together, let us centre ourselves in this moment, honouring the sacredness of being, and feeling the energy of the feminine that flows through each of usunique, yet universal. Together, we are co-creating a safe and open space for transformation, connection, and alignment with our highest selves. Join us in a scared, held space to re connect to the Divine Feminine within you. The workshop will be held in the Willow Lodge, a cosy wooden space with an open fire within the grounds of Lake House Kent Holistic Centre. Please bring your own yoga mat, comfortable/ loose clothing (clothing worn preferably white is possible- not essential), water (herbal tea be included as part of the ceremony), anything you additionally need to ensure your comfort during this workshop (eg. blanket/pillow etc) and your journal/ notebook and pen.

996324211537.summary: Pop down to your local People Planet Pint meetup to find more about what's going on locally with sustainability and how you can get involved. No pitches, powerpoints or panels. Just People, Planet, Pint/s. Your local meetup is a great place to start your journey or continue learning, and meet diverse people to chat about life and how we can sustain it. Every job is a climate job, so come along and learn about how you can take action, as well as what is going on locally. We welcome everyone, regardless of their experience or background. People Planet Pint is a space where everyone can feel comfortable learning about sustainability and sharing their ideas. Afterall, creating a sustainable future requires connected communities. And what better way to bring everyone together than over a drink? Prefer a Pastry to a Pint? Head along to People Planet Pastry ! Equally relaxed and welcoming, they run during the day and offer an informal way to learn about what is going on locally in sustainability. Your Volunteer Hosts Alice Lacey works in Communications for a global real estate company, which includes educating employees on Net Zero strategy. She lives in Oxfordshire and is part of Deddington Environment Network, editing their monthly newsletter. Nick Smith is co-founder of Deddington Environment Network , a local group looking to support initiatives within biodiversity, food, energy, transport and resources. He also co-hosts PPPastry Manchester.
996324211537.description: Pop down to your local People Planet Pint meetup to find more about what's going on locally with sustainability and how you can get involved
996324211537.title: Deddington - Small99's People, Planet, Pint: Sustainability Meetup

967656816587.summary: Building the Excellent Family (BEF) Summit Empowering Families, Shaping Futures This Years Theme: 'Called 2 Chosen' The theme for this year, " Called 2 Chosen," invites an exploration of our innate gifts and the profound act of stepping into our true potential. It speaks to distinguishing oneself, owning one's opportunities, and truly standing out from the crowd in a world that increasingly demands distinction and purpose driven living. Since its inception in 2019, Cedarcube has dedicated itself to empowering families and individuals preparing for family life. As Cedarcubes flagship summit, the BEF focuses on the pillars of empowerment, alongside healing, bonding, and connecting integral aspects of a balanced life. Our mission is to address macro societal issues at the micro level of the family, the cornerstone of society, guided by a core ethos rooted in the Word of God. A Transformative Experience: Attendees of the BEF summit embark on a transformative journey, gaining invaluable tools to enhance their health and well-being, parenting skills, financial acumen, relationships, and spiritual purpose. Each year, we create an oasis of learning and inspiration amidst the chaos of our times, helping individuals forge a vision of an enhanced life and family dynamics. Exclusive Access and Book Launch: This year, every ticket gives you exclusive access to the launch of Ihu's highly anticipated book, The Awakening of Purpose through Passion and Pain . Each attendee will receive a signed paperback copy of the book, while VIPs will be gifted a signed hardback copy. Past Distinguished Speakers: Our summit has been graced by world-renowned experts including: Philip Chan , the late #1 ten-second math expert globally. Chanel, for Caroline Marsh Success Secret of Millionaires. Teemak Phoenix , influential social media voice. Wai-Yee Schmidt , investment strategist. Professor Chris Imafidon , Guinness world record holder and patriarch of the UK's smartest family. Sabrina Ben Salmi and her children, the Fabulous 5, embodying influence and inspiration. This years event is no different as we have gathered experts in business, finance, health, relationship, parenting and ministry to ensure this is the one must attend to event to summise your 2024 and prepare you and your family for a soaring 2025. Join us at the BEF summit to not just envision but actively create a better future for yourself and your family. Embrace the call to rise above and be chosen for greatness. Sponsorship: Sponsorship opportunities are available. Please contact us via our email address info@cedarcube.com .
967656816587.description: Join us at "Building the Excellent Family 2024" Called2Chosen event to strengthen family bonds and grow together!
967656816587.title: Building the Excellent Family 2024 "Called2Chosen"

947334191067.summary: The Christmas Party by Bread & Jam returns. Join us and over 400 emerging challenger brands, industry experts, retailers, distributors, investors and press for an EPIC celebration this December at Crate in Hackney Wick, East London. Spaces are limited - last year sold out. Don't miss out on the party of the year and grab your ticket today. What can you expect? Celebrate with 4 00+ challenger food & drink brands Free flowing craft beers, softs and pizza. Secret Santa: bring your products (or a gift of any kind, up to 10) to take part in this classic Christmas activity - give a gift and receive one back from under the Christmas tree. Wrapping paper will be available. Chilled, pre-launch or just a bit complicated? No worries - bring a small wrapped gift of any kind to join in. The Producers' Table: a Bread & Jam favourite! Bring along your products, check out what everyone else is producing and get industry feedback. Why are we hosting a Christmas Party? We hosted our first Christmas Party in 2022, as a way to bring our community together at the end of a tough year for many food and drink businesses. We thought we'd be pretty chuffed if a couple dozen people came to share a drink or two with us... So we were pretty blown away when hundreds of people turned up and filled the pub! We realised that the food and drink community needed to kick back, celebrate and raise a drink just as much as we did. So, we're back for a second year, in a much bigger venue, so everyone can join in. Whether you're a food and drink founder, part of a food brand team, an industry expert, a pre-launch startup, a distributor, a manufacturer, a product developer, a branding guy... Anyone involved in the food and drink world is welcome and we can't wait to see you there.
947334191067.description: Get ready for a jolly evening on 21st November at Crate, where 500+ challenger food & drink brands will gather for an EPIC industry do.
947334191067.title: The Christmas Party by Bread & Jam

1008478766137.summary: Welcome to the LBS Investors and Founders Network Pitch Evening and Networking drinks - The EMBA Den ! Join us for an exciting evening of innovative ideas at the London Business School - Sammy Ofer Centre . Get ready to hear 2 x pitches from talented entrepreneurs, connect with like-minded individuals, and be inspired by the entrepreneurial spirit. If you would like to receive the pitch decks ahead of the night please fill out a quick FCA investor eligibility declaration using the link below and we can share the decks with you by email. Click to request access to pitch decks On the night: Please aim to arrive at the SOC by 6.15 pm as we will start at 6.30 pm (and the entrance will be at the front of the lecture theatre ;) After a mercifully short introduction, you will hear 2 x pitches from start-ups who are running live equity raises. Each pitch will be followed by a Q&A. After some closing remarks, we will take a short walk to our wonderful partner - Home Grown, a private members club for entrepreneurs and professionals. Home Grown's address is 44 Great Cumberland Pl, London W1H 7BS Networking social will be in the Unicorn Room on the 1st Floor from 7.30 pm onwards. Your ticket price will include a welcome drink (hard, or soft) in the Unicorn Bar. Cocktails, mocktails and food are also available. Click to see the Home Grown menus and drinks lists . The bar is licenced until 1 am... so a great opportunity to catch up with long-lost classmates. We will also include a complimentary day pass to Home Grown for you and a guest to use on another day. If you do not wish to take us up on the drink, just hand back the token and we will donate your ticket price to LBS. Abstinence will be gratefully received The pitches will be recorded to enable review, analysis and feedback for the start-ups. If you can't make the in-person event, a live stream of the pitches will be available to reach a global Alumni audience, please select a Zoom-only ticket and we will share the joining instructions ahead of the event. What attendees have said... "Thank you for organizing a wonderful event! As I mentioned, I'm very interested in learning more about E100 and the process of becoming an angel investor." - Sasha "Really enjoyed your LBS EMBA Den event last night and follow-up at Home Grown. A fascinating blend of people. Looking forward to the next one. (I have checked and will be back by then)" - Martin "Thanks for organising the EMBA event last night. Two interesting pitches (and awesomely diverse) Networking drinks afterwards was also a joy. I had not intended to stay for long but kept getting into fascinating conversations with interesting people. If that's not a great endorsement, then I don't know what is." Nick "Thanks for the invite! I enjoyed the evening and engaged in several interesting and stimulating conversations. Let me know when the next one is." Geoff "I really enjoyed the event! Nice to see two very different businesses at their stages and some useful takeaways for our pitch!" - James
1008478766137.description: An evening of inspiring pitches and networking with alumni at our EMBA Den pitch evening, in collaboration with Home Grown
1008478766137.venue_name: London Business School - Sammy Ofer Centre
1008478766137.title: London Business School EMBA Den - Investor & Founder Network Pitch Night

1038827700617.summary: Pop down to your local People Planet Pint meetup to find more about what's going on locally with sustainability and how you can get involved. No pitches, powerpoints or panels. Just People, Planet, Pint/s. Your local meetup is a great place to start your journey or continue learning, and meet diverse people to chat about life and how we can sustain it. Every job is a climate job, so come along and learn about how you can take action, as well as what is going on locally. We welcome everyone, regardless of their experience or background. People Planet Pint is a space where everyone can feel comfortable learning about sustainability and sharing their ideas. Afterall, creating a sustainable future requires connected communities. And what better way to bring everyone together than over a drink? Your Volunteer Hosts Anne Barrett started Climate Confidence to help small business owners feel empowered about combating climate change. She uses the Small99 Action Box, Carbon Reduction Fundamentals to help business teams develop an action plan for carbon reductions. She is also a Fresk facilitator, running workshops to help with understanding the causes and effects of climate change, also with the outcome of a plan for reducing carbon emissions. Shes proud to live in the London Borough of Lewisham. Fiona Caldwell swapped a career in TV for a new life at WRAP, a global NGO working to reduce food, textile and plastic waste and promote circularity. Among other things, she helps plan their annual summit event bringing businesses, govt and campaigners together to build a low carbon future. Prior to that she spent 20 years crafting award-winning films for everyone from the BBC to Netflix and particularly enjoyed promoting a green agenda as producer of the Channel 4 series Grand Designs. Shes also a regular for The Conservation Volunteers and can often be found building dead hedges in patches of woodland in north London (although she is a committed south London resident!)

955311240637.summary: "I AM AN ARKTIVIST" is an innovative networking event for environmentalists, aimed at fostering environmental awareness and promoting a green lifestyle by connecting local residents, businesses, and organizations through creative and community-driven initiatives. Who Should Attend: Environmental Organizations : Showcase your services and impactful work. There are no fees to participate, and if you wish to donate towards our admin fee, it would help us reach out to corporations and businesses that will be invited to pick projects to support. Local Businesses : Learn about eco-friendly practices and discover how you can support existing environmental projects. Artists : Display eco-friendly artworks that promote messages of cutting waste and environmental preservation. Volunteers: Join us in raising awareness and supporting the event logistics. Community Members: Anyone passionate about the environment and interested in learning more about local environmental efforts and the I AM AN ARKTIVIST initiative. Benefits of Participating: Networking: Connect with like-minded individuals, organizations, and businesses committed to environmental sustainability. Exposure : Highlight your organization's work and services to a diverse audience, including potential supporters and collaborators. Education : Gain insights into innovative waste management practices and sustainability efforts within the community. Support : Help raise awareness about climate change and local environmental issues, contributing to a collective effort to create a greener future. Impact : Be part of a movement that fosters community cohesion, environmental education, and sustainable action. This event is supported by BD Giving through their Give It A Go funding award, selected from 55 proposals by a group of young residents, underscoring the significance and potential impact of this gathering. Calling all Local Organizations and Passionate Residents! Mark your calendars for November 30th and join us at Barking Learning Centre for "I Am An Arktivist" a unique event that brings together the community, creatives, and environmental advocates to take action for a greener future! At Laura I Art Gallery , we believe in the power of creativity for social change , and this event will be an inspiring showcase of art , performance , and collaboration aimed at protecting our planet. Heres what to expect: Incredible local talent art exhibitions featuring works made from upcycled materials. Powerful performances by poets, singers, and creatives inspiring environmental action. Presentations from environmental leaders sharing Barking and Dagenhams vision of becoming the Green Capital of the Capital. Meet Noah, our beloved planet mascot ! Young attendees will have the chance to meet Noah, share their stories about participating in litter-picking initiatives and other environmental efforts, and receive an Arktivist (Eco Warrior) badge as a token of recognition for their contributions. Opportunities to network with organizations and individuals making a real impact. This event is not just for organizations residents with a passion for the environment are invited too! Whether youre here to learn, connect, or take action, theres something for everyone. Save the date: November 30th, 11 AM - 3:30 PM Barking Learning Centre Lets come together, inspire each other, and build a more sustainable future. To Reserve Your Spot: Organizations: Please confirm your participation to secure a table for your display. Individuals : Book your ticket to join us at the event and learn more about the incredible work being done to preserve our environment, including our innovative project, Noahs Ark. We look forward to your participation and to making a significant impact together.
955311240637.description: Are you passionate about the environment? Would you like to join our innovative and creative network?
955311240637.event_address: Barking Learning Centre (Barking Library) 2 Town Square Barking Learning Centre, Barking IG11 7NB, Barking, IG11 7NB
955311240637.title: "I AM AN ARKTIVIST": Building Networks for Sustainable Change.

1012989768667.summary: Pop down to your local People Planet Pint meetup to find more about what's going on locally with sustainability and how you can get involved. No pitches, powerpoints or panels. Just People, Planet, Pint/s. Your local meetup is a great place to start your journey or continue learning, and meet diverse people to chat about life and how we can sustain it. Every job is a climate job, so come along and learn about how you can take action, as well as what is going on locally. We welcome everyone, regardless of their experience or background. People Planet Pint is a space where everyone can feel comfortable learning about sustainability and sharing their ideas. Afterall, creating a sustainable future requires connected communities. And what better way to bring everyone together than over a drink? Your Volunteer Hosts Chris has a background in Green Chemistry and has worked in the environmental consultancy and FMCG fields. Currently, Chris works as the Environmental Social Governance Manager for Chelsea FC where his role is to work across the business to develop and deliver the club's sustainability roadmap, embed ESG into the staff culture and communicate success. Chris is incredibly passionate about all things sustainability and has experience in Carbon footprint calculations, delivering emissions reductions, BCORP certification, offsetting, and setting Net Zero targets for a business. Chris is also certified Carbon Literate and hopes to talk ESG to individuals across a wide range of industries. Guy is a keen skier and avid reader that has recently made the leap over to a sustainability-focused organisation, Position Green. Guy has a background in sport and travel and kicked off his sustainability journey in the Green Steering Group at Chelsea Football Club. To help his transition to a green tech business, Guy studied with the Cambridge Institute for Sustainability Leadership, the GHG Protocol and GRI, and also signed up to become an IEMA Associate member.
1012989768667.description: Pop down to your local People Planet Pint meetup to find more about what's going on locally with sustainability and how you can get involved
1012989768667.title: London - Small99's People, Planet, Pint: Sustainability Meetup

1020589810597.summary: Join us for an exciting evening at the BioTech Networking Event in London, designed to bring together innovative biotech startups, forward-thinking investors, and leading industry professionals. This event is the perfect platform to foster collaboration, share ideas, and build valuable relationships in the thriving biotech sector. Why Attend? Expand Your Network: Meet a diverse array of biotech founders, investors, and professionals. Forge meaningful connections that can lead to collaborations, partnerships, or investment opportunities. Discover Cutting-Edge Innovations: Learn about the latest advancements in biotechnology from groundbreaking startups and experts. Investors will have the chance to connect with high-potential companies pushing the boundaries of biotech innovation. Pitch and Connect: Startups can informally pitch their ventures to interested investors, gaining feedback and exploring potential funding opportunities in a relaxed setting. Foster Growth: Be part of a dynamic and supportive community of biotech innovators. Discuss challenges, celebrate successes, and contribute to the advancement of biotechnology as a critical industry. Stay Ahead of Trends: Whether you're an investor looking for the next big breakthrough or a biotech professional seeking to keep up with industry trends, this event will provide valuable insights into the future of biotech. Relax and Network: Enjoy a casual and engaging evening in Londons vibrant biotech community. Meet new people, reconnect with industry contacts, and build lasting professional relationships. If you are a part of the biotech ecosystem or have a deep interest in biotechnology, this event is an excellent opportunity to connect with key players, exchange ideas, and build valuable relationships.Whether you are a biotech startup seeking investment, an investor looking for promising ventures, or a professional passionate about biotechnology, the BioTech Networking Event offers the ideal setting to connect, collaborate, and grow. Who Should Attend the BioTech Networking Event? Biotech Startups: Entrepreneurs and founders at the forefront of biotech innovation who are looking to connect with investors, potential partners, and industry professionals to share ideas and explore growth opportunities. Investors: Venture capitalists, angel investors, and institutional investors interested in discovering and funding cutting-edge biotech startups with high potential for growth and impact in the life sciences sector. Biotech Professionals: Scientists, researchers, and engineers who are involved in the biotechnology industry and want to stay ahead of trends, exchange ideas, and network with like-minded individuals. Healthcare and Pharma Executives: Professionals working in the healthcare, pharmaceutical, and life sciences industries who are eager to explore new biotech innovations and discover potential collaborations or partnerships. Industry Consultants and Advisors: Legal, regulatory, and business experts who provide advisory services to biotech companies, helping them navigate challenges and seize opportunities for growth and success. Academics and Researchers: Those involved in biotechnology research and development who want to connect with startups, investors, and industry professionals to share knowledge and explore opportunities for collaboration or commercialization. Biotech Enthusiasts: Anyone passionate about the biotech sector and its potential to revolutionize healthcare, agriculture, and other industries through scientific and technological innovation. Whether you are a biotech startup seeking investment, an investor looking for promising ventures, or a professional passionate about biotechnology, the BioTech Networking Event offers the ideal setting to connect, collaborate, and grow. Spaces are limited, so join us now to secure your spot and connect with leading innovators in the biotech industry!
1020589810597.description: London BioTech Connect: a night of networking with fellow BioTech startups, entrepreneurs, and professionals in London
1020589810597.title: BioTech Networking Event: Connecting Startups, Investors, and Professionals

1014608791207.summary: Homeless charity Oasis Community Housing launches its 'Giving a Home' appeal in London for the very first time. This informal networking event is kindly supported by Barings, in their Old Bailey venue, with pastries, teas and coffees available for all attendees. Start your working week by hearing inspiring stories from people who have experienced homelessness as well as easy to-do things that will make a life-changing difference this winter, including the charity's Big Give week (3 to 10 December) where all donations are doubled thanks to the Julia and Hans Rausing Trust. Whether it's wearing a Christmas jumper, joining us on social media or buying original artwork to support the homeless charity - and gain an investment - your support will offer a brighter future to the 1,300+ people Oasis Community Housing supports across the UK every year. At the event, chat to existing supporters like Barings Director Sara Stewart and Artist Crispin, creator of 'Savage Garden - Elon Musk' $2m painting on display. See his special 'Whispers of Hope' & 'Rewind NA' pieces that will be auctioned to raise funds for the Giving a Home Appeal. Homelessness seems to loom larger than all of us, but you can have a real part in turning the tide, with this year's Appeal set to make the most difference possible. In years to come you'll be able to say, 'I was one of the original 50 in 2024 at the very first London Launch of the Giving a Home Appeal'. Free event - just 50 places available, booking essential.
1014608791207.description: Today 317,000 people in the UK face homelessness. Join us and hear how you can make a big difference this winter.

989076202547.summary: Hello, We are Mia, Katy, Sarah and Jake, and we are Shamanic Collective. We have experienced first-hand the deep healing and powerful transformation that shamanic work can facilitate when we are open to receiving guidance and knowledge from the liminal, otherworldly realms and the depths of our own being. Having studied with various teachers and shamans from around the world, we are passionate about sharing these modalities with those who seek holistic and alternative ways of healing. If youre interested in exploring shamanic healing, please join us for an afternoon of nourishing and joyful healing in community at the Bonnington Community Centre in Southwest London. Our community healings offer an opportunity to receive healing on emotional, physical and spiritual levels, re-establishing harmony, sovereignty and power. If you wish, you may join the 'healing chorus' to support the process with instruments and intention. Each participant receives a one-to-one shamanic healing. No previous experience required, just an open mind and heart. We are part of a larger network of shamanic practitioners and we occasionally invite other practitioners to help us faciliate our community events. Please note, the room is on the third floor of the building and unfortunately there is no wheelchair access. If you have any questions or need futher information, please email collectiveshamanic@gmail.com. We look forward to meeting you. Shamanic Collective What our clients say: "Thank you all for an amazing afternoon! I attended not fully knowing what to expect as I have not been to many events like this before. The environment was very calm and welcoming, with a beautiful altar set up for us to place offerings on. The healing session was a calming yet empowering experience for me. I felt like I went into a deep state and could have quite happily stayed for hours! It was so lovely to sit afterwards and talk through the experience with Sarah one-to-one, and to gain some insights into myself. After the healing I felt very serene and uplifted, and at the same time had a feeling of childlike excitement that I haven't felt for some time. I would love to attend more events in the future and highly recommend to anyone who is seeking healing and guidance in a safe, comfortable space with experienced practitioners! Thank you all so much." - Martha
989076202547.description: Join a small group of shamanic practitioners for an afternoon of nourishing and joyful healing in community.
989076202547.title: Shamanic Community Healing

943331639327.summary: Business Buzz Harpenden networking sessions are an excellent way to mingle face-to-face with other local businesses in a free-flowing, fun atmosphere. Designed to work with your schedule, theres no such thing as late with this two-hour drop-in session. Turn up whenever you like before the event closes at 12 noon and stay for 5 minutes or the full two hours. With no membership and no strings attached, its never been easier to meet your local business community. For just 10+ VAT youll get refreshments, a brilliant new set of contacts and the warmest of welcomes. With new people every month and a huge buzz in the room youre sure to make some great connections; we believe the more you chat, the more business just happens. We meet every 4th Thursday of the month between 10 am and 12 pm at the same venue. While you can book on the day, we ask that you purchase your ticket before you set off on your journey. This makes it much easier to check you in and get you to the coffee as soon as possible! How it works When you come to a Buzz youll be welcomed by the Buzz team, shown where the coffee is and introduced to some of the other attendees. Were here if you need further introductions to more guests, but youll find that everyone is really friendly and you can easily move around conversations to network as you like. The focus is open networking and easy-going conversations so that more business happens between our attendees easily. At roughly 11 am there is a short announcement section and youll find out who is in the room to help facilitate more connections.
943331639327.description: Come join us at the Harpenden Business Buzz Networking event for some great connections and buzzing conversations!
943331639327.title: Harpenden Business Buzz Networking

1038824581287.summary: Pop down to your local People Planet Pint meetup to find more about what's going on locally with sustainability and how you can get involved. No pitches, powerpoints or panels. Just People, Planet, Pint/s. Your local meetup is a great place to start your journey or continue learning, and meet diverse people to chat about life and how we can sustain it. Every job is a climate job, so come along and learn about how you can take action, as well as what is going on locally. We welcome everyone, regardless of their experience or background. People Planet Pint is a space where everyone can feel comfortable learning about sustainability and sharing their ideas. Afterall, creating a sustainable future requires connected communities. And what better way to bring everyone together than over a drink? Your Volunteer Hosts Nick Brincat is a small business owner who uses his storytelling powers to do good for people and planet. Through the East Surrey PPP meet-ups, hes keen to enable more small businesses to network and collaborate; for sustainable outcomes and to support each other in a changing world. Heather Lynch is a transformative and climate coach who supports people to find more clarity, overcome feelings of overwhelm and limiting beliefs, build resilience in uncertain times and find more fulfilment in their lives. Heather is also part of the Reigate and Redhill Climate Action Group (CARR) and organises the yearly Great Big Green Week. She loves mindfulness and being in nature, either walking or swimming.
1038824581287.description: Pop down to your local People Planet Pint meetup to find more about what's going on locally with sustainability and how you can get involved
1038824581287.title: East Surrey - Small99's People, Planet, Pint: Sustainability Meetup

1041030990717.summary: Pop down to your local People Planet Pint meetup to find more about what's going on locally with sustainability and how you can get involved. No pitches, powerpoints or panels. Just People, Planet, Pint/s. Your local meetup is a great place to start your journey or continue learning, and meet diverse people to chat about life and how we can sustain it. Every job is a climate job, so come along and learn about how you can take action, as well as what is going on locally. We welcome everyone, regardless of their experience or background. People Planet Pint is a space where everyone can feel comfortable learning about sustainability and sharing their ideas. Afterall, creating a sustainable future requires connected communities. And what better way to bring everyone together than over a drink? Your Volunteer Hosts Stephanie Lambert has 20+ years in the private sector, largely in marketing consulting roles working with fast-moving consumer goods globally and in the UK. She's on the board of an environmental charity, served as founding member for a global sustainability industry coalition, and is currently pursuing her masters in business & sustainability at UCL. She's lived in St Albans for ten years and spends most of her spare time hanging out with her young family. Rondi Allan is a Co-founder and Director of Sustainable X , an award-winning UK sustainability consultancy. She has 20+ years experience working in global businesses in the private sector. She is a mentor at the ICRS and a Board Advisor at the Global Chamber of Commerce. A former Chartered Accountant, she is passionate about aligning business with sustainability goals and has a proven record of enabling businesses to thrive while making a positive impact. She has lived in St Albans for almost 20 years and when not taxiing her children, loves volunteering and being part of community activities. Matt Bourn leads communications for the Advertising Association which includes steering the UK advertising industrys work around Climate Action through the global initiative, Ad Net Zero. He is co-author of a new book called Sustainable Advertising which is published by Kogan Page in March 2024. He lives in St Albans, enjoys the city for everything it offers to family and friends, and wishes to see it quickly embrace all things sustainable for the many benefits that can bring.
1041030990717.description: Pop down to your local People Planet Pint meetup to find more about what's going on locally with sustainability and how you can get involved
1041030990717.title: St Albans - Small99's People, Planet, Pint: Sustainability Meetup

1041506894157.summary: Good Game Dev Club is a free monthly games industry meetup which takes place at Loading Bar in Dalston, London. The event is aimed at anyone who works in the games industry, or is trying to break in. Its open to anyone to make friends and help the community to be a good place to exist in. If you're developing a game and would like people to playtest, please feel free to bring along your laptop and you can setup in one of the booths. Each has a plug socket below the seat. SPEAKER - Carsten Kisslat Carsten is the co-founder of Robot Riot Games, a small but beautifully formed team of game industry veterans with decades of cross-platform game and software development experience. Robot Riot offers end-to-end game and software development services for mobile, desktop, console, and web platforms and have been actively developing and publishing free-to-play games since 2011. Carsten will be providing a deeply informative talk on cross-platform free-to-play development, delving deep into best practices and the many lessons he's learnt running his studio.
1041506894157.description: Work in the games industry? Or trying to break in? Come meet some good people, have some good drinks and play some games. Sound good?

717685636057.summary: A unique one-day immersive experience for recruitment leaders and future leaders serious about elevating themselves and their business. IF YOU AGREE THE WORLD NEEDS BETTER LEADERSHIP WITH LESS FLUFF AND MORE ACTION, THIS IS THE EVENT FOR YOU. Let's be clear: This is NOT your standard conference. In fact, it's not a conference at all. The Recruitment Leader Experience is an interactive day careful crafted to help leaders go beyond limits, put plans into action, reshape thinking, and be better influencers. Whether you're flying solo, leading a team, aiming for the top, steering your business' marketing and ops strategy, or doing something else remarkable in recruitment, this flagship event - now in its 8th year - will empower you with actionable takeaways, whilst reinforcing existing skills, exceeding hope and achieving glory. Step away from the daily rigours for just one day and work ON the business not IN it. Successful leaders are curious and seek fresh perspectives to enhance decision making. That's why this event is always packed with engaging debates, positive thinking, tangible solutions, unique insights, ideas that work, tips, tricks, shortcuts to success, and on-the-money commercial strategies! Mix with fellow business leaders at this immersive collab-style experience fuelled by bright minds. Hear from worldclass speakers and engage in the interactive learning sessions that suit you. At this event, you're in control! Looking to change the game? This event is for you. WARNING: This event is NOT for people content with standing still. Our interactive roundtable discussions, workshops and expert panel will provide solutions to challenges nearly all recruitment leaders face. And, naturally, we'll be sparking ideas and fuelling minds for game-changing results! WHAT YOU'LL TAKE FROM THE DAY (with lunch and networking soire included) KEYNOTE SPEAKER: Former RAF combat pilot and international speaker, Sarah Furness World class leaders who'll challenge perceptions and empower critical thinking Focus on what really matters, get stuff done, waste less time Breaking free from limiting beliefs and creating a success mindset Experts to help you improve efficiency, increase productivity and achieve goals Unique content to help you break silos and CHANGE YOUR GAME! Collaborative workshop-style that instantly solves challenges Unrivalled connections and conversations Persona l development topics covered: Leadership, mindset, resilience, peforming under pressure, embracing fear, creating a winning mentality. marginal gains Business development topics covered: Succession planing, customer relationships, accelerating sales, EVP, talent attraction, marketing, industry insights We'll also solve the challenges that keep 90% of recruiters awake at night, as well as identiing the ONE THING business leaders can't do without! Whatever the last event you atended was, I guarantee this one will be better! Janine Owen, Co-founder, The Talent Crowd Powerful learnings, lifelong connections. What more could you want from an event? Clare Wight, Managing Director, Clarity Appointments Simply awesome. Not to be missed. Gary Lincoln, Director, TMS Global Recruitment WARNING: This ievent isn't for wallflowers! O nly attend this event if you're curious and want to be a high performing leader. Rohan Shah, Co-founder, Reuben Sinclair LOOKING TO STOP OVER? Avoid the worry of racing to catch your last train home by booking into one of these recommended hotels within a one minute walk of the event venue. There's something to suit all tastes and budgets.
717685636057.description: A unique one-day immersive experience for recruitment leaders and future leaders serious about elevating themselves and their business.
717685636057.title: The Recruitment Leader Experience: HOPE + GLORY

He helps Tech & Service businesses optimize pricing to accelerate product growth. He is the founder and M.D of PriceMaker Ltd , a specialist pricing consultancy and has helped his clients create new pricing solutions that add significant bottom-line value (+20% average increase in net profits). Mark previously spent 25 years working in the corporate world for brands such as DHL and The AA and was business unit director for two business units where he grew profits by +250% over 5 years. 1041232162427.summary: Join us for our the first session of our reading group! Well be joined by Aya ubuku in reading Decolonising Anarchism by Maia Ranmath. For this session well be reading and discussing the introduction, first chapter and the last chapter on solidarity . For this session well be reading and discussing the introduction, first chapter and the last chapter on solidarity. You can find a free PDF online here . Decolonizing Anarchism facilitates more than a reinterpretation of the history of anticolonialism; it also supplies insight into the meaning of anarchism itself. The first session will be held on the 23RD OCTOBER at 7PM , at FFF Dalston, 81 Stoke Newington Road, N16 8AD . If you have any questions about accessibility, please get in touch ! Who Are We? FFF is a collective with a goal to provide an inclusive and accessible alternative to charity shops. 80-90% of clothes donated to charity shops are sold to countries in the Global South against their will. Fast fashion companies make it hard to find information on a wide scale. As an example, one market in Ghana receives 15 million garments a week, with 40% going directly to landfill (The Or Foundation). Join the sustainable fashion movement making swapping accessible beyond friends and family, online apps and events. Did you know 6 out of 10 Britons don't know how to sew on a button (British Heart Foundation) ! We're here to change that. We're coming soon to a high street near you ! Follow our journey on our Instagram , Tiktok or website .
1041232162427.description: Join us for our the first session of our reading group! Well be joined by Aya ubuku in reading Decolonising Anarchism by Maia Ranmath.
1041232162427.title: Reading group with Aya ubuku

1043044152137.summary: Are you angry about the injustice that you see in your community? Would you like the tools to be able to turn that anger into action? We are running a free ten session course for people of ALL AGES (0-100+) on how to make the change you want to see in your communities. Expect sessions on topics such as power, how to run good meetings and conflict resolution and lots and lots of good food. The Open Houses will be an opportunity to meet the team running the sessions, hear more about the training series and explore what dreams we have for our communities and how we can action them. Don't worry if you haven't thought of yourself as a changemaker before. You do not need any knowledge or experience to get involved, jsut come with an open mind and a willingness to get stuck in. We want this programme to be as accessible as possible and so if you would like us to pay for your travel to our building please message Betty at 07762124216 . We are also exploring offering a creche so that young children can be cared for whilst their parents and carers participate in the session. Accessibility The Liberation Centre is wheelchair accessible and we have accessible toilets. We have a quiet room where people can decompress, be in silence and/or pray. We will have food options for all dietary requirements (halal, kosher, gluten free, vegan). The programme is being delivered by: The Advocacy Academy - a youth organising movement, we train young people from South London in the skills needed to change the world around them. InCommon - a charity that creates opportunities for young people and elders to learn from each other and build connection.
1043044152137.description: Join us as we introduce our new programme 'How to Make Change'. Everyone welcome!
1043044152137.title: How to Make Change - Taster Session

756400362847.summary: The African entrepreneurial ecosystem is growing and flourishing internationally, and its been made possible through collaboration and partnerships between founders, investors, and entrepreneur support organizations. With the African entrepreneurial landscape developing both on the continent, in the U.K and in the wider international market, there is an incredible opportunity to kick-start a networking event that brings these parties together. This networking event is designed for African founders, investors, techpreneurs, innovators, culture-shifters, distruptors, technology experts, entrepreneur support organizations who work and focus on the African continent and the international market and are based in the U.K. Through live interactive sessions, attendees will get to connect with like-minded individuals, share their knowledge and insights as well as get access to resources to help them succeed. The event will feature speakers from different industries and sectors such as finance, healthcare, technology, travel, etc. who will provide valuable insight into their respective fields while fostering a sense of creativity amongst attendees. Additionally, representatives from UK government agencies will be invited to provide advice on how best to run a UK business and secure financing for international projects. In addition to connecting people already involved in the African entrepreneurial space this event is intended to serve as a gateway for new Africans entrepreneurs looking to join this vibrant community by offering mentorship opportunities with more experienced members of the network. As part of our efforts to foster successful relationships between partners in this ecosystem we plan on hosting similar events every quarter throughout 2023 with each event focusing on different topics related to entrepreneurship in Africa and the U.K. based on the book Investment Worthy Startup by Tomi Davies (TD) . We believe that such actions can bridge the gap between aspiring entrepreneurs in Africa and those living in the UK Diaspora by creating deeper connections among peers which can lead towards greater collaboration opportunities down the line. AGENDA 18:00- 19:00 II Doors open & socialize 19:00 - 20:30 II Pitch and Q&A with speaker 20:30 - Close II Networking Series Investor Panel: Harry Tomi Davies (TD) is Collaborator-in-Chief (CiC)' at TVC Labs , an entrepreneurship support organisation working with technology-enabled innovation in Lagos, Nigeria which he founded. TD is the founding President of the African Business Angel Network ( ABAN ) and board member of the Global Business Angel Network (GBAN). As an active stakeholder in the African startup ecosystem he values intellect, innovation, independence, collaboration and integrity in all our relationships TD believes that humans are using technology to build a better life for humankind and innovative African startup founders are using technology to build a better Africa. He also firmly believes that supporting innovative startups creates economic value and social impact and that innovation hubs and business angels are a critical local resource to founder and startup growth. He asserts that locally led international support accelerates the development of the African startup ecosystems. After graduating from the University of Miami in 1982, TD led innovative technology-enabled transformation initiatives for influential global brands such as Elf Aquitaine , Marks & Spencer , Ernst & Young and Sapient across Europe, the United States and Southeast Asia. In 2000, his focus shifted to Africa where he worked on various technology-led innovation initiatives in Nigeria, South Africa, Ghana and Kenya using his goal-oriented approach to project delivery which inspired his 2014 book The African Project Manager . In December 2021, TD was named as one of the 100 Most Influential Africans of 2021 by New African Magazine. TD is Chairman of Powerstove (Renewables) and Non-Executive Director at MBO Capital (Private Equity) and sits on the boards of Big Cabal Media (Media & Entertainment) and Laptops4Learning (L4L) Nigeria (Edutech NGO). He also Chairs the Innovation Committee of the Lagos State Science, Research and Innovation Council (LASRIC). As an angel investor with insights gained from a growing portfolio of tech-enabled startup ventures originating from Africa, his personal goal is to Find, Fund & Follow, African founders that are using technology-enabled innovation to create economic value and social impact on the continent that builds Africas future together. These founders are the inspiration and target of his 2023 book Investment Worthy Startup which lays out his POEM Framework as a tool for building tech-enabled startups on the continent and their investors. Previous Guest Series Panel: Andy Davis , Early Stage Investor, 10x10 Freda Isingoma , Fund Manager, Octopus Investments Tshidi Hagan , Chief of Staff Launch Africa Ventures Richard_ Cummins , , Angel Black Angel Group Yvonne Nagawa , , Chief of Staff Black Seed Vivek Ghiya , VC/PE Gerrad Olisa-Ashar , Angel Investor / Dipa - Diaspora Investment Partners Africa Olanike Jagun , Investor Laurencia Day- Knight , KOLD Solutions Don James , Berkshire Rooms / The ASAP - Association of Serviced Apartment Providers (ASAP) Tai Karun , Join a nation / KMN Digital Venkatesh Ramasamy , Portfolio Founder Soji Sanyaolu , Portfolio Founder / AirSmat Jeffrey Williams-Edem , BD / Layton Vivek Ghiya , Head of Investments | VC/PE / ASIL Partners LLP Jeremy Brown , VC I Principal / Anthemis Group Previous Funding Raising Pitches: Dare Odumade of Chekkit , on an impressive journey to engage 10 million consumers. Tobi Akinyemi of TwoShot , also on the journey of realizing a remarkable 1.8m in ARR. Yoma James of Vendoir , co-founding a fast-growing, award-winning app, currently closing on their 200k round. Chukwudi Anyiam-Osigwe of Safiyo , building the biggest AI-powered consumer research platform in emerging markets with over 40,000 respondents. Nicolas Dehandschoewercker of FueGo. , identifying a $1.8bn opportunity in AI for travel personalisation. Mimi Kon of Mimi et Mina , radically changing the luxury hair brand landscape for women of color. PARTNERS & SUPPORTERS Entrepreneurs Collective : A member community of founders, investors and start-up enthusiasts. We accelerate our members success globally. Dipa (Diaspora Investment Partners Africa) : A networking platform connecting private investors to entrepreneurs creating sustainable value and impact in Africa. Leyton : Helps thousands of businesses each year to simplify their access to complex financial incentives, innovative investments and maximise their financial benefit, with more than 900m in the past year alone. T VC Labs : An entrepreneur support organization providing strategic and operational support to innovative early-stage African tech-enabled ventures. TVC Labs Find, Fund, then Follow innovative African founders to build our future Together!

1014772400567.summary: Hello campers! Our next meetup will be at Wimbletech , an affordable co-working and private office space and network for locals and communities in 10 London locations. We're very grateful to them for hosting us! We're also thankful to our new event sponsor, Othership , a platform to work the Other way with flexible workspaces, weekly events, member benefits & a welcoming community. Please note that by signing up for this event on Eventbrite you agree to share your name and email address with Othership. Join us from 6pm in Wimbledon to learn more about freeCodeCamp , continue your coding study and meet new and familiar faces. Tell us what you're studying or working on and hopefully we can help each other! Light refreshments will be provided. Afterwards, we'll continue networking at one of the many bars near by. Just like the freeCodeCamp platform, attendance to this meetup is always free. The room has a capacity of around 20 people. Generally about half of people who sign up drop out, so there will be an attendee limit to 40. Please be aware that this may mean if you arrive much later than 6:00 pm we could be full so do cancel your ticket if you cannot make it. If you can't make it, stay connected with our Slack group here: https://tinyurl.com/y6ptcwdg Venue Accessibility There are a set of stairs to get to the space. Unfortunately, the lift to the space is only in use until 6pm from the Library entrance, and so will be out of use on the day. How to find us The venue is Wimbletech (behind the Wimbledon library) and is a 1 minute walk from Wimbledon station (20 mins on mainline train from Waterloo Station, District, Thameslink). Please take the entrance on Compton Road (Wimbletech Zone 2) and not the library entrance. COVID-19 Safety Measures Event will be indoors. Under current England COVID-19 guidelines, we're expecting everyone to self-test and avoid attendance if they've tested positive for COVID-19. The venue will have hand sanitizers. About Wimbletech If youre looking for an alternative to working home alone, from the coffee shop or even the commute, Wimbletech have Fixed, Flexi + private office spaces for individuals and teams starting from as little as 3/day. About Othership Work the Other way. This is the floworking revolution - for flexible workspaces, weekly events, member benefits & a welcoming community across London and UK, check out Othership and try for free. For more info about this meetup and event, read the FAQ here: https://github.com/freeCodeCampLondon/meetup-faq Bring your laptop if you have one. All coding levels are welcome.
1014772400567.description: Official freeCodeCamp meetup in London. Come and learn to code, work through the freeCodeCamp curriculum and meet other developers!

1034954786627.summary: This event is open to all Post-Graduate Students at UAL. However, c apacity is limited for this event. If you can no longer attend, please cancel your order to release a ticket to someone on the waitlist. Join us this Autumn to celebrate Halloween in a low-key, relaxing enviornment hosted by Halls Life x UAL's Post-Grad Community to celebrate this spooky time of year,. You can have a go at the embroidary workshop, attend a well-being sensory session or get stuck into zine making. What to expect: The Spiritual Stitching Post-Grad Interest Group will be hosting a Spooky emrboidary workshop . Explore themes around aura's and spirits whilsts threading some needles and channeling the art of sewing. We are very excited to announce the Sensory Spacemaking* run by the enigmatic Dionne in the Cinema Room. This will be an, explorative, restorative practice entwining art, embodiment and care through tools and techniques to encourage sensory spacemaking, offering softness in a hard world. (This part of the event has limited capacity so will be on a first come first served basis). We will also be hosting a Zine Making workshop hosted by UAL amaZINES , where you can learn the basics of how how to make Zine and explore themes around autumn, halloween and spookyness. So come down to this wholesome event and hear more about your Post-Grad Community platform, how to access opportunities to share your work, find opportunities, and connect with UALs wider creative network. Event meeting point Common room area within Archwood House is based on the first floor of the building past the reception, leading to a walkway outside and through another set of double doors where the common room is to the left. Students who are not living in the halls will need to sign in at reception and show a valid student ID card. Accessibility: There is step free access from the road to the common room with a ramp to gain access to the front entrance if required. All reception and common areas are on the ground floor. Gender neutral and accessibility toilets are on the ground floor next to the common area where the event is taking place. Post-Grad Community Established in 2013, Post-Grad Community is an inclusive platform for all UAL postgraduate students to share work, find opportunities and connect with other creatives within the UAL and beyond. Find out more . Important filming and photography notice: Please note that filming and photography may be taking place at this event. Both bigger crowds, smaller groups and individuals may be captured on camera. All imagery and footage may at some point be published on the College website, social media channels, and in print. This event is for UAL students only, a UAL ID card will be needed to enter the site and attend.
1034954786627.description: Mingle with fellow post-graduate students at this low-key halloween mixer over a Zine workshop, spooky stitching & sensory spacemaking.

1009130545627.summary: Join us for a series of ' netwalking ' sessions in The Queen ELizabeth Olympic Park , to help reduce social isolation, as well as improve health and wellbeing for us Mamas. Working in oartnership with Newham council and Good Thinking , this isn't simply a walk, but an overdue investment in yourself and an opportunity to meet other local Mums. It is a time to ditch the daily tasks and intentionally prioritise YOU. We welcome women from all walks of life and nationalities for this child-friendly walk followed by FREE light refreshments at the TIMBER LODGE cafe. Do not forget to tell a fellow mama. Why Walk? Walking has a multitude of benefits including burning calories, improving heart health, reducing blood sugar and helping mental health. Most importantly it's FREE! Our walks begin on 23.09.2024 for 10 weeks. Each session will last 120 mins including a refreshment stop and changing intervals. Our meeting point is the AQUATIC CENTRE, where there will be a short prelude before we set out on our walk. Please arrive promptly so we can all set off together. All participants must register so we can maintain COVID-19 safety standards and ensure you are kept up-to-date. Contact details of your walking facilitator for the day will be sent via email a few days prior to the event. In the event the weather is not quite right for walking with children in tow we will send you a Zoom link for us to meet virtually. We hope you will join us, as we continue to enjoy the outdoors and walk our way to building relationships and positive mental health. NB: To partake in our walks you must adhere to COVID-19 safety precautions as per government guidance. For more information email: info@mummysdayout.com
1009130545627.description: Net-walking and Free refreshments with other local parents.
1009130545627.event_address: London Aquatics Centre, London, London, E20 2AQ
1009130545627.title: MAMA MEET UP - STRATFORD OLYMPIC PARK

947445935297.summary: Effective Business Network offers structured, face-to-face networking without any pressure. It's a relaxed and informal setting Yet remains focused on business The success of our Group Members speaks for itself, proving our longstanding networking formula that drives results! Knowledge + Trust = Business Growth If you're new to networking, feeling uncertain, or experiencing nerves about attending, you're not alone. We are experts at welcoming networking beginners and guarantee a warm welcome for everyone. Our Group Directors will facilitate introductions, provide guidance on networking etiquette to enhance your networking skills, and will follow up with you to ensure you had an exceptional experience at our events. We know your time is valuable as a busy business owner, and we want to make networking as convenient as possible for you. Thats why our events are scheduled before your workday begins, ensuring that your networking efforts won't interfere with your business activities. Additionally, we understand how hectic your days can be, often leading to skipped meals. To support your well-being, all our events include a delicious and hearty breakfast to kickstart your day on a positive note. Join us to connect with like-minded professionals while enjoying a great meal! For those committed to networking, where relationships are formed and genuine introductions are made in a friendly, stress free environment, we invite you to try us out. Visiting ebn comes with no immediate obligation and non-members are able to benefit from attending three of our events before we invite you to join our community. We are excited to welcome you to one of our highly attended networking events across Essex! Visit https://ebnevent.eventbrite.com to explore all our locations and events. Membership in ebn is a valuable investment in your business and one of the most cost-effective methods to connect with like minded business owners within your local area. Please note the following professions are already represented by our members within this group. If you work within an area not listed below we would love to welcome you:- Charity Estate Agent Lead Generation HR Locksmith Mortgage Advisor Solicitor Telecommunications Hornchurch ebn Group is hosted by Group Director Louise Mundy HBBS Counselling louise.mundy@hbbscounselling.org To discuss ebn membership, please send an email to nadine@ebn.uk.com

Barnett from Accounts & Tax Made Easy, based in Cheshunt, my aim for this event is to provide a great environment to network with local businesses, encourage collaboration and building relationships. 775818452877.summary: Pop down to your local People Planet Pint meetup to find more about what's going on locally with sustainability and how you can get involved. No pitches, powerpoints or panels. Just People, Planet, Pint/s. Your local meetup is a great place to start your journey or continue learning, and meet diverse people to chat about life and how we can sustain it. Every job is a climate job, so come along and learn about how you can take action, as well as what is going on locally. We welcome everyone, regardless of their experience or background. People Planet Pint is a space where everyone can feel comfortable learning about sustainability and sharing their ideas. Afterall, creating a sustainable future requires connected communities. And what better way to bring everyone together than over a drink? Prefer a Pastry to a Pint? Head along to People Planet Pastry ! Equally relaxed and welcoming, they run during the day and offer an informal way to learn about what is going on locally in sustainability. Your Volunteer Hosts Elizabeth Corse is a local resident and working mum who runs a training company to help more people understand and feel confident when Climate Change comes up. As a climate communicator, she helps kickstarts climate conversations in workplaces without the need for a sustainability expert. With a background in tech and sustainability, Elizabeth has spent almost a decade working with businesses who are either developing tech and nature-based solutions or those businesses looking to use technology to help them reduce their impacts on people and planet. When she isn't rushing around looking after her 2 football-loving young boys, she volunteers as an Enterprise Advisor for the Holt School. Anna Watson is a Wokingham mum and Sustainability Manager at a professional training company. Venue - The Rose Inn We'll be in the Parlour which is tucked on the right hand side of the pub.
775818452877.description: Pop down to your local People Planet Pint meetup to find more about what's going on locally with sustainability and how you can get involved
775818452877.title: Wokingham - Small99's People, Planet, Pint: Sustainability Meetup

827130628977.summary: If you want to be successful, you need to spend time networking . So take that first step and join us for breakfast with other like-minded individuals and companies, who want to build worthwhile and profitable relationships right in the heart of Horsham District. On the 1st Wednesday of every month, business owners and business leaders from a diverse range of sectors and sizes, meet for breakfast at the Roffey Park Institute, all looking to build connections and grow their network Our networking events are at the heart of what we do. Simply put, it is a structured meeting that creates relationships to grow business and a support network that enables connections to be made. All in a super friendly and welcoming environment, so come visit and see for yourself What is included? A well-structured 1.5-hour breakfast meeting, finishing before the work day starts Our breakfast buffet includes a full selection of hot and cold items alongside a selection of drinks such as tea, coffee and fruit juices A carefully organised 20-point agenda A 3-minute education slot to help members make better use of their membership 60-second pitch slots to talk about your business and highlight what youre looking for. Ample opportunity for open networking, to build relationships and organise 1-2-1s An 8-minute spotlight presentation by a local business about themselves and their business so we get to know them better. Of course, its not all about the breakfast (though who doesnt love a good full English to start the day). The fact that the meeting happens every month, with each and every attendee committed to attending, enables you to get to know each other, both personally and professionally. Remember, it's not what you know it's who you know Please note that only one business category can attend at a time so if someone is attending already with the same business type, you will be contacted to reschedule your visit. To avoid not being refunded your Eventbrite fees, it is recommended to message us prior to booking to confirm that your business type is not already represented.
827130628977.description: Are you ready to grow your business, expand your network and increase your sales? Join us to see the true power of networking
827130628977.title: Horsham Breakfast Networking Meeting

1042876942007.summary: Join The Network , a dynamic networking event designed to boost your business growth. Experience a friendly and relaxed environment, where connections flourish without forced selling. Present your business in a 60-second slot and seize the opportunity to expand your potential contacts. Our weekly meetings, every Thursday from 7am to 8:30am at the Wycombe Heights Golf Centre, offer valuable referrals, support, and knowledge sharing. Be part of a trusted network that understands the power of word-of-mouth recommendations. As a special offer, your first two meetings are free and include a delicious breakfast with tea and coffee. Don't miss this chance to elevate your business! Meeting Format 7:00 7:15 Coffee or tea and member to member informal chat 7:15 7:18 Chairman's Welcome, followed by: Two minute education slot given by a different member each week to help you and your business. 7:18 7:50 One minute introduction to each member's business, including your own and how the group can help bring new business to you 7:40 Breakfast served whilst One minute introductions continue 7:50 8:00 Recharge tea or coffee cups and informal chat with fellow members 8:00 8:12 Ten minute presentation from one business in more depth, followed by questions 8:12 8:25 Positive Contributions including the exchange of referrals generated during the past week 8:25 8:30 Statistical Update and AOB An update on where the group is in relation to annual targets, a review of the previous week's referrals and any other matters relating to the group 8:30 Meeting formally ends - members may remain to chat informally with each other
1042876942007.description: We build your business by building relationships in a friendly, supportive environment and harnessing the strength of Word of Mouth
1042876942007.title: The Network - Weekly Breakfast Networking Meeting

1037169310327.summary: Welcome to Let's Connect MK (Let's Meet MK) Marcos at the Holiday Inn in central Milton Keynes was once the home of one of the biggest networking events in MK, with between 100 and 150 businesses taking part every month. Now, in a new collaboration, networking is coming back to the venue with a brand-new event for Milton Keynes: Lets Meet MK. This collaboration is supported by The Point Radio and Connection Communications. Headline Sponsor Plumbing and Gas Solutions Sponsors Holiday Inn & Marcos New York Italian Lets Meet MK aims to create a vibrant space where local business owners can share ideas, forge partnerships, and expand their networks. Opportunities to showcase local businesses: Meet potential clients and collaborators. Engaging talks and workshops: Learn from experienced business leaders and experts. A supportive community environment: Be part of a network that encourages growth and innovation. The Point Radio CEO, Darren Dorrington, shared his enthusiasm, saying : "When I launched MKFM's The Meet of MK in 2016, I had no idea that our small event would turn into one of Milton Keynes' most successful monthly events. During the last few months, we have been planning how to further improve the networking scene and have a number of exciting plans to put into action over the coming months." Nicholas Mann commented, saying , Milton Keynes is the home of networking, yet since the pandemic, there have been fewer events, especially after work. We hope that this event will reinvigorate MKs networking scene, creating a friendly, informal, and fertile environment for businesspeople to grow their enterprises. Dates for 2024: Wednesday, 6th November Wednesday, 4th December Provisional Dates for 2025 Thursday 6th Febuary Thursday 6th March Each event starts at 5pm, with a buffet being served from 6.30pm. Address: Marcos New York Italian at Holiday Inn, 500 Saxon Gate West, Milton Keynes MK9 2HQ. Why Attend Lets Meet MK? Connect with Local Business Leaders: Engage directly with decision-makers and industry influencers. Build Your Brand: Gain visibility and recognition for your business in the Milton Keynes community. Access Exclusive Resources and Insights: Stay ahead of industry trends with expert-led discussions and workshops. Lets Meet MK is more than just a networking event; its a community-driven initiative designed to elevate local businesses and support Milton Keynes thriving entrepreneurial spirit. Whether youre a small business owner, a freelancer, or a business leader, this event is tailored to help you connect, grow, and succeed.
1037169310327.description: Networking is back at Marcos Holiday Inn Central Milton Keynes with former MKFM CEO, Darren Dorrington and Nicholas Mann, MD of Connection
1037169310327.title: Let's Meet MK (Let's Connect MK)

1041173145907.summary: The Reading Marketing Meetup is an informal, friendly place for the marketers of Reading to meet, learn, and share knowledge with one another. Come in 'listen' not 'sell' mode We're back at the awesome Dog House offices in Friar St for this one We just want to get together, say hello, have a chat, and have a nice time. Think of this as a community event, where the focus is very much on you meeting other people in a chilled out, friendly space. The format of this one will be a little different to others, and will have more of a festive theme! Instead of the usual expert talk, we'll dive into an interactive discussion about collaborations and partnerships, what these look like, when do you know if it's the right fit, and how could finding the right out can help your business grow. In partnership with Dave Plunkett of Collaboration Junkie Bring a festive prop* of choice and join us for some collaborative networking, connections, and learning amongst friends. *Festive prop - such as a burble, glases, headband, piece of jewellery, or a Christmas jumper! Lets have a lovely night in the company of some amazin people. -------------------- The format of the night: 6.00 PM - Doors open - drinks, networking, and smiles 6.30 PM - Introduction & guided group discussion begin 7.15 PM - networking, listening, saying hello, and positively lovely people - a nice chilled out time... with mince pies 8:00 PM - End of the night - you leave with new contacts and fresh ideas -------------------- Supported by Doghouse, a workspace for business owners and curious minds alike. Check them out at https://www.tcnuk.co.uk/dog-house Supported by Force4Events, helping you find joy in marketing your next event or launch. Find out more at https://force4events.co.uk/ Supported by David Perry Media, helping content creators on tight budgets to use video more effectively. Check out www.davidperrymedia.com Supported by Mike Green Photography, specialist in people, product and work environment photography for websites, brochures catalogues and other marketing applications. See the portfolio at https://www.mikegreenphotography.com/ Supported by Oh My Nosh!, offering Private Dining, Corporate, Weddings and Events. Where there's a whisk, there's a way! Check them out at ohmynoshcatering.com -------------------- And finally... This is a donation ticketed event. The ticket price is yours to choose, from 3 to 30 (the average attendee chooses to pay 8.79 :) We of course understand that these are tough times, so if you are experiencing financial hardship and cannot afford the minimum donation amount, please reach out to el@themarketingmeetup.com and well find a ticket for you (provided capacity hasn't already been reached!) Please let your marketing friends and colleagues know about this group too, we hope to build it into a great resource for the community over the coming months and years. Attendance will be taken at this event. If you sign up but dont show up, this has a knock on effect on event arrangements. If it happens 3 times, youre outta here! This is simply a measure to allow appropriate respect to the organisers, speakers, sponsors, and your fellow community members -------------------- See you there!
1041173145907.description: The Reading Marketing Meetup is an informal friendly place to meet, learn, and share knowledge with one another. Come in 'listen' mode :)
1041173145907.title: The Marketing Meetup IRL: Reading

941925433327.summary: Business Buzz Thame networking sessions are an excellent way to mingle face-to-face with other local businesses in a free-flowing, fun atmosphere. Designed to work with your schedule, theres no such thing as late with this two-hour drop-in session. Turn up whenever you like before the event closes at 12 noon and stay for 5 minutes or the full two hours. With no membership and no strings attached, its never been easier to meet your local business community. For just 10+ VAT youll get refreshments, a brilliant new set of contacts and the warmest of welcomes. With new people every month and a huge buzz in the room youre sure to make some great connections; we believe the more you chat, the more business just happens. We meet every 1st Thursday of the month between 10 am and 12 pm at the same venue. While you can book on the day, we ask that you purchase your ticket before you set off on your journey. This makes it much easier to check you in and get you to the coffee as soon as possible! How it works When you come to a Buzz youll be welcomed by the Buzz team, shown where the coffee is and introduced to some of the other attendees. Were here if you need further introductions to more guests, but youll find that everyone is really friendly and you can easily move around conversations to network as you like. The focus is open networking and easy-going conversations so that more business happens between our attendees easily. At roughly 11 am there is a short announcement section and youll find out who is in the room to help facilitate more connections.
