1036838440687.summary: We are delighted to extend an invitation for your participation in the third global RECLAIM Network Plus Conference at the University of Surrey on Thursday, January 30, 2025, from 10:00 am to 4:00 pm (GMT). This event offers a unique opportunity to share best practices around blue, green and grey infrastructures with city officials, business and industry professionals, NGOs, and academics who share a passion for fostering greener, more resilient, and prosperous communities. Funded by a 1.45m EPSRC/NERC/AHRC grant, RECLAIM (Reclaiming Forgotten Cities Turning cities from vulnerable spaces to healthy spaces for people) is led by the University of Surrey's Global Centre for Clean Air Research (GCARE), in collaboration with the UK Centre for Ecology & Hydrology, Universities of Bath, Bangor and Warwick. The RECLAIM Network Plus serves as a comprehensive resource for towns and cities seeking information and support to implement green and blue infrastructure in their communities. It also facilitates connections with others sharing similar experiences. Complete instructions and additional information about the day will be provided to all registered participants before the event. If you encounter any registration issues or have enquiries about the conference, feel free to reach out to events@surrey.ac.uk. Please also note, photography and videography will be taking place during the event. The images and videos captured may be used for promotional purposes, including social media, websites, and other marketing materials. If you do not wish to be photographed, please email events@surrey.ac.uk. For more info & for updates on our featured speakers for the Conference please visit our RECLAIM Linked In https://www.linkedin.com/company/92448049/admin/feed/posts/ & Twitter https://twitter.com/reclaim_network
1036838440687.description: Celebrating Success, Connecting for the Future
1036838440687.title: RECLAIM Network Conference 2025

1009217616057.summary: Welcome to The Neuro Spicy Entrepreneur Club! We are a vibrant community founded by Jemima Willcox of The Willcox Collective, dedicated to creating a safe and supportive space for neuro-diverse entrepreneurs and business professionals. Our mission is to connect, empower, and celebrate the unique talents and perspectives that neurodiversity brings to the business world. Check out the FAQs for more specific information. Event Details: The Alternative Christmas Party & NSEC Birthday Date: 26th November 2024 Time: 18:30 - 21:00 Location: Together Culture, 5 Fitzroy Street, Cambridge, CB1 1ER Recommended Donation: 5.00 - Pay what you can to support our mission! Accommodations: We strive to make our events accessible to everyone. Please contact us with any specific accommodations you require. What to expect: This event is designed to be a fun and engaging business networking and social gathering to celebrate 1 year of NSEC. There will be a range of interactive activities and networking opportunities including: A Fun, Interactive Quiz: Dive into our specially curated team quiz that shines a spotlight on neurodivergent trivia. This engaging activity will test your knowledge and provide fascinating insights into the world of neurodiversity. Not only is it a great way to learn more, but you'll also have the chance to win an exciting selection of prizes. It's a perfect opportunity for expanding your understanding of neurodivergent topics. Christmas Craft Corner: Immerse yourself in creativity at our Christmas Craft Corner, which is thoughtfully designed with sensory-friendly materials. This activity encourages you to freely express your Christmas creativity and engage in a spot of festive craft-making. Agenda: 18:30 - Welcome and Registration 19:00 - 1 year of NSEC - Update by founder Jemima Willcox 19:15 - Social networking, Interactive Quiz & Craft Corner 21:00 - Event Concludes Venue Facilities and Access Please note whilst there is step-free access to the venue's ground floor space, the toilet is on the first floor and is only accessible by stairs. Accessible toilets are, however, available in the Grafton Centre (a short walking distance away from Together Culture Fitzroy). They are accessible with a Radar key. Transport & Directions You can get specific directions from your location from under the map by selecting your preferred mode of transport, but the information below may be of help. The closest car park is The Grafton West Car Park- free parking after 6pm Bus links would be the Citi 1, 3 and 8. Guided bus stops close. The main bus station is 5-10 minutes walk. Bike parking outside the building Sponsors: We are grateful for the support of our sponsors: The Willcox Collective , XW3D , and Together Culture . Join the Movement: Ready to expand your network and meet fellow neuro-diverse professionals? Register now to secure your spot at our next event! Not sure this is for you? We welcome all those who are curious and open minded and won't turn anyone away. So come join us and experience a fantastic, welcoming and inclusive community. Contact Us: For more information, or if you have questions, please reach out to us via WhatsApp here , email: hello@thewillcoxcollective.com, or call 01223 560 162. Stay Connected: Don't miss out on future NSEC events and updates from The Neuro Spicy Entrepreneur Club! Join our community
1009217616057.description: Join us for a Neurospicy Networking & Social and help celebrate the end of the year and one year of NSEC!

912019975297.summary: BRAND NEW EVENT* Quiz dating is a unique concept of dating and it's exclusive to Original Dating. We've taken the classic speed dating format and combined it with the humble pub quiz to make it one of the most fun and innovative ways to meet people. We divide the group into teams of guys and teams of girls. The female teams compete in the quiz whilst the teams of guys rotate around the room after each round of questions, helping each team of girls as they go. All the girls get to meet all the guys and you get to use our unique online matching and messaging system after the event to message the people you matched with on the night. There are token prizes for the winning team and because it's a group-dating format there's less pressure than with one-on-one speed dating. Book now, we're sure to sell out!
912019975297.description: You'll meet up to 20 people in one night at this very cool venue. If you don't meet someone you want to see again, your next event is free!

773655613767.summary: Prepare to be blown away by the most sought-after and AWARD WINNING networking group of the year: the SiGNAL BiZHUB. As proud winners of the silver UK SME Awards for Best Networking Group, we invite you to experience our unrivalled events at our brand-new venue, the prestigious Blackmoor Golf Club Bar and Restaurant. Our monthly gatherings are tailor-made for ambitious business owners who want to leverage quality time with the right people in the perfect setting. We make it a priority to gather our wonderful business community together once a month because we believe who you mingle with truly matters! What better way to mingle than to connect with local go-getters, both aspiring and established , over a delicious continental breakfast. Unlimited free tea and coffee is provided with breakfast and if you fancy a speciality barista coffee, they are also available to purchase from the bar. In terms of business content, prepare for captivating talks, insider business tips and updates on town centre regeneration, all presented with a dash of entertainment. We start and finish with good old-fashioned networking (often with a twist!) where our hosts will be on hand to make sure you meet the people you want. Then the focus of the meeting is business keynotes two of just 10 minutes each - interspersed with plenty of audience interaction. The room is laid out with tables for breakfasting and group discussion and there should be plenty of opportunity for you to talk to everyone in the room. In addition, to make collaborating a breeze, we provide you with a comprehensive email contact list of all attendees. Saves you handing out cards! Our paid membership group is 90 plus strong and our average event attendance in 2023 was 36 business owners. Our best attended event was 43 and the lowest was 23. SiGNAL events are all about forging new friendships, helping others, building your reputation, and clinching game-changing deals! We love networking (done right!) and our goal is to make sure all our events are fun to attend and packed with value and opportunity. Join us to experience business events that combine business brilliance, picturesque views, and unforgettable connections. Don't miss out on this opportunity to make 2024 your best year yet!
773655613767.description: Hampshire's Award Winning & Fastest Growing Business Networking Community
773655613767.title: SiGNAL Business Networking: December

1023612682087.summary: Christmas at The Barrow Club in aid of St Wilfrids Hospice Venue: Prince Albert 2 at The Grand Hotel, 97-99 Kings Road, Brighton, BN1 2FW Event Starts : 2pm E nding at: 4:30pm Format: Drinks and twocourse finger buffet reception Dress code: Business casual or why not go all out with the festive cheer and get thatChristmas jumper out! Special note: 5 from every ticket sale will go to support the expert care and work of St Wilfrids Hospice Join the VIP Table Hosts and catch up with our nearest and dearest Barrow Club members for an afternoon of festive cheer as we present The Barrow Club: Remixed for Christmas. As the last event of 2024, Christmas at The Barrow Club is a chance to reflect upon the year and new relationships. Join us for networkingand a delicious buffet with festive treats- accompanied by a welcome glass of bubbles and a glass of wine, beer or non-alcoholic alternative. During this time of giving, we will be donating 5 from each ticket sold to St Wilfrids Hospice, a West Sussex-based charity whoprovide compassionate and specialist end of life care for patients, alongside help and advice for their families. There will be a charity raffle with some fabulous prizes up for grabs, tickets will be available to purchase throughout the event. (if you also wish to donate a prize please contact vips@barrowclub.com) Please join us in supporting Christine Gillot , Philanthropy Manager of St Wilfrids Hospice , and her team. Tickets are available now and limited - as always! P lease note that tickets are non-transferable and non-refundable. O ur VIPs: Rebecca Blott - Castle Garden Rooms , a construction industry professional and owner of Castle Garden Rooms. Rebecca is passionate about delivering high-quality, service-led solutions for clients and to raising standards across the industry. David Pegler - Brighton Capital Management, provides a truly bespoke wealth management and financial planning services to private individuals, families and institutional clients in Brighton and the south of England. Chris Mansfield - Fusion (The Business Catalyst) , who works daily for retained clients to connect them with the right people to ensure their businesses are successful and profitable. Chris is well known for generating good quality, vetted business leads from his 20 years of networking in Sussex, London and the South East in general. Paul Britton - Britton and Time Solicitors - Paul has been seen on Good Morning Britain , Piers Morgan Uncensored, TalkTV's James Max and Trisha Goddard shows as well as being featured in This is Money, People Management Magazine , The Sun's Fabulous , Attitude 101, Times Radio and many more. He is the Managing Director and a Solicitor Advocate at his firm based in prestigious Mayfair London and Brighton and focuses on a number of legal areas. Paul is also a leading solicitor in the LGBT+ community. His other achievements include founding LGBT Lawyers, a legal matchmaking service as well as The Barrow Club, Brighton and London's most exclusive networking event. Matthew Cox - Charles Cox Property , Matthew is the founder and owner of Charles Cox Property Group. Matthew and his team pride themselves on their knowledge of the property industry. They are experts in Leasehold Property and property where a service charge is due, this is a key part of their service. They provide a professional lettings service to landlords in Eastbourne, Brighton and Hove, and currently have attractive apartments to let. O ur Christmas Charity Partner: St Wilfrids Hospice - St Wilfrids Hospice are an independent charity that has been supporting and advocating for people living with terminal illnesses since 1987. We provide compassionate and specialist end of life care for patients, alongside help and advice for their families. As the only end of life care specialists in our region, we are committed to ensuring that all of our patients are comfortable and able to manage their pain. We want them to live each day as best they can with their final wishes made possible, and for the memories their loved ones carry of this difficult time to be filled with joy and peace. Since first opening, St Wilfrids has cared for over 22,000 local people and their loved ones, with 325 patients being looked after at any one time - either on the ward or out in the community. The Hospice covers a broad catchment area, supporting a diverse population of 190,000 in West Sussex. Along from Emsworth in Hampshire to Arundel and South of the Downs to the Selsey Coast, we receive around 1,000 referrals from this area each year. All patients are offered holistic care through a range of services, including; an 18-bed ward, Living Well Centre, Community Hospice Team, and our Family Services Team.

1038789225537.summary: Welcome to Let's Connect MK (Let's Meet MK) Marcos at the Holiday Inn in central Milton Keynes was once the home of one of the biggest networking events in MK, with between 100 and 150 businesses taking part every month. Now, in a new collaboration, networking is coming back to the venue with a brand-new event for Milton Keynes: Lets Meet MK. This collaboration is supported by The Point Radio and Connection Communications. Headline Sponsor Plumbing and Gas Solutions Sponsors Holiday Inn & Marcos New York Italian Lets Connect MK aims to create a vibrant space where local business owners can share ideas, forge partnerships, and expand their networks. Opportunities to showcase local businesses: Meet potential clients and collaborators. Engaging talks and workshops: Learn from experienced business leaders and experts. A supportive community environment: Be part of a network that encourages growth and innovation. The Point Radio CEO, Darren Dorrington, shared his enthusiasm, saying : "When I launched MKFM's The Meet of MK in 2016, I had no idea that our small event would turn into one of Milton Keynes' most successful monthly events. During the last few months, we have been planning how to further improve the networking scene and have a number of exciting plans to put into action over the coming months." Nicholas Mann commented, saying , Milton Keynes is the home of networking, yet since the pandemic, there have been fewer events, especially after work. We hope that this event will reinvigorate MKs networking scene, creating a friendly, informal, and fertile environment for businesspeople to grow their enterprises. Dates for 2024: Wednesday, 6th November Wednesday, 4th December Provisional Dates for 2025 Thursday 6th Febuary Thursday 6th March Each event starts at 5pm, with a buffet being served from 6.30pm. Address: Marcos New York Italian at Holiday Inn, 500 Saxon Gate West, Milton Keynes MK9 2HQ. Why Attend Lets Connect MK? Connect with Local Business Leaders: Engage directly with decision-makers and industry influencers. Build Your Brand: Gain visibility and recognition for your business in the Milton Keynes community. Access Exclusive Resources and Insights: Stay ahead of industry trends with expert-led discussions and workshops. Lets Connect MK is more than just a networking event; its a community-driven initiative designed to elevate local businesses and support Milton Keynes thriving entrepreneurial spirit. Whether youre a small business owner, a freelancer, or a business leader, this event is tailored to help you connect, grow, and succeed.

1023457277267.summary: REPLENISH We gather each month in Circle to share in a supportive non-judgemental community. We come together to give ourselves time, space and nourishment to express what needs to be expressed in a brave space. Sitting shoulder to shoulder with other women. Providing a confidential, nurturing space for women to gather together in community to learn from each other, share together and uplift each other. Each month we will enjoy a different well-being practise together covering areas like seated yoga and gentle movement, meditation, Ayurveda, mindfulness, breathwork, reflection, journaling, yoga nidra and more. Gentle, tender ways to rejuvenate our bodies and nervous systems, allowing us all to tap into simple yet potent practises to bring deep calm, confidence and intuition into our work, personal life and play. Well gather around the fire (candlelight) to talk and share, creating a sense of connection and belonging. "when I booked, I really didn't know what to expect. So glad I came along as I had a really nice evening and along with yourself, met some really lovely women. I will defininetly be at the next one ... the tongue scraping has got me intrigued! It was such an informative evening but done in such a calm and relaxed manner." Practicalities What to bring? Yourself, just as you are (and a notebook and pen). Refreshments - there will be a selection of drinks for us to prepare for ourselves. 10% discount! - anyone coming along to Circle is entitled to 10% discount at Harriet's of Hove on the evening of the event - so make sure to allow a little extra time for shopping! Location - Harriet's of Hove is in George Street, Hove. Our meeting will take place in the beautiful first floor event space, where we can access drinks and bathroom facilities. Please note that at this time there is no disabled access to the first floor space. What brings me here? Honestly, its a kind of pull, a kind of knowing that this is the work I need to be doing right now. I am very used to leading large groups of yoga, teaching workshops and intimate one-to-one work with Coaching clients and those interested in yoga, meditation and Ayurveda. However this is very different. I am not the leader of these Circles, I am merely the facilitator and we create the sessions within our growing community together. Upcoming dates: 14 November 2024 Festive Circle for December is in the planning stages! Unsure if this is for you or maybe you have questions? Just email me - adriennesay@icloud.com https://www.adriennesay.com/workshops

1005180179977.summary: The RSA Fellowship is spread across the world, with two-thirds of UK Fellows living outside London. The programme, RSA Connect, aims to enhance connections and the sense of belonging across our Fellowship. From February 2024, we will be hosting a series of Fellow meet and greets across our regions and nations, with the opportunity to meet with members of the RSA senior leadership team informally. Join Director of Fellowship, Line Kristensen and Chief Operating Officer, Sascha Taylor, with other RSA Fellows. This is an informal chance to meet and chat. It will be held at Mill Road Community Centre, from 12:00pm GMT. For further information or if you have queries, please contact your local Area Manager Callum Bate at networks@rsa.org.uk. 1039373964507.summary: ABOUT THE WALK This is a lovely walk, with lots of little bridges to cross (see if you can count how many!). We have actually not walked this trail since 2020, so it has recently been re-assessed. Thanks to Amanda for re-introducing this lovely little trail. We will confirm breakfast details a bit nearer the time. ROUND-ROBIN QUESTION: Do you have any allergies? Please arrive by 6.15 am we will set off at 6.30 am sharp. If this is your first AG walk, then please arrive nice and early and seek out the walk leader who will be wearing a red "walk leader" pin badge. WHAT3WORDS: https://what3words.com/lectures.masses.smirks Click the link above, then click "Navigate using Google Maps" . We often meet in places where there is no postcode, so we encourage you to use the What3Words app which will take you to the exact location. WALK LEADER(S): Amanda Johnson IS THIS WALK DOG FRIENDLY? Yes BREAKFAST? We often stop for breakfast after a morning miracle walk. The menu will be sent to you via email on the Wednesday before the event for pre-orders. WHAT TO BRING WITH YOU Good trainers or walking shoes (and other clothes of course!). Please bring a torch (no head torches please as they blind people), and bright clothing )for safety on the roads in the dark mornings) Bring rain gear if the weather is looking wet! A drink. RULES TO KEEP YOU SAFE : We walk in all weathers, however, if we have a weather warning then the event may be cancelled. Keep an eye on your emails and the Facebook event page for notifications of any cancellations. We will only ever walk in groups of 15 or less. If we have more than 15, we will usually have two walk leaders and walk in opposite directions.
1039373964507.description: This is a picturesque walk through the fabulous parks of Buckingham, taking in a section of the heritage trail.

1039881793437.summary: Gathering in circle to speak and to listen is an ancient tradition, one that we dont often practice in our modern lives. It is a very simple practice and a very powerful one. It is as much about deep listening as it is voicing what needs to be said. It is a place that is open to imperfection and vulnerability, to have your whole self be welcomed and held. The circle will be held for 1.5 hours. We will start with a short meditation, to set the tone for the space we create together. There will then be a reminder of the guidelines which help us to hold that space respectfully. We start with a short share, responding to a question, running around the circle in turn, to help familiarise ourselves with speaking in the circle. And then the space is open for what needs to be given voice. We will finish with another short share and a closing of the circle. To maintain the integrity of the circle we use guidelines that help us to be gentle with everyones vulnerability: the circle is confidential, nothing that is shared in the circle leaves the circle; we speak from our experience, from our personal story; we dont offer advice, or respond to what others have shared; silence is as welcome as sharing. This space is being offered for women and minority genders. Consessions available at 50% discount for students, NHS, low and no income etc. Please contact me for the discount code. The circle will be held in the cabin at Barracks Lane Community Garden. The cabin and the facilities there are fully accessible for those with mobility needs. Generally we will be seated on the floor, but if this is not possible for you chairs will be available. On street parking is available near the venue. I hope that you will join us. Bethan Axford trained as circle facilitator with Sister Stories in 2021. A architect and artist, holding circle is a beautiful compliment to her other practices, all focussed around creating grounding and nurturing spaces, objects and stories. To her, circle is the purest version of this.
1039881793437.description: Come join in the practice of circle, co-creating a space for sharing what you need to give voice to.
1039881793437.event_address: Barracks Lane, off Cumberland Road, OX4 2AP
1039881793437.title: Oxford Women's Circle

937009439457.summary: Join us as a guest for FREE at this in-person and online event hosted by Brighton & Hove Speakers Club : the Toastmasters public speaking club for the seaside city. Our meetings provide members and guests with the opportunity to develop and practice speaking and leadership skills. We meet every 2nd and 4th Wednesday of the month from 7.30 pm until 9.30 pm. What Happens in Our Meetings We devote the first half of the meeting to prepared speeches . Members sign up in advance to write and rehearse a short speech before delivering it to the audience. The second half of the meeting begins with a series of evaluations . Every prepared speaker in the first half receives constructive feedback and advice on improving their speeches from other members. We then have a go at delivering impromptu speeches in a section called Table Topics . Guests will get a taste of public speaking by joining us in Table Topics. This is a fun and popular segment that challenges you to think on your feet and get used to speaking off-the-cuff to an audience. We will invite attendees to take part by talking about a given topic for up to two minutes. Impromptu speaking can be scary for newcomers, but its something youll want to keep coming back to time and time again! Agenda Highlights Warm-up introductions for guests and members Speeches or workshops delivered by our members Feedback on speeches from evaluators Table Topics for guests and members Post-meeting social chat Everyone is Welcome Our meetings have people coming from all walks of life, with a range of backgrounds and levels of experience. If you are looking for a way to nail that future job interview, deliver a talk for your own business, make YouTube videos, give a wedding speech or just want to pick up some useful tips and techniques, then we can help. Find Out More Visit us online at https://brightonandhovespeakersclub.com . We are part of Toastmasters International , a non-profit educational organisation and a world leader in communication and leadership development with a network of over 364,000 members and 16,200 clubs, spread over 145 countries worldwide.
937009439457.description: Get Confident in Public Speaking by learning and practising in a supportive environment
937009439457.venue_name: Leonardo Hotel Brighton (formerly Jurys Inn Brighton)
937009439457.title: Brighton & Hove Speakers - Learn and Practise Public Speaking (FREE)

957270912067.summary: Simply Business Club is pleased to present you with the opportunity to experience our unique brand of business networking #ConversationalNetworking. We want to give you the best chance possible to connect with the others in the room and to do this we allow questions and discussion during every pitch. There is never any pressure during your turn, just conversation, tell us what you do, how you do it and how we can help and then we open up to the room to discuss, perhaps some questions or testimonials and that might spark a conversation about someone's experience or it might give someone an idea. Each attendee is given 3-4 minutes which means you have the time to talk and explain in more detail about you and what you have been up to (we may, at times, need to restrict each person to a maximum of 2 questions after their pitch, this will be based on number of attendees, if there is time at the end we can then return to any questions that were not asked) We will start the meeting at 7.15am breakfast available from 7.30am and the sit down meeting will begin at 7.45am starting with with updates from the club followed by everyone telling us about themselves. We will be wrapped up by 9.30am so people can get on with their day having had a shot of dopamine to spark them into a positive and productive day. Our Folkestone meeting does not include a cooked breakfast and so the price is reflective of this, we will serve a continental style breakfast (muffins, pastries, fruit and hot / cold drinks) any allergies or specific dietary needs must be advised before the meeting so we can cater for you.

927851487777.summary: What is Creative Youth Council? Designed for and with young people aged 14-18. All sessions are free and take place on the second Saturday of every month, 12-4pm. We invite young people to develop new creative projects and events, with the chance to roam our fields, use our ceramics and recording studio and work with artists on lots of different projects. You could create a new podcast or soundscape, make clay sculptures, or develop new events and festivals, at Wysing, for other young people across Cambridgeshire to enjoy. For more information about Creative Youth Council, please visit our website here. Why should I join? Join our creative group meeting monthly on Saturdays to: Collaborate and experiment with artists and meet new friends in a safe and supportive space. Let your imagination run free - share your ideas and express yourself with exciting art projects. Get involved in arts opportunities including creating events, festivals and resources as well as your own art work. Build transferable teamwork and leadership skills to support college, university or job applications. How can I get the bursary to attend? As part of the Creative Youth Council, we are able to offer a bursary of 15 to support young peoples attendance at the sessions. This is open to anyone who feels this bursary will help them to attend. For example, to cover the cost of petrol to get to Wysing or help pay towards bringing a packed lunch. You will be sent information on this when you register. You will normally receive the funds within 2 weeks of attending each session. Please note: Attendees cannot receive the bursary offer as well as free taxi transport, please pick only one of these offers. Lunch & Refreshments You will need to bring a packed lunch with you. Please note there are no shops nearby. Drinks and snacks will be provided during the sessions. Access Information Please get in touch with us to let us know if there is something you need to be able to participate in Creative Youth Council, by emailing info@wysingartscentre.org. Transport Information & Timings Free travel is provided from Cambourne, Cambridge and Huntingdon with DBS checked taxi drivers. This must be booked on Eventbrite by 12midday on the Wednesday before the session. Please note: if you require transport but find it difficult to attend from these locations, please get in touch with us so we can discuss potential travel options or other ways to support your attendance. We recommend young people are taken to the transport location by parent/guardian. Please specify the contact number on the booking form to share with the taxi company on the day of travel (parent/guardian if they will be there to meet the travel, or young person if they are travelling independently). After booking you will be emailed transport details and information on how to receive the bursary. Wheelchair accessible transport - We can offer wheelchair accessible transport. If you require wheelchair accessible transport, please tick the box on the ticket checkout page and we will be in touch by email to confirm arrangements with you. Please let us know by 12 midday the Wednesday before so we can make arrangements. Huntingdon Taxi: Departs Huntingdon at 11.30am Arrives Wysing at 12pm Departs Wysing at 4pm Arrives back in Huntingdon at 4.30pm Cambridge Taxi: Departs Cambridge at 11.20am Collects Creative Youth Council passengers from Cambourne at 11.45am Arrives Wysing at 12pm Departs Wysing at 4pm Drops off Cambourne passengers at 4.15pm Arrives back in Cambridge at 4.40pm Cambourne Taxi: Departs Cambourne at 11.45am Arrives Wysing at 12pm Departs Wysing at 4pm Arrives back in Cambourne at 4.15pm Timings are approximate.
927851487777.description: Aged 1418? For the creative and the curious! Get involved with Wysings Creative Youth Council.
927851487777.title: Creative Youth Council

941917670107.summary: Business Buzz Brackley networking sessions are an excellent way to mingle face-to-face with other local businesses in a free-flowing, fun atmosphere. Designed to work with your schedule, theres no such thing as late with this two-hour drop-in session. Turn up whenever you like before the event closes at 12 noon and stay for 5 minutes or the full two hours. With no membership and no strings attached, its never been easier to meet your local business community. For just 10+ VAT youll get refreshments, a brilliant new set of contacts and the warmest of welcomes. With new people every month and a huge buzz in the room youre sure to make some great connections; we believe the more you chat, the more business just happens. We meet every 1st Thursday of the month between 10 am and 12 pm at the same venue. While you can book on the day, we ask that you purchase your ticket before you set off on your journey. This makes it much easier to check you in and get you to the coffee as soon as possible! How it works When you come to a Buzz youll be welcomed by the Buzz team, shown where the coffee is and introduced to some of the other attendees. Were here if you need further introductions to more guests, but youll find that everyone is really friendly and you can easily move around conversations to network as you like. The focus is open networking and easy-going conversations so that more business happens between our attendees easily. At roughly 11 am there is a short announcement section and youll find out who is in the room to help facilitate more connections.

925100790367.summary: Come and join us for friendly relaxed networking. The quality of conversations and the opportunity to build genuine connections means many of our visitors join as a member following their first visit. Seasoned networkers and networking beginners will always receive a warm welcome (and a tasty breakfast!) If you run or work for a Hampshire business and are looking for a friendly, local, networking group then join us for our regular monthly meeting (the second Friday of each month) with a chance to network, enjoy a simple breakfast, make new friends, hear a little more about what some of our members do and to join informal discussions about the top topics on our minds. We gather at 0745, to grab a tea or coffee and breakfast, then with an opportunity to network before the meeting starts at 0800. Our host will oversee some talk about brief introductions, then our first Guest Speaker will talk about their chosen business topic. There will then be a topical 'Breakout Question' for the individual tables to discuss for 10 or 15 minutes and feedback on their conclusions. Our second Guest Speaker will then talk about their business. We aim to finish our meeting at 1000, after which there is plenty of time to connect with those in the room, exchange business cards or arrange a 1:1 meeting with those whom you have made a connection with You are welcome to join us as a Visitor to discover whether this networking group is for you. Charity Workers are also welcome to join us for this event - please choose this option at checkout. Hampshire Business Networking is a Not for Profit, Unincorporated Social Enterprise. Our income comes from the costs of attending a meeting and the fees generated from joining as a member (if you choose to do so). Any trading surplus goes to our charity partners. See the HBN Website here for further information. Tickets Member ticket 18.00 Charity ticket charity worker only 18.00 First time Visitor 25.00
925100790367.description: Join us for an exciting in-person networking event at Winchester Racquets & Fitness in Winchester, UK - second Friday of the month
925100790367.title: Hampshire Business Networking - Winchester Main Event

996199608847.summary: Join us at The Utilita Bowl for the Hampshire Business Show Networking Breakfast, powered by Network My Club. We have teamed up with the Hampshire Business Show to deliver the pre-show networking breakfast for exhibitors, visitors, and business owners in the region. For an opportunity to network and connect, and fuel yourself with breakfast and coffee before the show opens its doors. Open to anyone to attend, whether you are visiting the show, exhibiting, or just wanting to network witha room full of business leaders from across Hampshire expected to be there. Whats Included & What Can You Expect? Breakfast rolls & pastries Teas & coffees throughout Free parking onsite Full breakfast guest list sent 48 hours in advance SME directors/owners from across Hampshire Informal & relaxed networking Attendees there to build genuine relationships, not sell to one another! Event Itinerary 8.00am Arrival, teas/coffees, and open networking 8.40am Welcome & introduction from Network My Club 8.45am Breakfast buffet served 9.15am - Intro to the HBS 10.00am Event ends If you are exhibiting at the Hampshire Business Show, we advise you to set up your stand at the available times either the evening before, or in the morning before the breakfast. How much? General Tickets: 30+VAT Network My Club Members: 20+VAT (contact NMC team for discount code) Hampshire Business Show Exhibitors: 20+VAT (contact HBS team for discount code)

941973396787.summary: Business Buzz Chipping Norton networking sessions are an excellent way to mingle face-to-face with other local businesses in a free-flowing, fun atmosphere. Designed to work with your schedule, theres no such thing as late with this two-hour drop-in session. Turn up whenever you like before the event closes at 12 noon and stay for 5 minutes or the full two hours. With no membership and no strings attached, its never been easier to meet your local business community. For just 10+ VAT youll get refreshments, a brilliant new set of contacts and the warmest of welcomes. With new people every month and a huge buzz in the room youre sure to make some great connections; we believe the more you chat, the more business just happens. We meet every 2nd Tuesday of the month between 10 am and 12 pm at the same venue. While you can book on the day, we ask that you purchase your ticket before you set off on your journey. This makes it much easier to check you in and get you to the coffee as soon as possible! How it works When you come to a Buzz youll be welcomed by the Buzz team, shown where the coffee is and introduced to some of the other attendees. Were here if you need further introductions to more guests, but youll find that everyone is really friendly and you can easily move around conversations to network as you like. The focus is open networking and easy-going conversations so that more business happens between our attendees easily. At roughly 11 am there is a short announcement section and youll find out who is in the room to help facilitate more connections.
941973396787.description: Come join us at the Chipping Norton Business Buzz Networking event for some great connections and buzzing conversations!
941973396787.title: Chipping Norton Business Buzz Networking

1042543604987.summary: The next Together for Mission Zero* meet will take place on 6 November in Browns Sandown and we look forward to seeing you there. It will be a fun Open Space Meeting, where alongside moving forward with the islands visioning work (which we have been researching and thinking alot about), we will be inviting you to form your own discussions with the community about your ideas for change and/ or projects you are working on . Open Space is a meeting framework that allows an unlimited number of participants to form their own discussions around a central theme. Community members will have the chance to pitch their own discussion theme on the evening, perhaps based on an idea or project that they have, and the community can choose which discussion they would like to be part of. If you would like to pitch a discussion theme at the next TFMZ meet on 6 Nov, please tell us here . We really look forward to seeing you there to continue to move the dial on positive environmental, social and economic change on the island. * Together for Mission Zero (TFMZ) is a platform to connect, share, discuss and build a community of action around the Isle of Wight Council's 2040 Mission Zero Strategy. Anyone invested in making a positive social or ecological change on our island towards this goal is welcome in this community **Please note that tickets for the event will cost 4 in order to cover TFMZ web and event costs. If purchasing a ticket stops you from attending, please reach out to let us know, this is never the intention info@togetherformissionzero.co.uk
1042543604987.description: Moving forward with our work to vision a net zero, nature positive, thriving Isle of Wight alongside crowding in your topics of interest.
1042543604987.title: Stepping up a gear with you/ Together for Mission Zero Open Space/ 6 Nov

791268233587.summary: Pop down to your local People Planet Pint meetup to find more about what's going on locally with sustainability and how you can get involved. No pitches, powerpoints or panels. Just People, Planet, Pint/s. Your local meetup is a great place to start your journey or continue learning, and meet diverse people to chat about life and how we can sustain it. Every job is a climate job, so come along and learn about how you can take action, as well as what is going on locally. We welcome everyone, regardless of their experience or background. People Planet Pint is a space where everyone can feel comfortable learning about sustainability and sharing their ideas. Afterall, creating a sustainable future requires connected communities. And what better way to bring everyone together than over a drink? Prefer a Pastry to a Pint? Head along to People Planet Pastry ! Equally relaxed and welcoming, they run during the day and offer an informal way to learn about what is going on locally in sustainability. The Chippy group meets monthly on the first Thursday of the month from 6-9pm do come and join us ANYTIME between 6 and 9pm youll get a warm and friendly welcome. Your Volunteer Host Linda Aspey is an executive coach, facilitator, supervisor, therapist, and global faculty at Time to Think. She supports businesses large and small, and leaders and teams with their climate, environmental and societal challenges, bringing the latest social psychology and Active Hope for better communications, engagement and action. She runs various free climate cafes and workshops, and speaks and writes on climate psychology, leadership, mental health and social justice. Linda loves seeing how the growing number of businesses in and around Chipping Norton are doing amazing things to tackle the many challenges of our time, and how talking more openly about climate change is helping more and more people to make a real difference.
791268233587.description: Pop down to your local People Planet Pint meetup to find more about what's going on locally with sustainability and how you can get involved
791268233587.title: Chipping Norton - Small99's People, Planet, Pint: Sustainability Meetup

686640830207.summary: Are traditional, structured meetings not your cup of tea? Does the idea of networking at the crack of dawn give you the chills? Maybe all you need is a relaxed atmosphere to network and mingle over a steaming cup of coffee, complimented with some delectable biscuits, cakes or pastries. Similarly, not everyone enjoys the obligation of joining membership groups and attending every single meeting - we get it. And so, we present to you, BusComm Espresso - no complications, no hassle. Just rock up, meet other forward-thinking business owners, and take a step towards growing your business. Here's the cherry on top - attending won't cost you a fortune! About the Meetings Held monthly from 10-11.30am, these meetings come with no formal agenda - drop in whenever you like! With a pay-as-you-go model (no membership), all you need to do is book to reserve your spot. We keep the numbers limited to ensure you get the opportunity to engage with each attendee without feeling overwhelmed. What's more... More than one cuppa! Tempting cakes, pastries and more Display a banner (no extra charge) Complimentary networking guide Special offers for other BusComm events We'll have one or two hosts at each meeting to facilitate introductions and ensure you maximise each opportunity to find your ideal connections. Ready to shake up your networking experience? Join BusComm Espresso today and let's brew success together!
686640830207.description: Unleash New Business Opportunities: Connect, Collaborate and Succeed with our Mix 'n' Mingle Business Networking Events!
686640830207.title: #BusComm Espresso Mix 'n' Mingle Business Networking Networking Kettering

941950999797.summary: Business Buzz Market Harborough networking sessions are an excellent way to mingle face-to-face with other local businesses in a free-flowing, fun atmosphere. Designed to work with your schedule, theres no such thing as late with this two-hour drop-in session. Turn up whenever you like before the event closes at 12 noon and stay for 5 minutes or the full two hours. With no membership and no strings attached, its never been easier to meet your local business community. For just 10+ VAT youll get refreshments, a brilliant new set of contacts and the warmest of welcomes. With new people every month and a huge buzz in the room youre sure to make some great connections; we believe the more you chat, the more business just happens. We meet every 1st Tuesday of the month between 10 am and 12 pm at the same venue. While you can book on the day, we ask that you purchase your ticket before you set off on your journey. This makes it much easier to check you in and get you to the coffee as soon as possible! How it works When you come to a Buzz youll be welcomed by the Buzz team, shown where the coffee is and introduced to some of the other attendees. Were here if you need further introductions to more guests, but youll find that everyone is really friendly and you can easily move around conversations to network as you like. The focus is open networking and easy-going conversations so that more business happens between our attendees easily. At roughly 11 am there is a short announcement section and youll find out who is in the room to help facilitate more connections.
941950999797.description: Come join us at the Market Harborough Business Buzz Networking event for some great connections and buzzing conversations!
941950999797.title: Market Harborough Business Buzz Networking

1040483523227.summary: Hosted by Alex (yoga and mindfulness teacher) and Sarah (confidence and empowerment coach). We would love to welcome you to the Women's Circle, Evesham. "delivered with sensitivity, respect and knowledge." "this was my first time at a circle and I felt more able to talk than I thought I would." "extremely interesting, helpful and relaxing." Women all over the world for generations have gathered together witnessing, supporting and sharing with each other on their grand adventure and journey called life. But in recent times its an art form we have lost touch with. In a time when we have never been more connected, we are actually more disconnected. For many women, they are beginning to feel invisible as well as disconnected. Never has there been a more important time to come together to be seen and heard in a safe space, free of judgment, competition or expectation, free from the constraints and demands of the outside world. You will feel seen & heard connected & supported free & empowered ready to embrace who you really are here to be & release who you think you should be. Each session will include time for sharing and various activities depending on the theme.
1040483523227.description: Come join us at Women's Circle Evesham for a night of connection, support, and empowerment with like-minded women in our community!
1040483523227.title: Women's Circle Evesham

909369256927.summary: Join us for the African Business Chamber (AfBC) Africa Business Forum 2024 in Leicester during The Leicester Business Festival and The UK International Trade Week 2024 . Date: Thursday 07 November 2024 Time: 13: 00 - 17:00 GMT Venue: University of Leicester School of Business, Leicester, England LE2 1RQ Theme: Re-defining and strengthening the future: Empowering African and black businesses in the East Midlands; Accelerating inclusive economic growth, entrepreneurship, innovation, and trade in Africa . The Forum will bring together business leaders, Government officials, investors, entrepreneurs, diasporas, experts, policymakers, academia and professionals from across the UK to deliberate and showcase economic growth opportunities in Africa for both local, regional and internationals businesses and investors. Join our discussion to learn from our speakers and connect with like minded investors, businesses, leaders, professionals and entrepreneurs. SPONSORSHIP We have multiple opportunities for companies and businesses to showcase their product and services, enhance brand awareness and connect with new clients/customers. Please contact us at info@african-chamber.com for more. For enquiries, to express interest to become a speaker at our events or sponsorship opportunities, contact us at info@african-chamber.com Learn more and sign up for AfBC Membership , visit www. african-chamber.com/membership .

1030059424467.summary: Non League Networking hosts business networking events at local non league and grass roots football clubs around the UK. The aim is to bring together business owners and professionals to grow their network and build connections. Networking is a proven way of doing this. What makes us different is our mantra of "Support for all". We believe in supporting not just the growth of local businesses, but the football clubs too. Most of the money you pay to attend the events goes back into the football clubs and helps them financially. These clubs rely on events and sponsorships from local businesses to keep them going. So with our networking events you are helping the local communities! Our events are all very relaxed. We are not a membership organisation and we do not have any "rules" or single seat policy. All events are "pay as you go" so we are consistently welcoming new faces every month. Everyone is welcome from sole traders to large global businesses. The main thing we ask is that you are friendly and open to getting to build new relationships. We're confident that once you have tried Non League Networking you will be back for more!

976115687297.summary: Welcome to the Rotary Club of Leicester! Our Monday meetings, held at the Belmont Hotel Leicester, are a great opportunity to meet members, guests, and speakers over a delicious lunch. As one of the oldest and longest-established clubs in the UK, we have a wealth of knowledge and history to share. Our speakers cover a range of topics, from local charities to general interest speakers such as our city mayor Peter Soulsby, who visits us each year to give us an update on what's been happening in the city. Our members are mostly business and community leaders who have been with us for many years and enjoy listening to our various lectures. At our meetings, our club president chairs the meetings and updates members on club and district news and projects including various youth competitions and projects such as Kids Out, RYLA, young musician, and young speaker. The cost of the meeting is 14 and covers the cost of the meal, payable at the hotel or via Eventbrite*. And as a member, there's an annual subscription to the Club. We would love to have you join us on a Monday lunchtime and find out more about our Rotary Club and Rotary in general. So, contact us about attending a meeting or book your place now via Eventbrite* and we'll look forward to seeing you at our next meeting. * Note Eventbrite tickets have an additional Eventbrite fee applied.
976115687297.description: Every Monday at noon, The Rotary Club of Leicester meets at the Belmont Hotel for lunch & a presentation by a speaker.
976115687297.title: Rotary Club of Leicester Monday Meeting - Belmont Hotel

978177875357.summary: Get to know fellow neurodivergent business owners and leaders in a low-pressure, non-salesy environment that facilitates meaningful connections and provides genuinely helpful support for your business . What Makes This Networking Event Different? Structured (Yet Flexible!) Facilitated Networking: Say goodbye to awkward small talk! We've created a friendly, facilitated networking format to help you focus on the conversations that interest you and feel relevant to your business. Communication Made Easier: We understand that the pressure to engage in conversation at networking can sometimes be too much, which is why we provide colour-coded lanyards to indicate your preferred approach to communication. Choose from Green (Chat to me!), Orange (I might not be up for chatting) or Red (If I want to talk, Ill let you know) and engage with conversations on your terms, or just listen in. Quiet Space Available: Sometimes, we all need a breather. Our events will have a dedicated quiet space for anyone who feels like things are getting a bit much, so you can take however long you need to regulate and recharge. Choose From Four Different Table Activities + Discussions: Join one of our four themed tables to take part in the conversations that interest you , with an activity to focus on while you talk This event is an opportunity to connect with your neurodivergent tribe, learn from one another, support each other and explore new opportunities. Event Details Date: Wednesday 13th November 2024 Time: 18:30-20:30 Duration: 2 hours Location: Town Hall, Castlefield Rd, Reigate RH2 0SH Want to join our online events for FREE and get 50% off our in-person events? Sign up for monthly membership here and get your first month free. Event Agenda 18:00-18:30 - Arrive, get yourself a drink and snacks and choose a table 18:30-18:40 - Introduction from your hosts 18:40-19:10 - Discussions and Activities 19:10-19:15 - Five Minute Break & Hydration Reminder! 19:15-19:50 - Discussions and Activities 19:50-20:30 - Host Announcements, Event Close Please note, we may take photos or videos during this event to support us with promoting the events to reach other neurodivergent business owners and obtaining funding (as we are a non-profit). If you do not want to be in any photos and videos, please let us know and we will be certain to respect this. It is important to us that our events feel safe and that everyone who attends feels comfortable. Venue Accessibility We will be in the Old Council Hall on the First Floor in the old part of the building, where a lift is available and accessible for most wheelchair users . Find more accessibility info here. About Joyfully Different Our mission is to make business joyful for neurodivergent founders. We're an award-winning non-profit business community and learning hub for neurodivergent business owners, leaders and future founders. We believe self-diagnosis is completely valid we aim to support everyone who needs us. Want to find out more about our mission and how to sign up as a member? Head on over to joyfullydifferent.co
978177875357.description: Looking to connect & collaborate with like-minded, neurodivergent entrepreneurs? Join us in Reigate for neurodivergent-friendly networking.
978177875357.title: Neurodivergent-Friendly Networking in Reigate

1009233052227.summary: London Connector helps you meet the right people at the right place (business leaders, corporate professionals, entrepreneurs, investors, professionals). Our unique venue is: Set in a stunning six-story building at Berkeley Square, Hay Hill is unique as it combines the luxury of a private members club with the business focus of a co-working environment, pioneering the concept of the club working, all in the heart of Mayfair. For our event, we have reserved an area of the venue with a cash bar, so that we can mix and mingle and meet old and new friends, new contacts, and, why not, new clients too! Program The format of the evening is 'mix and mingle', meet like-minded business leaders and entrepreneurs and investors in a relaxed environment. Our team is onsite to facilitate meaningful introductions. We connect at a human-to-human level, and prefer building relationships. How many people are attending? We have a maximum capacity of 80 guests for this venue and given the popularity of our events and the nature of the venue that hosts us, this one is predicted to be sold out in advance also because on average for each event we run 30-40 places are booked by our members who have joined the yearly membership. Early booking is truly and highly recommended. Last time we run an event at this venue we had a larger capacity and we sold out 5 days before the event date. The reason the events we organize are so successful is that we follow a very simple, but effective formula. A couple of days before the event we create a WhatsApp group with those attendees who wish to start getting to know each other . This allows each participant to set up meetings with those they wish to meet during (or even before) the event. On the day of the event, you will find a relaxed environment, and a welcoming and supportive crowd. Our team will be at the venue to introduce you to anybody specific you'd like to talk to. Guests will have access to the part of the Club reserved for our event, but not to other private areas of Hay Hill Club. You can book a private tour though. Dress code: business casual (no trainers, no jeans) Refund policy. Tickets bought in advance are generally cheaper than those bought on the day of the event and for this reason cannot be refunded. They can be reassigned to another person of your choice.
1009233052227.description: By popular demand, back to Hay Hill Mayfair, normally accessible only to members!
1009233052227.title: Business networking at Hay Hill Private Members Club

1041586341787.summary: London's Best Single Muslim 1-1 networking and marriage event, at one of London's top restaurants The Adore British Asian Kitchen in Harrow. WE HAVE ALREADY HAD 2 MARRIAGES THIS YEAR FROM OUR EVENTS. ALHUMDULILAH The event will be split into two parts, 27-33 and 33 plus. Our Events our unique format of making people feel relaxed and comfortable, with Ice breakers and group discussions before they move on to the main part of the event which is the 1-1s. Everyone gets to talk to each person for 3 minutes before moving to thr next person and so on. We provide possible marriage related questions you can ask the person, instead of hearing the same Interview type questions from every rotation. In between the rotations we will have delicious food and drink which is included in the ticket. This networking & marriage event promises to be Unique, Fun, Activity based with plenty of networking and not to mention amazing food with In sha Allah the main goal being to find your Match! We have already had 2 success stories this year Alhumdulilah so we know how the formula works! We usually have a 50/50 ratio of Men to Women and are expecting a big turnout of 60 people which gives everyone good time to talk to everyone. The order of the events will be as follows: 1pm - Registration 1pm - 1.30pm - Ice Breaker Mingle 1.30pm - Group Fun Discussion - You will be put into a small group and after introducing yourselves you will be given a fun discussion to talk about 1.45pm - 1-1 rotations. You will talk to each person for 3 minutes and get to know if there is an intial connection or something which attracts or intrigues you about the person where you can talk further later. 2.30pm - Lunch Time - whether its a Sizzling Burger or Biryani, its time to take a break and recharge the batteries. 3.15pm - 1-1 rotations continue 4pm - Talk further to anyone who took your interest. 5pm - Home Time or After party Dessert and Chai (this is not included in the ticket!) Pls inform the Restaurant staff of any allergies. The ticket will include food chosen and drink. If you want to know more about someone after the event then please let one of the organisers know. 1020158129427.summary: Event Description: You have built the business, now it is time to grow Fireside chat facilitated Matt Black and few featured startup pitch presentations For founding teams of post-MVP businesses that are seeking support to grow. Fundraising support, bespoke management and advisory teams, partnership programs, investor introductions and much more are available from the event and community partners to help companies reach their potential. This event goes step by step through the challenges investors & founders face and how we can work better together. Event Highlights: 7.00pm 7.15pm : Registration and Introductions 7.15pm 7.45pm: Fireside chat facilitated by Matt Black 7.45pm 8.15pm : Pitches 8.15pm : The event concludes with Networking, allowing for continued conversations in a more informal setting. This is the perfect time to deepen connections and discuss potential collaborations. Matt Black: Born and raised in the remote outback of Australia, now he has swapped the desert life for the boardrooms & speaker podiums of America and more recently London. Branded a Maverick by peers but loved by founders Matt created 11 of his own companies, and assisted with literally thousands of businesses across three continents. He has inspired over a million founders to turn their dreams into reality through his books and public speaking. Matts mission To enable founders to forge a better world for all of us. Confirmed Panelists: Alaa Amer is the Co-Founder and CEO of Equisy, an entrepreneur with 15 years of experience in developing investment strategies, guiding startups through growth phases, scaling operations, and leading fundraising and M&A. Identifying investment opportunities to drive the growth and profitability of SMEs. Galina Markova: Ex-banker turned angel investor across SEE & CEE with focus on sustainability. Passionate about growing businesses. Seasoned financial services professional with deal making experience through cycles across multiple jurisdictions. Co-lead of the Bulgarian Angels Club UK Chapter Who Should Attend: Entrepreneurs Startup founders Angel Investors Business consultants Venue: Home Grown Members Club is an exclusive private club located in the heart of London, dedicated to nurturing and connecting entrepreneurs, investors, and business leaders. Housed in a beautifully restored Georgian townhouse, the club offers an elegant and inspiring environment for networking, collaboration, and professional growth. Members have access to luxurious facilities, including meeting rooms, event spaces, a private dining area, and a vibrant bar, all designed to foster creativity and innovation. The club also hosts a variety of curated events, workshops, and seminars, providing valuable opportunities for learning and development. With a focus on fostering a supportive and dynamic community, Home Grown Members Club is the perfect place for ambitious professionals to thrive and achieve their business goals. Location: 44 Great Cumberland Place, Marylebone, London, W1H 7BS Dress Code: Business Professional/Business Casual RSVP: Please register online in advance; no tickets will be sold at the door! Tickets: Early Bird 15 Standard: 20 Contact Information: For inquiries or additional details, please contact us at info@konnetwork.com or call the organizer. Dont miss this chance to connect, collaborate, and grow. Join us and take your professional network in the property industry to the next level.

776828383607.summary: The November meeting of Women in Telecoms & Technology (WiTT) celebrates women entrepreneurs in tech with a panel discussion among leading women who have founded, grown, and in some cases sold businesses in the tech sector. Our women entrepreneurs event is timed to take place in the week before Global Entrepreneurship Week , which runs from 18-23 November 2024. Audrey Mandela, WiTT Chair and co-founder of Multimap.com, will chair the panel. Our speakers will include: Jessi Baker, Founder, Provenance; Jaye Cowle, Founder of Launch; and Sushma Shankar, Co-Founder & CEO of Deep Planet. Our panel will discuss their views and experiences, including: panelists' own challenges in starting and growing (and in some cases selling) their businesses; best and worst decisions made while building their businesses; whether panelists believe there are differences between male and female entrepreneurs, the types of businesses they start, their management styles, and their experiences of raising capital; views on scaling up businesses started in the UK; and advice for other women entrepreneurs. We'll begin at 6:00pm with networking. The panel will run from 6:45 to 7:45, including Q&A. Drinks and canapes will be served after the panel finishes. WiTT would like to thank Michelmores LLP for hosting. Please email info@wittgroup.org if you have any questions. We look forward to seeing you on November 12th! The WiTT Board Annette, Audrey, Helen, Michelle, and Yasmeen
776828383607.description: WiTT's annual discussion among women tech entrepreneurs
776828383607.title: Lessons from Leading Women Tech Entrepreneurs

1026914507937.summary: An Evening To Remember | Drinks & Networking | Rare Items on Display If you're an amateur or professional collector, curious about whisky , comics , cards , and coins , then you are invited to learn more about it as you start or expand your collection. Featuring an expert guest speaker in the collectable space, Tom Pelc, join us on an evening to learn more about the nuances of the market . This event will be hosted in Marylebone , brought to you by Yubaro, a young app in its early access stage: it is a social space created for real-life treasure-hunters. The current version of the app highlights collectables in whisky, gold coins, classic cars, and art. Wind down on your Thursday evening with a group of open-minded Londoners building their own collection, and meet the Yubaro team. Beyond cards, comics and whisky, a sneak peek at some pieces on display: Robert Indiana's "Love," framed the artist's iconic LOVE piece led to his involvement in the HOPE campaign for Obama. A HOPE sculpture of his signature style is still on display on 53rd St in New York. A limited edition "Alec Monopoly X Jacob & Co Whisky bottle" which modernises the traditional whisky experience. This is one bottle from the 2,000 created featuring Gliclee print. The "Gothic Crown" coin depicting Queen Victoria featuring a stunning medieval-inspired design by William Wyon. This rare coin is part of a limited mintage and highly sought-after by coin collectors. The evening will feature a number of rare and iconic pieces taken out from the vault. Drinks and nibbles will be provided for the evening. Please dress smart casual.
1026914507937.description: See first-hand exclusive big-ticket collectables amongst like-minded collectors ft. an expert speaker & rare items taken out from the vault
1026914507937.title: An evening of drinks ft. iconic and rare coins, whisky & comics

1028729717277.summary: Welcome to the Nurture Connection Business Networking Evening ! Join us for an evening of networking and building meaningful connections with like-minded individuals in East London. This in-person event will be held at Bow Brew Caf (situated inside St Paul's Community Centre), providing a welcoming and engaging environment for all attendees. Whether you're looking to expand your professional network or simply meet new friends, this event is the perfect opportunity to nurture connections. Don't miss out on this chance to connect with others and grow your circle! The evening will start at 6pm with registration and a quick chance to have a welcome drink and snack with other attendees. At 6.30pm we will proceed with a talk from our guest speaker Mike Southon , the co-author of the book The Beermat Enterpreneur who will share some tips on how to turn a good idea into a great business. Mike co-founded The Instruction Set, a training and software business which grew from three to 150 people in five years and was then acquired by Cap Gemini Ernst and Young. He then worked on two start-ups which eventually both went public, and a number which didnt. Since the first publication of The Beermat Entrepreneur in 2002 he has spoken at over a thousand events all over the world and provided free, face-to-face mentoring to over 1,500 aspiring entrepreneurs. When hes not being The Beermat Entrepreneur at live events, Mike helps any type of company refine their elevator pitches, test their sales models and grow their sales. Mike is more than Quite Interesting. He spreads insight and cheerfulness in equal measure, like an ambidextrous chef icing two cakes at once. John Lloyd, producer of QI, Not the Nine oClock News, Spitting Image and The Hitchhikers Guide to the Galaxy. You will have the chance to Mike questions you may have. At 7pm we will proceed to 'round the circle' style 1 minute business introductions when you will have the opportunity to talk about your business and anything that you are looking for in terms of help, networking, collaboration or investment. We will end the evening at 8pm with thank yous and talking about next event and plans for the future. I look forward to meeting you all on the day and finding out about yourselves and your businesses! Julia @ Nurture Connection
1028729717277.description: Come join us for a relaxed evening of networking and building connections in East London to nurture relationships and grow together!
1028729717277.title: Nurture Connection Networking Evening in East London

1036571943587.summary: Welcome to the epitome of luxury networking, brought to you by Opulent Access Events! This exclusive event is designed for professionals, entrepreneurs, and innovators from all sectors, offering a unique space for people of all abilities to connect, collaborate, and experience the best in accessible networking. Enjoy a day filled with rich conversations, high-end experiences, and valuable connections, all within the stunning setting of Kew Gardens. We are redefining what it means to network inclusively, ensuring that accessibility and luxury meet harmoniously for every guest. Whether youre an event planner, DEI strategist, entrepreneur, or corporate leader looking to expand your network in an inclusive environment, this event is for you! Why Attend? Inclusive Networking: Connect with diverse professionals and industry leaders in an accessible, supportive environment. Accessibility at Its Finest: The event is designed to be fully accessible, ensuring comfort and ease for all attendees. Luxury Experience: Immerse yourself in an elegant day out with gourmet catering, luxury settings, and bespoke experiences. 1020991863147.summary: Many recent innovations and emerging technologies allow for the transformation of the lives of all people, but they need to reach the particular needs of disabled and neurodivergent people. This requires inclusive and universal product design, bespoke products targeting these needs with full lived experience involvement. Tech For Disability advocates for delivering innovation to all needs and including disabled and neurodivergent people in all aspects of its development. We are launching an online resource hub aimed at the tech industry, funders and lived experience to share information, promote discussion on what people need and inform how it can be built and brought to market. It covers topics like personal perspectives, practical areas on inclusive design, market research, funders and networks of support, emerging tech and a showcase of example startups, amongst others. It is open to regular contributions and content updates with membership communications. Complementing this would be an online community to continue the conversations and exchange and, of course, our events. Join us for the launch of this online resource hub at our first in-person event at Level39, high up at Canary Wharf, which hosts innovative startups across many sectors, on 7th November at 5pm. For those who cannot attend in person, please book via our Online Event Booking Page to share your presence online. We will record the content generated in different ways and publish it as well. Well feature speakers bringing to life different areas of the resource hub, followed by networking opportunities. Accessible facilities and catering: The location is accessible in terms of entrance, lifts, and space. Light snacks and drinks will be available. Please let us know on info@techfordisability.org if you have any questions or requests.
1020991863147.description: Join us for the launch of our online resource hub at Level39, high up at Canary Wharf.
1020991863147.event_address: 1 Canada Square Canary Wharf, London, E14 5AB
1020991863147.title: Empowering Inclusive Innovation - Tech For Disability Resource Hub Launch

1006250270647.summary: Do you feel you could offer a generous referral commission to reward introducers who bring you new business? Would you like to monetise your network and get paid for introductions you make? Then this event is for you. We are excited to join forces with introstars, the #1 marketplace for high-value business introductions & referrals! With introstars.com you can earn 5,000 to 50,000 for every business introduction you make, and also receive introductions to your ideal clients. All attendees will receive a special VIP promo code to use introstars.com to receive referrals for free! (value of 95 per month ). Join introstars.com now to start making & receiving high-value intros! Program The format of the event is free format networking and mix and mingle. We expect a good mix of company founders, directors, business development people and also investors. 7 PM: Arrive at the club, sign in at the reception. Come upstairs, meet friends and make new connections. Our team is on-site to help with introductions if you need it. You leave with a lot of valuable business connections, buzzing with new ideas and potential, and great memories of a fantastic event. Venue Set in a stunning six-story Georgian building in the heart of Marylebone and part of the Home House Collection, Home Grown offers a space for like-minded people to network, entertain and grow. For our event, we have reserved a part of the Club and we will mix and mingle and build long-lasting relationships, on a human-to-human level . Who is attending CEOs, entrepreneurs, corporate leaders, and business leaders from several industries. A good mixture of familiar faces and new guests. We are shy-friendly, so if it's your first time, you won't feel lonely. How our events are different The reason the events we organise are so successful is that we follow a very simple, but effective formula. A day before the event we create a WhatsApp group with those attendees who wish to start getting to know each other. This allows each participant to set up meetings with those they wish to meet during (or even before) the event. Our team will be at the venue to introduce you to anybody specific you'd like to talk to. Tickets go fast Given the exclusive nature of the venue that host us, combined with the popularity of our events, we expect this event to be sold out in advance. Early booking is highly recommended. Dress code: business casual (no trainers, no jeans) Refund policy: we are unable to refund tickets, but if you can't come you can give it to someone else, and let us know who is coming.

1011299593307.summary: Welcome to the Women Awakening Book Club! I wanted to bring together a group, a community of like-minded women who love to read, nurture their inner wisdom and celebrate the divine feminine that they are. By being open, curious is how we grow and expand. We will meet every 6-8 weeks in a London cafe, where we discuss a particular book. The range of books will focus on self-development, spirituality, women empowerment and ways we can relate this to our everyday world. Each session we will discuss and share our insights from the book and most importantly how these learnings can be embodied as we grow. I will guide the gathering, with key discussion points, however the main goal is for me to create space and allow the sharing of wisdom within the group. F or our next event in Nov we will discussing the book "Sensual" by Henika Patel. You can purchase the book at your local book store, online or see if you can borrow it at your local library. There will be a small fee for joining the gathering of 7. This will include a tea or coffee at the venue and an organisers fee. This ensures that we are supporting the venue and any costs that occur in supporting the book club, so we can continue to run this going forward. The fee is refundable if the cancellation occurs a week before the event. I recommend you RSVP in advance to book your space and leave you sufficient time to read the book. I will close the RSVP 1 day before the event, to allow sufficient time to finalise numbers for the venue. To make sure we keep an enjoyable, safe and non-judgemental space, here are the Book Club Rules:- Please RSVP on time and if something changes and you cant attend please let me know as soon as possible, so I can offer that place to someone else- Please arrive on time. We have so much to discuss so we want to maximise the time and explore as many insights as we can.- Please try to finish the book so you can contribute to the discussion. Sometimes we know life gets in the way, and if you havent completed the book, you can still attend and contribute as much as possible. - Allow a space for everyone to be heard. Please be respectful and open, even in times of disagreement. We want to avoid a space where there is interruption or certain members are dominating the conversation. - Given the nature of the topics, members may share very personal experiences or emotions. Please respect that this is a confidential space. Most of all have fun, grow, expand, allow us to connect with our inner wisdom as we sit in the company of some amazing women!
1011299593307.description: A women's bookclub that awaken's our spiritual curiosity and honouring the divine feminine within...
1011299593307.title: Women Awakening Book Club - Nov 2024 Event

1038954329367.summary: London Queer Death Cafe is a monthly discussion and peer-support space for LGBTQ+ people on the subject of death, loss and grief. Join us as we come together hold space for one another and our experiences to listen, learn and grow. Discussions will be held in both larger and small groups, facilitated by our volunteers. All experiences are welcome and everyone will be given space to share if they wish. Our approach is a shame-free and open discussion which aims to help us find belonging, solidarity and support from the experiences of others. Ticket donations will go towards supporting future events by the Queer Death Cafe. If you are unsure if this space is right for you, or have any questions please get in touch.
1038954329367.description: A space for LGBTQ+ people to discuss and share mourning, grief and loss.
1038954329367.title: London Queer Death Cafe - November
