887707415777.summary: Man TALK - Eat & Connect! An Event for Men to Share, Eat, and Connect Calling men from all backgrounds (over 18 only)! Looking to connect with others, share and be encouraged by others' stories/experiences, and enjoy some delicious food? Man TALK - Eat & Connect is the perfect event for you! Only 30 spaces available !!! Here's what you can expect: Relaxed atmosphere: Meet new people and build supportive friendships in a comfortable environment. Open conversations: Share your experiences and hear from others in a safe and supportive space. Focus on men's health: Explore topics like mental health, stigma, mindfulness, and managing stress with professionals. Delicious food: Enjoy a free lunch while you connect with others. Why attend? Learn coping strategies: Gain practical tools for dealing with stress, anxiety, and other mental health concerns. Discover resources: Find support networks specifically for men in your community. Strength in numbers: Be inspired by others who understand your challenges. Build connections: Make new friends and strengthen existing bonds. Event details: Date: Saturday, Nov 16th, 2024 Time: 11:00 AM Location: Christ Church, Newham URC Food: Free lunch provided! LIMITED SPACES!!! Don't miss out! This is a great opportunity to connect with other men and prioritise your well-being. See you there! Sponsored by Newham People Powered Places. This event is hosted by Ayati Mind in partnership with Christchurch Newham URC . Visit www.ayatimind.com/events for more information. #AyatiMind #PeoplePoweredPlaces #ChristChurchNewham #NewhamLondon #MensMentalHealth #MensMentalHealthAwarenessMonth

1027997085957.summary: Acland Burghley School have embarked an ambitious project to return our Grade II listed Brutalist Assembly Hall to its original vision a world-class heritage, arts and performance space for our students and the local community. The exceptional space will also be home to the Museum of Brutalist Architecture (MoBA). This Hall for All event will take place between 4.00pm and 6.30pm; feel free to join us when you can: 4.00 - 5.00pm : Guests are invited to watch the Orchestra of the Age of Enlightenments rehearsal of the Brandenburg Concertos. Bach's groundbreaking 'Six Concertos for several instruments' puts the collective virtuosity of the OAE in the spotlight. 5.00 - 6.30pm : Drinks and canaps will be served and Headteacher Nicholas John, a representative from the OAE and from Urban Learners who are leading on the development of MoBA will speak about our Brutalist heritage and the Hall for All project. You will also have a chance to see the new MoBA display. Please get in touch with hnewman@aclandburghley.camden.sch.uk if any of your colleagues or your network would also like to attend.
1027997085957.description: Join us for a dedicated networking and information sharing event for those working in architecture, design and the built environment

Bring along your current project and work alongside other artists, creatives, crafters and those exploring their creative side - everyone is welcome. A great opportunity to connect with other local creatives. The Community Art Space is run on a pay what you can basis in order to make it accessable for everyone. Our suggested amount if you are able to contribute is 10 Please be aware that flammable materials such as fibreglass, chemicals or solvents must not be used without previous consent from Jelly, as it may not be possible without adequate ventilation. Anything electrical that needs to be plugged into the sockets needs to be safe and under a year old. Alternatively we can arrange for the items to be PAT tested but this may incur a fee. By attending this workshop you are agreeing to act in accordance with our online safety and online behaviour policy which can be viewed here: https://www.jelly.org.uk/policies Inclusivity, safety, respect, confidentiality and consent are fundamental principles at Jelly workshops and events. Frequently asked questions: We are a small team working behind the scenes answering your questions. If you email us via eventbrite or via our website we will answer as soon as we can. W here does this workshop take place? This workshop will take place at the Jelly studios, Broad Street Mall

945106126867.summary: Effective Business Network offers structured, face-to-face networking without any pressure. It's a relaxed and informal setting Yet remains focused on business The success of our Group Members speaks for itself, proving our longstanding networking formula that drives results! Knowledge + Trust = Business Growth If you're new to networking, feeling uncertain, or experiencing nerves about attending, you're not alone. We are experts at welcoming networking beginners and guarantee a warm welcome for everyone. Our Group Directors will facilitate introductions, provide guidance on networking etiquette to enhance your networking skills, and will follow up with you to ensure you had an exceptional experience at our events. We know your time is valuable as a busy business owner, and we want to make networking as convenient as possible for you. Thats why our events are scheduled before your workday begins, ensuring that your networking efforts won't interfere with your business activities. Additionally, we understand how hectic your days can be, often leading to skipped meals. To support your well-being, all our events include a delicious and hearty breakfast to kickstart your day on a positive note. Join us to connect with like-minded professionals while enjoying a great meal! For those committed to networking, where relationships are formed and genuine introductions are made in a friendly, stress free environment, we invite you to try us out. Visiting ebn comes with no immediate obligation and non-members are able to benefit from attending three of our events before we invite you to join our community. We are excited to welcome you to one of our highly attended networking events across Essex! Visit https://ebnevent.eventbrite.com to explore all our locations and events. Membership in ebn is a valuable investment in your business and one of the most cost-effective methods to connect with like minded business owners within your local area. Please note the following professions are already represented by our members within this group. If you work within an area not listed below we would love to welcome you:- Charity Financial Advisor Funeral Director IT Support Marketing Mortgage Advisor Solicitor Rainham ebn Group is hosted by Group Director Leanne Livingstone Palmers Solicitors 01375 484444 lgrafton@palmerslaw.co.uk To discuss ebn membership, please send an email to nadine@ebn.uk.com
945106126867.description: Breakfast business networking events with ebn provide an excellent opportunity for successful, local business owners to make new connections

773654229627.summary: Prepare to be blown away by the most sought-after and AWARD WINNING networking group of the year: the SiGNAL BiZHUB. As proud winners of the silver UK SME Awards for Best Networking Group, we invite you to experience our unrivalled events at our brand-new venue, the prestigious Blackmoor Golf Club Bar and Restaurant. Our monthly gatherings are tailor-made for ambitious business owners who want to leverage quality time with the right people in the perfect setting. We make it a priority to gather our wonderful business community together once a month because we believe who you mingle with truly matters! What better way to mingle than to connect with local go-getters, both aspiring and established , over a delicious continental breakfast. Unlimited free tea and coffee is provided with breakfast and if you fancy a speciality barista coffee, they are also available to purchase from the bar. In terms of business content, prepare for captivating talks, insider business tips and updates on town centre regeneration, all presented with a dash of entertainment. We start and finish with good old-fashioned networking (often with a twist!) where our hosts will be on hand to make sure you meet the people you want. Then the focus of the meeting is business keynotes two of just 10 minutes each - interspersed with plenty of audience interaction. The room is laid out with tables for breakfasting and group discussion and there should be plenty of opportunity for you to talk to everyone in the room. In addition, to make collaborating a breeze, we provide you with a comprehensive email contact list of all attendees. Saves you handing out cards! Our paid membership group is 90 plus strong and our average event attendance in 2023 was 36 business owners. Our best attended event was 43 and the lowest was 23. SiGNAL events are all about forging new friendships, helping others, building your reputation, and clinching game-changing deals! We love networking (done right!) and our goal is to make sure all our events are fun to attend and packed with value and opportunity. Join us to experience business events that combine business brilliance, picturesque views, and unforgettable connections. Don't miss out on this opportunity to make 2024 your best year yet!
773654229627.description: Hampshire's Award Winning & Fastest Growing Business Networking Community
773654229627.title: SiGNAL Business Networking: October

947454581157.summary: Effective Business Network offers structured, face-to-face networking without any pressure. It's a relaxed and informal setting Yet remains focused on business The success of our Group Members speaks for itself, proving our longstanding networking formula that drives results! Knowledge + Trust = Business Growth If you're new to networking, feeling uncertain, or experiencing nerves about attending, you're not alone. We are experts at welcoming networking beginners and guarantee a warm welcome for everyone. Our Group Directors will facilitate introductions, provide guidance on networking etiquette to enhance your networking skills, and will follow up with you to ensure you had an exceptional experience at our events. We know your time is valuable as a busy business owner, and we want to make networking as convenient as possible for you. Thats why our events are scheduled before your workday begins, ensuring that your networking efforts won't interfere with your business activities. Additionally, we understand how hectic your days can be, often leading to skipped meals. To support your well-being, all our events include a delicious and hearty breakfast to kickstart your day on a positive note. Join us to connect with like-minded professionals while enjoying a great meal! For those committed to networking, where relationships are formed and genuine introductions are made in a friendly, stress free environment, we invite you to try us out. Visiting ebn comes with no immediate obligation and non-members are able to benefit from attending three of our events before we invite you to join our community. We are excited to welcome you to one of our highly attended networking events across Essex! Visit https://ebnevent.eventbrite.com to explore all our locations and events. Membership in ebn is a valuable investment in your business and one of the most cost-effective methods to connect with like minded business owners within your local area. Please note the following professions are already represented by our members within this group. If you work within an area not listed below we would love to welcome you:- Accountant Building Claims Estate Agent Financial Planning Hypnotherapy Insurance Broker IT Mortgage Advisor Solicitor Stylist Photographer Utility Warehouse Brentwood ebn Group is hosted by Group Director Debbie Glover Utility Warehouse 07738754555 gloversuw@gmail.com To discuss ebn membership, please send an email to nadine@ebn.uk.com

Property Millionaire Mastermind is a fun and interactive networking event for all property enthusiasts! Whether you're new to property, an established investor or developer, there is something to learn at all our networking events. 1003458640807.summary: People, Planet, Pastry If youre interested or curious about sustainability, come along to the People, Planet, Pastry event to meet like-minded business owners who are taking action on sustainability. Learn about what is going on locally, share insights on how to overcome barriers and make new friends! This relaxed and informal event brings people together to learn more about sustainability and take action. The sister event, People, Planet, Pint, brings people together to learn more and chat about climate, while our Pastry series is focused on empowering small businesses with the action they can take and where to start with sustainability. While we will mostly be discussing businesses, this is an open event where anyone is welcome, so if youre curious about whats going on, come on down! Your Volunteer Host Jill Poet is the co-founder and CEO of the Organisation for Responsible Businesses , a national member-owned, not-for-profit company limited by guarantee. ORB was launched in 2010 with a mission to change the world, one small business at a time. Prior to launching ORB, Jill spent 40 years working as, with, or for micro and small businesses as a management accountant. She is passionate about small businesses and their potential to create positive societal change by taking a very holistic approach to the sustainability agenda. Jill is also the author of Amazon bestseller It Really Is Just Good Business: the art of operating a responsible, ethical and profitable small business. She has lived in Southend for almost all her adult life a long time! She is looking forward to meeting more local people who are keen to drive sustainability in her home city and beyond. Venue: This event will take place at Waitrose Caf, Fossetts Way, Eastern Avenue, Southend-on-Sea, SS2 4DQ.
1003458640807.description: Meet others interested in sustainability in your community, share local stories and ideas, and accelerate local climate action.
1003458640807.event_address: Garon Park CIC Eastern Avenue, Southend-on-Sea, SS2 4FA
1003458640807.title: Southend-on-Sea - People, Planet, Pastry

1036989703117.summary: 28 January 2025 - Innovation theme: Greentech, Cleantech and Climate Tech Please note this event is not aimed at or open to service providers, and we will cancel any tickets that do not meet the event criteria. Event attendee criteria: You must be an active innovator (linked to this theme) or active investor. Do ensure you use the information boxes in the second part of the registration form help us verify and confirm your place. Building and maintaining a network of good connections can be key for shrewd investors and those seeking funding to grow their business. Our Abel + Imray Investors + Innovators Meet Up series bring people together to start creating those connections through networking over informal drinks. Each event has an innovation theme to provide a focus to attract relevant investors and innovating businesses to be 'in the room'. The meet up is free to attend though places are limited, and places are restricted to 2 per organisation. 18.00 Arrival and networking 20.00 Close Who should attend: Investors: Including angel investors, venture capital funds, private equity and others who are actively offering funding to growing businesses Growing businesses: Innovating businesses who are or will be seeking funding. We think these events will be most beneficial for those looking for investment from pre-seed through to series B. Please note we reserve the right to refuse entry to the event if we believe you do not fuflil the intended criteria of either an active innovator (linked to the theme) or an investor. We will be taking photographs at the event for marketing purposes, and may share your business name to encourage investors to attend the event.

1036989703117.title: Investors + Innovators Meet Up (Greentech, Cleantech and Climate Tech)

1026036872907.summary: | _ | .) | Hey, Welcome to the Supporting Actors HQ : Networking & Social ! About this event: Join us for an exciting Networking & Social event hosted by Supporting Actors HQ, the premier community for Lead/Supporting/Background Actors (SAs), Extras, film makersdancers, etc. Connect, share experiences, and grow professionally with fellow Actors from all backgrounds. What to expect Warm Welcome : relaxed, open interactive warm intro's, "get-to-know-you's" session Networking Opportunities : meet and interact with fellow Actors, Extras, and industry professionals. Share your experiences, exchange contacts, and build lasting connections. Interactive discussions : participate in engaging discussion led by industry peers. Topics include mastering set etiquette, enhancing acting skills, and navigating casting calls. Job Listings: access job listings & learn about upcoming casting calls to advance your career. Industry Insights : gain valuable insights that can help you stay ahead in your career. Rooftop Bar: after the Enigma Room session, unwind at the Unity Sky Lounge Rooftop Bar. Enjoy panoramic views, your favorite drinks, and relaxed socializing to foster lasting connections. Why Attend ? Grow your career, connect with industry peers, gain new skills, and valuable insights When & Where ? This is an in-person event on Thursday, Oct 17th, 2024, at 4 PM UK time [ BST (GMT+1) ] in the Enigma Room at Work/Cafe, Unity Place, located at 200 Grafton Gate, Milton Keynes. The venue is conveniently situated just a 5-minute walk from Milton Keynes Main Train Station and a 7-minute drive from Junction 14 on the M1, providing easy access for both public transport users and drivers. Join us for an exclusive gathering of Lead/Supporting/Background Actors and extras, where we celebrate the unsung heroes of film, TV, Stage, and Cinema. Dive into the heart of the entertainment industry, connect with fellow performers, and share your experiences on and off the screen. Discover new opportunities, forge lasting connections, and celebrate the vital role of background talent in bringing stories to life. Don't just be a part of the scene, be the scene. See you there! In the meantime, let's keep the excitement rolling! Join our WhatsApp group and be part of the fun. Get insider scoop, laugh at behind-the-scenes stories, share your own adventures, and get first dibs on exclusive events. It's your all-access pass to a world of creativity and camaraderie. Click here to join the party : Supporting Actors WhatsApp Group
1026036872907.description: Networking & Social for Lead/Supporting/Background Actors, Extras, Film makers, Production etc. to connect & grow, on Thu 17th Oct, 2024

1042307679327.summary: Women's Business Link London, recently shortlisted for in the invites you to the workshop for women in collaboration with . The event will take place at the remarkable and historic Drummonds Bank, located on Trafalgar Square. This iconic venue offers a perfect blend of elegance and rich heritage, making it an ideal setting for the occasion. Celebrate your success! The event will be presented by Kate Kowalska , a Global # and . Kate is a seasoned Premier Banking Manager at NatWest Group, boasting over a decade of experience advising Affluent and High Net Worth clients. Kate is passionate about diversity and inclusion, she co-leads Wealth Gender Network, advocating for gender equality and supporting female talent in their career progression. She holds Women in Business accreditation and dedicates her time to empowering females through education, networking and financial guidance, helping to bridge gender financial gaps and foster better financial decision-making for families across the nation. Kate is one of the global #IAmRemarkable community of facilitators. As a facilitator her role involves hosting workshops and being ambassador for #IAR withing her personal and professional networks. What's #IAmRemarkable #IAmRemarkable is a global movement that empowers everyone to celebrate their achievements in the workplace and beyond. Cultural and gender modesty norms as well as imposter syndrome can prevent anyone from acknowledging their remarkable attributes and expressing their achievements. At the heart of the initiative is a 90-minute workshop. During the 90-minute workshop, you'll learn the importance of self-promotion in your personal and professional life and be equipped with tools to develop this skill. You are invited to challenge the social perception around self-promotion. What are the goals of an #IAmRemarkable Workshop? 1. Improve self-promotion motivation and skills 2. Challenge the social perception around self-promotion Drinks and light refreshments will be provided. To learn more, visit the website: Celebrate your success - #IAmRemarkable | Rmrkblty
1042307679327.description: Join us for a fun workshop with NatWest to celebrate your achievements and empower women!
1042307679327.title: Celebrate your success! Workshop for women in collaboration with NatWest

911227424757.summary: Ascentis ESOL Quality Meeting (QM) What is a QM? An ESOL Quality Meeting is a free, quality-focused event that Ascentis offers for all approved centres delivering Ascentis ESOL qualifications. Quality Meetings are face-to-face events hosted by an approved Ascentis ESOL centre. This year, Quality Meetings will focus on the processes of Internal Quality Assurance and attendees will also receive an update on the ESOL qualifications and the support we provide for centres on our new ESOL Hub. There is also the opportunity to share best practices with other practitioners. Who can attend a QM? All approved Ascentis centres delivering Ascentis ESOL qualifications centre co-ordinators, tutor/assessors, exams officers and those involved in the Internal Quality Assurance of these qualifications are invited to join us. Who delivers the QM? The QM is delivered by the Lead ESOL External Quality Assurer (EQA), Ruth Simons. Ruth is a subject expert in the field of ESOL and she works in centres as an EQA so has a vast knowledge of Ascentis expectations and processes. A Quality Assurance Manager and a Product Development Manager will also be available to address QA or Qualification specific questions. Why attend? Each attendee will receive a certificate of attendance which counts towards Continuing Professional Development. It is a great opportunity for you to network with other Ascentis centres that deliver these qualifications. You will take away useful materials and information that will help with the delivery, assessment and Internal quality assurance of the qualifications. Feedback from previous QM delegates includes: Excellent understanding and supportive attitude towards centres Very organised, well managed and involved the audience as far as possible Very clear and informative We very much hope you will take up this opportunity to join with our centres to participate in important quality assurance activities. Please note that this event is for Ascentis centres only and places are limited. Please book your place using your centre email address to avoid disappointment How to get to the venue: There are no Parking Facilities avaiable at this venue Transport Links Underground: Finsbury Park (Piccadilly and Victoria Lines) Buses: 4, 19, 29, 106, 153, 210, 236, 253, 254, 259, 279, W3, W7 By signing up for this event, you are also consenting for us to be able to use your provided information for marketing purposes.
911227424757.description: An ESOL Quality Meeting is a quality-focused event that Ascentis offers for all approved centres delivering Ascentis ESOL qualifications.

1027131587227.summary: Join us on October 16th at Civo Tech Junction Space, London for a London AI Meetup. This will be the evening of AI learning and networking. Were bringing together AI/ML engineers, data scientists, CTOs, and tech enthusiasts to share knowledge, real-world examples, and the latest AI trends. Connect with like-minded professionals, share insights, and learn from industry experts as they dive into the real-world applications of RAG and LLM. Speakers & Topics: Cristi Burca , Co-founder & CTO at VerbalEaze Topic: RAG Renaissance. RAG plays a key role in modern AI systems, helping reduce errors and generate more accurate, context-specific answers. However, implementing it can be challenging. Well dive into cutting-edge techniques for finding information thats both relevant and reliable. Jurgen Riedel , Founder at Baiomics Topic: Decoding AI: Linguistic Insights and Ethical Strategies for Advanced Language Models. Discover how language models like GPT-4 process information and the limitations shaped by their data and design. We'll also explore the ethical aspects of AI use and discuss strategies for implementing AI responsibly in business. What to Expect? No formalities just connecting with peers, sharing insights, and discovering the latest trends and use cases of the industry. Well kick off with welcoming drinks to set the mood, followed by presentations and a Q&A session with our speakers. Event Details: October 16, 6-9 PM London, Civo Tech Junction Space The event is free, but registration is mandatory. Due to limited seats, the invites will be sent to a limited number of interested guests. We kindly encourage our guests to register for our event using their work email addresses. Please check your inbox for a confirmation email about your attendance. See you! By registering for the event you consent to the processing of your data by Roosh LTD (its affiliates), partners, and co-hosts of the event, including sharing your data with the event partners and co-hosts.
1027131587227.description: Connect with professionals, share insights, and learn from industry experts as they dive into the real-world applications of RAG and LLM.
1027131587227.title: London AI Meetup

1040653301037.summary: Networking is so much more than showing up for a coffee and handing out business cards. Its an opportunity to connect with other business owners who understand your challenges and your big and small wins. We know that it can be hard to walk into a room full of strangers and start to make connections out of thin air, which is why we have created a space for people to network in a relaxed way. If you have not visited BASE Bordon before, you will be delighted by this beautiful historic building with plenty of parking and you will have the opportunity to have a tour of the building if you wish to have one. We are looking forward to inviting you to this friendly and relaxed networking meeting and look forward to making new connections. Team BASE FAQ Is the networking free - Yes it is completely free and always will be, we want to make networking accessible to all and for local businesses to connect no matter what their size or financial situation Is there somewhere to park - yes, there are plenty of parking spaces in front and behind the building (go past reception and carry on round to the right and behind the building). If the car park is full please use the Phoenix Theatre car park at at the end of the road. Will there be refreshments - yes there will be snacks and refreshments available. I have never been networking before and am a little nervous - please let us know if this is the case and we will make sure to greet you and introduce you to a couple of people to get you started, or you can start off in the quiet corner. I can only come for some of it - that is absolutely fine, you don't have to stay for the full 2 hours, there are no speakers so just turn up when you can, and leave when you want to. Can I bring a friend - yes the more the merrier - just make sure they also register so we know how many people are coming as the meeting is limited to 45 people. If I change my mind on the day is that okay - yes we absolutely understand that things come up, or that nerves take over, so just let us know via email and register for next month's instead. If you have any other questions please get in contact with us at abunney@oxin.co.uk or RBasebordon@oxin.co.uk We will be looking for sponsors for future events, so please let us know if you would like to sponsor the next event.
1040653301037.description: Connect with other businesses in a relaxed way
1040653301037.title: BASE Connect Networking - November 2024

941321296337.summary: Why Network? Networking serves as a vital tool for establishing and nurturing professional relationships, fostering connections, and gaining referralsultimately contributing to the development of your business. Our monthly gathering at the Roundabout Hotel provides an opportunity to connect with a diverse group of businesses in a warm and inviting atmosphere.This in-person event is more than just a meeting; it's a chance to engage with like-minded individuals, exchange ideas, and build meaningful connections. Held on the last Friday of each month (excluding Bank Holidays), the event is hosted by Abbie, Serina, Hollie, and Jeaniepassionate advocates for relationship building and local economic growth.Whether you're an experienced networker or just beginning, these meetups cater to individuals at all stages of their professional journey. Take advantage of the opportunity to expand your network, discover new possibilities, and mark your calendar for each month. A modest fee of 15 ensures the organisers can dedicate time to make this event successful, providing participants with tea, coffee and a breakfast buffet of delights! Don't miss the chance to humanise your networking experience and strengthen your professional connections

Keyperson workshop: Focus on Personal Social and Emotional Development. Supported by Nicola Millard and Lorraine Bampton, Bedford Borough) We will explore the role of the co-regulator in supporting children to begin to self-regulate and reflect on the key person characteristics. Theres no doubt that networking plays a crucial role in the success of holistic entrepreneurs. This is why we founded CHIC - to create a space for individuals to build genuine, deeper connections & relationships within a strong supportive community. We also invite you to join us on our 'Netwalking' mid month meet-up, where we gather at the beach for a refreshing morning walk in the sea air. 1021778766797.summary: ROBIN Networking event We are delighted to announce that our Autumn ROBIN Networking event will be held at the Yellowshed of Wonderment! The Bicester HQ for B-Corp certified, sustainable marketing agency Webmart. Webmarts story started in 1996 with Dr Simon Biltcliffes vision for an independent and innovative marketing agency that makes a difference. With almost 30 years of impact, Webmarts mission is to pioneer responsible marketing and empower brands to amplify their impact. Their core ethos Do Good, Be Good runs centrally throughout all that they do, and their passion for using business as a force for good sees Webmart turn income into impact through campaigns that prioritise people and planet. For the Autumn event, Webmart will be hosting us in their ground-floor event space, comprising of various themed rooms and a conference suite. There is ample parking at Webmart, and both Bicester Village and Bicester North train stations are close by. A tour of Webmart's office space will be available on the day. Along with their Yellowshed of Wonderment, Webmart also has a northern residence in Barnsley, Yorkshire, and owns 164-acres of Scottish land in Berwickshire. The affectionately named Oxygen Farm is an off-grid retreat and Webmart have committed to a long-term regeneration plan with the Scottish Government that will see the land flourish! Find out more about Webmart here: www.webmartuk.com If you are not already aware of ROBIN, it unlike most business networks. The aim of our ROBIN meetings is to facilitate networking between businesses, charities, voluntary groups, social enterprises and educational institutions keen to explore ways of collaborating for mutual benefit. Members attend events and take part in our lively LinkedIn group to find ways of sharing skills and resources with each other. If that appeals to you, please join us at this much-anticipated event. If youve not been to a ROBIN event before, we are confident you will enjoy it. If you have, you can expect more of the same, a warm reception in a relaxed and friendly environment where you can meet and get to know likeminded people. We look forward to seeing you there! The ROBIN team.
1021778766797.title: ROBIN Networking event October 2024

955936199907.summary: Business Buzz Cambridge networking sessions are an excellent way to mingle face-to-face with other local businesses in a free-flowing, fun atmosphere. Designed to work with your schedule, theres no such thing as late with this two-hour drop-in session. Turn up whenever you like before the event closes at 12 noon and stay for 5 minutes or the full two hours. With no membership and no strings attached, its never been easier to meet your local business community. For just 10+ VAT youll get refreshments, a brilliant new set of contacts and the warmest of welcomes. With new people every month and a huge buzz in the room youre sure to make some great connections; we believe the more you chat, the more business just happens. We meet every 1st Thursday of the month between 10 am and 12 pm at the same venue. While you can book on the day, we ask that you purchase your ticket before you set off on your journey. This makes it much easier to check you in and get you to the coffee as soon as possible! How it works When you come to a Buzz youll be welcomed by the Buzz team, shown where the coffee is and introduced to some of the other attendees. Were here if you need further introductions to more guests, but youll find that everyone is really friendly and you can easily move around conversations to network as you like. The focus is open networking and easy-going conversations so that more business happens between our attendees easily. At roughly 11 am there is a short announcement section and youll find out who is in the room to help facilitate more connections.
955936199907.description: Join us at Business Buzz Cambridge for our monthly relaxed & informal networking. No membership or professional lock out.
955936199907.title: Cambridge Business Buzz Networking

1012967742787.summary: Pop down to your local People Planet Pint meetup to find more about what's going on locally with sustainability and how you can get involved. No pitches, powerpoints or panels. Just People, Planet, Pint/s. Your local meetup is a great place to start your journey or continue learning, and meet diverse people to chat about life and how we can sustain it. Every job is a climate job, so come along and learn about how you can take action, as well as what is going on locally. We welcome everyone, regardless of their experience or background. People Planet Pint is a space where everyone can feel comfortable learning about sustainability and sharing their ideas. Afterall, creating a sustainable future requires connected communities. And what better way to bring everyone together than over a drink? Your Volunteer Hosts Tom Beckett is the Founder and CEO of Better Century, an organisation that helps people and organisations be net positive for nature and climate. He advises NGOs, business and financial organisations to deliver their nature and climate strategies, and in Bicester supports local community activities and acts as a councillor. He looks forward to welcoming people from a variety of backgrounds to join People, Planet, Pint, in Bicester.

Our groups might be a fit for you and your business, if you fall into one of the below categories: You are looking for a great networking group to join for support, motivation, new business, etc. You want to grow your business You have just set up your business and you want to meet some useful people You want to try networking as you think it could help your business You have tried other networking groups and found them to be too disciplined, not enough structure, etc. You want to try networking but are nervous about taking that first step You need to pre-book your place. 1030949586967.summary: The Portsmouth Marketing Meetup is an informal, friendly place for the marketers of Portsmouth to meet, learn, and share knowledge with one another. Come in 'listen' not 'sell' mode We're headed to the Village Hotel for this one. We just want to get together, say hello, have a chat, and have a nice time. Please look out for TMM signs on the night, which will point you to the right entrance for the venue! :) Think of this as a community event, where the focus is very much on you meeting other people in a chilled out friendly space. Well chat over food and drink, listen to an inspirational speaker or two, chat some more, and go home buzzing with new contacts and new ideas. Lets have a lovely night in the company of some amazin people. -------------------- Speaker: t o be confirmed! -------------------- The format of the night: 6.00 pm - Doors Open - Drinks, Networking, and smiles 6.30 pm - Introduction and Talks Begin 7.15 pm - Talks Finish, Networking, Listening, Saying Hello, and Positively Lovely People - A nice chilled out time 8:00 pm - End of the night - you leave with new contacts and fresh ideas -------------------- Supported by Lumico, a team of software, electrical, and mechanical engineers based in Lee-on-the-Solent. We build apps and cloud-based platforms, develop IoT products and connected devices, and enhance our clients' productivity through industrial process automation. Check them out at www.lumico.io Supported by The Village Hotel, providing everything you need for a great stay and more - a pool, a gym, a pub, a coffee shop, and VWorks coworking space. Check out the details at https://www.village-hotels.co.uk/portsmouth -------------------- And finally... This is a donation ticketed event. The ticket price is yours to choose, from 3 to 30 (the average attendees choose to pay 8.79 :) We of course understand that these are tough times, so if you are experiencing financial hardship and cannot afford the minimum donation amount, please reach out to el@themarketingmeetup.com and well find a ticket for you (provided capacity hasn't already been reached!) Please let your marketing friends and colleagues know about this group too, I hope to build it into a great resource for the community over the coming months and years. Attendance will be taken at this event. If you sign up but dont show up, this has a knock on effect on event arrangements. If it happens 3 times, youre outta here! This is simply a measure to allow appropriate respect to the organisers, speakers, sponsors, and your fellow community members -------------------- See you there!
1030949586967.description: The Portsmouth Marketing Meetup is an informal, friendly place to meet, learn, and share knowledge with one another. Come in 'listen' mode!
1030949586967.title: The Marketing Meetup IRL: Portsmouth

929073522917.summary: The Connections Club Practical, Professional & Profitable Networking Open to Business Owners, Influencers, and Leaders only, we understand the importance of networking in business. We focus on business excellence with quality businesses sharing best practices and learning with each other and from other experts, we bring in not on the networking circuit. Join our members to connect, build and maintain relationships The Connections Club is a structured and professional networking group which gives you the opportunity to connect with other business owners who are serious about growth, allows you to promote your own business and you take away a valuable skill, learning or insight - at every single meeting. Attendees are carefully selected to ensure that each meeting is filled with decision-makers and influencers - so you meet the right people to help you grow. Contact barbara@yourbusinessmatters.co to reserve your slot or to ask to be invoiced for the visitor meeting fee. Note we are not taking bookings for the following slots: IFA Slot, Commercial Insurance , Solicitors wills Trust & probate, Family Law or IP. Event Organiser Barbara Hodgson is the founder and chair. She has more than 10 years experience of connecting businesses through networking groups, conferences and one-off events - and is regarded highly by the numerous businesses she has connected. Quick to spot a potential partnership or a useful collaboration for her members, she ensures every meeting is practical, professional and useful for everyone who attends. Q & A Is The Connections Club right for you? Networking is only successful when the right people are introduced to each other, so we are selective about our members. We welcome business owners and influencers who have the ability to make decisions, who are committed to the growth of their business and who are just as interested in buying products and services as they are in selling their own. Is this you? If that sounds like you, The Connections Club may be the networking group youve been looking for. Who can attend? Attendees are all owners or decision-makers within a privately-owned business. (This is not a format that suits MLMs.) Male, female, start-ups and established businesses - all are welcome. What makes the Connections Club different? The objective is to make your networking profitable, not to profit from your networking. How is this done? Selective membership increases your chances of meeting the right people. The attendance of around 70 business owners gives you a large pool of contacts. The meeting format maximises the number of useful connections you make. You will eat, meet, learn and share at every meeting. The membership model attracts regular attendees who get to know you and your business and who are committed to helping you where possible Face-to-face Meeting format Our face-to-face meetings are informal networking followed by a seated lunch and a 60-second introduction from everyone at your table. There will then be an open session where you will hear from a speaker who may share business learnings or a skill, chair a debate or manage a discussion amongst the room. Whatever the topic, you will take away something that you can apply to your business. When will the group meet? The first Tuesday of the month, 11.45am - 2pm
929073522917.event_address: Delapr Abbey Preservation Trust Abbey Cottage, London Road, Northampton, NN4 8AW
929073522917.title: The Connections Club Northampton - November

906781687437.summary: Don't you just love a morning walk at the beach when all you can hear are the waves crashing, the light wind blowing and the seagulls squawking in the distance! :) Such a perfect start to the day. Why not join us for a mid-month mindfulness "Netwalk" - a group stroll along the beautiful shore with other holistic business ladies. We will perch on the rocks for a half way opportunity to do card readings or a meditation... of just to listen to feel more present and connected. The benefits of this group mindful walk are huge & interconnected! Starting the day away from our work environment in the fresh sea air with the beautiful ocean views alone will allow us to refresh our spirits, giving us a sense of peace that we can carry with us throughout the day. You can bring your own hot or cold drink or purchase one at the Oceanside cafe after the walk. We look forward to welcoming you there! Vee & Louise at CHIC!

1045177914277.summary: Pop down to your local People Planet Pint meetup to find more about what's going on locally with sustainability and how you can get involved. No pitches, powerpoints or panels. Just People, Planet, Pint/s. Your local meetup is a great place to start your journey or continue learning, and meet diverse people to chat about life and how we can sustain it. Every job is a climate job, so come along and learn about how you can take action, as well as what is going on locally. We welcome everyone, regardless of their experience or background. People Planet Pint is a space where everyone can feel comfortable learning about sustainability and sharing their ideas. Afterall, creating a sustainable future requires connected communities. And what better way to bring everyone together than over a drink? Prefer a Pastry to a Pint? Head along to People Planet Pastry ! Equally relaxed and welcoming, they run during the day and offer an informal way to learn about what is going on locally in sustainability. Your Volunteer Hosts Alexina launched independent consultancy ActNow Consulting in 2022 with the mission to help businesses flourish through adopting positively impactful practices and becoming forces for good. Alexina is a member of UK for Good and is working to create a network of Northamptonshire businesses interested in sustainability, ESG and systemic change. Laura is the founder of B Corp Expert - a consultancy that specialises in helping businesses achieve B Corp Certification/recertification. Laura is a member of UK For Good along with Alexina, and is a fan of collaboration and cake!
1045177914277.description: Pop down to your local People Planet Pint meetup to find more about what's going on locally with sustainability and how you can get involved
1045177914277.title: Northampton - Small99's People, Planet, Pint: Sustainability Meetup

1031020759847.summary: The Climate Adaptation World Caf Event is an opportunity to drive forward Rugby Borough Councils work on climate adaptation, aiming to engage with new audiences and stakeholders. Rugby Borough Council declared a climate emergency in 2019, setting an objective to become Net Zero Carbon by 2035. Furthermore, the Council adopted a Climate Change Strategy in 2022 setting the strategic direction for future climate change work. Progressing this, the Council plans to focus work on Climate Adaptation. The event is being held at the Benn Hall on 9 November between 10am and 2pm. It will take a World Caf format and there will also be a resource marketplace hosting materials and displays from partner organisations. A key output from the event will be a report reflecting the views and opinions expressed on the day. This will be used to inform the Councils work in relation to Climate Adaptation.
1031020759847.description: Join in the conversation on Rugby's Climate Adaptation, with our world caf engagement event at the Benn Hall.
1031020759847.title: Rugby Borough Council's Climate Adaptation World Caf Event

794095088787.summary: Pop down to your local People Planet Pint meetup to find more about what's going on locally with sustainability and how you can get involved. No pitches, powerpoints or panels. Every job is a climate job, so come along and learn about how you can take action, as well as what is going on locally. We welcome everyone, regardless of their experience or background. People Planet Pint is a space where everyone can feel comfortable learning about sustainability and sharing their ideas. Afterall, creating a sustainable future requires connected communities. And what better way to bring everyone together than over a drink? Prefer a Pastry to a Pint? Head along to People Planet Pastry ! Equally relaxed and welcoming, they run during the day and offer an informal way to learn about what is going on locally in sustainability. Your Volunteer Hosts Danni Brotherston & Nick Hunt from Murmuration Partners www.murmurationpartners.co.uk (and Cotswold Lakes Brew Co. )

739230958697.summary: A Leading Business Networking Event in Ringwood & Fordingbridge, Hampshire BNI Ringwood & Fordingbridge is a new business networking organisation which meets weekly at Framptons, Ringwood ___ Tuesday 06:45 AM Framptons , Ringwood Register Now _____ Network with Local Business Owners in Ringwood, Fordingbridge and Surrounding Area Our members represent businesses in Ringwood & Fordingbridge and Surrounding Areas and showcase the best from industries including Financial & Professional Services, Trades & Creative Industries This group is ideal for business professionals in the New Forest area who want to widen their networking opportunities in South Hampshire and meet new people grow their business through structured networking. BNI's focus is on helping local small business owners to connect and build meaningful business relationships. Through its structured; supportive, face to face business networking events, local business owners can generate significant business for each other. Frequently Asked Questions About BNI How much are visitor fees to attend? As a visitor you maybe expected to pay a visitor fee which covers room hire and breakfast (where available). This is 15 per visitor. Further details will be made available once your ticket is confirmed. What makes BNI different from other networking groups in Ringwood? BNI is a structured, supportive group that pass qualified business referrals which are quality checked and tracked. No other networking groups come close in terms of the support that is offered. How long will I get to talk about my business? As a member of BNI you will get 60 seconds every week to talk about your business as well as a 10 minute slot on a 10 minute speaker rotation to educate other members about your business and who you are looking for in terms of referrals. What does my Visitor Pass Get Me? Visitors are permitted to attend up to a maximum of two meetings. Visitors who wish to register as a Member will be required to complete a membership application form, from which the application form will be reviewed by the Leadership team. Membership is not guaranteed and based on an industry first come, first serve basis.
739230958697.description: BNI Ringwood & Fordingbridge - A Leading Business Networking Event in Ringwood Hampshire to grow and develop your business.
739230958697.title: BNI Ringwood & Fordingbridge - A Leading Business Networking Event

1031062243927.summary: Sign up now for the 2025 Youth Interfaith Summit on 5 February 2025 in Central London. Hosted by the Faith and Belief Forum and the London School of Economics Faith Centre, the Youth Interfaith Summit is the largest youth-based interfaith gathering in the UK. Through expert speakers, workshops and networking, the summit will offer a space to think collaboratively about the role of faith in driving a more positive climate story for policy impact. Key Topics: Exploring Your Climate Story: Explore how you relate to the climate considering faith and other aspects of identity by crafting a human library style story. Communicating Climate Change: Explore the different methods of communicating climate change using digital media. Youth Influence on Climate Policy : Explore how young people of faith can have a significant impact on climate policy decisions at a national level. Engagement in the International Space : Explore how young people can get more involved in the climate space at an international level and why this is important. Join us for a unique opportunity to network with other young activists and engage in an important conversation about our shared future, and leave feeling inspired to advocate for collective action in your local community. #YouthInterfaithSummit
1031062243927.description: Faith & Climate: Finding your place in the narrative.
1031062243927.title: Youth Interfaith Summit 2025

1022557776837.summary: Hoppy Hopeland by Bishwo Shahitto Kendro UK Doors 7.00pm Start 7.30pm Bangla/English | 60 minutes All ages Synopsis: Hoppy Hopeland is a captivating journey into a world where hope reigns supreme. This enchanting play invites audiences to follow children through Hoppy Hopeland. This is a vibrant and whimsical landscape. But it also includes real-world challenges. Along their journey, the children confront climate change and war. They discover their own power to shape their destiny. Through collaboration and creativity, the children find innovative solutions. They overcome obstacles. They weave a rich tapestry of imagination and insight. The story highlights the transformative power of hope. This inspires audiences to believe in the potential for change even in the darkest times. "Hoppy Hopeland" is a celebration of resilience and imagination. It mirrors the boundless possibilities that hope can bring. About the Company: Bishwo Shahitto Kendro, UK (BSK, UK) is a non-profit organisation in London. For over 20 years it has promoted literature and the creative arts within communities. BSK highlights Bangladeshi culture and heritage. It nurtures inclusivity. It celebrates diversity. It fosters cultural identity.
1022557776837.description: Take a magical journey into 'Hoppy Hopeland'. Let your imagination soar. Youth and resilience reign supreme in a realm of hope and dreams.
1022557776837.title: Hoppy Hopeland by Bishwo Shahitto Kendro UK

All sales are final, NO refunds All who enter the room requires a ticket, even care takers No children under 16 permitted, no exceptions, no infants Age 16-17 must be accompanies by an adult Author, Narrator, Vendor line up subject to change at any time ITINERARY: Friday 4 July, 2025 Meet & Greet, Excel 4:30pm - 7:30pm Raffle - Must be present to win (at the Meet & Greet) Meet & Greet tickets are only available to those with a Saturday signing ticket. This will be verified. 80% of Saturday signing authors will be in attendance to meet, chat, take photos A few authors might offer a pop up signing at the Meet & Greet but no pre orders will be picked up. Cash bar Some finger foods provided Saturday 5 July, 2025 Signing event, ExCeL London Early Entry 9:30am - 5:30pm General Admission 11:30am - 5:30pm Snack bar/bar on site - card only Depending on sponsorships there will be some free books only given out at signing RARE25London Anthology will be available Where is the event at? Location: ExCel London (disabled friendly)Royal Victoria Dock, 1 Western Gateway, London E16 1XL, United Kingdom Halls SO3 - SO5 West entrance Level 1. What are my transport and/or parking options at ExCeL? Parking is available on a first come, first served basis, using pay and display. If you are travelling to ExCeL London by road please use postcode E16 1XL. There are multiple ways of travelling to the venue:Elizabeth line (Custom House station)Underground and DLR (ExCeL can be accessed via two DLR stations: Custom House and Prince Regent)Cable car or Uber Boat are also options.For detailed directions click here and scroll downhttps://www.excel.london/visitor/getting-here Is the venue (ExCeL) disable friendly? Yes - all areas Where should I stay? If you plan on sightseeing you'll want to stay in central London, if your only attending the event you'll want to stay close. Hotel rooms and AirBnB's are limited due to all the other events in town over the weekend. We strongly encourage you to book a room now with free cancellation. There are two Premier Inn's and a Travelodge near by. How much are tickets? All tickets available on PayPal - PayPal will be used to process payments and an account isn't required. Unfortunately due to high conversion fees all tickets will be sold in US dollars, spreading the expense helps us keep ticket prices down as low as possible Early Entry Tickets: $135 ($42.09 increase) + conversion & PayPal fees General Admission: $85 ($21.13 increase) + conversion & PayPal fees Meet & Greet: $20 ($7 increase) + conversion & PayPal fees **** IMPORTANT INFO : Due to the surcharge between Eventbrite and PayPal in addition the conversion fee between GBP and USD we no longer charge in local currency. All transactions for all sales will be in USD$. I apologize for the inconvenience. The amount of money we were losing to fees overall and to get the funds converted to USD at a lower merchant rate in order to pay bills in the UK was astronomical. **** Will there be a limit on the number of tickets I can buy? Yes, only two (2) tickets per transaction for Early Entry tickets and four (2) per transaction for General Admission. What is included with each ticket? ALL signing tickets include entrance, pictures and autographs with authors. There is no separate cost for pictures or autographs (this is NOT a con or book fair). One ticket= all day access. The only difference is that Early Entry tickets give an additional 2 hours to meet authors , get books signed/take photos etc. Who must be ticketed? Anyone entering the Exhibition halls and/or Foyer must be ticketed. All spouses, caregivers, friends, parents, and children over the age of 16 must be ticketed. No children under 16 permitted, no exceptions Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event? RARE is now able to scan tickets for entry, so paper or electronic tickets are both accepted.If you do not have your paper ticket or can not check in electronically then identification is required. If you do not have a paper ticket, can not check in electronically, and your identification is not the same name as you purchased your ticket in, you will need to update the correct information on Eventbrite prior to the event. I s there an age restriction for the event: No one under 16 will be permitted into the event. All attendees between the age of 16 and 17 must be accompanied by a ticketed adult. Please note there will be explicit book covers and banners in the event room. *Due to occupancy restrictions CHILDREN UNDER 16 will not be permitted entry* Do I need to add personal information to all tickets being purchased? Yes. The ticket holder's name, email address , age and country should be on each ticket. Prior to paying for your tickets you will be prompted to enter the name, email, and age for each attendee. **DUE TO THE NUMBER OF TICKETS SOLD WE WILL NOT MAKE NAME CHANGES FOR YOU** Should you sell your ticket this is between you and the buyer, you must change the names AND email address on all tickets. Is my ticket transferrable? Should you sell any tickets it will be your responsibility to transfer the ticket to the new owner by updating the name, age, country and email address for each attendee. Can I update my ticket information? Yes, log into your Eventbrite account and update your information there. Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event? No! You can also present your electronic ticket and QR code on your phone.Please bring one of the following with you to enter: paper ticket, electronic ticket, or identification that matches the name on the purchased ticket. Identification is required for those who look under 17 if not accompanied by an adult 18 and over. Or if you do not have a paper ticket or a way to electronically check in, and said identification must match the name on the ticket. The name on the ticket doesn't match the attendee. Is that okay? Tickets should match your identification so we can verify the age of each attendee and purchaser if ticket is lost or you are not able to check in electronically. For a smooth entry, try to make sure if possible that your name on your identification and your ticket match. Please keep in mind if your friend buys your ticket and her name is on it you have no recourse. Is there a limit of how many items I can get signed by one author or in total at the event? No more than 2 non book items (including book plates) per each author. No more than one special edition per title; for example if an author has 3 special editions each has a different title then you can purchase a total of 3, one of each plus any back list titles. No limits on non special editions unless otherwise noted Some authors will have a limit of total number of items to be signed. This information will be posted as soon as possible and is subject to change at any time. What can/can't I bring to the event? Feel free to bring as many books as you like, Kindle covers, iPad covers, book plates, and/or any items you would like signed by authors. No alcohol of any kind can be brought into the event. Snacks and non alcohol drinks can be brought into the event. There will be a bar /snack bar at the event. Do I have to buy my own books? Yes. Books will not be provided for free. If you would like a book signed, please bring that title with you. Some attending authors will have a pre order form so you can order directly from them, some will not. Only traditionally published books in the UK will be available through a bookseller at the event. **WE STRONGLY ENCOURAGE YOU TO BRING YOUR BOOKS WITH YOU TO THE EVENT*** Avoid having a broken heart should your favorite author sell out of books or the book retailer didn't bring that title. Will a bookseller (bookstore) be selling books at the event? Yes however a book seller will only sell traditional titles -meaning only titles distributed by a UK publisher. If the book you want is not traditionally published (the author is indie) then the bookseller will not have the book. Will there be food or drink for sale at the event? There will be a cash bar for drinks along with a snack bar on Saturday. Water stations will be throughout the event on both days Is there a dress code for the event? No. You will be on your feet all day and rooms tend to get warm, please dress comfortably, wear comfortable shoes, and dress in layers. Will the author list change? Yes. The author list is subject to change at any time. Ticket sales are final regardless of cancellations. Authors take signings very serious and confirm after much thought. RARE re confirms with each author three - four times prior to being announced. Should they cancel it is due to a conflict in schedule, an illness, or emergency. Please be prepared for cancellations, they are inevitable especially for overseas signings. What is the refund policy? **ALL SALES ARE FINAL AND NO REFUNDS REGARDLESS OF REASON** Where can I contact the organizer with any questions? Contact Team RARE at the following email address: rarettes@gmail.com Where can I find more info about the event and get in touch with fellow readers? Please join the dedicated facebook group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/rare25londonattendees T IPS/REMINDERS * *All who enter must be ticketed** If you are disabled and have a helper, the helper is required to have a ticket to enter. A retail shop will be posted soon Don't worry about attending alone, there will be 1000+ of your closest book friends with you. RARE is a community and I promise, you will be OK. Feel free to volunteer if you want to be with people **READ AS MANY ATTENDING AUTHORS AS POSSIBLE - Why? Should your authors cancel you'll have new to you unicorn's/fave authors to see. What is the official #: #rare25london The venue is larger than our previous London events, 11000sqm. 400+ authors currently have reconfirmed attendance. Many sub genres will be present. HOWEVER the author line up can change at any time. Cancellations will happen, they are inevitable. Schedules change, illness occurs, emergencies happen, life changes. There are some authors who like to confirm closer to the event date meaning we may also add authors later. Author lunches/breaks: The room does not close for lunch however each section will leave for lunch. Once the table map is released you will want to plan accordingly and make sure you are not in any line in the sections during their lunch break. 12:30pm Section 1 1:00pm Section 2 1:30pm Section 3 2:00pm Section 4 2:30pm Section 5 **No After Party***Not sure of a pre/Registration party. This will depend on the number of tickets sold to the signing and when we gain access to set up. Directions & Parking Parking is available on a first come, first served basis, using pay and display. If you are travelling to ExCeL London by road please use postcode E16 1XL.There are multiple ways of travelling to the venue: Elizabeth line (Custom House station)Underground and DLR (ExCeL can be accessed via two DLR stations: Custom House and Prince Regent)Cable car or Uber Boat are also options. For detailed directions click here and scroll down https://www.excel.london/visitor/getting-here All pictures will be taken by author assistants and in front of the table to help expedite lines Some authors will be wristband meaning after the first 20 attendees in line a line ambassadors will hand out numbered wristbands - one per attendee. You will then go about meeting other authors until your number is called. You can join the queue any time after your number is called, so no worries if you are busy or in another queue. There is a Costa across from our room next to a sandwich kiosk. There are also other food options up and down the hall corridor. Keep in mind food /snack bars will be open for the entire building meaning attendees from other events. For food options :https://www.excel.london/visitor/food-drink Disability Accessibility information:https://www.excel.london/visitor/venue-guide/accessibilityVenue FAQshttps://www.excel.london/visitor/venue-guide/faqs/accessibility Author Line Up **subject to change at ANY time** AUTHOR A. 967596756947.summary: Our Open Evening Saturday 7 December 2024 between 11:00am - 2:00pm, is a great opportunity to find out more about our Chelsea Centre for Creative Industries and how we can help you achieve your goals and career ambitions. We offer great courses for 16-18s, in arts and creative to business, fashion, health and social care, IT and music, and for adult learners wanting to return to higher education or to improve their literacy and numeracy skills in English and maths. Come and tour our newly refurbished modern centre, try out our fantastic resources like our Esports suite, science labs, fashion, millinery, art and photography studios and many more. Meet with our specialist subject tutors and ALS teams to discuss your options Whether you want to update your current skills, start your career, go to university or change direction from your current path, Morley College London can help you with your journey. At our open day events you can; Get one-to-one advice and guidance with an expert subject leader about your chosen course Tour specialist facilities Join workshops and tasters taking place on the day Meet current and past students Get support and advice from our Finance, Admissions, Wellbeing and Student Support teams Read below for more information on our different study levels and what will suit your needs. Book your place now at our open day.
967596756947.description: Our Open Evening Saturday 7 December 2024 between 11:00am - 2:00pm, is a great opportunity to find out more about our Chelsea Centre
967596756947.title: Open Day: Chelsea Centre for Creative Industries

We also have Retro gaming, facepainting, board and card gmaing areas, movie cars on display and lots of exhibitors selling everything from Star Wars to Stranger Things. A family friendly, great value for money event where everyone is welcome :-) For ticket holders with additional needs who may find it helpful to enjoy the event in a quieter atmosphere we offer a 9.30am entry so that gives some time before the main entry at 10am where the event is not crowded or loud. 1023151974097.summary: Discover the Ultimate Collector's Experience at Card Con in Farnborough (only 35 mins from London Waterloo) one of the UK's biggest leading trading card events. Card Con is the annual must-attend convention for over 2,000 trading card enthusiasts from across the UK and beyond. Whether you're a fan of Sports Cards, Pokmon, Magic: The Gathering, One Piece, Yugioh or any trading card game, Card Con has something for everyone. Explore a vast selection of vintage treasures and the latest releases from professional sellers and dedicated collectors alike. But that's not all immerse yourself in the heart of the trading card community with our special events. This year, we're elevating the experience with exclusive guest appearances by renowned artists and sports stars, engaging panels, Q&As, and an array of prizes and surprises. With so much to do, Card Con is more than just a convention; it's a celebration of all things trading cards.
1023151974097.description: Card Con 3: Unleash Your Passion - Collect, Connect, Celebrate! All things Pokemon, TCG, sports and collectibles!
1023151974097.venue_name: Farnborough International Exhibition and Conference Centre
1023151974097.title: Card Con 3 - Pokemon, TCG and Sports Card Show

955917323447.summary: MK FILM AND COMIC CON - SATURDAY 12TH JULY 2025, 10AM - 4PM RIDGEWAY CONFERENCE CENTRE, WOLVERTON, MK12 5TH Returning for our 5th anniversary year, after an overwhelming response from our visitors and traders, we are pleased to be back with the MK Film and Comic Con 2025 on Saturday 12th July from 10am to 4pm at The Ridgeway Centre, Wolverton, MK12 5TH. Get the cosplay outfits out, visit lots of stalls with film and comic merchandise, admire various artists work, look out for your favourite characters from the film and comic book world (don't forget to ask for a photo!) and immerse yourself into the various free entertainment, games and competitions throughout the day. Don't miss photo opportunities with cosplay groups and various prop displays! Keep an eye out on our website and facebook pages for all MKFCC updates and what you can expect to see on 12th July! We have taken the decision to continue to NOT have guest signers at this event, but give a more interactive and entertainment-focussed experience for the day. TICKETS!! ALL DAY 8 ENTRY IN ADVANCE (plus booking fee) HALF DAY (From 1pm) 6 ENTRY IN ADVANCE (plus booking fee) 11 ON THE DOOR TICKETS - please note advanced ticket holders will get priority over anyone that turns up on the door and if the event is full, you will need to wait until a space is available. KIDS 10 YEARS AND UNDER GO FREE - with a ticket CARERS CAN ATTEND FOR FREE WITH VALID ID - with a ticket All tickets are available through Eventbrite. Children 16 years or younger must be accompanied by an adult. Ticket cancellation policy: Tickets may refunded up to 30 days before the event. Once this date has passed, tickets will be non-refundable. When registering for tickets for this event, you will be added to the Central Exhibitions Ltd mailing list to inform you about future MKFCC shows. Your details will not be passed onto any third parties. You can read our GDPR policy here and can unsubscribe at any time by emailing events@centralexhibitions.co.uk.
955917323447.description: Milton Keynes Film and Comic Con is BACK for 2025! Saturday 12th July, 10am - 4pm at The Ridgeway Centre, Milton Keynes!
955917323447.event_address: Featherstone Rd Wolverton Mill, Milton Keynes, MK12 5TH
955917323447.title: Milton Keynes Film and Comic Con, Saturday 12th July 2025, 10am - 4pm

1000680019877.summary: 20 June 2025 Paranormal Investigations & Psychic Mediumship with Celebrity Psychic Medium Marcus Starr At The Holiday Inn Express Kettering 20 Per Ticket 7pm until Late Address: The Holiday Inn Express Kettering, Weekley Wood Avenue, Kettering, NN14 1UD Step into the extraordinary as Marcus takes the stage, conducting captivating Paranormal Investigations and channelling messages from the spirit world to the physical realm, connecting you with your long-lost loved ones. Embark on an extraordinary journey with the renowned psychic medium, Marcus Starr, as he guides you through an immersive adventure of the paranormal and psychic mediumship. Picture yourself catching a glimpse of a mysterious figure, enjoying a cigar, only to vanish into thin air. Witness doors opening and closing on their own, filling the atmosphere with an undeniable sense of wonder and intrigue. Unleash your spiritual investigations as you consult the spirit board, tarot cards, crystal ball, or pendulum in search of answers. Will the revelations bring you comfort or ignite even deeper questions? A word of caution: Marcus's psychic messages may sometimes be unsettling. This experience is not intended for the faint of heart. Only those brave enough to immerse themselves in this chillingly enchanting world should step forward. If you're feeling brave, come along and bring a friend - living or otherwise... Don't miss out on this unparalleled opportunity for an evening of spine-tingling excitement and mystical discoveries. Reserve your tickets now before they vanish into thin air. Over 18's and for entertainment purposes only. About Marcus Starr Marcus Starr, is a well-acclaimed British Psychic Medium like no other. His performances are known to shock, amaze, intrigue and emotionally move even the toughest of sceptics. Marcus Starr has the answers whether you are curious about the paranormal or have questions on love, relationships or career. Come and join us on this fascinating eerie and spiritual journey. Be prepared for heart-racing accuracy, hair-raising moments and psychic mediumship performances that are second to none. About Haunted-Events.com & ConnectingWithSpirit.uk We are a paranormal activities and psychic company specialising in haunted tours and spiritual mediumship events across the UK. We intend to investigate and demonstrate the presence of paranormal activity and relay psychic messages from loved ones who have passed over. Our events are for 18+ and entertainment purposes only. For more information please visit our websites: www.haunted-events.com www.connectingwithspirit.uk
1000680019877.description: Paranormal & Psychic Event with Celebrity Psychic Marcus Starr @ Holiday Inn Express Kettering. 20 per ticket. 7 pm - Late.
1000680019877.venue_name: Holiday Inn Express Kettering, an IHG Hotel

918714217957.summary: Elves at the ready on Sunday 1 December Mental Elf is a unique event which focuses on bringing people together, not only to fundraise but to raise awareness of mental health and wellbeing. It promotes the benefits of physical activity, connecting with people and doing something to help others. Its an inclusive event, accessible and open to all ages and abilities, and of course, Christmas fancy dress is very much encouraged! Jingle all the way down to the War Memorial park Mental Elf will take place at the beautiful War Memorial Park in Coventry, with a route around the park. All proceeds will help fund our key mental health and wellbeing services in Coventry and Warwickshire. What does a ticket include? A place in the Mental Elf 5k 2024 and a victory medal Free warm-up session with a trainer from no other than David Smith aka The Mindset Soldier Free entertainment Place in the best-dressed competition Fundraising! Whilst fundraising isnt compulsory for this event, we would encourage each person taking part to reach a target of 20. The more money you raise, the more people we can help. You may wish to ask family, friends or colleagues for sponsorship. So, set up your JustGiving page today. And please remember to put Coventry and Warwickshire Mind as your chosen charity. https://www.justgiving.com/campaign/covmentalelf2024
918714217957.description: Join us on Sunday 1 December for an elf-tastic 5k fun run for mental health!
918714217957.title: Mental Elf Coventry 2024

Whether you're looking to push your limits in a bootcamp, let loose in our dance class, or simply connect with others over food and drinks, this event has something for everyone. This action-packed day will feature dynamic fitness classes, live music from a DJ (to be announced) , and networking opportunities that will inspire and motivate you to lead a healthier lifestyle. Expect to work hard, sweat it out, and enjoy a well-deserved break afterward with some great food, drinks, and music. What to Expect at Nakoa Health Fitness Event! Enjoy a day packed with fitness and fun, accompanied by a live DJ providing energizing music to keep the momentum going during every session. You'll participate in three 45-minute fitness classes , with 15-minute intervals between each to rest and recharge: Body Combat: A high-energy workout inspired by martial arts. Dance Fitness / Exercise to Music: Fun, rhythmic movements designed to burn calories. Pilates / Yoga: A blend of stretching and strengthening exercises for balance and relaxation. Take advantage of the breaks to network with fellow attendees, and dont miss out on the food and drinks available for purchase. There will also be merchandise sales , where you can buy workout gear and event-branded clothing. Whether you're a fitness enthusiast or just looking for a fun way to stay active, this event is the perfect opportunity to move your body, make new friends, and have a blast! Keep up to date on socials: Instagram: @nakoa.health TikTok: @nakoa.health ------------------------------------------------- Disclaimer: Nakoa Health Fitness Event is not liable for any personal injury or health problems that may arise from participation in the event. Attendees are encouraged to consult with healthcare professionals before engaging in any physical activity and to participate within their own limits.
